Choose one of the cards from the centre of the table.
Carry out the corresponding action.
Replace this card with a new card from the pile.


There are construction, attack, defence, decoration and wave cards.

name: J'apprends l'anglais en jouant
description:
Created and play tested by teachers, this speed and memory game helps learn English while having fun, with a mix of images, words and riddles both in French and in English.

The players choose a category (human body, fruits & vegetables, colors & shapes, in the classroom, clothes & accessories, food & drinks) and display the 12 related cards on the table.

Then the first player draws one of the 80 question card, and asks a series of definitions that are matched by one of the cards. The fastest player to point at the correct card wins a point.

name: The Supershow: Knockdown the Table Promo Card
description:
Originally available at Origins Game Fair 2018

The Supershow: Knockdown the Table Promo Card #20
Follow Up
Grapple (Blue)
The Crowd Meter is +1.
If this Card is Flipped by "Set Up the Table", Add it to your Hand

Illustration by: Juan Pablo Massa
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Supershow: Knockdown the Ladder Promo Card
description:
Originally available at Origins Game Fair 2018

Knockdown the Ladder Promo card #19

Follow Up Still (Yellow)
The Crowd Meter is +1.
If the Card is Flipped by "Set Up the Ladder" Add it to your Hand.

Illustration by Juan Pablo Massa
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Supershow: Wrist Lock Promo Card
description:
Originally available at Origins Game Fair 2018

Wrist Lock
Lead Submission (Purple)
Bury 2 Card in Any Players Discard Pile, or Look at the Your Opponents Hand.

Illustration by Nunoh.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: TradeWorlds: Adversity AI
description:
This "expansion" features a solitaire, one (1) player experience which allows gamers to go head-to-head against the "Adversity AI" developed and designed by Joseph E. Pilkus III.

This is an addition to the "core" game and it is recommended to play without the Planetary Expansion. This is because the AI difficulty has been designed around the "core" product. This is mainly because the Trade Agreements with Colonies will give the player a fairly large advantage with the Planetary Expansion.

This expansion is comprised of a total of 18 cards for the one (1) player experience. It features a 12 card initial deck and an 6 card development deck which makes the solo experience harder as the game progresses. The solo player may choose which of the four (4) factions (Mega-Corporations) he wants to play.
categories: Dice, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading

name: [redacted]: Identity
description:
A new expansion to [redacted], introducing 2 modules: the Free Agent, and Escalation.

In the Free Agent a new player joins the fray: everybody knows who he is, but nobody, not even he himself knows what team he is on! The Free Agent module also comes with several new missions (including 3v2 game for 5 players, or a 4 player game using the Alliance Letters, and many more), doubling the gameplay content of the original [redacted] game.

In the Escalation module, unique special intels are added for each faction, thus two games of the same mission will be different based on which factions are in play, opening up several new strategies and misdirections. And to further spice it up, four new factions (Germany, France, Israel, Hungary) are added to the mix!

3 to 6 players supported, or up to 7 players if used together with the Garden Party expansion.

—description from designer
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Team-Based Game

name: Driller Dwarves
description:
The competition in the Larendon Mining racket is fierce and only the strong have survived... the Driller Dwarves.
Now, the battle for Honor between them has pushed this competition to the limit. Become a Legendary Driller Dwarf and take on formidable adversaries for the prestigious honor of becoming the first Larendon Driller King.

Game Play
Each player has a Mine with 50 Hit Points. Each turn you can Mine for Gold to purchase enchanted Drill Bits, fill Faction Resource Orders to gain Honor plus barter with local Factions to sabotage opponents Mines or defend and repair your Mine.

How to Win
Win by getting to 50 Honor first with your Mine still standing or when only one Mine remains, the player with the highest Honor wins.

Solo Play
Take on your nemesis Driller Dwarf head-to-head in this AI driven competition.

Multi-Play
Take on your friend or friends! 4 player mode can also be coop 2v2.

Card Drafting
Card drafting 10 out of a pool of 14 adds a level of customization granting players the ability to skew their starting deck depending on their style of play.

First Player Card
First player card can actually be used to increase your chances of attaining very powerful Drill Bits.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Nine Virtues
description:
Free game published in the January 2018 (GTM #215) issue of Game Trade Magazine.

The game utilizes the Pairs game system and is designed with the Muses Deck, though it can be played with any Pairs deck.

Background:
The Nine Muses of the Old World were crafted as courtly educators and advisors, always on hand to help the young princes and princesses reach their full potential. “Nine Virtues” is
a card game about excelling in all the best aspects of life.
In the game of Nine Virtues, players try to collect hands of
the most valuable virtues, and to take pride in owning them.
But the greatest risk is to claim a virtue you do not possess!
The game is played in rounds, with each player dealing once.

Equipment:
A PAIRS deck and a way to keep score.

Each Round:
Shuffle the deck and deal a hand of six cards to each player. Then deal two cards per player face up into the center of the table. For example, if there are five players, deal ten cards face up in the center.

Turns:
Play starts on the dealer’s left and proceeds clockwise. On your turn, you must do one of the following:

Bid: Take a card from the middle of the table and keep it
face up in front of you. This is called “taking a bid.”
Exception: The 1 is wild, and can’t be taken as a bid.

Swap: Exchange a card in your hand with a card in the
middle. The card you take goes into your hand.

Kill: Choose any card in the center and discard it. You
cannot do this until each player has had one turn.

The round ends when there are no cards left in the center.

Scoring:
The player who holds the most cards in each rank scores points equal to that rank. For example, you will score four points if you hold the most fours. (Bid cards are not in your hand.) If there is a tie, all tied players score the full value.

Calling the 1:
Before scoring begins, the player who holds the 1 must declare what rank it will become. It is important to do this before players reveal their hands.

After this, go up through the ranks and determine who has
the most of each. You can set cards aside to tally your score.

Bids: Each bid you make is a claim that you will hold the
most cards of that suit. If you have the most (or are tied for
the most), then each bid card is worth its face value. If you
were wrong, then each bid is worth negative points. If no one holds any cards of the bid rank, then all players are tied at zero. They score zero points for cards in their hands, but bids in that rank are worth their face value.

Final Score: A full game is one round for each player. The
player with the highest total score wins.

name: Bitter
description:
Free game published in the March 2018 (GTM #217) issue of Game Trade Magazine.

The game utilizes the Pairs game system and is designed with the Trolls Deck, though it can be played with any Pairs deck.

Summary:
You are Internet Trolls, struggling to justify your place in this modern world. You will write scathing reviews of entertainment properties, spreading vitriol while also refining your unique identity. In other words,score points with cards and win if you have the most.

Equipment:
A PAIRS deck and a way to keep score.

Setup:
Setup: Shuffle the deck and deal a hand of six cards to each player. Players will then draft a hand of five cards, because all good games start with a draft.

The Draft:
From your starting hand of six, choose one card to keep, and pass the rest to the player on your left. Keep your selected cards on the table in front of you. You will do this five more times, but rather than passing the last card, you discard it.
Each player should now have a five-card hand. With this hand you will now play five rounds.

Each Round:
You will play cards trying to score points. The highest unique card wins each round.

First, deal one card from the deck face-up into the center of the table. This card represents a new entertainment property that some group of misguided fools have poured their hard work and time into, but which is an insult to all true fans of the genre.

Players will then “review” the property by playing a card from their hand. This play is simultaneous. The number on the card represents (roughly) the amount of spite and vitriol in your review.

Next, the reviews are scored. First, discard any cards that match the center card or that match each other. These reviews are unoriginal and worthless.

Next, look for the highest card among the reviews that remain. The highest number wins the round,but the lower numbers also score points.

If your review was unique, whether it is the highest or not, you keep it aside for points. In addition, the player whose review was highest (not counting the discards) scores the card from the center.

If all reviews were duplicated and were therefore discarded, the center card is also discarded.

Winning:
The highest total score wins the hand. If there is a tie, count it as a win for all tied players.

The first player to win three hands wins the game!

name: We Slay Dragons
description:
We Slay Dragons is a fantasy card game focusing heavily on cooperation and tactical gameplay. A warm homage to classical role-playing and card games, We Slay Dragons brings them together for a fun experience to be shared between friends and family alike.

Free Print and Play now available!

Objective: Slay the Dragon and its Broodling horde with your party of powerful adventures! Make use of various cards in the form of magic, items, and more to either defend yourself or press the attack.

Choose Your Character: Your team needs to work together if you are to stand a change against the fearsome Dragon. Select a race, as well as one of four class decks, each with their own unique strengths and weaknesses.


Mage: A powerful wielder of magic, the Mage has a versitile hold of both offensive and defensive spells. Great for handling multiple enemies at once.
Knight: The stalwart knight functions best when placed in the thick of battle. Equip powerful weapons and armor to get the leg up over your foes.
Thief: The Thief is a tricky fighter that can make use of ally's items and equipment. Great combo potential make this class easy to pick up, and rewarding to master.
Mender: Best for players that enjoy a more supportive role, the Mender uses a variety of items to assist those in need, but can also dish out damage when needed.
8 Races: Choose from classic options such as humans, elves, and dwarves, or from others like trolls and goblins. Each brings their own bonuses and penalties to change the way you play the game.


—description from the designer

name: Mesmerized
description: Trivia quiz game in which each player has a secret response (like a post-hypnotic suggestion) to certain key words in the questions. Each player starts the game with a card listing their personal keywords. The active player asks a trivia question from a card. Other players answer the question or make their post-hypnotic response to any keyword that they hear in questions or answers. Players are rewarded for correct quiz answers and for guessing other players' suggestions.

name: Road Trip USA
description:
In Road Trip USA, each player is a traveler, represented by a pawn, on a mission to see various sites across the USA. When the game starts, depending on the number of players, a number of landmarks are drawn from the landmark deck and placed on the board as places for the players to travel to and collect. Once a landmark is collected by a player, however, the other players cannot collect that same landmark and a new landmark is drawn from the deck and placed on the map.

During a turn, players must choose to collect resources, travel, or use a free ride card. When collecting resources, they may choose any one of the available tickets (bus, rail, high-speed rail, or airline) or all of the cash currently face up in the resource pool, called the panhandle. New cards from the resource deck replace those that were taken. To travel, a player spends the required resource cards from their hand to move from one city to another city, matching resource cards to the method of travel required. Some cities are connected to one another by rail or road, others by high-speed rail, etc. Cash allows a player to buy any of the various means of travel. On a free ride turn, the player gets to utilize a rail or bus connection for free (without spending any resource cards from hand) by using a free ride card that is available in the panhandle.

Landmarks have three traits: Type (entertainment, natural, historical), region (Alaska, Hawaii, Northwest, Southwest, Northeast, Southeast) and alignment (represented by a number: 1-100). In order to win, a player must be the first to collect any one of the following sets: Any 8 landmarks; 2 of each type of landmark; 5 landmarks from different regions; or any 3 landmarks that have a matching alignment number (only the last digit of the number is used to determine).

-description from publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Roll & Move Boardgame: Dungeon of Kar-Kass the Dragon
description:
Roll & Move Boardgame: Dungeon of Kar-Kass the Dragon is a fun and simple game where you roll the dice and move a token, follow the directions on the space you land, and try and be the first to the finish.

This is just a fun little project for you to collect, enjoy the nostalgia, and play with friends and family.

—description from the designer

name: Nemo's Island
description:
Escape from Nemo's Island is a game in which 2-4 players have become stranded on an island where Captain Nemo retired from the world long ago. They must explore the island to gather resources (food, water and fuel), with which they can escape in the Nautilus.

Captain Nemo has also hidden his marvelous inventions around the island, and player can use clues to dig up those treasures. Gathering resources and digging up treasures earn the player victory points.

But Nemo has also hidden booby traps around the island, and if enough of the traps are triggered, the volcano on the island erupts and covers the island with lava. If the players escape the island before the lava covers the island, then the player with the most victory points wins, so players must work together to gather the resources needed to escape, but also work independently to dig up treasures to win the game.

—description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlefields: From Broadswords to Bullets
description:
The purpose of this book is to provide a simple set of fast moving rules, to simulate battles using model soldiers in the “HO” scale. This Scale is also referred to as 1/72nd or 20mm, and these figures are the most commonly available (and cheapest) on the market today. As such, it should be easy for the tactically inclined gamer to find armies of whatever time or country he or she may be drawn to.

These rules favor simplicity over “realism” and provide a fast moving and exciting style of play. They give you the feel of a historical battle ... without the death and tragedy of the real thing.

With this game, you can test your knowledge and understanding of strategy and tactics, while you enjoy the company of like-minded friends. You can reenact actual historic battles or create your own unique scenarios. The game is quite open-ended and has a lot of possibility for surprise, intrigue, fun and (hopefully) victory.

—description from rulebook

name: Table Top Baseball
description:
Table Top Baseball is played on a large (20"x30") rubber play mat. The playing pieces are chips of various sizes and colors.

The pitcher slides the ball "puck" from the pitchers mound towards the batters box. Results depend on where the puck lands.

The batter slides the puck from the batters box towards the field. Results depend on where the puck lands.

It comes rolled up in a tube.
publishers: Table Top Entertainment, Tame Tiger LLC

name: IRS
description:
An exciting new game of skill and chance in which you attempt to outsmart the ever present tax collector.
—description from the rulebook

A Yahtzee-style game played with 5 dice, 4 regular d6 and 1 with "IRS" replacing the 1 pip. Like Yahtzee, the scorecard is divided into upper and lower sections. The upper must be completed before anything in the lower can be done.

The upper section sets your Base Salary. You choose which number you are going for (1's through 6's) and roll all five dice. Count the ones that match what you are going for. You can continue rolling the 5 dice and adding more of your chosen number (1-6), thereby increasing your salary. One of the dice has "IRS" in the 1 position. If it ever comes up your turn is over and you only get half of the income you've accrued for that number.

The lower section lets you add extra income via Stock Options, Profit Sharing, Capital Gains, and a Tax Refund. Those rolls are also negatively effected if IRS come up.

Once you add your Base Salary and extra income you get your Total Income. You then have to roll for an Audit. Depending on your roll you will subtract money leaving you with your Take Home Pay. Highest Take Home Pay wins.

You record your scores on a pad of 1040 Forms.

Comes in a 2pc dice cup that doubles as case. The cap reads "Don't Gamble With Your Life".

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: Sandwich Masters: Attack Pack!
description:
10 cards to add to the game:

4 Health inspectors
4 attack condiments
2 new events
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Fahrt durch Venedig
description: The players start from different spaces to reach the Piazza di San Marco (space 80). Movement is determined by two dice. On some spaces, events hinder or benefit the players. From space 78 (Quai) on, the players roll only one die. The first player to reach space 80 wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der Fuchs im Hühnerstall
description:
The fox-player has two foxes on the red spaces under the roof of the henhouse. The other player has 15 chicken, one on each of the board's green spaces. The goal for the chicken-player is to occupy all nine red spaces with one of his chicken. The goal for the fox-player is to reduce the chicken to eight pieces, thereby preventing occupation of the red spaces under the roof.
All pieces may move along all lines in any direction. The chicken may not jump or capture any pieces. The Fox may capture (remove from the board) a chicken by jumping over it to a vacant opposite space.

The Game box is marked with the Letters A H E and was printed by Litho-Druck Kappler, Ravensburg

—user summary

name: Wasgo
description:
Journey to the islands of the Haida people to hunt animals of the land and sea in this unique trick-taking game. Play your cards wisely; you never know when the mythical Wasgo might turn your cards upside down!

In this trick-taking game, players compete to collect land and sea animal symbols. Each round, players will bid on a land animal type and receive one point per animal of that type collected in their score pile. Additionally, players will score their most valuable fish using multipliers that will continue to increase over the length of the game as players trigger them to upgrade by performing special actions. Wild cards (Eagle, Raven, Owl, and Wasgo) can be played for face value, or alternatively played along with other cards for their special abilities. Player should use their wild cards strategically, especially the Wasgo, which will flip the cards of all players upside down.

After 5 rounds, the player with the most points is named the best hunter in the land!

-description from designer
categories: American Indian Wars, Card Game, Mythology

name: Colorado: Sfida la Luna Nera!
description:
Board game based on the Italian TV program "Colorado", which was broadcast by Rai in 1997-1998. The program featured a push-your-luck game in which the contestants selected a number of cards from a set. The more cards they selected, the more they earned, but also the more the chances that they'd find the card called La Luna Nera ("the black moon") and get no rewards.

The board game is a hybrid between trivia game and card draw. The players must advance their pawn on a track, and the first player to reach the end wins the game. In the first phase, the players must answer riddles to advance on the track. In the second phase, players try to guess the position of the Black Moon card from a set of face down cards, and they advance based on how well they do. In the third phase, the players draw cards from a different set and advance based on the value of the cards they draw.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Logic and Reasoning: Riddle Master
description:
A children's game that has players moving along a board and tasks them with solving riddles. It is intended as an educational game for young readers and it includes instructions for the teacher as well as an answer key.

Description from the box:

Brave the Riddle Master's reading challenge! As players move through the maze, they are faced with the Riddle Master's logic and reasoning questions. If they answer correctly, they could be the first to reach the heart of the maze!

name: Il gioco dell'acqua
description:
Free educational board game sponsored and distributed by the government of the Piedmont region (Italy). It is meant to teach children how to save water. It also teaches about local water sources.
The game comes in a canvas bag, and includes a board and 6 pawns. The players must add 2 six-sided dice.
The game is a simple roll-and-move. The players roll dice and advance on a single track. Spaces include information about water preservation and main sources of water in Piedmont.

name: Little Chinese Warriors
description:
Unlike other boring educational game to learn chinese characters, little chinese warridor is very fun for family.

Through intense and exciting game competition, children can focus their attention and improve their cognition of Chinese characters, help them understand the correct composition of Chinese characters in game play, and gain an in-depth understanding of Chinese characters.:)

1. Shuffle all the cards and make them all face down on your table.

2. Youngest player first, initially clockwise. Each player take turns filp over one card.

3. When a player find two cards can form a Chinese character when he need to shout it out loudly the characters with correct pronouncation, and at the same time to cover these two cards with both hands, then he can take these two cards as scores of his.

4. If the pronouncation is not correct, need to discard a card which has been obtained, as a punishment.

5. When all cards been flipped over, or all players can not find characters they can compose, the game is over, players get the most cards wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Spelling Phonics
description:
A natural spelling the full amount of the card game, somewhat small to carry, best for traveling time to consolidate what school of natural law of spelling it.

Cleverly integrated into 324 high-frequency words, 44 gold natural spelling rules, the use of basic play UNO won the hearts of children with humor cute style.

Course of the game will not dull, on the contrary full of joy.

Level 1, 2, 3 implemented progressively, step by step, let the children slowly into the lane in the game to fully grasp the natural spelling pronunciation rules.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Panda's Wish
description:
It's a bit "sad" joke
On Panda's birthday, after blowing out all birthday candles, friends asked, What is your wish?
Panda says
I made two wishes
One is to have my dark circles cured
The other is shoot many colored photos
Then there is this game Panda's wish
We can not cure his black eye circles.
But we can help him shoot a lot of colored photos ...

1. After shuffle evenly, starting from the younger players, each player drawn 5 cards from the draw pile.

2. Flip over top card from draw pile, as starting card.

3. The next card must be the same color, or the same pattern match with previous card.

4. If the function cards is played, then you need to use the corresponding function.

5. When a player only two cards, you need to shout Panda so other players will notice.

6. Player who collects three star, win, and he is able to help to realize the Panda's wish.a

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Shopping List: Mathematics
description:
Shopping List is a image recognition, memory and match, pre-school mathmetic game for 3-6 year old kids.

Within a limited budget, let's do shopping, get to know the items in your shopping list, match and purchase, and get your changes back.

Who first get all items bought wins the game!

1. Each player gets a shopping list and a corresponding trolley.

2. Draw a price tag, and assemble it on your shopping list.

3. Each player will be dealt 30 USD as shopping fund.

4. Evenly shuffled 32 shopping item cards, place on center of table by 4 x 8 square.

5. Initially clockwise, each player take turns flip over one item card.

6. If the item is on your shopping list, pay the money, and put it into your trolley.

7. If the item card is not yours, flip it back, other player who need this item card, can remeber the position.

8. When player get all item cards on list, wins the game.

name: Sandwich Masters: Order Up!
description:
Order Up! is an expansion pack for Sandwich Masters.

Includes 4 new order cards, two new events, plus 4 blank order cards so you can design your own sandwiches!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Naves en Combate
description:
Challenge a friend to a battle. Take the reference monitor and build a fleet of ships to attack your opponent. Activate your ships and position them strategically on the map. Give your best attack using the Reinforcement Cards, but try ... not to lose any Mother Ship.

"Naves en Combate" (Ships in Combat) is a strategy and chance game for two players. Each one will be in charge of a fleet of ships with different attributes that will fight a battle on space platforms with obstacles and bonuses.
Players will get help from the battle environment and the Reinforcement Cards that will be used for their benefit or to deploy new ships in play.
The combat will not be simple since the motherships, sources of the Action Points, must be protected, an essential resource to start up the fleet of ships.
The winning player will be the one who destroys all the enemy motherships or who adds more energy points at the end of the game.

---

Desafía a un amigo a una batalla. Toma el monitor de referencias y arma una flota de naves para atacar a tu oponente. Activa tus naves y posiciónalas estratégicamente en el mapa. Da tu mejor ataque utilizando las Cartas de refuerzos, pero procura... no perder ninguna Nave nodriza.

“Naves en Combate” es un juego de estrategia y azar para dos jugadores. Cada uno estará al mando de una flota de naves con distintos atributos que librará un combate sobre plataformas espaciales con obstáculos y bonificaciones.
Los jugadores obtendrán ayuda del entorno de batalla y de las Cartas de Refuerzos que serán utilizadas para su beneficio o para desplegar nuevas naves en juego.
El combate no será sencillo ya que deberán ser protegidas las naves nodrizas, fuentes de los Puntos de Acción, recurso esencial para poner en marcha la flota de naves.
El jugador vencedor será aquel quién destruya todas las naves nodrizas enemigas o quién sume más puntos de energía al final de la partida.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Lord of the Sea
description:
A 38-page collection of fast play rules covering individual ship actions, major battles and featuring an extended campaign system, “Lord of the Sea” is centered set primarily on naval actions in Northern European waters in the 13th to 15th centuries. The rules have been written with 1/1200 scale models in mind, their inspiration being the models designed by Outpost Wargaming Services and others.

The rules mainly use six sided dice (d6), with ten sided dice (d10) used in some circumstances. Unless specifically stated otherwise all die rolls use a d6. Sometimes a d3 roll is called for. In this case roll a d6 and halve the score, rounding up (so a 1 or 2 gives a result of 1, a 3 or 4 gives a result of 2, a 5 or 6 gives a result of 3).

You will need (in addition to models and a playing area) a handful of dice, a ruler measuring in inches, pens and paper. Ship damage states are denoted by markers. Suggestions for more visually attractive markers are given later in the rules. Also included at the end of the rules are sailing templates for caravels and other sailing ships.

-description from Wargame Vault
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Build-A-Word Phonics
description: Two players take turns dropping letter chips into a grid to form words horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. Longer words are worth more points. The goal is to have the higher score once the grid is full.

name: Game of Oppression: Poe's Law
description:
Welcome to The Game of Oppression: Poe’s Law (GoO) a darkly, sardonic game focusing on inclusive gaming through humor. Similar to Cards Against Humanity in comedy style, in GoO you play a troll on the internet trying to prove you’re the most oppressed snowflake of them all. You are a troll though so your complaints aren’t about real issues but things you’ve made up in your mind. Your friends, evil trolls that they are, are also trying to prove they’re actually the most oppressed and stop you from gaining the win. Most importantly though the Game of Oppression: Poe’s Law is about inclusive gaming. Almost everyone will find an image of themselves somewhere in the deck.

The goal of GoO is to gain the most Oppression Points (OP) and/or to be crowned King of the Snowflakes. Game play is simple turn-based competitive point grab. There are three to five rounds per game depending on the number of players. Each game is approximately 30-90 minutes in length. During your turn you’re allowed to play up to three Cards of Complaint (CoC) worth between 3-5 OP. Additionally, you may play up to one Special card per round. All CoCBlocks are worth -3 OP and one may be played per Card of Complain. Every CoCBlock though can be countered with a DoubleDown worth a single point. Any item on the table not in the SafeSpace may be stolen through judicious use of the special Yoink card. After each round all players draw up to the hand limit of five so you’re never low on ways to prove how “abused” you are by the world.

Storytelling is an important element of the inclusive comedy of GoO. After playing a Card of Complaint you explain your story that goes along with the card. The story is built upon via blocking and then finished via DoublingDown. Each CoC can contain one tiny snippet of story for the group to discuss and share. While you do not have to include storytelling to play the game one of the main goals of the Game of Oppression is to share with your fellow trolls. Prove you’re the most oppressed troll ever to gain the crown.

—description from the publisher

name: 台詞回し (Serifu Mawashi)
description:
User summary
台詞回し (Serifu Mawashi), which would translate as "deliver your lines", is a party game whereby the players, as cartoonists, each receives 3 Line cards as their hand and use 1 or 2 cards to deliver their lines to fill the empty balloon on the single-panel Cartoon card drawn from the deck.

Vote on who has delivered the most suitable or fun lines, replenish your hands, and then repeat this until one of the players wins by acquiring 5 points.

Publisher's summary
一コマの漫画に描かれた吹き出しに当てはまる台詞をみんなで考えよう！
誰の台詞が1番そのコマに当てはまるか投票し、投票が多い人が勝ち！
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Party Game

name: That's So Wrong: Caveman Edition
description:
That's So Wrong: Caveman Edition is the first in what is hoped to be a long series of strategic party games that you can learn quickly, but spend years mastering. The game system offers so much substance that you can play them forever and ever until you die and pass them on to your children. Traditional standalone games usually make you pick one: they're either easy to pick up, but don't have enough gameplay to keep experienced players engaged; or they're loaded with depth, but tough to get into. That's So Wrong: Caveman edition was designed to keep experienced gamers entertained, while maintaining simplicity so new players can jump right in.

Players start the game by building their tribe from a random set of 4 caveman. Once all players have done this, players can send their caveman out to the "wild" to fetch items which in turn help make your tribe stronger. Conflicts happen when your caveman and another player's choose the same item, cave woman, event, caves to live in, or dinosaurs to hunt. If this happens conflicts begin and are resolved by looking at the text of the card. Follow the simple instructions to determine the winner. Winners take the prized possessions back to their tribe.

Certain cavemen and items are better at accomplishing different tasks. Some cavemen are good at hunting, some are good at finding love with the cave-ladies, and others are less practical. Some are even perfect for winning conflicts.

Cavemen who successfully accomplish their mission by being uncontested or winning a conflict become exhausted and they (and their spoils of discovery) are unable to be sent back out again until the following turn. Managing who is exhausted and how many cards are in your hand (which can be expanded with the discovery of a new home/cave) is important to claim victory. As your tribe grows rich with items, powerful dinosaur hunts, cave-woman, and pets you'll be able to win more conflicts and cause more mayhem for other players.

At the end of the game, players add up the value of the cards they've collected and a winner may emerge.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Colleges Against Insanity
description:
In this higher education-themed game, deal seven White Cards to each player. The person who most recently saw a squirrel begins as the Dean of Cards and plays an orange card. The Dean of Cards then reads the Orange card out loud. Everyone else answers the question or fills in the blank by passing one White Card, face down, to the Dean of Cards. The Dean of Cards shares the answers with the group, chooses the funniest card, and awards one .edu point to the person who played it. The person to the left of the Dean of Cards becomes the new Dean of Cards and everyone draws back up to seven White Cards. The game ends when all White cards have been played, or at least two players realize they have important work to do. The winner has the most .edu points at the end.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Lästerschwester
description: The malicious gossips meet and a hotbed of rumors swirls…who will it catch today?

name: Atlantic Adventure Race Game
description:
British board game celebrating Bob Manry's epic 1965 solo Atlantic crossing in his 13.5 ft. sloop Tinkerbelle.

The board depicts a map of the Atlantic Ocean, showing various possible routes from Falmouth, Mass. USA to Falmouth, Cornwall England.

A simple roll and move game for up to four players with numerous hazards and course changes along the way.

name: Tabaluga: Die große Reise
description:
It's your turn to roll the dice and move forward with your character, or back.

If you land on a motif that you have not collected yet, you may take a matching tile.

The game is exciting until the end: whoever arrives in grassland must check that he has the correct tiles. And if not, then the player must start over.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Sowas fragt man nicht!
description:
In turn, every player gets a piquant question such as: "Who has ever peed in the shower?"

Who does not want to answer, can fit up to two times - who fits for the third time, loses and is punished!

So, dress warmly, in this game you may learn more about your fellow players than you actually love!

name: Top Gamer
description:
In Top Gamer every player wants to be the best boardgames' gamer. This game uses Games Cards system and simulates boardgaming.

Every player trains his brain by playing board games during game parties. Playing in every game gives some experience to him, and player chooses which his level of game type or game mechanism to raise. After 2 game parties all players try to win the next 8 players (bots replace absent players) game tournament. To win tournament player must have higher total of his levels for type and mechanism of tournament game. The best 3 players of tournament get 3, 2 or 1 victory points. After 10th round player with the most points is top gamer.

name: Nonstop Dungeon
description:
Shake up the 36 dungeon cubes, flip the timer, uncover and compete! In this epic real time tabletop dungeon crawler players have four minutes to draw routes through the dungeon on their 6x6 grids on their score sheets. After, players add up their scores from all grids they've filled out this round and the highest total score wins! players gain more points per run the more spaces they cross and the more enemies they defeat and treasures they collect.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Pick-up and Deliver, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Dungeon Furry
description:
In this turn based follow up to the real time dungeon crawler Nonstop Dungeon take control of your favorite cat character and control them in the dungeon with your personal video game controller player mat. Use the DPAD sticks to claim routes on the map. Complete quests by collecting items in the dungeon to earn upgrades for your controller such as a joystick or shoulder buttons. Steal Dragon Eggs to gain VP or purchase quests. When a player has filled up their personal tv screen with quests or when all dragon eggs are claimed from the bank the game is over with the highest scoring player winning!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Détective Mathéo
description:
Détective Mathéo is a mathematics card game. The box contains three games: additions, subtractions, and multiplications.

Cards are displaying calculations on one side and results on the other side.

Players choose a card set, shuffle the cards, and put the pile between them with the calculations visible. They flip over the topmost card which now shows results and place this card next to the pile. The aim is to be the first to find the only calculations whose result is on the result card.

The player who first finds the right pair gives the result aloud and then the associated calculation. If they are correct, he then wins the "Results" card which is worth one point. If they are wrong, the are out for the rest of that round.

At the end of the game, one card will be left on the table, the player who has won the most card is the winner of the game.

name: Devil Core Tactics: Strategy RPG Card Wars
description:
Devil Core Tactics is a diceless strategy RPG card game for 2 players. Build your battlefield, summon your allies and enter into the war of the gods as you battle against each other. This is the core set and includes everything needed to get started.

This set includes :

Sacred Cross Deck x30 Cards (In Custom Sacred Cross Tuckbox)
Crimson Nobles Deck x30 Cards (In Custom Crimson Nobles Tuckbox)
8x10 Sinosha Battlemaps x30 (15 Per Deck) (Double Sided)
Devil Core Tactics : Rules
Battle Record Sheet x2


—description from the designer

name: Deck Derby: A Dead Seas Racing Game
description:
Deck Derby is a fast paced racing game in the Dead Seas fantasy realm. Racers use unique dice drafting mechanics to upgrade and win!

In Deck Derby each racer has a "Favored Number" and a "Favored Color". All players roll their dice and place them into a dice pool. One at a time players draft the dice there racers need to perform actions. Some of these actions won't require any certain number or color, some will require your preferred number, some will require you preferred color, and for game changing abilities the player must have both their preferred number and color. Racers will use their actions to speed themselves up, slow down other racers, or attack if the race is close.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: 1676: Miniatures Skirmish Battles in the Time of King Philip's War
description:
Pilgrim cavalry charges! Desperate attacks on fortified settlements! Daring ambushes! These are just a few of the skirmishes you can fight with 1676 - a tabletop miniatures game set in New England during the Native American uprising that became known as King Philip’s War.

The types of conflicts that occurred in King Philip’s War were usually small skirmishes that can be represented on a tabletop with these rules. You can play a native war party or a force from the Army of the United Colonies. If you want to add "fell creatures," magic, & (gasp!) European powers, there is a supplement available with these additions (Mad Dogs & Englishmen).

The core rules are provided in only 5 pages. They are simple & straightforward. Simple die rolls - using 6- & 8-sided dice - are used to resolve combat & other actions. Most actions have the same target for success, so they are resolved quickly.

You can use one of the pre-made "armies" provided in a second PDF (Part Two), or can create your own balanced forces using a simple point build system. Part Two includes unit cards, sample army lists, & all the tokens you’ll need. Alternatively, premade Unit cards, Command cards, & (Mis)Fortune cards are now available from The Game Crafter.

Both books are illustrated with photographs of figures from Brigade Games' King Philip's War line. With these figures (supplemented by those from other manufacturers), you can now easily field beautiful forces in miniature to represent the combatants.

So heed the call to arms! Your colony or tribe is depending on you!
categories: American Indian Wars, Book, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: A Formidable Enemy: Rules for Miniature Skirmishes in The French & Indian War
description:
A Formidable Enemy is a fast-paced skirmish game set in the French & Indian War. There are two PDF downloads included with your purchase: a 36 page rulebook, and a 45 page book of army lists and rosters. You can use one of the six premade armies, or create your own force with a comprehensive point system. The game has a historical "feel" through the use of Assets specific to different types of characters & units. Optional "otherworldly" rules are included to take advantage of some of the outstanding figures available for this period. Color photographs of figures from Conquest Miniatures, Eureka Miniatures, AW Miniatures, & Warlord Games, as well as structures by Acheson Creations (all used with permission) illustrate both documents.

Part One contains the game rules (summarized in a 4-page Quick Reference), Assets to personalize your troops (Abilities & Characteristics, Weapons, Artillery, Special Unit Members, Equipment, Vehicles, Animals, & Structures), Liabilities, Otherworldly Assets (including Divine Interventions), Templates, Markers & Tokens, & optional Event Cards.

Part Two contains brief historical information, Army Lists, and Unit Cards for the Indians, French, British, Canadians, & American Colonials. There is also information on Bears, Dogs, Zombyes, & a few other optional (but fun!) non-historical additions to the game (inspired mainly by figures from Conquest Miniatures). There are six sample armies, & information about how to create your own troops & armies.
categories: American Indian Wars, Book, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Yip, Yip, Yip: eine nervige Erweiterung
description:
This expansion offers new arrangements and event cards. Some arrangements include new mechanics, feeding back into player actions.

—user summary

Du dachtest, noch chaotischer geht nicht? Falsch gedacht: Mit Yip, Yip, Yip wirken sich die Arrangements auch auf deine Aktionen aus. Und die neuen Ereigniskarten halten ein paar hübsche Überraschungen bereit ...

Jetzt gilt umso mehr: Nicht die Nerven verlieren!

Eine besonders nervige Erweiterung für das Unicante-Spiel mit 34 Arrangements und 16 Ereignissen.

—description from the back of the box (German)

name: Earthly Scenarios
description:
The Earthly Scenarios game probes how adventurous you think you are, and how adventurous your friends & family think you are with its worldly content on real life events, occurrences and cultural traditions going on around the globe.

Players take turns reading a scenario aloud to the other players and then the other players try to predict how likely the reader is to participate in that scenario. Example: There is a Bridge made of Glass in China, would you walk across it? Predict correctly and points are gained. Every time 3 points are accumulated, an Earthly Card can be drawn, which contain certain clauses on them that can be used on yourself to get ahead, or against other players to keep them down. First player to 30 points wins!

Intuition of your peers is put to the test, as the most instinctive player is the most likely to win. Best part is learning about dozens of interesting, hilarious & thought provoking facts along the way.

-description from designer

name: CQB: Futuristic Skirmish Miniatures Rules
description:
Welcome to CQB, a complete self-standing set of science fiction miniatures rules for depicting Close-Quarter Battle! Inspired by the combat actions of the United States Space Marine Corps and other units featured in Skirmisher Publishing's popular and bestselling USMSC FM 7-22: Space Boarding Operations universal sourcebook, CQB replicates gritty, intense, close-quarter skirmishes fought on board starships, space stations, and industrial settings of Earth’s colonial worlds.

—description from the publisher

name: Der letzte springt
description: Each player has to get his 3 meeples from start to finish. There is a colored track for each player and movement is determined by a die. Only the last of the 3 meeples of a player may move and only if it can get to a space that isn't occupied by one of the 2 meeples before it. The first player to get all 3 meeples into the finish space wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Laura in the Magic Forest
description:
You are a sorcerers apprentice. You send familiars to the forest to gather ressources and with them produce magic artifacts or simply extract mana from them. But other apprentices are also competing for experience: who will display the best result?

in the magic forest is a mini-worker placement game, were you sent familiars (workers) either to gain ressources or to take one of three actions. Ressources can be used one-time or continuing, depending where they are stored.

name: Hidden Pavilions: The Maze Game
description:
2 to 4 players enter the maze. First to claim 4 pavilions and leave wins...but will the others catch up?

There are two sorts of double-sided maze tiles - fixed and variable. The fixed tiles are arranged in a static pattern, the other tiles are shuffled and laid around the fixed tiles to form a 7 x 7 grid.

In your turn, you have the choice of one of 4 actions:

roll the die and move your counter the indicated number of spaces along the path
turn over the tile your counter is sitting on
rotate a tile adjacent to the tile your counter is sitting on provided the path you're on leads to that tile and there is no other player's counter sitting on the tile
move a card from elsewhere in the maze to a gap adjacent to the tile you are on provided the path you're on leads to that gap and there is no other player's counter sitting on the gap you are filling


You need to roll the exact number to land on one of the 16 available pavilions and claim the tile (this is how gaps are created). Then you must be the first player to return to the gate with 4 pavilion tiles to win (and other players will be actively trying to block you).

—user summary

name: Critical Mass: 15mm Sci Fi Company Level Battle System
description:
The Critical Mass 15mm rule system is a fast play alternative action company level game. Infantry are based in multiples and form platoons, vehicles are based individually and grouped to form units. Each game round players must manage their units activations with play continually moving back and forth as each unit is activated meaning games a tense and involved. As you would expect from a sci-fi game Walkers, Drop Troops, Grav Tanks, and much more are a plenty, coupled with lots destruction and mission defined battlefield objectives.

—description from publisher
publishers: Critical Mass Games, Ral Partha Europe

name: Jönköping: Spelet om din stad
description:
Jönköping - Spelet om din stad ("Jönköping - The Local Game") is yet another of those Monopoly-style games that Swedish Local Authorities love to commission from games publishers.

In this case it was Gothenburg-based games publisher We Are Sailing (now defunct) that created the game.

The game is about the modern Municipality of Jönköping (Jönköpings kommun), which explain why the towns of Gränna and Huskvarna is present in the game (included in the Municipality since 1971). Historically, geographically and culturally Jönköping (founded 1284), Gränna (founded circa 1690) and Huskvarna (founded 1911) is quite separate entities. Also, the isle of Visingsö (a former countryside council in its own right) features fairly prominently in the game.

The game is estimated to have been published in 2008.

name: Greetings Fellow Humans!
description:
A game of extra-terrestrial antagonism for 3–5 players!

You are an alien! Your objective is to steal the Earth’s defense codes and conquer the planet.

In this fast paced party game, you must collect Intel cards from several search piles each with its own risks and rewards, the higher the risk the more likely you will gain the precious Intel but, try to avoid the Accident cards as they call attention to you and your plans.

Each player has access to a variety of Gadget and Sabotage cards to help them, or to hinder other players.

Collect the Intel, escape the secret compound and win the game, before you are discovered!

–description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Towerblox
description:
Towerblox is an early implementation of the block-stacking game that would be popularised by Jenga, but predating the release of that title by a year, and with 39 blocks to Jenga's 54. The packaging is in English and German, unusual for the early 1980s.

Gameplay is much like Jenga except the blocks are stacked on their sides, leaving space between them.

Published by Games Workshop, it was not a success on release. According to Ian Livingstone the rights to the game were sold to the creators of Kensington.

—user summary

name: Lobsterman's Lot
description:
From the manual:
"Find out for yourself what lobstering's all about. You never know what's in store for you. It may be verry bountiful, or full of perils - just like the Lobster Industry. Lobsterman's Lot is a fun game. Fair weather or foul, you're in for a treat, so 'come aboard and haul on your dory!' See what a lobsterman's lot in life is like."

In this game, the players move their fishing boats around the board purchasing bait, catching lobsters and crabs and selling them for money. The goal of the game is to be the first player to reach $7,000.

name: Nya Geni
description: Nya Geni is a trivia game that is played much like Trivial Pursuit: you walk around the circle of questions and when you've got an correct answer in all six categories (actually marked with a small colored chip laying at the table, nest to the player - no pie slices here!), you move into the central area and answer a final question chosen by the opponents. First to do so wins.

name: Föräldrafritt
description:
Föräldrafritt ("No Parents") is a fairly simple childrens game for the age group 8 to 14.

Spin the spinner and move on the board, draw an apropriate card and do what is says. It could be singing, acting or guessing - and it is all about yourself, your mates, the school, the life as a young teen. The outcome of your task will affect gameplay. Eventually one player will reach the last square - and win!

While being a board game the aim is probably more to have fun and laughter (and perhaps a few embarrasing moments) than actually to make grand strategic plans etcetera.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show in 6 Acts
description:
Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show in 6 Acts was published by American Tobacco Company, with paper pieces distributed inside cigarette packs.

The game consists of thirty-eight separate pieces, a game board (referred to in the rules as a "base"), and a "program", including instructions. The various paper pieces can be arranged (according to the program) to provide various scenarios (the "6 Acts") for play. Scenarios could be played only once the player had accumulated the required pieces from purchased packets of cigarettes.

The six scenarios include: Act 1 - Attack on Deadwood Coach; Act 2 - The Rescue; Act 3 - Buffalo Riders, Bucking Bronchos, Etc.; Act 4 - Surrounding a Wagon Train; Act 5 - Scalp Dance; and Act 6 - The Last Stand.

An annotated copy of the game is on display at the Buffalo Bill Center of the West in Cody, Wyoming. In the museum, the actual game pieces have served also as inspiration for life-size steel cutout "pieces" that are used throughout the display area to present various aspects of Buffalo Bill's life and times.

–user summary

name: Sten, Saks & Papir
description:
Board game inspired by rock-paper-scissors. Each player has six pieces each showing a hand gesture (two of each of rock, paper and scissors).
The game is chess-like and you get points for taking the other player's pieces.

name: Refugee Journeys
description:
Refugees are human beings. The journey doesn’t end with arrival in a new country. This educational tool explores themes of belonging, identity, discrimination and culture in a hands-on experiential way.

Refugee Journeys is based on a simple "snakes and ladders" game concept - players move forward, backward, or miss turns based on the cards they draw or the spaces they land on. Cards include integration experiences of real refugees, drawn from academic research, news and media, and the game creator's personal experiences. Examples are: "You are 65 years old. You want to learn English, but the topic is always about finding a job. Move back a space." "You were sponsored to a rural area, where there is no bus transportation. You always have to ask for rides. Move back two spaces." "Your child has made a friend at school. Move forward a space." Players move through the game using an "Identity card" which details their country of origin, family background, housing situation, gender, and many other identity markers. As they move through the game, their identity influences the path they take. For example, one space on the board says, "Are you Muslim? Move back 2 spaces." The game critically highlights experiences of discrimination and profiling.

While the goal of Refugee Journeys is for players to move from the "start" to the "finish," the real purpose of the game is to establish a space for critical conversations about refugee experiences, integration, and the intersectionality of identity. To this end, after every experience card is played, players choose a discussion question from options printed on the board to talk about as a group. The discussion questions cover topics related to identity, injustice, policy, and allow for players to share their personal experiences with the topic.

name: Miner 49r
description:
Miner 49r - Dice Game is a grid movement/dice placement game where you are a miner searching for GOLD, GEMS, JADE and DIAMONDS. You start at level 1 and as you search each level you progress down to the next level of the cavern. You will be digging within a hex grid using directional movement dice. You have TNT that you can use to blow up granite sections that block your path. Each level has an entrance to the next lower depth and as you dig your way through the cavern you must decide whether you can grab the precious minerals and make it to the exit or just get to the exit before you get stuck!

—description from the designer
categories: American West, Card Game, Dice, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement

name: Dominoplay: Fractions and decimals
description:
The series Dominoplay, created by Flavio Fogarolo, offers fun, didactic games which are variations on the classic game of dominoes, excellent for supporting learning and automatisms, especially but not only in calculations.

Dominoplay enables children to have instant control of the right matches: in fact, each element has a multi-coloured edge, a sort of colour barcode, which identifies the quantity represented, despite being presented under a different guise. If children try to pair up dominoes with different values they’ll realise immediately.
Thanks to the effective checking system, they can play fractions and decimals dominoes independently, even with the tables they don’t know perfectly, without needing the constant supervision of an adult.
Each game is divided into three levels of increasing difficulty and you can choose to play with only the dominoes belonging to the first level, only those from the second or the third level, those form the second and the third level together or the whole pack.
Dominoplay is a fun didactic tool and is ideal for encouraging inclusion: by carefully choosing the groups of dominoes all children can learn and have fun!

Dominoplay – Fractions and decimals provides exercises on fractions and decimals, using pictures as well.

name: Dominoplay: The Regions of Italy
description:
Created by Flavio Fogarolo, expert teacher of compensatory and didactic tools for pupils with special educational needs, Dominoplay innovates the classic domino game to sustain learning in the geography curriculum area in primary school. This box, in particular, concentrates on the regions of Italy.

HOW IT WORKS
The box contains 72 cards, divided into 3 groups:
• first group of 24 cards: regions in northern Italy
• second group of 24 cards: regions in central Italy
• third group of 24 cards: regions of southern Italy and islands

In turn, the groups are divided into two levels of increasing difficulty:

– the cards in the first level represent the name of the region with the coat of arms and the map of Italy with the region coloured in red.
– the cards in the second level represent the map of the region (only the external outline) with the location and name of the capital city, a picture of something characteristic from that region, with indications of the subject and its location, and names of cities and characteristic places of the region represented in road map format.

Game play can be organized by choosing the tiles based on the players knowledge. For example, if the players know northern Italy very well, central Italy a little but, and southern Italy/islands not at all, all 24 of the northern Italy tiles can be selected, only 8 from the first level of the central Italy group, and none from the southern Italy/islands group, for a total of 32 cards in all.

name: Weltindor's Stones
description:
Weltindor's Stones is a fairly simple game to win, despite it actually being lightly complex. The board is set up with nine platforms, each of which is split into a 3 by 3 grid. The platforms are all set out about 3 inches from each other, and connected by bridges, which are 1 tile long and create choke points. The corners are elevated about 1 inch off the ground, which gives an advantage to the player on them by giving them a higher chance to attack successfully. Each player is given a corner and the board to the left of the corner. The corner itself is named the lead board. On each of that player's platforms, there will be one stone, which can be moved by other players by having three individual units on the same tile as that stone. The overall point is to get 5 stones to your lead board.

A single turn consists of placing five units and moving them as a group or single unit 5 times. A move can also be spent attacking an adjacent square. Different units have different abilities, such as being able to attack from 2 tiles, or moving 2 tiles at once.

5 basic soldiers can come together to form a barracks, which essentially acts as a factory allowing extra units to be placed at the beginning of your turn. Barracks have to be hit 5 times to be destroyed. The leftover neutral platform in the middle acts as free land to establish barracks for anyone who can get there.

Action cards are abilities that cost mana (You get 1 mana at the beginning of your turn.), and can be played whenever they are needed, not specifically on your turn.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: The Princess Bride: Inconceivable!
description:
The Inconceivable! pack is a deck of 6 Princess Bride-themed cards that can be used with our line of The Princess Bride games, any of your other favorite games, or even in real-life that require a quick decision!

Whenever you don't want to do something, shout "Inconceivable!" and draw a card. If it is an "Inconceivable!" card, you don't have to do that action! Discard that card face up.

If you draw "You keep using that word...", you are the unlucky one that must do that action. Collect all six cards together to be ready for future use!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Imagine: jeux de société promo
description:
A promo card for Imagine released in Plato Magazine.

It's an extra card with only board games to guess.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Puzzle

name: Dino Twist: Bankiiizaurus
description:
Joker of strength 11, it is played on any species.

This promo (2 cards) is given out by the publisher at conventions.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Math, Number, Party Game, Prehistoric
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Starboard
description:
Starboard is a simple game you can play with a Pairs deck after (or during) a long sea voyage.

The rules were first published with the Pairs Pirates deck, but they are also published in the Pairs Companion as well.

The game utilizes the Pairs game system and is designed with the Pirates deck, though it can be played with any Pairs deck.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck

name: Kitty
description:
The basic goal of Kitty is to score points by winning bids and collected sets of cards. The core version of the game is for four players, but variants are covered later in the rules.

The rules were first published with the Pairs The Princess and Mr. Whiffle deck, but they are also published in the Pairs Companion as well.

The game utilizes the Pairs game system and is designed with the Princess and Mr. Whiffle deck, though it can be played with any Pairs deck.

name: A Rather Difficult Choice
description:
Would you rather have the head of a baby or only ever travel at 1mph regardless of the method of transport? And would the former still let you talk as an adult, and if the latter were true, what would happen if you grabbed onto a fast moving car? This game is about creating and fine tuning the most difficult choices in order to split your friends right down the middle!

All players start with a hand of five cards, each with a different scenario on, and during a round each player gets the chance to be the 'chooser', picking two cards to present to the others as a choice. All the other players must then ask at least one question to define the rules of each choice, with the goal of the chooser being to answer them in such a way to make them even more difficult to choose between. When a player has made up their mind, they take a 'decision card' and can no longer contribute to the discussion, and when all decision cards are gone, an immediate vote takes place. If the players split their votes as evenly as possible, the chooser wins!

This is as much a discussion mechanic as it is a game, focusing as much on creativity, humour and considering the implications of each situation as it does on winning!

—description from the designer

name: Mathemagician
description:
The tournament of the best Mathemagician is now initiated! In order to win the first prize: the legendary Book of Mathemagic, every mathemagician is well-prepared. Be ready for this challenge, doing whatever you can to beat other competitors and become the Master of Mathemagician!

Players will exchange their cards to form their card piles in gameplay. They can rely on the effect cards or their own judgment to achieve this goal. Meanwhile they’ll also use barriers to make their pinballs drop into right slot to get higher score, and avoid being disturbed by other competitors’ action. The key to win this game is by using your effect cards successfully and skillfully.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Smuggler
description:
The object of the game is to smuggle two bails of contraband from the "Mother Ship" and then proceed to land without being busted.

Each player selects a speedboat and corresponding color course to represent his/hervoyage across the board. There are three marked zones across the playing board. Each zone has both an eastern and western color course. Each zone should contain 2 stacks of corresponding game cards, marked EAST and WEST, placed face down on their allowed geographical spaces. There should be a total of 6 stacks of game cards on the playing board.

THE PLAY... Play begins with each player rolling die. Highest roll starts from Florida coast first. Second highest goes next and so forth. Speedboats progress across the board according to the roll of the die. When a player lands on a space marked X he/she must pick a game card form the corresponding zone and comply with the requirements before returning card to bottom of respective stack. Players are to draw NO MORE than one card per turn.

MOTHER SHIP & YOU'RE BUSTED... "Mother Ship" counts as one space to board and load. After reaching the "Mother Ship" each player must decide upon the quantity ( 1 or 2 bales) he wishes to load. The quantity of the load decides the degree of risk. If a player carrying 1 bale back to Florida draws a "You're Busted" card he/she must replace the bale back on the "Mother Ship", return his/her speedboat to start in Florida and try again. Two busts and player is out of the game. A player who risks to smuggle 2 bales on one trip back to Florida is automatically out of the game upon drawing a "You're Busted" card. (Exception see Pay Off Cards). The first player who successfully smuggles 2 bales back to Florida either on one trip or several is the winner.

PAY OFF CARDS... When a player draws a "Pay Off Card" he/she should keep it for use when busted. After it is used return it to the bottom of the deck.

name: Toke Up
description:
Go up and down the leaf, following the arrows and instructions on the cards that you receive from landing on their respective spaces. You must get all the way to the end of the leaf (without passing out). The first person to who lands on the "100 Kilo" space with an exact roll wins 100 Kilos. This stops all play and everyone counts up how many kilos they have. The person with the most kilos wins the game.

—user summary

name: K-Chess
description:
To play K-Chess you need a box of 8 K-Drons (4 each of 2 colors) and a regular chessboard.

There are only five (5) different types of pieces involved in this game: pawns, knights, bishops, rooks and queens (no king).

The object of the game is to capture the opponent’s figures using all the chess rules of movement. Each player has four (4) pawns at the start of the game located on the corresponding color square of the first row.

At each turn the player can either move a piece or transform it into another on (up or down the scale) according to the following sequence (scale): pawn-knight-bishop-rook. Pawn can be transformed into queens by crossing the board to the opponents starting row.

name: DinoPark
description:
You’ve heard the stories, seen the movies, but now the chance is yours to create history. For nearly 200 years, humanity has been fascinated by dinosaurs, ever since the first unearthing in Oxfordshire, England. From the mid 19th Century onwards, dinosaur discoveries were made around the world, on every continent and the rush was on.

Throughout all of this, fossils were uncovered and with these bones, scientists were able to recreate the look and properties of these “Terrible Lizards” for all to see in museums. This was the closest that we were ever able to walk amongst these creatures – until now.

Through ground breaking use of recreating DNA, scientists have been able to bring these creatures back from their millions of years of extinction. Theme parks are now being built for every man, woman and child to gaze upon these animals in their natural habitat. You have been tasked to design the ultimate dinosaur theme park with the hopes of it becoming the World’s Most Incredible Theme Park!

Through two Eras, you will be tasked with drafting cards to build a Dinosaur Theme Park. By strategically placing Herbivores and Carnivores around your park, you will attempt to outscore your opponents by collecting Victory Points (VP). However, dinosaurs alone will not be enough to win the game. Attractions and Rides will need to be built to increase your income, and you’ll need to build around the natural geography that your park is built upon. Oh, and let’s not forget about security, otherwise all those people you are bringing into your park may not be able to make it out and let others know how incredible your park is.

-description from designer
mechanics: Enclosure, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Ouroboros: Eternal Struggle
description:
The cards themselves change every round. Constantly changing tactical card play that can be cruel, yet just. This is a mystical ecosystem card game where managing your hand and board is challenged by ever-changing cards.

Players are simply playing cards either for effect (Spells), or to Store for later use. Be it Points and Carry-Over abilities (Boons), or Negative Points played on others (Curses)

name: Quorum I
description:
Quorum I can be played by two to six players. It represents a typical business corporation consisting of different levels of management. The objective of the game is to see which player will eventually attain the highest level of management - the Presidency! The first player to reach the Presidency and successfully obtain a dice score of seven is considered the winner, and the game is over. Quorum I is a game of chance and involves the tossing of two dice. As in any corporation, a player is subject to promotion, demotion, layoff, transfer, suspension, reprimand, and even dismissal.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Out of ConTXT: Geek Deck
description:
Reveal a card with a suggestion and then find the best answer on your phone. Use you texts, photos, song titles, whatever it takes to win. If you've got the funniest answer, you win the card. Get enough cards and you win the game.

A Comic Con exclusive.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Out of ConTXT: Raucous Caucus
description:
A stand alone expansion for Out of ConTXT.

Reveal a card with a suggestion and then find the best answer on your phone. Use you texts, photos, song titles, whatever it takes to win the State and all important electoral votes. Get enough votes and you win!

name: Hero Bridge: Battle of Northeast China in 1931
description: Hero Bridge is a two-player game of the Resistance at Nenjiang Bridge during the Invasion of Manchuria in 1931.
publishers: Kilovolt Design, The Later Han Games

name: Skirmish Action
description:
This set of WWII skirmish rules covers 1939-1945 with major unit Army Lists for German, US, Soviet, British, French, Polish, Italian, and Japanese forces, complete with point system for tournament games.

It includes variable initiative using cards (including command and control decision making), streamlined cover and concealment rules, streamlined sighting rules, vehicles, artillery, aircraft, scenario suggestions, and a d6 system with a single clever combat results table for infantry, vehicles, and guns. Optional rules cover vehicle crew bail out, slow turret traverse, ambushes, mines, night battles, massed targets, and more. Includes sample historical TO&Es, markers, and web support.

For Flames of War players, Skirmish Action includes adaptation for multiple figures per base.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Kilo
description:
The object of the game is to go out and by landing directly on one of many slightly shady establishments on the board, score one kilo of stash. In case you have forgotten, that is 35 lids. Should you go to jail you lose all of the lids you are carrying that are not safe. You lose 2 turns but can go free by rolling doubles on either throw or by paying $50 immediately.

You may go out and return home as many times as pessary, each time you return home you get an additional $75.00 and all the lids you are carrying are Safe. You may attempt to score your kilo in one trip around the board and return home, winning the game. But remember, anyone landing on the same space as you may take one of your lids you are carrying.

After landing directly on the scoring place, the price of your lids is determined by retooling the dice and paying the number rolled for each lid. You may purchase all or part of the number of lids listed for that scoring establishment.

name: Brain Quest Card Game: Grades 3 & 4
description: BRAIN QUEST card game comes with two decks. The Questions deck is like a normal deck of playing cards with the addition of 4 trivia questions on them. These can be used to play variants of Rummy, Solitaire, or Go Fish (instructions included.) The Game Deck is used only with the BRAIN QUEST card game in which players draw from the Game Deck to get instructions on how to play their Questions cards. The first player to get rid of his or her cards wins.

name: Trilobite: Family Game
description:
Trilobite is an educational game repeating a half billion years of marine evolution.

One to three players design an animal genotype set in the ocean of 500million years ago. Another player known as the “Mariner,” controls the trilobites, ammonites, plesiosaurs and other animals indigenous to the era.

The genotypes must survive the great radiation of life called the Cambrian explosion, as well as the Permian mass extinctions, and the Cretaceous event that exterminated the dinosaurs.

The genotypes evolve and metamorphose as they eat the marine animals they encounter.

—description from the publisher

name: Stages: Can you win a Grand Tour Bicycle Race?
description:
Welcome to the world of Grand Tour Bicycle Racing !

Stages is a 2 - 4 player card game where players battle for the Leader's Yellow Jersey by assembling teams of bikes racers in hopes of winning the most stages.

As the Sports director of the team, you are in charge of choosing which stages you are going to battle for with the team you have assembled.

There are 5 types of rides :
"The Captain", these are the leaders of the pack and their peddling for the podium.
"The Sprinter", these speed demons are winners of flat stages when top speed is on the line.
"The Climber", when the race heads into the mountains, you need the lungs of a yak, the speed of a mountain lion.
"The Domestique", eveybody needs help and these self-sacrificing riders are there to support their team by any and all means possible.
"The Super-Domestique", the ride able to morph into any rider when the time calls on them and thus the wild card.

Each of the 21 stages has a different profile suiting a different type of team. A stage takes anywhere from 1 - 5 riders to accomplish the stage. Every stage has points for the Leader's Yellow jersey and can have additional points toward the Sprinter's Leader Jersey with green points or red points towards the Climber's Leader's Polkadot Jersey.

However you can Crash Out of a stage or have teammates Traded to Other Teams.

Stage by stage and step by step battles ensue with the various jersey's changing hands until the final 21st Stage is completed and the winner is declared by holding the final Leader's Yellow Jersey.

Stages consists of 130 beautifully designed larger Tarot Card size (70mm x 121mm, 2.75" x 4.75") made of 300gsm professional quality card stock with a wonderful smooth finish.

With Hours of Play Testing, we Have Made Stages Easy to Learn and Quick to Play Taking Only About 30 Minutes for a Full Game.
