You can simply build your team for the Current Stage or you can carefully plan your next few moves while you building your team for the more difficult upcoming stages. With stages, you can play with as little or as much strategy as you want to put in it. Whether you are 6 or 106, everyone will have fun collecting riders and winning stages.

—description from the designer

name: The Noisavni Invasion
description:
The Noisavni Invasion is a light, science fiction skirmish game for two players. It consists of eight scenarios that can be played individually or linked together in a campaign telling the story of a conflict between identical mecha forces across mirrored dimensions. With only two pages of rules, it’s ideal for both inexperienced wargamers and seasoned veterans who want to have a series of quick, fun battles.

Players drive the action through a strategic hand-management system that gives them partial control over the order in which units activate - both their own and the enemy’s – adding a layer of command confusion. The scenarios specify changes or exceptions to the standard rules and explain the game end and victory conditions. Some scenarios even let you "shift" your units between the parallel dimensions, adding a simulated 3D experience!

The game adds fresh ideas while incorporating familiar wargame concepts such as zone of control, supporting fire, attacker losses, and advances after combat, tucking them into the mechanisms in subtle ways that make it easy for novice players to understand.

You’ll need to print and cut 2 map sections, 10 unit standees, and (optionally) 10 Turn Tokens. The components come in two sizes, and you’ll only need to print one or two pages depending on the size you prefer. You’ll also need a regular deck of playing cards or a handful of six-sided dice.

—description from the designer

name: Valiant & Villainy
description:
Valiant & Villainy is a card game in which players take on a superhero or super villain that is defined by drawing random cards from the origin deck, the offensive power set deck, the defensive power set deck, and the utility power set deck. There are over 80k different possible combinations, so every game you play, your heroes and villains are different.

Throughout the course of the game, each player uses the same action deck that triggers super powers. They can use the powers to capture an objective or fight directly against the enemy.

Valiant & Villainy is both a co-operative and a competitive game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Garden Rummy
description:
Garden Rummy uses the 64 Seed Packet Cards from The Garden Game to give a new twist to an old favourite.

There are 4 suits (Wild Garden, Flower Garden, Fruit Garden and Kitchen Garden) of 16 cards each. Each player is dealt 7 cards. The object of the game is to Go Out by putting all your cards down, either in sequences or in suitable discards. You may add cards to your opponent's sequences, but only when you go out (and the card you add will count to your opponent's score)

Triples of a single number do not count as sequences.

The number 16 card is special, in that you can discard a 16 with 1 or 2 more hidden cards beneath it, thus ridding your hand of unwanted cards without having to give them to your opponent. You may only pick up a 16 if you hold the 14 and 15 of the same suit to form a sequence immediately. Before picking up the 16, you must say whether you wish to have the concealed cards under it, sight unseen.

Scoring:
100 points for going out. 50 points for each sequence. 10 pts/card in sequences of 3,4 or 5 cards. 20 pts/card for sequences of 6 or over.
Sequences containing a 16 double in value.
A complete suit of 16 cards doubles again.

—user summary

name: Guilty!: A Shamefully Fun Card Game
description:
Guilty! is a cutthroat game of cunning, manipulation, and deceit for 3-6 adult players. You probably want to keep children at least 500 feet away from this game at all times.

Each player acts as the Public Defender to one of 6 deplorable suspects being held in connection to a crime they most likely committed.

It is your duty to manipulate the system at all costs to make sure that your suspect is not found guilty by playing evidence cards like "Brown Eyes", "Fat", or "Mole on Face" and then debunk those pieces of evidence with cards like “Intimidate a Witness", "Flush the Drugs", or "Did You Just Assume My Gender?”

Once you have pinned enough evidence on your opponents, they are found guilty and they lose.

There is no winner in Guilty, only a loser. And no one likes a loser.

So, if you’ve ever wanted to bribe a cop, claim oppression, impersonate an officer or claim conspiracy in the comfort of your own home, Guilty! Is the game for you!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Being Erica: The Game
description:
This game is based on the Canadian television show, 'Being Erica' (which aired from 2009-2011).

The object of the game is to be the first player to move your pawn around the board and back to the start space.

Depending on which space you are on, you might have to share regrets, give advice on how to deal with regrets, vote on other players' advice, etc. "Erica's Regrets" cards will help fuel the conversation. Depending on the answers you provide and the spaces you land on, you may be able to advance on the board faster than any other player. The player who advances the fastest will be the winner.

name: Auf die 6 kommt's an!
description:
Each player uses 3 neighboring columns on the game board. The spaces in each column are numbered 1 to 4. The big center space has the number 5. Each turn the player rolls a die and sets one token on a space of the rolled number. If a 6 is rolled, the player may chose one column. For each placed token, the player gets as many points as the space it has been placed on indicates.
If all 3 spaces of a number are occupied, they count double. The tokens get stacked, ifa number is rolled more thn 3 times.

After 6 turns the players roll the die till a 6 is rolled. The player who rolled the 6 gets 5 points for each token on space 5. The player who has the most points after 6 rounds wins the game.

name: Shh! Bocadillos de medianoche
description:
The night has fallen, all humans are off to sleep, and the racoons seize the darkness to get inside their kitchen and steal delicious snacks to take back to their lair. But, be careful! The family dog sleeps in the kitchen and will bark immediately if it discovers thieves inside! So,Shhh! Don’t make any noises, for if the humans wake up, they’ll bring their brooms and you’ll have to run away empty handed.

Game Description
Shhhhh!!! Bocadillos de medianoche ("Shh! Midnight Snacks") is a fun and fast-paced, game in which players are represented by racoons that try to steal as much food as possible before the dog barks and wakes up the people inside the house.

Game Objective
The objective of the game is to be the player that collects the most amount of food points. This is achieved by moving food tokens from the kitchen to a nearby window, but the bigger the food looted, the noisier the racoons will be and chances are they might wake the dog up. If the dog is fully awakened, it will start barking and the residents of the house will wake up. The player that collects the most amount of food points will be the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Video Trivialities
description:
The box contains one game board, eight pawns, a VHS cassette, and booklet with the rules and questions. After each player chooses a pawn, they roll the dice with the greatest number rolled getting a three space starting advantage on the game board and the role of video operator. The video operator poses the questions in the booklet and operates the remote for the VHS player.

To play, the video operator reads aloud the next question in the booklet. Each player offers an answer starting with the video operator and going clockwise. Players must offer a different guess than one already offered by a previous player or pass one’s turn. When everyone has made a guess or passed, then the video operator plays the VHS tape which reveals the proper response. If a player has given the correct answer then that player rolls the die and advances that many spaces on the game board toward the finish. The first player to reach in the finish is the winner.

The Video Trivialities game contains 258 questions. There is at least one expansion with a question booklet and another VHS cassette.

name: Casino Action
description:
In this simplified home version of Craps, players are attempting to win poker chips from the banker by betting on which number will be rolled on the added value of two 6-sided dice. Depending on the value rolled, players will either be paid back 2-4 times the amount of their bet, or will owe their money to the bank. The role of the banker switches when one player rolls a 7. At some point, one player will have won the majority of the money in the game and can be considered the winner at that point.

—user summary

name: Dickie Dick Dickens
description:
One player playes Dickie Dick Dickens (DDD) and up to four players are his pursuers. DDD has to get from one D-Space to the other. Movement is determined by a die. The pursuers start at the blue V-spaces and try to catch DDD by landing on the space he occupies. If DDD lands on a space that is occupied by a pursuer, the pursuer goes to prison for the rest of the game. If a 6 is rolled the player may not move but draws a card and has to follow the instructions printed on it. DDD may not move through the blue areas, whereas the pursuers are forbidden to move through the orange areas.

DDD wins the game if he reaches the other D-space. The pursuers win if they manage to catch DDD.

The game was most likely published between 1957 and 1962, when the DDD radio show was aired.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cim
description:
Cim is an abstract game for two to four players, played on a fifteen by fifteen rectangular grid. Each player attempts to arrange a set of Miwin's Dice (numbers III, IV, and V in the family) into the shape of an isosceles right triangle.

Placement of dice is constrained by their distance on the grid from other dice. During initial placement, dice are placed exactly n units away from the last die placed (which has n pips showing). Once all dice are on the board, a player may re-position one of her own dice with respect to the pips showing on any other die on the board.

—description from the publisher

name: Truth Be Told: Girls' Night Out
description:
A hybrid between Jenga and a party game geared toward women.

The game consists of a set of small wooden blocks. Each block has a personal question written on it, like "What is the biggest sacrifice you ever made for a boyfriend?" or "Have you ever taken revenge on an ex?" The blocks are used to form a Jenga-type tower.

Players take turn removing blocks. To stay in the game, a player must also answer the question on the block. The person is eliminated if the other players agree that the answer was not truthful. A player who makes the tower fall is eliminated. The tower is then rebuilt and the game continues as above.

The last player to remain in the game is the winner.

name: Cunning
description:
A trick-taking game in where the goal is to play the lowest card of the trick face down to win points equal to the value of all cards in play.

The game ends after someone reaches the point limit of 50 times number of players or 20 turns, whichever is achieved first.

name: Das München-Spiel
description:
This game is a memory-variant with pictures of the city or region the game is developed for. There are many different editions for about 200 cities or regions in Germany.

Each pair of tiles has a set of corresponding questions on it, where each tiles also gives the answer to the other one.
This way, several trivia-games can be played. Two special dice are included.

The rules describe 7 different way of plays.

name: Mord im Büro
description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Murder in the Office

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

name: Mein allererstes Würfelspiel
description:
My very first dice game

The mouse, cat, bear and elephant try to reach their cosy bed in the clouds as fast as possible. But only the one who has a bit of luck with the dice and who takes big steps will arrive there first.

A very first dice game with simple rules, wooden child-friendly counters and a big dice with symbols.

Game material: 4 mice, 4 cats, 4 elephants, 4 bears, 1 game board, 1 large dice with symbols

name: Prinzessin Amelia
description:
Princess Amelia

This is a game for glittering princesses, both big and small!

It's almost time for the annual summer festival in honour of the great fairy sorceress Valpurga and you are invited, of course. So, you go into the big diamond forst to look for the most beautiful, glittering stones so that you can light up the magical festival with your jewellery.
The princess with the prettiest jewellery wins the game and is queen for the evening.

name: Lizenz zum Sterben
description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Licence to Die

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling

name: Kommissar Rex: Das Verkehrsspiel für Spürnasen
description:
Material:
Gameboard 28 places (city) for the question cards
(all have a colored border).
26 fields around the board for the moving
of Kommissar Rex
36 Question cards Front with a road sign on the front side
(all have a colored border),
name of the sign and meaning of the sign.
on the back side
1 dice: Numbers 2 + 3 and Paw Symbol (each 2 times)
1 dice: with the direction Road Signs "turn right", "turn left",
"straightforward"

Setup:
On every city field 1 question card (road signs)is placed (colors are ignored). These are the fields where the player can move their stones. The rest of the cards, are not needed for the actual game.

Target:
The player with the most question cards at the end of the game wins.

At players turn he roles both die and moves his stone exactly the number he has rolled. He has to change the direction (left or right) 1 time if he has a turn left or turn right.
If on the target field there is still a question card, the player gets it without any question.
If the field is already empty, he looks at the colored boarder of the field and can try to steal a card with the same color from another player. To do this he has to say the right name of the sign (for experst: He has to say additional what is the meaning of the sign, for little children: they get it for free).

Kommissar Rex the Dog from the TV crime series is moving on the fields at the edges around the board every time the paw symbol is diced (the actual player gets no card).
The game ends when Kommissar Rex reaches the police station.

Cooperativ variant
In this variant the stones are allowed to be movesd on the fields at the edge of the board, when they hit exactly Kommissar Rex. All players are allowed to move every stone. All players win if they have done this with all 4 stones before Kommissar Rex reaches the police station. If a stone does not reach Kommissar Rex but a Question Card, the player is asked for the name of the road sign on it. If it's the right name he gets the
card and Kommissar Rex is moving 1 field. Otherwise ths card and Kommissar Rex stay on their places.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Monstermampf
description:
A game for all those who loves monsters!

Who hasn't been of a loud, growling monster? But monsters don't growl, because they are angry, but because they are very hungry. The hungry monster's stomach growls so loudly that it sometimes frightens itself. Help the monsters by feeding them. Find the right treat and free the monster from its growling stomach. The winner is the player who has succesfully fed the most monsters at the end of the game.

name: Gummibären im Zauberwald
description:
Jelly babies in the mysterious forest

The jelly babies explored the mysterious forest and found the following magic objects: Magic swords, secret maps, magic rings and bags of gold.
Each player tries to move the pawns on the board so that they eventually arrive in his house and give him some magic presents. The first player with all 4 kinds of magic objects wins the game!

But beware of the wizard who changes the magic objects into useless flowers!

name: Geometrie für Kinder
description: Geometry for children

name: Kreuz und Quer durch das Neue Testament
description:
This game is a mixturure of a Bible trivia Game and Monopoly.
The board game has 2 parts: In the middle a card of Mediterranean Sea at the period of Jesus. There is a single path through this map.
The second part of the board are fields at the border of the board with fields known from Monopoly. Instead of streets this are chapters from the New Testament. There are some special fields where you have to ask questions from the bible.

The game starts at the start point of the map track. The actual player roles 2 die and moves. dependent of the points on the die he gets questions from different stacks of cards (all from the bible). If he knows the answer he gets the points written on the card.
When the track ends the figure changes to the Monopoly kind path. Like in Monopoly you can by the fields, but not with money but with the points you have collected with the right answered questions. You have to pay parking fee for fields owned by other players. As in Monopoly you can increase the parking fee by placing houses (they are named red and white stones here.
Running out of points and area cards you may change back to the Mediterranean Sea path 1 time to get points answering new questions.
The game ends after a predefined time. The player with the most points wins (including value of area cards and stones).

Variants (mentioned in rules):
1. Just role the die and run first the Mediterranean Sea path and after that the Monopoly path. The first player who comes to the Start of teh Monopoly Path again.
2. Bible trivia: Just use the question cards. Who has the most points at a predefined time wins the game.

name: Mega Party
description:
Collection of party games for youngsters:
- Quiz about music, charts and stars
- Live acts and pantomimes
- Quiz about trend sports, such as mountain biking, inline skating, skate boarding, etc.
- Describing words while avoiding any forbidden terms
- Blindfolded drawing
- Spinning the bottle

name: RAMPopoly
description:
A high-flying aviation game of elimination starring Lloyd L. Lander. Fly your miniature plane around the airport themed board winning as many Airline, Airport and Service Contracts as possible.
The more aviation Contracts you operate, the more money you'll make!

Rolling the red & green dice (dice double as auction & repairs) to fly your coloured plane to purchase Airline service contracts to earn money from the loading/unloading of baggage & cargo. Additional income can also be earned from providing aircraft power and fuel services. Should a player have twin contracts eg. both Scottish airlines then more baggage capacity can be added to collect higher contract fees.

The unique auction & repairs mechanic sees both dice rolled, should the green die roll higher than the red die then the player receives the “green” light to repair their plane or have won a contract aution.

Win a Long Haul game by being the last airport services company operating on the ramp. A Short Haul game is won after the first player has been bankrupted, the player with the most assests wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation

name: Diesel Punk Apocalypse
description:
Out in the wastes, our engines roar. Rumor of a city full of scrap and supplies lay out there on the red horizon. Getting there first is the problem.

Diesel Punk Apocalypse is a fast-paced game of vehicular mayhem. Players take the wheel of a unique faction as they battle across scrolling road tiles. When a vehicle is destroyed, the fun doesn't end. Just draw another vehicle blueprint, punch the nitro, and reenter the fray!

The faction of marauders with the most points at the end of the game wins!

name: Marbel Firefighter: The Card Game
description:
Oops! The flame fo fire burns the Marbel Town! Hurry! Get Ready to extinguish the fire before it's too late!

Be the best firefighter in Marbel Town! Grab the hose, plug it in to hydrant, shoot the water and extinguish the fire! Earn the points as much as possible. Get the extra points by rescuing other victims such as cat, baby and grandma.

Player with the highest points will be the champion of the game. What are you waiting for? Let's play this fun game!



HOW TO PLAYIn the player turn, they have up to 2 action and choose one of this action :
1. Extinguish The Fire
We can extinguish the fire with discard our cards in hand same with the symbols showing on the fire card. We can use star cards as a wild card. All player can only extinguish fire that stay on same position with hydrant card.

2. Move the Hydrant
We can discard 1 extinguish card with the specific symbol to move hydrant card into the different building. Symbol at the discarded card must same with building symbol.

3. Exchange Card
We can exchange 1 card in hand with 1 card in 4 opened extinguish cards.

After one player turn we must check :
1. If total cards in hand less than 5, player must take new cards form pile so player get total 5 cards in hands.

2. If all of 4 opened extinguish cards is have same symbol. Discard all and open new 4 cards from pile.

3. If pile is runout, we can re-shuffle discarded cards.

—description from the designer

name: Bushido: Jyoto Ashigaru
description:
All Jyoto Ashigaru are heavily armoured, each suit individually tailored to the particular soldier. They carry heavy metal Tetsubo which most men need two hands to use (Though some of the Minimoto effortlessly swing them with one hand or indeed, wield two of them!) with which they are trained relentlessly to build up their strength. They form the bulk of the Minimoto forces and each started their life in the army as an unblessed, proving themselves before joining the ranks of the Jyoto Ashigaru.

Blister contains two models, two 30mm bases and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Hisoka
description:
Hisoka is undoubtedly and completely mad. He spends much time alone in the mountains and how he survives is a mystery, when he does venture to the lower climbs his bare chest makes even the hardiest of Minimoto shiver. He does however fight for what he believes in and his knowledge of the land and surviving the wilderness is very useful to the Minimoto, whilst his resilience and hardiness leaves the peasants of the Ro-Kan in awe.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Minimoto Clan Special Card Pack
description:
Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create a very focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are four types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event, Terrain and Theme Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the faction’s strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.

Pack contains fourteen faction specific special cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Nova Regula
description:
Nova Regula is a classic card game with one twist - the rules are always changing. Players take turns playing cards into the pot. If you can't play a regular card, play an event card instead. Some event cards change the rules, but beware - the change may not be in your favor!

The game ends when one player no longer has any cards in his or her hand. Each player adds the values of the cards in his Score Pile and the player with the highest number of points wins the game.

Includes a custom deck of 52 classic playing cards, 6 Wild cards, 20 Event cards, and 30 Rules cards, packaged in a box large enough to hold the cards from both this set and the expansion.

—description from the designer

name: Nova Regula: Expansion Set
description:
Nova Regula is a classic card game with one twist - the rules are always changing. Players take turns playing cards into the pot. If you can't play a regular card, play an event card instead. Some event cards change the rules, but beware - the change may not be in your favor!

The game ends when one player no longer has any cards in his or her hand. Each player adds the values of the cards in his Score Pile and the player with the highest number of points wins the game.

The Nova Regula Expansion Set includes 108 more cards to shuffle into the Nova Regula and Rules decks. Recommended for use with 5 or more players, as there are too many cards to handle when playing with fewer players.

—description from the designer

name: Gameception: Sneak Geek
description: Gameception: Sneak Geek is a 15 card (Geek culture inspired) Kickstarter stretch goal expansion to Gameception.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Temple of Knowledge
description:
In Temple of Knowledge, players work together to explore a crumbling temple and find ancient books. Grab as many books as you can before the temple collapses! You and your teammates will work together to get the highest score you can.

Temple of Knowledge is an educational, cooperative game that is driven by flash cards. It can be played with any subject, and the more difficult the flash cards are, the more difficult the game will be!

On their turn, each player either discovers a new tile of the Temple or walks back over an old tile. As players get questions wrong and discover Crumble tiles, the Temple will begin to collapse. When it does, tiles flip over starting from the Crumble tiles and spreading from there. When each player has escaped from the Temple or been rescued, the game is over.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Tile Placement

name: Aussie Outback Dice
description:
This is a dice game for two or more players of any age. Players try to score in one of fifteen categories on each turn. The scoring categories are listed on a score sheet. Examples include: "3 Different Animals," "4 Koalas,"3 Emus," etc. At the end of the game each player adds the category scores together and subtracts any penalty points (from crocodile encounters!). The player with the highest total score wins the game.

There are five identical six-sided dice. Each face has a picture of an animal on it (opposite face pairs on a die are lizard-koala, kangaroo-emu, and buffalo-crocodile).

Players roll all five dice, then may select dice for scoring. The player can reroll twice and select dice each time, if desired. If a player cannot put a score down for any category after three rolls, the player must record a zero in one empty category. Each and every appearance of a crocodile on every roll imposes an immediate 3-point penalty for that player.

The rules include an alternative game, optional penalties, and a listing of the odds for each type of dice roll.

The game consists of a card stock cover (with rules printed inside), five special dice, and a scorepad. Everything is packaged in a clear plastic envelope.

—user summary

name: Trillionaire: The Card Game
description:
Billionaires from all sorts of dimensions have traveled through wormholes in space and time and have arrived in the same place. They all have one goal in mind... to become the first trillionaire in the universe (or universes)!

Trillionaire is a card game that comes with pre-built, balanced decks so it can be played right out of the box. Players continue battling until one obtains 10 Cash Cards ($1 Trillion worth) and successfully deposits their full Trillion into the bank. You can only obtain sufficient Cash Cards for victory by Bankrupting opponents' Billionaire Cards.

Billionaires range from a sentient computer from Neato Prime, who philanthropically solves global problems, to a space traveling asteroid miner from the Bermuda Wormhole dimension. Each player must ‘Lawyer up’ their Billionaires to make them ready for battle with opposing Billionaires, while also playing Control Cards to influence their own and other players’ actions.

Every player starts with a deck of 60 cards. Players may use one of the pre-built decks, or each player's deck may be customized before play begins. Trillionaire was designed from the start to be both highly customizable and strategic.

There are four categories of cards which make up each deck:


Cash Cards - Worth $100 Billion each, these cards are the heart of the game. If you successfully put 10 Cash Cards on the table, you may attempt to deposit them to win the game!
Billionaire Cards - These character cards serve as your front line to Sue and Bankrupt your opponents' Billionaires. Comes in "Standard" and "Super" varieties.
Lawyer Cards - These cards are attached to your Billionaire Cards, enabling them to Sue your opponents. Without them, your Billionaires wouldn't be able to do anything. Comes in "Standard" and "Power" varieties.
Control Cards - These cards help you control the game in your favor. Some involve greater risk, but have a greater reward.


If players choose to customize their decks, they must follow certain rules:


There are no more than 10 Star Cards allowed per deck. (Every card is either a Star Card or a Non-Star Card.)
Your deck must contain exactly 15 Cash Cards.
All players must have exactly 1 Veto Card in their deck.
Players may only have up to 3 of any card that is not a Cash Card, Standard Lawyer, or Veto card.


Trillionaire can be played with a teammate (2 v 2) or as a free-for-all (up to 4 players).

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order

name: ZAM
description:
ZAM is a game between two players. The object of the the game is to "exterminate all the Zammen of the adverse side or leave some immovable." The game is played on an 8x8 checkered board.

The pieces are made of colored wood, one side red, the other yellow. Each color has two shapes: either a short cylinder with a hole through the axis, or a short cylinder with a post protruding from the center.

A short cylinder with the central hole is called a "SOL." It moves diagonally one square at a time, forward or rearward. It captures forward only. When it reaches the extreme end of the board it is promoted to a "ZAM" by placing it upon one PARPY of the opponent.

The PARPY has a post protruding upwards from its base. It moves one or two squares diagonally in any direction and can jump over a friendly SOL to an unoccupied space. It captures forward only. It can be promoted to KING upon reaching the far rank by turning it over and inserting it into an opposing SOL.

The ZAM has complicated movement and capturing abilities and restrictions. It can move one space diagonally, or two diagonal spaces not in the same line. It captures by leaping (with certain restrictions).

The KING can move in any direction. It can move one or two squares diagonally or two squares vertically or horizontally.

The rules are presented in the form of fourteen laws.

The game comes in a small box. There are six SOLs and six PARPYs included, along with a paper board and an instruction pamphlet.

—user summary

name: Jibe Card Game
description:
Jibe is a strategic matching card game.

The Cards

There are twelve icons, each with a different point value. Each six-sided card has either two sets of three identical icons or one set of six identical icons. The cards with six identical icons are known as a “core” cards. There are 80 unique cards. There are four colors associated with the icons. Each color is shared by three icons.

The value of each card is the sum of the values of each icon set on the card and is displayed in the center of the card.

The icon set values are as follows: Can=0; Joker=0; Beakers=5; Pencil=10; Bulb=15; Note=20; Star=25; Heart=30; Plane=35; Gear=40; Key=45; Fire=50.
Play

There is a core card for every icon. Every round of the game is started by placing a core card in the center of the playing surface. You can play just one round, or you can play multiple rounds, starting with a different core card each time. Choose it before distributing cards to the players.

Deal five cards to each player. During your turn, play one card from your hand by matching the colors or icons with cards already played. If you just match the color(s), you can only count the value of the card you laid down. If you match the icon(s), you can count the value of your card plus the value of each card(s) where the icon(s) matched. All colors must match, except when a joker is played.

If you play a core card during your turn, you can play another card during your turn to match it.

After your play, you replenish your hand by drawing one card from the pile. If you play a core card and are able to match it with another card from your hand, you draw two cards.

If you can’t play or choose not to play during your turn, pick up one card from the pile.

Jokers are wild. They can match any icon and each of the three Joker core cards can be used to match six cards at once. They have no point value when played, but make sure you play them, because their value switches to 100 points and count against your score if left in your hand.

Record your score after each play. Keep playing until all the cards in the pile are drawn. Then play until someone has played all their cards or until no other play can be made. Each player then adds up the card values left in their hand and subtracts the sum from their score.

If you play multiple rounds, you can add the scores from each round to determine the winner. Or, you can treat each round separately, award a point to the player with the highest score for each round, and the winner is the player who won the most rounds.

name: Power Zone
description:
Power Zone is specially designed for maximum play - 5 games in 1! The dual position pockets can be closed or opened to create a variety of challenges. In some games, players take turns aiming and shooting; in others, you battle simultaneously. Every game, no matter which you choose, is an action-packed experience.
—description from the manual

Power Zone resembles a circular version of Crossfire, with 2 disc launchers and 6 goals.
—user summary

name: Sue Sue Sue: Arnold Brothers Lawsuit Game
description:
The object of Sue Sue Sue is to sue your fellow players with a lawsuit, pay the smallest amount of lawyer fees, and pay out the least amount of money when another player sues you.
You must make the best of a difficult situation in terms of money. The player with the largest net worth in terms of cash and cash value of assets at the end of the game is the winner.
The end of the game is determined by a time limit agreed upon by all players such as one, two, or three hours, The game's end may also occur when only one player is not bankrupt. Bankruptcy terminates a player's participation in the game.
The equipment consists of the game board, 2 dice, 6 token players, 6 stock certificates, 6 houses, 6 cars, 8 "Expert Witness" cards, 8 "Lawsuit" Cards, "Small Claim's Court" cards, and "Good News" cards.

—user summary

name: Fame The Board Game
description:
It all begins with a dream. In an incredibly competitive atmosphere, plagues with self-doubt, each player's passion will be put to the test. As each player strives for his or her moment in the spotlight, they'll discover who among them has the innate talent and necessary discipline ti succeed and achieve Fame....Have you got what it takes? i.e 'Blow and imaginary, huge bubble gum bubble until it pops all over your head'. 'Pretend you are a dog trying to scratch a flea that you can't quite reach for 1 minute' plus much more.

A fantastic gift for fans of the brilliant TV show Fame.

—description from the publisher

name: Tattigol
description:
Tattigol is a board game that simulates the game of football, enhancing its tactical aspects; it does not use dice or cards as it usually happens for "football setting" boardgames.

The exciting newness of Tattigol compared to the classic "chess matrix" games, is that the player who attacks, realizes his game tactics not only with the movement of man but also with the ball movement, with which he tries to realize the goal.

Men's movements and ball's movement depend on the role of the pawns and the 2 players have 15 pieces available with 8 different roles to select to form their team: this situation creates dynamism and tactics really exciting both in attack and in defense and contrast .

—description from the designer

name: Spin Mania
description: Spin Mania - Players must pick up and carry spinning plates from the spin-base to stands placed in awkward places by their opponents. This exciting, action packed game is a race to find the fastest plate placer.

name: Carol Vorderman's Tribond Game
description:
Addictive, challenging and competitive, Carol Vorderman’s Tribond will test your knowledge to the extreme. Three clues, one answer!

Simple yet challenging game play. Engaging and addictive. All about the “THREEZER” puzzles, move around the board answering set number of THREEZERS, winning points as you go along. What links 3 things together e.g. Florida, piano, locksmiths? Answer is they all have keys!

—description from the publisher

name: Trivia Board Game Agatha Christie
description: Test your knowledge in this trivia board game with hundreds of questions about Britain's favourite mystery writer...Agatha Christie.

name: Conspiracy!: Bigfoot/Patterson-Gimlin Film Promo Cards
description:
Set of 6 cards (1 Patterson-Gimlin Film & 5 Bigfoot) that can replace one set of conspiracy cards in the game.

Each conspiracy has different abilities in game.

Given out at conventions
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: The World of the Horse
description: The world of the horse board game features 2,200 questions and a selection of answers related to horses. For example: 'What is a horse with a black coat called?' A) Grey, B) Dun or C) Dark ? One of many questions on the always topical subject of the horse. There is a selection of three answers for each question. The players move their pieces across the board and receive a chip for every correct answer. Who will be the first to collect all of the eight different colored chips?

name: GourmetSmarts (Second Edition)
description:
A trivia game with 100 question-and-answer cards covering four categories (Lingo, Ingredients, Cuisines, and Wild Card) related to food and fine dining. A score pad tracks the progress of from 2 to 12 players. The winner is the first to answer three questions correctly in each of the four categories, or the first to get a total of 12 questions correct.

Additional question-and-answer cards for the second edition were written by S. J. Allison.

name: Psycho Loco
description:
Psycho Loco is a strategic card game for 2-5 players.

Players bet on how many of their cards they can match to the target Psycho Dice over five rounds. The winner of each round acquires all wagered Betting Bones as well as an all important Skull Token.

The player with the fewest Skull Tokens at the end of the game must risk the pain of eating a Russian Roulette Chocolate Bullet, some of which are plain 'blank rounds' and some of which are 'live rounds' laced with enough chilli heat to melt your face off.

—user summary

name: Kofre's Curse
description:
Kofre’s Curse is a treasure hunting game where you and your friends work cooperatively to excavate a pyramid. The pyramid contains 25 chambers that either contain traps, treasures or monsters. Each character in the game has unique skills that allow them to pass through some trials without much struggle while having to exert themselves in other areas. Unique skills include Strength, Sanity, Speed and Sanity. Use your muscles to plow through leagues of mummies! Use magic to break curses and go head to head with magical foes!

Gameplay: In Kofre’s Curse you build a pyramid using chamber tiles you as you see in the picture's below. Every player starts in the entrance and on each person’s turn they draw a tile and complete the task on the tile. When the 25 tiles are laid down a boss will emerge from the tomb and all the players will work cooperatively to beat him or her. Players will win and take the treasure home or forever lay buried within the tomb!

—description from the publisher

name: Dojo Sensei
description:
Dojo Sensei is a worker placement game set in the future on a fictional Japanese island called Meiyoshima. In this game, you are a sensei opening a new dojo, trying to make a name for yourself and your school.

In Dojo Sensei, you will make decisions that will customize your dojo, your fighters, and your students. You will carve a path to victory and honor by training students, turning fighters into warriors, putting on demonstrations of your skill, constructing and remodeling your dojo how you see fit, investing in different martial arts styles, competing in various martial arts competitions, and of course proving yourself in the Kumite!

Players are in control of 3 different types of workers - Sensei, Trainers, and Champions that will be placed on the main board and in their dojo. The Sensei is a trainer that you can customize with bonuses or even break the rules. The trainers are the majority of your workers and they will build your dojo and train your champions. Champions are workers that are placed in competitions - forms, breaking, and weapons - that when resolved, will earn you victory points. You can add more trainers and more champions to your dojo, but you will first have to start training them as students in your dojo.

Tableau
Champions - players are able to customize up to three champions. Their basic stats - Strength, Finesse, and Mastery. As well as use trainers, to give their champions new maneuvers. These maneuvers are the deck-bulding / card management of the game.
Dojo - your Dojo is a player board that you will customize by placing different shaped tiles on it, that will slowly bring your dojo to life. These tiles will give you actions and bonuses in the game. Here you can decide if you want to focus on income, on building strong champions, on performances, on specific competitions, and many more.

Every play of Dojo Sensei will be different. The goals you are reaching for to end the game will change, the tiles available to build your dojo will be different every turn. The maneuvers that are available in the temples to train your champions will be different. In order to win you will need to both focus on how you will bring honor to your dojo, but also be flexible enough to react to your opponents and the conditions on the main board.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Battle For Dawnstone
description:
Battle for Dawnstone is set in an original fantasy world with a rich back story. It is entirely comprised of playing cards. You draw units and spell cards from a deck of cards and play them to a map where you try to destroy your opponents castles, or all of their units. There are several types of units that all have a different play style. The map is customizable by setting up with the (larger) terrain cards the way you want at the start of the game. There are different terrain cards that do different things to enhance your army, or hinder movement and so forth.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management

name: Bushido: Kokoro the Harvester
description:
Kokoro is unusual for an Oni, unusual in many ways. He invokes both fear and respect in other Oni, feelings that are alien to them. This is what has not only allowed him to survive into old age but also flourish. Nobody knows how old an Oni can live until a natural death, it hasn’t happened. What is known is that Kokoro has consumed countless souls and is called the Harvester by those that revere him. What is certain is that none yet have faced Kokoro and survived.

Blister contains one model, one 50mm base and one full colour profile card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Izu Serpents
description:
The Ito source their serpents from the jungles of the island they inhabit, Izu. Having heard the call to serve their Kami these servants are an incredibly useful resource for the Ito. Individually they can be useful but when combined in larger numbers they can quickly outnumber and tire stronger opponents leaving them vulnerable to the companions’ attacks. Certain Ito have trained to work with the serpents and have developed useful techniques to stop the enemies of their clan.

Blister contains three models, three 30mm bases and one full colour profile card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Hideaki
description:
Hideaki was always known as a bit of a melancholic soul. He has treated his sea blessing, seen as an honour to the clan, with his usual lack of fervour. He does however long for the day when the process is complete and he has the strength needed to move his shell as he would like. Hideaki quickly loses any resentment for his shell when it helps him avoid danger, and the speed that he can switch between safety and pressing the attack can surprise those that face him.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Desert Scorpions Assault/Mortar Truck
description:
The Desert Scorpions of the Long Range Desert Group have arrived! Still fighting a long war in Northern Africa against Axis forces who have returned, the elite corp of the Desert Scorpions have expanded to the rest of the Middle-East to counter the new threats that have arise. With their lightning strikes capabilities and seasoned troops, they are a welcome reinforcement to all Allied soldiers in the region.

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards: one Assault Truck for the Desert Scorpions and the same for the Allies, one Mortar Truck and one Transport Truck for the Desert Scorpions. Please note that all crew miniatures depicted are included.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Desert Scorpions Truck
description:
The Desert Scorpions of the Long Range Desert Group have arrived! Still fighting a long war in Northern Africa against Axis forces who have returned, the elite corp of the Desert Scorpions have expanded to the rest of the Middle-East to counter the new threats that have arise. With their lightning strikes capabilities and seasoned troops, they are a welcome reinforcement to all Allied soldiers in the region.

This vehicle comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant of the vehicle that can be assembled with this Truck: the Command version, the Transport version and the Gun Truck. The Command Truck is a Command Vehicle that can carry a Command Squad and enhance its capabilities. The Transport version benefits from the Assault Vehicle skill, that allows its Passengers to disembark after the Vehicle has moved, and the Gun Truck is here to blow stuff up! The fourth card is for a Bloc version of the Command Truck, that allows easy access to this vehicle for any Allied Faction. Please note that the crew miniatures are included.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Pointe Du Hoc: Gamers Guide
description:
This single issue magazine provides supplementary material for Critical Hit’s historical module Pointe Du Hoc, featuring the Rangers on D-Day.

Contents:
Historical Articles
Variants
Errata & Clarifications
Scenario Analysis
Additional Scenario and Overlay inserts were also included by the publisher with varying consistency.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: So Far from God: A Sharp Practice Supplement for the US Mexican War
description:
So Far from God expands Sharp Practice to cover the US Mexican War of 1846 to 1848.

With full details of rule amendments, a comprehensive playsheet, details of US and Mexican organisation and eight scenarios this supplement may be used in conjunction with Sharp Practice to game this most colourful of conflicts.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Citadel: The Breakthrough – Grossdeutschland Attack at Kursk Part Two: A Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command
description:
This Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command is the second covering the decisive battle of Kursk in 1943. The action here covers the attack of the Grossdeutschland Division on the Soviet Second Defensive Line. This key action will either see the Germans breakthrough and head onwards for Kursk, or be stopped by the Soviets; whoever wins will seize the initiative in the East for the rest of the year and possibly change the course of the war.

Six battlefields provide a campaign which sees the Germans attacking and the Soviets but with the Russians counter-attacking to buy time. This campaign can be fought as a stand-alone series of games or can be played as a continuation from the first Kursk Pint Size Campaign, Storming the Citadel.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Gen Con
description:
Gen Con is the unofficial name given to the set of cards that were obtainable at the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game demo events held at Gen Con 2013. These cards are not tournament legal.

63 unique cards were released as part of the set: 2 Mane Characters, 25 Friends, 8 Events, 6 Resources, 6 Troublemakers and 16 Problems.

Cards in the Gen Con demo decks do not have a printed rarity or set number, as they were not meant for official gameplay.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Premiere
description:
Premiere is the name of the base (first) set of cards released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release: December 13, 2013
European release: late December, 2013

213 unique cards were released as part of the main set:

6 Mane Characters,
103 Friends,
36 Events,
22 Resources,
10 Troublemakers, and
36 Problems.


The main set contains

60 Common (C) cards,
60 Uncommon (U) cards,
60 Rare (R) cards,
18 Fixed (F) cards, and
15 Ultra Rare (UR) cards.


There is a 1 in 13 chance for a Premiere booster pack to contain an Ultra Rare card in place of a Common card.

In addition to the main set, there is also a foil parallel set of 41 cards. These Foil (f) cards are foiled versions of cards found in the main set but are otherwise the same as their main set equivalent. There is a 1 in 4 chance for a Premiere booster pack to contain a parallel Foil card in place of a Common card.

The promo set of 19 cards cannot be found in booster packs. Of these 19 Promo (P) cards, 15 of them are foiled versions of cards in the main set, and 3 are unique to the set. Rarity, Dragon Charmer has been released as part of the Canterlot Nights main set. Rainbow Dash, To the Rescue and Applejack, Farm Foremare were released as Fixed cards in theme decks in the Absolute Discord set; Previous to this, they were exclusively promo cards.

Theme decks:


Twilight Sparkle & Applejack Theme Deck
Rainbow Dash & Rarity Theme Deck
Pinkie Pie & Fluttershy Two Player Theme Deck
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Rock N Rave
description:
Rock N Rave is the name of the first miniature expansion released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game; it was released between the Canterlot Nights and The Crystal Games expansions.

Compared to regular expansions, none of the cards in this set can be found in booster packs; they can only be found in the Rock N Rave Two Player Theme Deck.

14 unique cards were released as part of the main (and only) set; 2 Mane Characters, 4 Friends, 2 Events, 0 Resources, 2 Troublemakers and 4 Problems.

In terms of rarity, the main set contains 12 Fixed (F) cards and 4 Foil (f) cards. Maud Pie, Rockin' and DJ Pon-3, Party Starter each have two different versions with one version having the Start side foiled and the other version having the Boosted side foiled, but are otherwise the same.

Princess Luna, The Party's Over and Rarity, Mover and Shaker can only be found as part of the Rock N Rave Two Player Theme Deck, but they are technically a part of the Canterlot Nights expansion.

American release: August 8, 2014
European release: 4 September 2014
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Celestial Solstice
description:
Celestial Solstice is the name of the second miniature expansion released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game; it was released between the Canterlot Nights and The Crystal Games expansions.

Compared to regular expansions, none of the cards in this set can be found in booster packs; they can only be found in the Celestial Solstice Deluxe Set.

10 unique cards were released as part of the main (and only) set: 2 Mane Characters, 4 Friends, 2 Events, 1 Resource, 1 Troublemaker and 0 Problems.

In terms of rarity, the main set contains 8 Fixed (F) cards and 2 Foil (ƒ) cards. Uniquely, all of the cards in the set are foiled despite not all of them having the Foil rarity.

American release: November 14, 2014
European release: 15 December 2014
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Absolute Discord
description:
Absolute Discord is the name of the fourth set released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release:
Theme decks: April 24, 2015
Booster packs: May 8, 2015

European release:
21 May 2015

208 unique cards were released as part of the main set:

6 Mane Characters,
89 Friends,
37 Events,
37 Resources,
14 Troublemakers, and
25 Problems.


In terms of rarity, the main set contains

60 Common (C) cards,
61 Uncommon (U) cards,
60 Rare (R) cards,
11 Fixed (F) cards, and
17 Ultra Rare (UR) cards.


There is a 1 in 11 chance for an Absolute Discord booster pack to contain an Ultra Rare card in place of a Common card.

Blank, Nightmare Star, Solar Flare, and Gummy, Things Just Got Real are "secret" cards such that they are not listed in the set checklist, but they are still part of the set and still have the same chance to be obtained from booster packs as any other card in the set.

Discord, Master of Chaos is a foiled Fixed card released as a teaser in the Discord Collector's Tin product, and is also released as a Common card in the same set.

In addition to the main set, there is also a foil parallel set of 50 cards. These Foil (f) cards are foiled versions of cards found in the main set but are otherwise the same as their main set equivalent. There is a 1 in 4 chance for a Premiere booster pack to contain a parallel Foil cards in place of a Common card.

The promo set of 15 cards cannot be found in booster packs. Of these 15 Promo (P) cards, 9 of them are foiled versions of cards in the main set and 6 are unique to the set.

Theme decks:


Double the Fun Theme Deck
Unlikely Duo Theme Deck
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Equestrian Odysseys
description:
Equestrian Odysseys is the name of the fifth set released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release: August 28, 2015

218 unique cards were released as part of the main set:

10 Mane Characters,
112 Friends,
32 Events,
30 Resources,
12 Troublemakers, and
22 Problems.


In terms of rarity, the main set contains

60 Common (C) cards,
60 Uncommon (U) cards,
60 Rare (R) cards,
16 Super Rare (SR) cards,
16 Ultra Rare (UR) cards, and
6 Fixed (F) cards.


There is a 1 in 3 chance for an Equestrian Odysseys booster pack to contain a Super Rare, Ultra Rare, or Royal Rare card in place of a Common card.

In addition to the main set, there is also a foil parallel set of 4 cards and 2 Royal Rare (RR) parallel alternate-art full-card cards. These Foil (f) and new Royal Rare (RR) versions are foiled or full-card (borderless) versions of cards found in the main set but are otherwise the same as their main set equivalent. The Foil (f) cards come on the front of the theme decks and there is a 1 in 108 chance for an Equestrian Odysseys booster pack to contain a Royal Rare (RR) in place of a Common card (average of 2 per case of 6 booster boxes of 36 booster packs).

The promo set of 15 cards cannot be found in booster packs. All of these Promo (P) cards are alternate-art foiled versions of cards in the main set (none are unique to the promo set).

Theme Decks:


Jam Session Theme Deck
Takin' Care of Business Theme Deck
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – High Magic
description:
High Magic is the name of the sixth set released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release: November 20, 2015

152 unique cards were released as part of the main set:

3 Mane Characters,
92 Friends,
18 Events,
15 Resources,
5 Troublemakers, and
19 Problems.


In terms of rarity, the main set contains

40 Common (C) cards,
41 Uncommon (U) cards,
40 Rare (R) cards,
12 Super Rare (SR) cards,
13 Ultra Rare (UR) cards, and
6 Fixed (F) cards.


There is a 1 in 3 chance for a High Magic booster pack to contain a Super Rare, Ultra Rare, or Royal Rare card in place of a Common card.

In addition to the main set, there is also a foil parallel set of 4 cards and 3 Royal Rare (RR) parallel alternate-art full-card cards. These Foil (f) and Royal Rare (RR) versions are foiled or full-card (borderless) versions of cards found in the main set but are otherwise the same as their main set equivalent. The Foil (f) cards come on the front of the theme decks and there is a 1 in 108 chance for a High Magic booster pack to contain a Royal Rare (RR) in place of a Common card (average of 2 per case of 6 booster boxes of 36 booster packs).

Each theme deck contains two double-sided Token cards that can be put into play via card abilities. They have a unique Token (T) rarity and card number but are not listed on the official High Magic collector's sheet.

The promo set of 14 cards cannot be found in booster packs. All of these Promo (P) cards are alternate-art foiled versions of cards in the main set (none are unique to the promo set).

Theme Decks:


Chaos is Magic Theme Deck
Steal the Show Theme Deck
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Marks in Time
description:
Marks in Time is the name of the seventh set released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release: June 10, 2016

Marks in Time includes

2 new gameplay mechanics (Dilemmas and Cutie Marking).
5 new color combinations on dual-color cards, rounding out all 15 across Block 2
The return of Token cards


144 unique cards were released as part of the main set:

4 Mane Characters,
79 Friends,
21 Events,
16 Resources,
5 Troublemakers, and
19 Problems.


In terms of rarity, the main set contains

40 Common (C) cards,
40 Uncommon (U) cards,
40 Rare (R) cards,
11 Super Rare (SR) cards,
10 Ultra Rare (UR) cards, and
3 Fixed (F) cards.


There is a 1 in 3 chance for a Marks in Time booster pack to contain a Super Rare, Ultra Rare, or Royal Rare card in place of a Common card.

In addition to the main set, there are also 2 Royal Rare (RR) parallel alternate-art full-card cards. These Royal Rare (RR) versions are full-card (borderless) versions of 2 Ultra Rare cards found in the main set but are otherwise the same as their main set equivalent. There is a 1 in 216 chance for a Marks in Time booster pack to contain a Royal Rare (RR) in place of a Common card (average of 1 per case of 6 booster boxes of 36 booster packs).

The promo set of 11 cards cannot be found in booster packs. All of these Promo (P) cards are alternate-art foiled versions of cards in the main set (none are unique to the promo set).

There are no theme decks released for the Marks in Time set. Instead, there are 3 versions of the Make Your Mark Pack Drafter, meant for use in Limited Draft events.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Defenders of Equestria
description:
Defenders of Equestria is the name of the eighth set released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release: June 16, 2017

Defenders of Equestria has 142 new cards and full suite of two-color card support. It is booster-only (no theme decks).

142 unique cards were released as part of the main set:

7 Mane Characters,
89 Friends,
21 Events,
8 Resources,
7 Troublemakers, and
10 Problems.


In terms of rarity, the main set contains

60 Common (C) cards,
30 Uncommon (U) cards,
30 Rare (R) cards,
11 Super Rare (SR) cards, and
11 Ultra Rare (UR) cards


There are no Fixed (F) cards in this set, since there are no theme decks or other non-booster products for them to be found in.

There is a 1 in 3 chance for a Defenders of Equestria booster pack to contain a Super Rare, Ultra Rare, or Royal Rare card in place of a Common card.

In addition to the main set, there is also 1 Royal Rare (RR) parallel alternate-art full-card card. This Royal Rare (RR) version is a full-card (borderless) version of 1 Ultra Rare card found in the main set but is otherwise the same as its main set equivalent. There is a 1 in 216 chance for a Defenders of Equestria booster pack to contain a Royal Rare (RR) in place of a Common card (average of 1 per case of 6 booster boxes of 36 booster packs).

The promo set of 10 cards cannot be found in booster packs. All of these Promo (P) cards are alternate-art foiled versions of cards in the main set (none are unique to the promo set).
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Seaquestria and Beyond
description:
Seaquestria & Beyond is the name of the ninth set released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release: November 24, 2017

Seaquestria & Beyond has 142 new cards and six new Mane Characters.

142 unique cards were released as part of the main set:

6 Mane Characters,
99 Friends,
9 Events,
15 Resources,
5 Troublemakers, and
8 Problems.


In terms of rarity, the main set contains

60 Common (C) cards,
30 Uncommon (U) cards,
30 Rare (R) cards,
11 Super Rare (SR) cards, and
11 Ultra Rare (UR) cards


There are no Fixed (F) cards in this set, since there are no theme decks or other non-booster products for them to be found in.

There is a 1 in 3 chance for a Seaquestria & Beyond booster pack to contain a Super Rare, Ultra Rare, or Royal Rare card in place of a Common card.

In addition to the main set, there is also 1 Royal Rare (RR) parallel alternate-art full-card card. This Royal Rare (RR) version is a full-card (borderless) version of 1 Ultra Rare card found in the main set but is otherwise the same as its main set equivalent. There is a 1 in 216 chance for a Seaquestria & Beyond booster pack to contain a Royal Rare (RR) in place of a Common card (average of 1 per case of 6 booster boxes of 36 booster packs).

The promo set of 10? cards cannot be found in booster packs. All of these Promo (P) cards are alternate-art foiled versions of cards in the main set (none are unique to the promo set).
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Seek and Find
description:
An exciting game to seek out animals that are Out of View and a challenging race against time between your opponent and yourself!

The object of the game is to seek and find the right animal so that you can start collecting scoring bands until you collect all six different colors, one scoring band from each player, you have to seek and find the right animal to collect one of your own color bands as well, in order to win the game.

Play begins by flipping over a card revealing an animal. All players reach into a sack and try to identify the animal by touch before time runs out. Whoever picks the animal shown by the card gets one of the six bands owned by the other players. A new card is then drawn until one player has all six bands.

name: Sixth Tackle: 2003 Australian NRL Season Cards
description: Sixteen team cards for the 2003 season of the Australian National Rugby League competition.

name: Pickup Lines
description:
Pickup Lines is a fast paced party game where you try and guess which line the chosen player would use on a specific type of person.

The game itself is pretty simple. Players take turns being the pickup artist in a clockwise order. The pickup artist will draw a random person type card and then place either the male or female version face up in front of them. Other players will then choose from their hand which pickup line they think the pickup artist will use on that person type in front of them. After all players have selected their choice and placed it face down, the pickup artist will shuffle them and then read them one by one out loud. Whoever had the winning line gets to keep that pickup line card face up in front of them creating a score pile. First player to reach 18 points or person with highest score when the pickup lines deck runs out, wins!

name: Company II
description:
The object of Company II is gain the most power by capturing as many enemy marines as possible and also have the most remaining men of your own in the battlefield when the game is over. Game contains 216 pieces (All made of color stained, stamped, wood).

Only five-hundred copies of this game were produced. The artwork on the box was commissioned locally at a cost of seven hundred dollars.

—user summary

name: Das Kalispiel
description:
The players start at space 1 and the first player to reach space 31 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Devil's Own Day
description:
The Devil’s Own Day is a 2 player war game depicting the events of the Battle of Shiloh on April 6th and 7th, 1862. While certainly not the bloodiest battle of the war, it may well be the battle that set the tone of what a Civil War was really going to cost.

NOTE:
This game was designed as part of an ONE WEEK design challenge. Including all testing. I can not guarantee it is balanced.

You have been warned.

—description from the publisher

name: Game of Mother Goose
description:
Unique game, but similar in play to Chutes & Ladders. Rules suggest that "Any number" can play, but I think that 6 would be maximum number of players. Players spin a 6-space spinner to advance 1-6 spaces on the board and then respond to penalties or rewards in that space. The first player to the center of the board wins. Many house rules exist: such as "Capture" & Needing exact number to land on winning space...

—user summary

name: Daughters of Nyx
description:
The Daughters of Nyx is a 3 player game about determining the Fate of 3 mortal heroes.

NOTE:
This game was designed as part of an ONE WEEK design challenge. Including all testing. I can not guarantee it is balanced.

You have been warned.

—description from the publisher

name: Death of the Mountain King
description:
The olde King is Dead. Time to choose the new King.

Players take turns playing claim cards face down on the three heirs to the throne, placing an influence cube for each card they play. Each claim card has a value which is scored at the game end. The player with the most influence on the heir who claims the throne wins the game.

NOTE:
This game was designed as part of an ONE WEEK design challenge. Including all testing.

I can not guarantee it is balanced.

You have been warned.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing

name: Aotearoa
description:
Sometime around the year 1300 AD the Maori people began settling the islands of New Zealand, a land they called Aotearoa. This is a game about their initial settlement for 2 to 4 players.

Ki te kahore he whakakitenga ka ngaro te iwi
Without foresight or vision the people will be lost.

NOTE:
This game was designed as part of an ONE WEEK design challenge. Including all testing.

I can not guarantee it is balanced.

You have been warned.

—description from the publisher

name: Galatune: Duality
description:
Galatune: Duality is a new 2-player stand-alone game that is fully compatible with other Galatune games. Use Duality alone for intense 1v1 battles, combine two Duality decks for up to 4 players, or combine with our 2016 Galatune Starter Deck to support insane free-for-all brawls for up to 8-player battles, or even more players if you combine multiple sets.

Duality includes everything you need to support 2 players in 1v1 battles. 9 new holographic Champions cards, 48 new action cards, no duplicates, no filler, tons of incredible American anime art. All our cards are large 2.75 x4.75 inches (standard tarot size) with high-quality materials. One vs. One, Light vs. Darkness, opposing powers and conflicting factions compete to shape the future of Planet Lyra.

Galatune is an anime battle tabletop card game set on the fantasy planet of Lyra. The United World Government maintains peace and prosperity through the monopoly of advanced ancient technologies, but utopia comes at a steep cost. Will you join with the government to protect unity, or will you join the rebels and fight for freedom and independence?

2-5 players each lead a Champion warrior into battle and earn a Victory Point each time an opponent is defeated. You win the game by being the first to earn 3 Victory Points by defeating 3 opponents. BUT there's a twist! The game doesn't end for you when your Champion falls in battle. Instead, you just get back up on your feet, respawn your Champion, and continue fighting! Think of it as a sort of card-based battle-royal, like a Battle Arena game, where you play for KOs.

Unlike other battle card games where players take their turns one-at-a-time, in Galatune everyone attacks simultaneously! It's an exciting formula that keeps the game moving and encourages players to predict and react to each other in real time.

Great game for first-time gamers or serious pros! Easy-to-Learn, impossible to master!

name: Sovereign: The Card Game
description: Sovereign is a turn-based card game for 2-4 players. Players take turns building an army and promoting leaders to take opponent leaders. Players win by banking opponent leaders and earning points.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Kill Steal, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Parasitic Temples
description:
Parasitic Temples is a strategy compete game. The game concept is inspired by traditional Taoism template in Taiwan and let people to learn about the template culture.
In the game, Players play Villiage god, find the suitable location to build the template in the city and make your template larger and larger by managing your templates and using money (given by follower).
During the game, players should contest for the resource. The final target is to be a giant tutelary god in the city.

There are three parse in the game play.
1. Building and upgrading
Build new temples at suitable location or upgrade the price of your land.
2. hold a festival
Choose a template to hold a festival that you can receive money given by follower and get faith power.
3. Invest and trade
Use money and buy the "card" to get the right that you have permission to develop your temples in the city.

name: Kiricuack
description:
Aim of the game: Retrieve all the cards.

Rules of the game:
Shuffle the cards. Deal out all the cards among the players. Direction of play is clockwise. The youngest player begins the game. Each player holds all of their cards in one hand, with the faces hidden. At the same time, players take the top card from the pile and turn it over in front of everyone.
If there are at least 2 farm animals and/or at least 2 wild animals, the players concerned must make the noise of their animal. The fastest one to do this correctly picks up all the face-up cards and puts them with their cards.

name: Vanguard: War on the Frontline 1410
description:
Let rip the tides of war in VANGUARD: War on the Frontline 1410, a lightning quick psycho-tactical card battle game for two or four players.

Scheme. Bluff. Strike. Outwit and overpower your opponent in this play-it-anywhere card battle game.

CONCEPTS OF PLAY


Deploy your units to the frontline, in direct conflict with enemy units.
Win skirmishes by overpowering the enemy.
Throw bluffs to trick your opponent into defeat.
Stymie the opposition with a defensive barrier, or inspire an unstoppable rally to steal away a skirmish.
Read your opponent and regroup to gain a tactical advantage.
Employ your wits and wagers to capture the most enemy units before conclusion of the battle.


THE HOOKS


VANGUARD 1410 is incredibly compact and highly portable: Take this ultimate pub and filler game anywhere, and play a game in less than 30 minutes.
Great as a casual filler game, or for tournament game nights. Also fantastic as a play-for-stakes game.
Even as a pub/filler game, VANGUARD 1410 maintains levels of depth, meaningful decision making, and tension that are often missing from other pub/filler games.
Carefully designed game pacing, with moments of suspense, exhilaration, and triumphant climax.


BACKGROUND

This 1410 edition of Vanguard is an homage to one of the greatest battles in history: The Battle of Grunwald. As the very pinnacle of the tumultuous Polish-Lithuanian-Teutonic War, the Battle of Grunwald marked victory for the Polish-Lithuanian alliance, who decisively defeated the Teutonic Knights.

All of the lavish illustrations presented in the game are taken from a digital restoration of Jan Matejko's Battle of Grunwald - a painting which, more so than any other, gives insight into the fury and chaos of the battle.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Vakantielandenspel: Spanje
description:
Name translates to 'Highlights of the Game: Spain', part of a series of such games with different countries being the subject.

This is a game where you can show off your knowledge of Spain by answering questions on History, Art, Culture, Sport and Food.By answering questions correctly, and with a little luck, you will collect souvenirs of the country.

The game consists of 48 question cards, 30 souvenir cards, one round ard, 1 rules card and 1 pamphlet with informative background information about your holiday destination.

On each card there are questions in 5 categories and each is designated with its own icon and colour. The five categories in full are;
Eten en Drinken (Green) - Eating and Drinking
Geschiedenis (Yellow) - History
Sport, Spel en Vakantie (Orange) - Sport, Games and Holidays
Kunst en Cultuur (Red) - Art and Culture
Stad en Land (Blue) - Cities and Countries

On each card the category questions are in a different order. On the back of each card are the answers. You play in rounds. The Round Card is placed on the bottom of the deck. You start with the first question on the card you have just drawn. If the Round Card is on the top of the deck, you put it back on the bottom and then ask the second question, and so on until 6 rounds have been played. On the question cards there are also commands, recognizable because the icon box is blank. These commands are on the lines of "Change a Souvenir to a different colour, Lose a souvenir, and so on.

The Question reader is the player to the left of the player whose turn it is. If the question is answered correctly, the player receives a souvenir in the same category of the question. If the player answers incorrectly then that player must lose a souvenir (if he has one) in that category. The question card is then placed on the bottom of the stack and the turn passes to the next player in a clockwise direction.

Maximum number Souvenirs
The number of souvenirs that a player may have in a category is a a maximum of '2 players - 3', '3 or 4 players - 2'.. If a player gets a question in the category of which he already has reached the maximum, then he can choose a souvenir of any other category if he answers correctly. At the end of your turn you can exchange any 2 matching souvenir cards for one in any other category.

The winner is the first player to get souvenirs in all 5 categories

name: Elemental Conflux: Pointy Hat Spell Promo Card
description:
Originally available at GenCon 2018

Pointy Hat Spell
(Playable after opposing armies have engaged in battle)

The armies of both players are switched before the winner is determined.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Clash d'Ardèche: Camping Shop Supply
description:
