The Camping Shop Supply Expansion Set boosts the Clash d'Ardèche experience of building and managing your own campground even more, by enabling players to use the roads on the gameboard for supplying their Camping Shop.

Each player drives his own truck. Pick up and deliver groceries, wood and souvenirs to the Camping Shop on your camping ground, using the roads on the Clash d'Ardèche gameboard. If the shop is fully supplied, your guests will start spending more money. This enables you to build an extra Camping Ground Upgrade, such as the Canoe Rental, Hiking Trips or the Disco.

—description from the publisher

name: Colors and Shapes City
description:
Product description

The Explore & Learn games are two great products in one! Each game combines a giant, beautifully illustrated 2 x2 talk about floor puzzle that, when put together, becomes a fun learning game for up to four players. First, have fun piecing together the 50 piece puzzle. Then attach the spinner in the middle and play the game. Learn all about the alphabet and first words, counting, rhyming, and colors, and shapes while collecting your game pieces. Explore & Learn is a fun way to learn.

From the Manufacturer
The Explore & Learn games are two great products in one! Each game combines a giant, colorfully illustrated 2’ x 2’ “talk about” floor puzzle that, when assembled, becomes a fun learning game for up to four players. Have fun piecing together the 50-piece puzzle, then attach the spinner in the middle and play the game. Learn all about the alphabet, counting, rhyming, food groups, spelling, and colors and shapes while collecting your game pieces. Explore & Learn is a fun way to learn! Ages 3+ years.

name: Candy Store
description:
Be the first to fill your jar with candy.

The Candy Store Game is an exciting early learning game which teaches color recognition and matching, provides practice in counting, encourages observation skills and develops hand-eye coordination.

name: 妄想トランプ (Delusion Trump)
description:
User summary
In the game of 妄想トランプ (Delusion Trump), you play a game which normally uses a deck of standard playing cards without using any cards. Rules for Delusion Shichinarabe, Delusion Daifugo, and Delusion Chinese Poker are introduced in this package, but more games can be played with it.

When you play a card, you just name a card out loud. While playing, each player holds a suit-and-rank matrix, and mark what that player has played. Judging from your matrix and your memory, when you think another player has just made an illegal play (playing the same card twice, 5th card of the same rank, and so on), you may challenge that player. You win the game if the challenge is correct, otherwise you lose. You may win the game by winning the played card game normally.

You can adapt other playing card games into it with your own ideas.

Publisher's summary
妄想トランプは「カードを使わないトランプ」です。
プレイヤーはトランプのカード一覧が示されたメモを持ち、自分の使用したカードだけをメモします。
この状態でトランプのゲームを行い、普通にゲームに勝つか、他の人の間違いを指摘できたら勝ちになります。
（逆に、指摘が外れたら負けになります）
トランプ＋記憶の、トランプゲームの新しい遊び方を体験してください。

ルール説明では「妄想七並べ」「妄想大富豪」「妄想十三張」を記載していますが、トランプなのでいろいろな遊び方ができます。
いろいろな遊び方を探してみてください

name: Castlevania: Nocturne of the Tabletop – 1999
description:
1999 was the first expansion to Castlevania: Nocturne of the Tabletop, released in June of 2015. This expansion contains the following:

-3 new characters: Julius Belmont, Sonia Belmont, Eric Lecarde
-3 modes of difficulty: Vampire Killer (Easy), Nightmare(Normal), and 1999 (Hard)
-Balancing updates/corrections for some existing character abilities, items, and events.

-11 new bosses

-3 new Dracula forms

-25 new monsters

-22 new events

-26 new items
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Castlevania: Nocturne of the Tabletop – All Hallows
description:
All Hallows was the second expansion for Castlevania: Nocturne of the Tabletop, released in October 2015. This was a Halloween-themed expansion, featuring:

-3 new characters: Pumpkin, Cornell, and Yoko Belnades
-11 new bosses
-3 new Dracula forms
-22 new events
-36 new items
-41 new (and updated) monsters
-14 new soul abilities for Soma
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Castlevania: Nocturne of the Tabletop – What a Horrible Night to Have a Curse
description:
What a Horrible Night to Have a Curse was the third expansion to Castlevania: Nocturne of the Tabletop. It was released in November 2016 and included a number of major changes to the game.

-Large character mats, mainly intended for use in Tabletop Simulator

-New Classic Mode, a very difficult survival variant with restricted movement, limited lives, and no items, meant to more closely resemble the classic games in the Castlevania series.

-New Lord of the Castle Mode, an asymmetrical variant with one player acting as Dracula, controlling all monsters and events in the castle. Dracula becomes more powerful and gains new special abilities to hinder the other players as the curse clock gets closer to Midnight.

-2 new difficulty levels: Morning Sun (Very Easy/Beginner), and Despair (Very Hard)

-New Map Deck: Reveals a location with special conditions as players enter each of the 6 stages, making every game a very different experience.

-10 new bosses

-2 new Dracula forms, including an evil Soma as Dracula

-9 new items

-Several new and updated abilities for existing characters
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Castlevania: Nocturne of the Tabletop – The Morning Sun has Vanquished the Horrible Night
description:
The fourth expansion to Castlevania: Nocturne of the Tabletop, released in November 2017. Includes:

-2 new characters, Albus, and Henry Oldrey

-8 new bosses, and 7 updated bosses, including special conditions

-Custom combat dice representing every character in the game. Purely aesthetic, mainly used in Tabletop Simulator to give each character a more unique feel.

-1 new Dracula form, Dracula + Death

-2 new hybrid events. One half event/half monster, one half event/half boss, with varying effects.

-46 new items, including 13 shield items

-Defense dice, used alongside new shield and armor items, as well as some special character abilities. These dice give the players additional chances to defend against monsters.

-6 new map location cards

-2 new monsters

-Several new abilities and special items for existing characters, some of which provide defense dice.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Castlevania: Nocturne of the Tabletop – The Lecarde Chronicles
description:
The Lecarde Chronicles is the fifth expansion to Castlevania: Nocturne of the Tabletop. Released in February 2018, this expansion centers around The Lecarde Chronicles 2, a 2017 Castlevania fan game designed by Mig Perez. This is the first expansion to reach outside of the original Castlevania canon, and the first not to include a new incarnation of Dracula, who did not appear in The Lecarde Chronicles 2.

-1 new character - Efrain Lecarde

-9 new bosses

-5 new events

-17 new items

-8 new map locations

-14 new monsters
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Echt jetzt?! oder was? Junior
description: Echt Jetzt?! Junior is an electronic quiz device that challenges young players — and possibly old ones as well — to test their knowledge and judge bold claims such as these right or wrong: "Sometimes fire can be freezing", "The sun is closer to the earth than the moon", and "Some dolphin species have over 200 teeth". Buzz quickly if you think you know the answer, then press the green face if you think the statement is correct and the red face if not.

name: Mythic: Legends of the Earth
description:
In Mythic, you are an Overseer — a mortal being striving to join the Order of the Mythic and obtain immortality. Gain fame by defeating other Overseers in combat with the powers gifted to you by the Order, and take on step closer to being recognized as worthy.

The game is played on two 3x3 grids with each player having a 40-card main deck and a 20-card Soul Deck. Players alternate going through all of the phases of their turn, managing their resource, their offence, and their defense in an attempt to defeat their opponent. Players are trying to deal 60 Soul Damage, destroy the opponent’s Soul Spire, or run their opponent out of cards.

Mythic is a unique game that blends many popular aspects of gaming into one cohesive and balanced game. It has a Mythology theme that stays true to traditional lore, dynamic RPG battle elements like ranged combat, movement and resistances, traditional trading card game depth of strategy and familiarity, mixed with its own unique resource management system.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Kaosmos: Gen Con 2018 Promo Card Pack
description:
Includes:
Temporal Vortex - Do not use the sand timer. The first player to finish their Galaxy counts to 10, and the round ends.

Infintesimal - Zone Bonus tokens score for having the smallest (or tied for smallest) zone (1 planet minimum), rather than the largest.

Given out at GenCon 2018
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle, Real-time, Space Exploration
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Clown Cars
description:
In 2013 a group of daring clowns from Castries, France set a record that many said would never be broken. Thirty-One of these daring entertainers squeezed themselves into a tiny Citroen 2CV automobile, shattering the old record!

But this is a new age in clowning and you and the talented troupe of clowns that you lead are determined to show it! A spectacular star-studded show has been arranged for all the great clown troupes in the land to gather together and show off their skills. The highlight of the show will be...The Clown Cars.

The first troupe of clowns who can wedge at least 32 of themselves into one tiny car and set a new record will be forever known as The Kings and Queens of Clownery.

Are you up to the challenge?

—description from the publisher

name: I would Fight the Dragon...: King Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for I Would Fight The Dragon....

This promo adds a new card to the game. Unlike the other cards in the game, which each only depict one of the five pieces of gear, the King promo card depicts all five pieces of gear (armor, helmet, horse, shield, and weapon).

This promo was included in Game Trade Magazine #222 (August 2018).
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection, Storytelling

name: JAG the Card Game
description:
JAG is an African word means “hunting “. it is a game for 4 players (no partnership) using a special customized 60-card pack. Deal and play are clockwise. Game is divided into 4 "Kingdoms". Each Kingdom consists of 6 games, and the player who "owns the kingdom" decides the sequence of the games to play.

JAG is played by four people using a special 60-card pack contains 4 different jungles (Blue, Green, Red and Yellow). The cards in each suit rank from high to low: the Hunter, Lion, Tiger, Leopard, Hyaena, Wolf, Fox, Hawk, Shrike, Lizard, Spider, Beetle, Ant, Butterfly and the Flower. Deal and play are clockwise.
To begin the session, the cards are shuffled, cut and dealt out to the four players, one at a time, so that each player has 15 cards. It does not matter who deals first, but the player who is dealt the blue ant o in this first deal will "own the 1st kingdom". This player chooses which contract will be played, and will also be dealer for the next 5 deals, choosing a different contract each time.
After the first dealer has played all six contracts, the kingdom passes to the player to his left, then to the player opposite, and finally to the fourth player. Each of these players, during their kingdom, must deal six times, choosing a different contract each time, without repetition. After the four kingdoms are complete, 24 deals have been played, every player has chosen every contract once, and the game is over.

—description from the designer

name: Wakening Lair: Mystic Ward Promo Card
description:
Promo card for Wakening Lair distributed at Gen Con 2018 with game purchase.

Mystic Ward is a treasure card prevents the Monstrous Terror from moving.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Plan Master
description:
This house-building game is slightly more complex than the average roll-and-move. Each player starts with a House Plan that shows eight rooms: Living Room, Dining Room, Family Room, Kitchen, Bath, Master Bedroom, Child's Bedroom and Garage.

The goal is to purchase Construction cards for each room to complete the house. Each player starts with $18,000, but this amount is a "mortgage" that must also be paid back in order to win.

In order to build a room, a player's token must move to the Home space and draw a Construction card. This may offer a chance to build a specific room at a certain price; if the player cannot afford, does not want to pay the price, or already has built that room, his turn ends. Construction cards may also direct a player to draw and act on a card from the Risk/Option deck. Players may stay at the Home space as long as they wish and continue drawing a Construction card each turn.

Since the initial mortgage is not enough to build the entire home, players must also spend time "working". This involves starting from the Work space and rolling 2D6 around the board. Players earn $200 per space moved, and continue to work until they are able to reach the Home space. Board spaces have various events with bonuses and penalties dealing with home-building issues like strikes and permits. Players may also choose to play the stock market instead of moving, drawing a card from the Stock Market deck that either wins or loses money.

—user summary

name: Extended Broadside
description:
Extended Broadside is like a classic Battleships game on steroids. Instead of having two players placing their hidden fleets on a 10X10 grid, this one is played by four players on a huge (36" across) octagonal board in which each player has a five-sided slice of 160 numbered squares.

The board, vertical dividers, posts and spacers are all of wood. The ships are gorgeous metal and wood miniatures, with carriers, battleships, cruisers and liners about 6" long, and destroyers and submarines about 4". Each player gets two of the large ships and one of the small ones, and may place them either orthogonally (covering 5 and 4 spaces respectively) or diagonally (covering only 4 and 3 spaces).

Each player also has an island (same size as a destroyer), two minefields and an airplane. Before normal shooting starts, each player calls out the location of his island, and any island intersecting with any other player's ship(s) cause a grounding equal to a single hit, and the placing player gets a free additional shot. Then each player calls out the location of each one-space minefield: any ship on any of these squares is sunk instantly. These spaces are marked on all boards as hazards and are permanently blocked. Finally, each player gets a shot with a plane, which requires only one additional hit of any kind to sink a ship (an aerial hit on a grounded ship would sink it).

Finally the regular shooting begins. Each player calls out the number of a space, and hits any ship on that space on all other players' boards. A hit grants another shot. Once all spaces occupied by a ship are hit, it sinks and is removed from play. Players may also choose to use a more powerful air or mine attack, but lose their next one or two turns for doing so. Finally, unlike any traditional game of this type, this game allows a player to move a ship to a new location instead of shooting.

The game appears to have been hand-crafted, since the ships are all of slightly different sizes with a unique storage insert for each in the box. The only indication of a publisher is a coat of arms with a Greek motto on the wooden box. The use of a carrier with monoplanes suggests that it was made in the mid-1930s, shortly after the traditional Battleships game appeared under multiple titles including Broadside.

—user summary

name: Lingo: Cross Word Board Game
description:
Resembles the licensed Scrabble clone Skip-a-cross. The board has the word "LINGO" written one letter per square in various places, and you score extra points for playing the letters of "LINGO" on their own squares. You can also earn extra points by playing words that fit a theme such as animal, mineral, vegetable, fruit, tree, bird, insect, or clothing. The first word played earns double the total word score. Letters played on red squares earn double letter score, yellow squares earn triple letter score, blue squares earn double the total word score, and purple squares earn triple the total word score. There are two wildcard tiles with a Joker image on them, and two blank tiles to be used to make replacements for missing letter tiles.

The same publisher also released a card game version of Lingo in the same year.

—user summary

name: Kingdom of Cards
description:
Kingdom of Cards is a hybrid Massive Deck Building card game and a worker placement board game. The game focuses on bringing back the joy of playing trading/collectable card games by providing:


Great rich balanced game play.
Huge amounts of Deck building, with tons of customization.
Fun Trading.
Face to face interactions.
Support for different play styles.
A lot of Replay-ability.


The game comes with over 500 Cards. One Copy of this Game supports 4 Players (with the ability to support 6 or more with custom rules).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Resident Evil Juego de cartas
description:
During the night of July 24th 1998, a series of unusual murders occur in Raccoon City: all the bodies show signs of cannibalism.

The local authority sends a team of elite policemen to investigate the case. Contact with Team Bravo is lost, so Team Alpha is sent to rescue them and carry on with the mission. But a crashed helicopter and a severed hand on the site leave little hope for their survival. Team Alpha is attacked by cerberus dogs that kill one of the members, causing the pilot to panic and to take off. Left alone and under attack, Team Alpha takes shelter in an seemingly abandoned mansion...

Resident Evil Juego de cartas is a cooperative experience in which each player controls one of the characters. You will have to team up and synchronize your action cards to uncover the mysteries kept by the Umbrella corporation.

And of course, you will have to avoid the threats lurking in the T-Virus infected mansion!

-description from publisher
categories: Horror, Mature / Adult, Murder/Mystery, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Detour USA
description:
Players must race from a common US coastal city, to a common destination city on the opposite coast. Each player will have 4 different checkpoint cities which they must pass through as they chart their own course across the United States. Along the way, they must avoid roadblocks and make sure that they don’t run out of gas. First person to pass through all their checkpoints and reach the end destination wins.

Game play is quick to learn and has a nice mix of strategy and a bit of luck. With each turn, roads are blocked or unblocked depending how the player rolls the dice - so the course travelers are taking is constantly changing. Players pick their checkpoint cities out of a deck of cards. Players use fuel tokens to travel, also to pay "tolls" to jump over road blocks or even move their opponents. Play time depends on number of players.

name: FRX
description:
FRX is a 2 or 4 player minimalist 4X game, where players move chips into position to form polyominoes (shapes created by joining multiple squares side by side) that are on their cards to score points. A player can sprint for 100, or spend their points on upgrades to increase their chips, change their movement actions, gain attacks and increase their hand size.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Star Pioneer
description:
Exploring space. Grow your wealth. Become the richest.

In Star Pioneer you play intrepid pioneers seeking out new riches in the great expanse of unknown space.

You will explore new regions, trade with newly discovered inhabited worlds, search for mineral deposits and manufacture super commodities from strange new materials.

With some luck and careful strategy you will be become the richest pioneer in the galaxy.

The Basics

You start with 100,000 Galactic Dollars (GD) and your rocket on a map card. As you play you will lay down new map cards expanding the playing area. Most map cards will provide a new opportunity to earn money and you'll get some money just for exploring.

Planet map cards will let you trade one of 3 commodities; water, food and ore. By buying at planets where the price is low and selling at planets where the price is high you'll make a profit. Easy! But be warned that the prices are not fixed. When any player buys or sells, the price will go up or down due to demand. Additionally, prices have a chance to fluctuate on their own, this can happen locally on a single planet or galactically for a single resource. A good trade route won't stay open for long, but without risk there is no reward.

Planets also have resource points that let you buy resource cards. These are expensive long-term investments as you'll need two or more before you can make a profit from them. There are also only a limited number of resource points, so make sure you get them before your fellow players. The investment can be worth it as a good hand of 3 or 4 resource cards can win you the game.

Mineral Deposit map cards offer good earning opportunities for those feeling lucky. The smaller mineral lodes are easier to find than the big ones. You could spend several turns just floating in space looking at rocks before hitting the mother lode.

The player who reaches 1,000,000 Galactic Dollars first wins, so don't spare the rocket fuel and get earning if you want to be the best Star Pioneer!

(Rules Summary)

There are 24 hexagonal map cards, each divided into three lozenge-shaped movement spaces. There are 2 blanks, 4 wormholes, 8 planets, and 10 mineral deposits. In a four-player game, the starting map consists of two side-by-side planet cards.

The three Commodities on each planet (Ore (red), Food (green), and Water (blue)) have prices indicated by a correspondingly coloured die (1 to 6), in units of 10,000 GD. Additionally, each planet (except the starting one(s)) have D3 Resource Points (yellow), indicated by Resource tokens.

On a player turn, they first roll two dice. If the total is 7, reroll the Commodity prices of the closest planet(s). If a double was rolled, there is a 'Galactic Crash' of a specific Commodity (1-2 Ore, 3-4 Food, 5-6 Water). Reroll the Commodity price of the affected commodity on all planets.

Next, the player moves their ship, up to 3 spaces. Wormhole spaces are connected to all the other Wormholes on the map. If they explore (move off the map), they draw and place a map card, oriented as they wish. This earns the player 10,000 GD.

Finally, the player can perform one action (out of 3 possible ones).

The player could Prospect if on a Mineral Deposit space. These are rated from 1 to 5. When Prospecting, the player must roll greater than that number to find the mineral deposit. If unsuccessful, nothing happens. Otherwise, the player earns 50,000 GD times the Mineral Deposit's size, and the Deposit is marked as exhausted (black token).

The player could Trade if on a planet. A player's ship can carry up to 3 Commodity tokens. If the Commodity price is 2 or less, the player can only buy. Once the player has bought or sold, the price is adjusted. If the player sold, the price goes down 1 (but no lower than 3); if they bought, the price goes up 1 (but no higher than 6).

Finally, the player could buy a Resource Card if on a planet with remaining Resource tokens. The player pays 50,000 GD, removes one Resource token, and draws a Resource Card. You can only buy one at a time.

Resource cards are used to make Super Commodities. At any time during their turn, a player can reveal 2 or more Resource Cards to produce a Super Commodity. Its value is the sum of the base numbers on the cards multiplied by the highest multiplier on the cards. The Resource Cards are then discarded.

-description from publisher
categories: Dice, Economic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Letter-Bags
description:
A word-making game on an entirely new principle, "as fascinating as bridge".

Letter-bags is a word-making game using four identical tile-sets of single letters, one per player. One player is the caller and draws letters at random from their set, calling them out. All other players take the same letter from their sets, and place in one of six columns, trying to make words vertically. Tiles may not be rearranged, but completed words can be removed to score, or left in the hope of making them longer with subsequent tiles. Words must be at least four letters and score one, with an extra point for each additional tile, and one bonus point for the longest word of the game.

The game's date is uncertain, but judging from the typography is late Victorian. Published by Miss M. I. Drury of Kingstown, County Dublin.

—user summary

name: Journey through Austria
description:
Part of the Ravensburger "Journey Through …" series. Players are dealt 6 cards each showing names of different towns within Austria.

On their turn they roll a die and move the shown number of spaces along road, rail and air links marked on a map of Austria. The object is to be the first player to travel to all 6 given towns and return to the starting point.

name: Global War 1936-1945: German & U.S. Ordnance Set #1
description:
This set features new ordnance for use with Global War -2nd edition. This set introduces a new concept to Global War – the idea that players can spend IPPs for advanced ordnance they expend to improve their outcomes. Ordnance can improve combat values, grant the ability to select targets and in some cases give units abilities they don’t have, like being able to hunt IPPs on convoy lines.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Global War 1936-1945: Fascist Croatia at War
description:
The Independent State of Croatia (NDH) was a puppet state of Germany and Italy created out of territories in occupied Yugoslavia. The territory comprised modern-day Croatia, Bosnia-Herzegovina, and part of Serbia. Welcome to Fascist Croatia at War (CRO)! This expansion will bring a new dimensions to occupied Yugoslavia.

Many atrocities were committed by the NDH, not the least of which was the establishment of a large extermination camp at Jasenovac. These atrocities spurred the Serbs, Croats, Bosniaks, Communists, and many ordinary citizens to join the pan-Yugoslavian partisan movement lead by Josip Tito.

The Chetniks were Yugoslavian army units that both engaged in resistance activities and, at times, collaborated with occupation forces. In the end, the Chetnik agenda appears to have been a self-motivated attempt at creating their own self-styled Serbian state. Their racial ideals and terror tactics put them add odds with partisans.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Global War 1936-1945: Neuschwabenland – The New Berlin
description:
In this expansion we explore Antarctica, the great Southern continent, and its (albeit hypothetical) role in World War II. In reality the Germans did have an interest in Antarctica. In 1937 Germany sent an expedition aboard the MS Schwabenland, primarily for the purposes of establishing a whaling station. The German venture to Antarctica is fraught with myth and so for the purpose of making an interesting expansion (NEU), we are going to write a bit of alternative history:

The German exploration of 1937 was surprised to find a high volume of low-salinity water flowing from a wide opening in the glacial ice on the Prince Martha Coast. Miles of navigable passageways in the Antarctic interior lead to an enormous geothermal heated lake. The Germans quickly established a submarine base and fortress in Antarctica and mapped passages all through the south polar ice cap. Antarctica quickly became a base for submarine operations against South Africa and Australia. Later in the war the German “Base 211” served as a research laboratory for top-secret projects and a redoubt from which the last vestiges of the Nazi empire could hold out.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Global War 1936-1945: Elite Fighter Squadrons #1
description:
HBG is proud to present Elite Fighter Squadrons (EFS), an examination of elite and specialized air units in World War II. In this set players take control of some of the best air units in the Second World War. Random drawing of units provides some variation in which air units will be show up from game to game. You’ll also be happy to see we’ve added a number of aircraft to this set. Some are specialized 3D printed units like the Italian SM-79 while others fill the role of regular fighters and bombers. From the Night Witches, to the Black Sheep, the units in this set promise an exciting range of possibilities for Global War!

—desription from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: Gruppe Monsun
description:
The Indian Ocean was a transit route for strategic raw materials flowing from British colonies as well a route to get war material from England to defend India and the Far East. Submarines were also an important way for the Germans and Japanese to exchange technology and raw materials for mutual benefit.

In Gruppe Monsun (GM) You will get to play out Germany’s strategic investment in Indian Ocean U-boat Bases.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Global War 1936-1945: Atlantis Rises Again
description:
Atlantis has been a continent of myth since the time of Plato. During World War II the Nazis searched for Atlantis, which they believed was the origin of the Aryan race. The Germans even believed that the descendants of Atlantis had fled to the high parts of the world – specifically Tibet to never again be victims of the angry sea. Atlantis (ATL) Rising is an Alternative History expansion for Global War-2nd Edition Game.

Contents
(x1) Atlantis Island Marker
(x1) Submarine Base Marker
(x3) SS Infantry Marker
(x4) Wonder Weapon Markers

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Global War 1936-1945: Spanish Civil War
description:
HBG’s Spanish Civil War (SCW) expansion provides a new set of rules and pieces to play out this epic conflict inside a game of Global War! Here you will find new rules for expanded intervention from foreign powers, new consequences players face for victory (or defeat!), a random events table, and many units with which to prosecute your ambitions. Also introduced are new arms supply markers and armored cars!

· Republican Infantry (Plum Infantry) x8
· Republican Motorized Infantry (Plum Infantry) x2
· Republican 122mm Artillery (Plum) x2
· Republican T-26 Light Armor (Plum) x2
· Republican T-34 Medium Armor (Plum) x2
· Republican BA-6 Armored Car x2
· Republican I-16 Early Ear Fighter (Plum I-16) x2
· Republican Su-2 Tactical Bomber (Plum) x2
· Republican IL-4 Medium Bomber x2
· Nationalist Infantry (Yellow) x8
· Nationalist Motorized Opel (Yellow) x2
· Nationalist Artillery 75-7 Veld (Yellow) x2
· Nationalist 38t Light Armor (Yellow) x1
· Nationalist Medium Armor Pz III (Yellow) x2
· Nationalist FW-190 Fighter (Yellow) x2
· Nationalist Fokker TV Medium Bomber x1
· Nationalist De Ruyter Class CA (Yellow) x1
· Nationalist Transport (Yellow) x1
· Nationalist Admiralin Class DD x1
· Nationalist 232 Armored Car (yellow) x1
· Nationalist Wz34 Armored Car (yellow) x1
· Espana-Class BB (Yellow) x1 (3D Printed)
· Nationalist Roundels (Paper) – 1 Set
· Republican Roundels (Paper) – 1 Set
· Spanish Blue Legion Marker x1
· German Condor Legion Marker x1
· Communist International Brigade Marker x4

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Defensa de los 9 Reinos
description:
Our kingdoms are under siege, the 9 kingdoms are in danger, be the most tactical general, defend yourself from invasion and be the first to liberate your kingdom.

Objective: Be the first to eliminate all Siege tokens in front of your castle zone, thus eliminating the Horde that awaits our defeat. Once all the Horde markers are eliminated, you will have won.

Round to round players have to go through the various actions of the game to recruit the powerful herores of the factions of the game to eliminate the Horde, combat the attacks, defend your kingdom and if you can hamper the work of the others so that each attack is to them to those that affect them and you are not the target of the new blow of the Horde.

The game can end in 2 ways, a) when a player eliminates all the siege tokens from their zone, b) when the 3 war end cards are placed next to the pile of theft (this rule is optional).

Players: 3 -6
Age .: 13
Duration: 20 - 60 min.
Cards: 90


Nuestros reinos están bajo asedio, los 9 reinos están en peligro, sé el general más táctico, defiendete de la invasión y se el primero en liberar tu reino.

Objetivo: Sé el primero en eliminar todas las fichas de Asedio frente a tu zona de castillo, eliminando así a la Horda que aguarda nuestra derrota. Una vez eliminados todos los marcadores de Horda, habras ganado.

Ronda a ronda los jugadores han de ir buscando a través de las diversas acciones del juego la forma de ir reclutando a los poderosos héroes de las facciones del juego para así eliminar la Horda. Combate los ataques, defiende a tu reino y si puedes obstaculiza el trabajo de los otros para que cada ataque sea a ellos a los que les afecte y no seas tu el objetivo del nuevo golpe de la Horda.

El juego puede terminar de 2 maneras, a) cuando un jugador elimina todas las fichas de asedio de su zona, b) cuando las 3 fichas de final de guerra se colocan al lado del montón de robo (esta regla es opcional).

Jugadores.: 3 -6
Edad.: 13
Duración.: 20 - 60 min.
Cartas.: 90
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Variable Player Powers

name: All Around Mackinac Island
description:
This game is based on Mackinac Island, a popular tourist spot in Michigan.

From the Publisher:
It's the simple game of familiar sights and fun surprises!

If you've ever been to Mackinac Island you'll certainly remember the fudge, Arch Rock and the Grand Hotel. All those things and more will show up in this quick game for the family.

Players travel the Island hoping to acquire the most Fun chips. Every location and event card will have directions to take more chips or pass them around. Your only choice will be when to stop rolling the die. Do you push your luck hoping for more Fun? Be careful not to Mack' Out!

The small box contains 11 cards, one die, one pawn, 50 Fun chips and rules.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Champions of Arathus
description:
Champions of Arathus is a tabletop game for 3 to 6 players based on RPGs with medieval scenery, but without all those complicated rules of the genre. In this game, you and your friends assume the role of the adventurer at an unknown island in a quest the maximum glory of being the next Champion of Arathus.
Every match the players must fulfill a determined quest (which will be set at the beginning of the match), ranging from defeating unknown beasts to defending cities that have not been destroyed. It can put players against each other or make them work together to achieve a goal, forcing heroes to put their differences aside for a greater good.
Choose your weapon, wear your armor and discover this new and challenging land to become the new Champion of Arathus. Finally yet importantly, have fun!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Stak Bots: Purple Expansion
description:
Turn the tables on your enemies with disruptive new mechanics that let you attack and defend the base of your Staks!
16 new Bots across 60 cards bring a new wave of controlled chaos as you strive to manipulate and destroy all of your opponent's cards.

This is an expansion, but it does not require the original game to play (by using the online rules for the original).

name: Global War 1936-1945: Afrika Korps
description:
The Deutsche Afrika Korps (DAK) was the German expeditionary force sent to assist Italian forces in North Africa. In this set we provide German units in Afrika Korp Mustard as well as rules for easily transferring DAK units across the Mediterranean.

Set Contents:

3 Infantry w/ Rifle (Mustard Color)
2 Opel Maultier Motorized Infantry (Mustard Color)
2 105mm Artillery (Mustard Color)
1 Hummel Self-Propelled Artillery (Mustard Color)
2 38t Light Armor (Mustard Color)
1 Pz III Medium Armor (Mustard Color)
1 KT-1 German Transport (Black)
5 German markers (15th, 21st, 90th, 164th Pz Div & Bonus Ramcke Para Brigade) 3 Markers unique to this set.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: Ordnance III – Chemical Weapons
description:
This set features a number of new chemical and biological ordnance for use with Global War -2nd edition. It is a testament to the horrific effects of these weapons that they considered too brutal for use in the Second World War. However, these weapons were at times used clandestinely by the Axis. The Japanese used them against China and the Italians used gas against the Abyssinians.

On the eve of World War II the production capacity of many nations far outstripped its World War I capabilities. Germany, which could produce about 40,000 tons of gas per year in World War I had the capacity to create 184,000 tons by 1939. Germany had also excelled in the development of new gases such as Tabun and Sarin gas with near 10 time the toxic potential of Mustard Gas (which itself was responsible for a quarter of all US casualties in WW I).

In these set we will explore the use of weapons in select theatres as well as the grim possibility of their full-scale use. In researching this set, I can’t begin to describe the abject horror and brutality of these weapons and the experiments used to test them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: River Monitors
description:
Welcome to Historical Board Gaming’s River Monitors (MON) expansion for Global War 1936-1945. In this set we cover rules for both River Patrol Boats and Monitors. In this set you will get more of the patrol boat markers first featured in our Manchukuo expansion as well as a 3D printed Erebus class monitor.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Global War 1936-1945: Operation Sealion
description:
Operation Sea Lion (OPS) is the Global War 1936-1945 expansion that covers the (hypothetical) German invasion of Britain. This expansion features British defenders (home guard, auxiliary, sea forts) and German amphibious units, paratroopers & commandos and rules that bring new depth to this epic struggle!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Global War 1936-1945: Oil Wars
description:
HBG is excited to present Oil Wars (OIL), an examination of the strategic importance of oil in World War II. The importance of oil in 20th century warfare cannot be overstated. Oil not only powered ships, tanks and aircraft but industry, transportation and energy production – in short, almost everything a modern nation needs to function. In this set you will learn the importance of oil as your nation clamors for oil wells, captures reserves and relies on on its oil-rich allies for help.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: Turkey at War
description:
Welcome to Turkey at War (TAW). In this set you receive a large force of grey Turkish units, including the 3D-printed battlecruiser Yavuz. Some really fun changes are part of this set. Turkish participation was too important to leave to a single die roll, so in this expansion we’ve added some more complex influence rules. We also let players manage Turkey as an independent country run by the Italian player. That’s right – we wanted more options for Italy and more of an independent attitude for Turkey – one with a more Mediterranean and Middle East focus. We think you’re really going to like it!!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: Winter War
description:
In January 1939 the Soviet Union invaded the small peaceful nation of Finland. In Winter War (WWR) players fight this epic conflict with a host of new weapons including Ski Troops. Finnish special forces, Soviet Aerosanis and more! This set has a full set of 25 molded plastic units and special markers for ski troops, Utti Jaeger and Sissi infantry.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Pelle the Pilot
description:
The goal of the game is to fly highest with your plane.

5 different planes start to fly to the center of the board. Each player has is own plane in front of him/her. Shuffle the deck and deal 5 cards to each player. In his turn player may play any plane on the table near the same plane (to fly with this plane).
If you cover any other plane with your card, the covered plane is out of game.

If you are the last pilot in game you are the winner.
If the deck runs out the player in game who´s value in his/her last card is the biggest is the winner.

—user summary

name: Global War 1936-1945: Hitler's Plan Z
description:
As early as 1934 Hitler envisioned a powerful fleet that could challenge British naval superiority. In this expansion, the German player can purchase one of three War Plan Z (WPZ) schemes. While the Germans get a discount on ships, they also commit themselves to building a lot of vessels, committing resources for many turns to come.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: U.S. War Plans
description:
The United States developed many color-coded war plans to deal with various military scenarios. In this expansion the U.S. receive some additional options to engage in battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: The Amerika Bombers
description:
Historical Board Gaming is excited to introduce Amerika Bombers (ABO), in which you get some seriously long range bombers to create some worldwide destruction! While they aren’t cheap to build or develop, these weapons were on the drawing board in World War II and we don’t think your Global War experience will be complete without them. So, without further ado – let the bombing commence….

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: Command and Conquer – Commanders of WWII
description:
Commanders I (COM) is an expansion Set for Global War 1936-1945. In this set, nations will acquire commanders that can support your forces in combat using a basic set of rules. Commanders II will provide advanced rules for specific commanders with unique abilities.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Operation Unthinkable
description:
FIGHTING OPERATION UNTHINKABLE
At the end of May 1945, it is highly doubtful the Soviet Government is going to allow democratic processes in the countries they occupy. As Prime Minister Churchill feared, it appears the Russians are not going to honor the agreements made between Allies concerning the future of Central and Southern Europe. To impose the will of the United States, The British Empire, and their Allies, the Joint Planning Staff draws up plans for Operation Unthinkable, a plan completely dependent on strategic surprise and the support of other European powers, including those they liberate. Outnumbered 2 to 1 in men and materiel, the Allies will need every advantage in the opening offensive in a war that many thought was over for Europe. D Day is set for 1 July 1945…

—description from the publisher

name: Dark Secrets of Alar
description:
Murder in a small town! Join a band of loyal friends seeking to uncover the real villain in the ghastly murder of the beloved Nurse Judy. This Homebrewed Cthulhu-esque board-game uses cooperative play on a 3d terrain map of a small New England town from the 1920's.

In this cooperative game, players move around the game board uncovering clues and revealing alibis for the members of the Town Council, all of whom are suspects of the murder. Work with the other players to deduce which Town Elders committed the murder, and reveal their hidden motive.

As players move around the board, they may draw cards from two decks, a Event deck, and a Town Deck. Event cards reflect general occurrences in the town, as well as the actions of the Villain as they attempt to hinder the investigation. The Town cards contain rumors and gossip that allows the players to discover who the real culprit and their secret motive through a process of elimination.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement

name: Trivial Pursuit: Editie Antwerpen
description:
Trivial Pursuit is a roll-and-move trivia game where players try to collect different colored "wedges" in their player wheel, and than make it to the center of the game board.

Trivial Pursuit: Editie Antwerpen is a smaller version with only 60 cards.

Categories:

Blue: Aardrijkskunde
Pink: Amusement
Yellow: Geschiedenis
Purple: Kunst & Literatuur
Green: Wetenschap & Natuur
Orange: Sport & Ontspanning

name: Conquering the Fertile Crescent
description:
“Do not try to do too much with your own hands. Better the Arabs do it tolerably than that you do it perfectly. It is their war, and you are to help them, not to win it for them. Actually, also, under the very odd conditions of Arabia, your practical work will not be as good as, perhaps, you think it is.”
T.E. Lawrence, Arab Bulletin, August 20, 1917

The Arab Spring that began in 2010 spread across the greater Middle East and North Africa. With little exception, it has not been resolved peacefully or resulted in greater democratic representation. Syria remains embroiled in a civil war that started in March 2011 and the immature Iraqi government was easily contested by the growth in Islamic State in Syria and Levant (ISIS).

Nothing is more horrific than the actions of ISIS, also known as DAESH (Dawla al-Islamiya al-Iraq al-Sham), and this game is not intended to glorify them in any way. ISIS is a radical extreme with megalomaniac goals that has fed off the turmoil and instability of this region inside the Fertile Crescent. Their actions fall into three broad categories: atrocities in Syria or Iraq, atrocities inspired by their radical ideas occurring outside the region, and other external ISIS planned and executed events—largely in Europe.
Western powers have attempted a multitude of approaches with each of the revolutionary uprisings but the global ambitions of ISIS placed them in direct confrontation. Of all the contestants, ISIS is the most aggressive, far reaching and extreme in their methods; ensuring that they cannot be ignored or contained without direct intervention.

—description from the publisher

name: RATH: Race Against The Horde
description:
RATH
Race Against The Horde

Goal: To be the first survivor of the zombie outbreak to complete 3 Survival Missions.
Premise: You are one of the few surviving humans in a zombie infested world. Your town, once full of beautiful trees and parks is now decaying and run down. There are a few groups of fellow survivors with base camps set up around the town. Through your walkie-talkie a distress call is heard requesting that a supply run be done as soon as possible. You accept the task and start off on your journey. Along the way you come across floods, fires, zombie hordes, and military fall out. At the end of the journey, you are the hero that helped save mankind from annihilation.

Game Board: Movement can only be done on spaces that have grid lines. Players cannot move through bushes and trees or walk on water. The buildings can be accessed by any space surrounding the border.
Daily Update Cards: The Daily Update cards effect game play in different areas of the board. Hazards in this zombie infested city slow down a players’ travel time, move them back to their home base, or force detours from their original path. Multiple grids on the map can be effected at once and each player must comply.
Survival Mission Cards: Each player will have one Survival Mission at a time to fulfill. Each player has a separate base camp of survivors they are trying to keep alive. By completing the missions on the cards, each player saves human lives by delivering life sustaining goods such as food, water, weapons, or building supplies to repair dilapidated structures.
To Start: Shuffle Survival Missions cards and place on corresponding space on board. Shuffle the Daily Update cards and place on the corresponding space on board. Place each colored playing piece on the corresponding colored home base buildings on the map. This means each player will have a different starting position based on the color of their piece.
Each player picks a random Survival Mission at the beginning of the game. The mission does not start until the player reaches the first building to pick up supplies and the mission does not end until the player reaches the destination to drop off supplies. Once complete, the player turns the card over and picks another Survival Mission to start on the next day/turn. Once a player has completed 3 successful Survival Missions, they are the winner of the game.
Player Movement: Each player can move a maximum of 5 spaces per day (turn) unless specified on the Daily Update card. Players can move horizontal, vertical, and diagonal.
Game Play: One (1) Daily Update card is drawn per day (turn) and effects each player on the board for that day/turn only.
The youngest player at the board is the first to draw a Daily Update card. Each player moves based on the Daily Update card in a clockwise manner, starting with the card drawer first. For example, player one reads the Daily Update card and is slowed from maximum movement of 5 spaces to 2 spaces. Their turn is over and now player two reads the same Daily Update card and makes their move.

name: Global War 1936-1945: Going Nuclear
description:
Welcome to Going Nuclear, Historical Board Gaming’s nuclear war expansion for Global War 2nd edition. This is the first of many 3D printed piece sets to supplement HBG’s Global War game. All of our 3D printed rule sets are denoted by the letters TDP with a letter after them to indicate the set (TDPA, TDPB etc.…) for easy reference in future rule sets.
In this expansion you’re going to learn how to build an atomic bomb. You and your opponents will be scavenging the globe for resources and constructing facilities in order to “GO NUCLEAR!” Also included in this set are rules to help Axis & Allies 1940 & Global 1939 players connect these rules to those game systems.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: New Berlin – Fall of the Reich
description:
Welcome to New Berlin: The Fall of the Reich (FOR) expansion for Global War. In this expansion Germany has the option to relocate its capital after the capture of Berlin and stage a desperate last stand from Argentina.

Contents:
1-Neu Berlin Marker
1-Führerbegleitdivision Division
Marker
1-Wasserfall AA
1-A-10 Marker
1-Bell (3D)
1-PZ VII Lowe (3D)
1-Type XXI Submarine
2-SS Infantry Markers
4-Werwolf Force Markers
1-Secret Air Base Marker

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: The Elite of the Third Reich
description:
An exploration of Germany’s Elite SS units in World War II.

In this expansion we will present both a Basic and Advanced version to suit your style of play. In the basic version Germany can build up to 35 unique SS units of different types based on their historic availability. In the advanced version we allow you to follow the historical progression of each unit as they evolve to different types (infantry, mechanized, armor etc..) during the war.

Contents: (60 Markers)
1 ea. of SS Divisions 1-38
1 ea. of SS Paper Divisions: 39-45
6 SS Divs (Generic)
1 ea. of 500th & 600th SS Para Div.
1 ea. of 101, 102, & 103rd SS Hvy Tank
1 Z.v SS Div
1 ea. of 1st & 2nd SS Cossack Div
1 Special Leibstandarte SS Adolf Hitler Div.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: Partisans
description:
Partisans were an integral part of World War II. These citizen soldiers took up arms in occupied territories, causing terror and mayhem for their oppressors, and ultimately helping in some cases to liberate their homelands. In this set you’ll be busy rolling for Partisans in captured territories, and trying to keep enemy Partisans from disrupting your conquests.

Set contents:
Partisan (US) x6
Partisan (UK) x6
Partisan (France) x6
Partisan (Germany) x6
Partisan (Japan) x6
Partisan (Italy) x6
Partisan (USSR) x10
Supply marker x6

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: East vs West
description:
HBG presents East vs West; an exciting continuation to Global War 1936 game that moves the conflict between communism and democracy from ideological to direct combat. With East vs West, the world powers continue the clash of military might and ideology until the world can find peace. These rules are an extension of 1936 Global. When in doubt, refer to 1936 Global rules on matters unclear or not covered in this expansion.

Contents:
Overlay that will fit exactly over your map.
Rules
Charts

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: King of the Castle
description:
A game for 2 players, the object of which is to win as many crowns as possible by having 3 stones of the same color leading to a crown vertically or diagonally.
One player takes 23 pink stones, the other player takes 23 green stones. The 5 crown cards are placed on the parapet spaces at the top of the board. Each stone that is placed must be supported by a stone beneath it.
When a player makes a line of 3 stones with one stone directly under a crown, he takes that crown and game continues until all stones have been played.

name: Global War 1936-1945: Russian Super Weapons
description:
Russian Super Weapons (RSW) brings you five new heavy-hitting units for the USSR. This set contains all you need to smash fascism once and for all and claim a Global War victory; The MiG-9 fighter, 4302 Rocket-powered interceptor, IS-7 heavy tank, SU-101 tank destroyer, and a Soyuz Class battleship! Rules for developing and using these units Global War 1936-1945 are provided. While many of these units did not enter real-life service until after the Second World War, players can now use the technology development system to add them to their arsenals during the game. Go to HBG Shapeways store to print out the number of models you would like for your game.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: Battle for the Atlantic – The Allies Strike Back
description:
In this Global War 1936-1945 expansion the Allies get a host of new units to fight against German Uboats. Many of the units in this set are exclusively designed to assist in ASW operations – a good counter to all those submarines in our last set! The B-24 Liberator can get out into the Atlantic Gap zones (represented by SZ 21-23 and 31-32). The CAM ship is great for defending against the FW Condor, and the DDE is a low-cost escort option instead of sticking your Destroyers on patrol duty. The Sub-chaser and K-Class blimp are good for inshore duty around the British Isles and Gibraltar.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: Battle for the Atlantic – The German Menace
description:
In this Global War 1936-1945 expansion Germany finds itself with Six new units with one sinister purpose - to disrupt and destroy allied shipping in the Atlantic. In this set you’ll find two new U-boat types, merchant raiders, Milch Cows, and FW Condors – enough to sink more allied tonnage than ever. But don’t worry allies, Battle for the Atlantic: The Allies Fight Back will feature units to combat this dire threat!

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Global War 1936-1945: Elite of the Soviet Union
description:
OVERVIEW
Historical Board Gaming is excited to present the Elite of the Soviet Union © expansion. An expansion involving the Soviet Guards Units (Guards) and the ‘Order of the Red Banner’ in World War II.

SET CONTENTS
-30 Guards Division Markers
-10 Order of the Red Banner Markers
-1 For The Capture Of Berlin Marker
-2 Guards Bomber Regiment Markers
-2 3D printed Po-2 night bombers

1.0 GUARDS

1.1 Overview
The USSR player can award Guards status to units that distinguished themselves in battle to boost moral and create elite units. Over 120 infantry divisions alone were given Guards status during the war.
Guards units were given better and more weapons, ammunition and vehicles than regular divisions. Guards divisions were sometimes reformed for various reasons. Some Guards units knew multiple formations during the war. These promotion rules replace the Soviet Union’s Guards Infantry rules on the Soviet Union’s National Reference Sheet in the Global War 1936 rules.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: シスターズチェイン (Sisters Chain)
description:
Publisher's summary
シスターズチェイン (Sisters Chain) is a Japanese game of tile placement, published in Japanese an English.

In Sisters Chain, the players race to the goal by linking character tiles according to simple conditions. If you have pairs of the same or sibling character tiles in your hand, you can play them at once.

You can also take the tiles placed by your opponents and aim for a come-from-behind victory by continuously placing tiles in sequence. This simple and tactical board game can be played from 2 to 6 players is recommended for all ages.

The game is themed on Touhou Project characters, but you can play the game without such knowledge.

タイルに描かれたキャラクター達を簡単な条件に合わせて繋いでいき、相手より早くゴールに到達することを目指すゲームです。
手札に同じキャラクターや姉妹同士のキャラクターがあれば一気に使うことができます。
また、相手が置いたタイルを取ることもでき、場合によっては連鎖的に置き続けることができるなど、逆転を狙うこともできます。
年齢問わずシンプルだけど油断はできないボードゲームとなっております。１対１の真剣勝負から最大６人でワイワイ遊ぶことも可能です。
東方Project作品の二次創作ですが、原作を知らなくてもプレイ可能です。

name: こんなブラックな魔王様はイヤだっ!! (Konnna Black na Maou Sama wa Iya Da!!)
description:
こんなブラックな魔王様はイヤだっ!! (Konnna Black na Maou Sama wa Iya Da!!) is a Japanese deck-building game. In English, the title translates as "I Can't Stand Such Evil Satan!!". But the publisher offers "Scout Monsters" instead (although this is not on the published edition). The game can be played as a solitaire as well as a 2-4 player game.

Publisher's summary
Scout Monsters is a deck-building card game whereby each player chooses their heroes and spells and fight to defeat monsters or have them join your team before they reach the final showdown against Satan.

Unlike many deck-building games, the cards are not divided into "treasure" and "point" cards, making it more beginner-friendly. On the other hand, Satan's Attack card, designed to damage all the players' decks, promotes competition with skills and tactics between skilled players.

In the 2- to 4-player games, the players race to defeat Satan. In the solo game, the player fights directly against Satan.

「こんなブラックな魔王様はイヤだっ！！」は、プレイヤーごとに英雄と呪文を選んでデッキを持ち、迫り来るモンスターを倒したり仲間にしたりしながら、最終的に魔王を倒す、デッキ構築型カードゲームです。
一般的なデッキ構築型ゲームと違い、いわゆる""金""と""点数""に分かれていないので、初めての人も遊びやすくなっている点と、全プレイヤーのデッキにダメージを与えようとする「魔王の攻撃」カードがあり、慣れた人同士も技術や駆け引きで競い合える点が特徴です。
より早く魔王を倒す２〜４人用ルールと、１人で魔王と直接戦うシングルルールがあります。

name: Hildarting
description:
Hildarting is a strategic game of area control settled in the Faroer Islands during the Viking Age.

The board represents the islands and regions of the Faroer arcipelago. Each player starts with a number of regions under their control, and the goal of the game is to conquer other regions. In the end, only one player will remain to be the ruler of the Faroer. The mechanics and the game goal resemble very much the classic Risk.

In turns, players move region to region by sea or by land. Entering other players' regions causes conflict, and the winner of the battle claims the region.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Honey Pot Hop: A Musical Party Game
description:
This game features two unique games, each utilizing a mechanical, talking Winnie the Pooh figure.

Set-up for both games is the same: place Pooh in the centre of the floor. Arrange the six character circles in a large circle around Pooh. All players start on a different character circle.

Bee Bop

Place the Bee Tokens next to Pooh, then push the honey bee button on Pooh once to start the game, and then once more to select the Bee Bop game.

Pooh will then give a direction (such as "bounce like Tigger") and begin playing music. All players must move around the circle, following the direction given by Pooh. When the music stops, each player must stand on a different character circle. Pooh will then name one of the six characters. If a player is standing on that character circle, they collect a Bee Token, and a new round begins.

The game ends when one player has collected 3 Bee Tokens OR when Pooh ends the game, at which point the player with the most Bee Tokens wins.

Honey Hop

Push the honey bee button on Pooh once to start the game, and then twice more to select the Bee Bop game.

Pooh will then give a direction (such as "scratch your head like Rabbit") and then begin playing music. All players must move around the circle, following the direction given by Pooh. When the music stop, all players stop and listen to Pooh. Pooh will then name characters, equal to the number of players minus one. So if there are 3 players, Pooh will name off two characters. Players run to try and stand on one of the character circles named by Pooh. The player who is not standing on one of the characters named is eliminated.

Remaining players continue playing another round. This time Pooh will name one less character. Players continue playing until only one player has not been eliminated at the end of a round.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Music, Party Game

name: Rezonite
description:
Rezonite is a two player duel where you battle using cards that represent mystical crystals. The goal of the game is to be the first player to reach a victory condition, which are printed on certain cards. This means you must cast a spell that has a victory condition and then use your other spells to help you achieve that condition, while preventing your opponent from achieving theirs first.

You get three willpower on your turn, which can be spent like action points to do things like draw and play cards. Spells are played face down, and remain that way until you manifest them. This gives you plenty of opportunities to bluff and outwit your opponent.

Every card in your deck is unique and every card can be played as either a spell or as energy. The choices you make about which cards to play as energy and which ones to play as spells can have a massive impact on the outcome of the game.

The core set comes with 150 cards, divided into 5 preconstructed decks. You can play with any of these decks, or build your own deck by combining any 30 Rezonite cards. There are no restrictions on which cards can go together, but think carefully about which energy types and victory conditions to include in your Rezonite deck.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Take That

name: Hey! Those Are My Glasses
description:
Hey! Those Are My Glasses is a children's shape matching game. Each player starts with a lemur face in front of them and the goal is to collect the most shape-based glasses cards. A player flips the top glasses card and then rolls the die. If the shape of the die matches the glasses on the card, they get to keep it. If not it stays on the table and the die is passed to the next player. If on their turn a player rolls a shape that matches one or more of the glasses on the tables, they get to collect all of the matches. Player with the most glasses cards at the end of the game is the winner!

-description from designer

name: Tank Battles
description:
Your tank rumbles into the bombed out ruins of a small town, a forest of jagged walls and rubble. Once a bustling town on a crossroads, it is now used as passage for supply trucks heading to the front line. Your mission is to hold this strategic location at any cost. But you’re not the only one with this mission. Other rival forces have sent their own armored units to secure the ruins. As a tank commander you’ll need to use your superior skills to win the day!

Tank Battles is an easy-to-learn, fast-paced game of tank combat with a surprising amount of tactical depth despite its simplicity. Take command of your battle tank(s) by moving and shooting each turn. Make difficult tactical decisions to stay alive and destroy enemy tanks. To win you’ll need to have the last tank left standing!

—description from the publisher

name: Menukaarten: Het Flexitarisch Dinerspel
description:
Cardgame Published by Foundation "Natuur&Milieu"

Light game that involves building menu's with different ingredients, based on the ecological footprint of the ingredients.

Players add ingredients (ranging in ecological footprint from -5 to 14 points) to a dish (set of cards) until the dish contains exactly 21 points of ingredients. The last player to add an ingredient wins the set.
To make the game more varied, some action cards are included that lets players start extra dishes, restrict the use of certain ingredients etc.
The player to finish the most dishes wins.

—user summary

name: Stop den Dieb
description:
Up to 4 players can take part in the game. Each player receives one token and must throw a "6" on the dice to be able to start. If a "6" is thrown during the game the player is allowed to have another turn. "Throwing" the dice is done by means of a short, sharp tap on the knob of the dice box. If the figure reaches a number field, there is a special event (according to the game instructions).

—user summary

name: Panda Rollers
description:
Shake the panda head to shake the dice and then everyone races to be the first player to match their Panda cards to the eye colors of the dice shown in the panda's eyes. The first player to match their Panda cards to the Panda dice shaker wins a reward tile.

Reward tiles can give players one or two bamboo pieces, or a fortune cookie. If a player draws a fortune cookie, that player can choose 2 reward tiles. Once all the reward tiles are gone, players add up their tiles. The player with most bamboo wins!

—description from the designer

name: Merit International: Sports Car Racing Game
description:
As read on the front box: "An Exciting Game for two to four players"
This game is a very simple ancestor of Speed Circuit and it is dated back in 1960 printed in England. There's a speedometer in the center of the mapboard and depending on how much speed you want to give to your car, you spin it. If you get a result of trouble you are blocked until the arrow of your car spinner (in the pits 1-2-3-4) goes to the space of appropriate problem resolution .

name: Alles was fliegt
description:
Game Material:
24 cards with different flying things (e.g. butterfly, witch, comet). Each card has a colored dot on the backside, representing the height it flies.
color die

Game rules
All cards are places face up in the middle of the table.
At players turn he roles the die and chooses a card he thinks has the right color (height) on the back. If he is right he gets the card. If no card of this color (height)is in the middle the player is allowed to take a card from another player.

Target of the game:
The first player who has all 6 cards of 1 height wins.

Variants:
Collect all heights: Have 1 of each 6 heights to win
Easy/Beginner variant: Place all cards with the back sides (color/height visible) in the middle.

Detail variant:
Place all cards in the middle face up. 1 player describes a detail on a choosen image. The player who finds the right card first gets the card. Game ends when only 5 cards are left. The player with the most cards wins.

name: Alles was fährt: Von ganz langsam bis ganz schnell
description:
Game Material:
24 cards with different things (e.g. car, inline scates) which can drive with different velocities.

3 games can be played with this cards:
1. Try to sort all cards from small to fast. 1+ players
2. Domino: All cards have 2 little images at the 2 ends of the card. This can be used for playing domino.
3. trick-game: The highest velocity wins. The speed is shown at the backside as number and as a red line (the longest line is the fastest thing).

name: Zingaro
description: In this game, several gipsies play poker with their golden rings.

name: Die Lustigen Frösche: Wer ist zuerst über dem Teich?
description:
Card driven race with frogs.
Each player has a frog which he tries to run as fast as possible on a path of water lilies.
The speed is not given by a die, it's given by the number on the card you get from the top of a stack.
There are some single cards with negativ values, which have the result that you go back this number of fields.
The player who is first on the other side of the pond (end of the path) win the game.

name: Lustige Rheinfahrt
description:
Funny trip on the rhine
This is a travel and geography game on the river Rhine. It's a jump and run game with some events on top of that.

name: Das Pinocchio Spiel
description: This is an interesting variant for a jump and run game where the players start by creating their own route in the first phase by selecting some of their cards. In the second phase, they eventually use this route.

name: Wettrennspiel "Toto"
description: This game combines a flat race and a steeple chase and the option to bet on the results. There are two separate race tracks for both races. Movement is determined by one die. On some spaces certain events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Clusterfight!: The Gang's All Here!
description:
Expansion for Clusterfight!:

"The People have spoken, and Clusterfight! has listened... but you will soon find that the wacky game of what-ifs isn't pulling any punches. THE GANG'S ALL HERE fills your fights with fan favorites: new fighters and items, treacherous (and often hilarious) locales, and absurb situations!

You want more? Get ready for more."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Storytelling, Take That

name: MRD Roadgame
description: Roll-and-move game following a path of 70 numbered spaces along the main highways of Western Australia from Eucla to Wyndham. Various spaces offer thematic bonuses or penalties, including detours and dead-end highways.

name: Ob Robert etwa Kleingeld hat?
description:
Each game board is used by 2 players, who move in opposite directions. The first player to reach the opposite circular space wins the game (space 121 or 0) an gets the content of the cash box.

Movement is determined by 4 dice with the numbers 1 to 4 and "+" and "-" on their sides. Each number on a die is for another player color. "+" and "-" for each color are on the same die as the "1". The Players may only move the amount of spaces indicated by the numbers of their own color. If a player rolls al 4 of his numbers the roll counts double. If all dice show the same number, the Player may move for all 4 dice.

On the roll of a "+" of his color, the player gets 1 token from the cash box, on a "-" he has to pay 1 token. If all 4 dice show a "+" he gets 4 token and on 4 "-" he has to pay 4 token.

If a player rolls only the color of an other player, this player may move 2 spaces and gets 1 token for a "+" from the active player. If a "-" is rolled the other player has to pay 1 token to the active player.

If a player gets on a space of his own color he gets to move 1 space ahead. On a black space with a white dot the player has to skip a turn. The spaces with the thick black border cause the players to jump 2 spaces back. If a player would get on an occupied space he may not move and has to wait for his next turn.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Oni (Second Edition)
description:
In Old Japan spring it’s a big celebration, and while everybody wonders looking the flowers bloom, the Oni, twisted and legendary creatures fight each other to see who is the one who makes more mischief endevors before somebody catches them... who will be the winner?

This new edition introduces several gameplay improvements, making it faster to play and easier to memory but the same big fun for all players.

name: Dark Masts
description:
Dark Masts is a 2 player deck building card game of high fantasy, in which players take control of powerful captains and mighty war ships in order to rule the seas. The game uses a unique three deck system where players compete for the scarce resources they will need to build their ship and destroy their foes.

In this 1 v. 1 game each player chooses a nation and places the captain and ship in play. Drawing up to 5 cards from any combination of common deck or the nation specific deck players will draw cards to upgrade their ship. Available upgrades are stronger cannons, thicker and stronger hulls, and crew members with special abilities. Players declare an action during the action phase that can include boarding the enemy ships, attacking with the ships crew and cannons, or batton down the hatches to give a temporary defense boost. Shaman and mages can be used to cast spells giving boosts to your crew, damaging enemy ships, or repairing your own ship.

name: Zombie Sheep: Dung of the Dead
description:
This is a promo card for the game Zombie Sheep, given out at conventions and to playtesters.

Dung of the Dead is shuffled in to the game deck. It is played against an opponent, causing that opponent to lose their turn.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Zombies

name: Patrol: A Coloring Card Game – Power Patrol
description:
Power Patrol is the original deck for Patrol: A Coloring Card Game. The Power Patrol deck first premiered at the 2017 Great Philly Con. The deck featured the original artwork and abilities of the game. In development of the game, a few spelling errors were added to designate the first printing. However, there ended up being a lot more spelling errors than intended.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Ant Swarm
description:
In Ant Swarm, you take on the role of running an ant colony. You will need to acquire Food and Water Pods with your Worker Ants, capture your opponent’s Ants with your Fighter Ants, and, most importantly, protect your Queen Ant from being captured by your opponent’s army.

During the game, each player may move either their Worker Ant OR Fighter Ant tiles. Move the Worker Ants towards the center of the board to collect Water and Food Pods, then move them back to your Queen to redeem for Energy Pods. Your Fighter Ants will face your opponent on the field of battle. If you win, you get to lock up your opponent’s Ants in your dungeon and force your opponent to rescue their Ants. To win: capture your opponent’s Queen first.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Long Beach-Opoly
description: Familiar real estate themed acquisition race that uses landmarks from Long Beach California (a suburb of Los Angeles) as properties.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Head Hints: Star Wars
description: Who is strongest with the Force? Imagine entering the universe of Star Wars in this intergalactic version of the Head Hints game and choose to play as Luke Skywalker, Yoda, Princess Leia, or Chewbacca. Players try to guess the mystery card that's placed in their Star Wars character mask so they can boost their Force strength and become Clue Commander to help others guess their cards. But be careful…Darth Vader tokens take Force points away!
