The spinner will land on one of 5 different ways to give clues including acting it out, breathing like Darth Vader, or even doing a Yoda impression. The first player to reach 4 Force points wins.

name: The Orchardist
description:
The Orchardist is a simultaneous-action card drafting game designed to teach the basics of pest management and crop care in orcharding systems.

Players are dealt eight face-down pest cards, each of which may contain 0 to 4 pests of four different types. Players also receive a hand of four crop cards comprising resources and actions for successfully growing and harvesting a crop, or revealing eliminating the pest cards. Each round, players all draw one more card for their hand, choose one to play, and pass the rest of their hand to the next player. Players must decide between monitoring and managing their pests, applying fertiliser and other crop enhancers, or amassing the seasonal workers, pack houses and export licences needed to make the most profit.

The cards run out after eight rounds, when players take turns to tally their scores. Type of orchard they have and the resource cards they have collected determine their base profit level. This is increased by fertiliser, pollination etc, but decreased by the particular pests that remain in their orchard. The game can be customised for regional orchard types.

Integrated Pest Management is part of an educational kit used in schools to teach children about horticulture and biology.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Economic, Educational, Farming, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Happy Heist
description:
Happy Heist is a ridiculous card game about robbing banks! Gather 3-10 friends and battle to create bulletproof master-plans to break into the bank, bypass security and steal the cash.

One player is nominated to be The Bank, all the other players are Robbers. Robbers are dealt a hand of random items, weapons and skills (Action Cards) to use against the bank security systems (Security Cards) which The Bank is dealt a hand of, and can use in whatever order they wish. The Bank also takes one card describing a uniquely fortified or defended bank vault (Vault Card) for the final round.

One Security Round at a time, Robbers will play an Action Card and explain/role-play/justify how they would use it to defeat the Security Card. Creativity is key. The winner of each round is decided by The Bank and they will receive a new Action Card. When The Bank runs out of Security Cards, it's time for the Vault Round and Robbers can combine any of their remaining Action Cards to create an elaborate plan to break into the unique vault, get the cash, and escape.

Players will need to play their cards strategically, holding powerful cards for the final round if possible, and creatively justifying their choices to win over The Bank.

—description from the designer

name: MMA Throwdown
description:
MMA THROWDOWN is a fast-paced, simultaneous-turn role playing game that simulates the strategy, excitement, and unpredictability of a mixed martial arts contest in real time!

The object of the game is to outwit opponents by maximizing your strengths and exploiting their weaknesses in order to defeat them by either knockout, submission, referee stoppage (TKO), or judge’s decision. But in this sport, victory is never quite certain and even the most dire of situations can be salvaged in the final seconds.

Use your skills of deduction to out-think your opponent time and time again. But don't leave yourself open to that counter, because all it takes is one mistake to swing momentum the other way and leave you reeling in Survival Mode.

Remarkably simple to play and incredibly hard to master, MMA THROWDOWN is the only mixed-martial arts game of its kind.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Es geht um die Wurst
description:
The players start on the colored spaces. As long as they are on the square spaces, movement is determined by a black-white die.
Movement is one space (black or white). If a pawn gets on an occupied space, the first pawn is thrown out and has to begin anew.

On the circular spaces, movement is determined by a number die. If a pawn gets on an occupied space while moving forward, the first meeple is pawn out and has to begin anew. If a player rolls more than he needs to reach the sausage pot, he has to use the surplus points to move backwards. If he gets on an occupied space, he has to move further backwards, depending on his rolled number.

The first player to reach the sausage pot wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fast Flags
description:
Get rid of your cards first by putting down cards where two or more Flags match the Flags on the card on the table!

—description from the publisher

name: Havok: Battle Cards
description:
In Havok you play as a god. From your deck, you must select your champions wisely, armour them strategically and defeat other gods’ champions. When you defeat an opposing gods champion it becomes your servant and joins your deck. The winner if the first player to claim all opponents’ cards.

Players start with a few champions, upgrade them with powerful weapons and shields then send them into battle. Clever game mechanics can punish heavily armoured champions and chaos cards can level the odds on the turn of a card.

Havok is a fast-paced game that is extremely simple to pick up. You certainly won’t need a PHD in card games to get going. The creators have even included a simple multiplication guide to help younger players with any complicated sums!

One of its defining features is the beautiful artwork promised on each card.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Mythology, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Battle Board Roller
description:
A game played on a chessboard with battle-chits. The battle-chits have swords or shields on different edge's, they also have a dice symbol in the middle. the four royal battle-chits on each side have a crown. the game is themed on Medieval knights. You setup like chess in the top and bottom two rows arranged anyway you want.

In a turn if a sword contacts an enemy chit that has no shield opposing it the enemy chit is removed from the board. Each turn you roll a die, one of the battle-chits on either side can be rotated to maybe attack with sword or defend with shield. after you decide to rotate or not you may move a chit on your side one square in any direction.

The goal of the game is to capture at least two of the enemy crown battle-chits.

name: TimeMaster the game
description:
A Time Guardian hunting for the seven crystal shards to stop the dreadbots from taking them to control time.

The game is a solitaire or two player game, played on a large grid with interconnecting mechanisms to show local-time-travel and deep-time-travel. the Time-master moves on the board trying to land on the crystals or landing on the dreadbots to destroy them and take the crystals they carry. The dreadbots move around trying to kill the Time-master or collect crystals.

The object of the game is to collect all seven crystals before the dreadbots do.

name: Paparazzi: Gæt en kendt
description:
Paparazzi is an entertaining team- and party-game for adults, where the goal is to guess famous persons. The persons to guess can be known from, tv & movies, sports, writing, royal life, fictive persons, historical persons, and many other.

Make two teams of at least 2 players each. Team A starts. Team A choose a player (Mr. X), to give clues, and the team have four rounds to guess the person on the card, the faster the more points.

The four rounds are: Give 2 out of 3 clues. Draw letters from a bag and spell out clues, mime or draw, and finally answer yes/no-questions from the team. The team that first reaches goal wins the game.

Lots of laughter, and enterainment for you and your co-players.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Paparazzi er et underholdende hold- og selskabsspil for voksne, hvor det gælder om at gætte kendte personer. Personerne, som skal gættes, er kendt fra bl.a. film og tv, sportens verden, er forfattere, royale personer, fiktive personer og historiske personer.

Der dannes to hold af minimum to, og hold A begynder. De udvælger en Mr. X til at give ledetråde, som så har fire runder til at få sine holdkammerater til at gætte personen på kortet - jo hurtigere desto flere point.

De fire runder går ud på at udvælge ledetråde, sammensætte bogstaver, mime eller tegne og til sidst at stille ja/nej-spørgsmål. Det hold, der først får deres brik i mål, vinder.

Der er lagt op til masser af grin, og underholdning for dig og dine medspillere.

—description from the publisher

name: Milibarries Series 1
description:
This is a collectible figurine strategy board game. The goal of the game is to defeat your opponent's troops, or "Barries", with your own Barries. Each Barry has Health, Damage, and Range, along with other distinguishing features.

To play, place 6 Barries on your side of the battlefield, and put number tiles under each Barry. Then, roll the die to see which Barry attacks, number tile corresponding with number rolled. When a Barry takes damage, mark it using the damage sheet (sheet shown in documents), and then your opponent rolls. Repeat until all Barries are gone from one side of the battlefield.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dogfight squadron cards
description:
The game simulates WWI or WWII dogfights with squadrons of fighters and bombers. it has a campaign game to fight a war. the game uses an ordinary deck of playing cards.

Gameplay has one squadron facing out against the other. you draw two cards per plane, these are your manoeuvre cards the four suits representing climb, dive, roll left and right. The cards are chosen but not shown to the enemy player. Each plane can be tailed or tailing or even unopposed. Having an unopposed plane is a big advantage because it can help join in a battle between other planes. each player shows one card if the direction is different then the plane breaks the tail and is tailing the enemy, but if the card is the same then a second card is flipped, if the direction is the same the tailing plane gets a shot, its a simple high low cut, but some cards add effects like ace's a new plane joins your dogfight.

The object of the game is air superiority but the campaign game adds ground targets.

—designer from the publisher
categories: World War I, World War II

name: Book of Nox
description:
Book of Nox is a horror dungeon crawler which follows the adventures of a Group of Victorians exploring strange lands and battling a host of evil cultists and monsters in a traditional Victorian setting.

At the setup of the game a story is chosen. (six included) The Games Master prepares the adventure. All the rooms and corridor cards are shuffled. The cards are revealed when a player explores the next doorway.
When a card is revealed dice are rolled to determine the encounters for that specific room.

A turn consists of three phases:

Players phase:


During a turn a player must perform two actions (move, attack, push, swap weapons, put down/pick up lantern, open door).

Monsters phase


After all players have acted, the monsters will attack. The monsters also perform two actions.

Upkeep phase:


This is the tidy up phase, certain actions are resolved now and it will state in the description when an action resolves in the upkeep phase.

The game is won if the players achieve the objective of the story.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Tutti Frutti
description:
Tutti Frutti - fill up your plate!

There is nothing more healthy than fresh fruits. They don't add weight, help with digestion, have lots of vitamins - a game where you can easily fill up your plate. Maybe this wets your appetite for delicious fruits!

In the game, each player gets a cardboard plate. The 38 slices of fruits are openly placed upon the table. The special thing about the game is the size of the slices. The smallest have the number 1, the biggest the number 6. In between there are the other sizes with values from 2 to 5. A player rolls a six-sided dice and may take a slice accoding to the rolled number, putting it on the plate. As time goes on, the plate fills up. Goal of the game is to get slices exactly reaching 36 points of value - then the plate will completely filled. Who first fills his plate up, wins the game!

name: Kwispel
description:
Equipment
Playboard with 6 horizontal fields numbered 1 to 6
40 Strips with a word which gives a category
a series of letters
1 coored stone
2 dice

In each of the numbered fields on the game board 1 word strip is placed. All other word strips are given to the players.

At players turn, he can choose to roll 1 die to get this number of new letters or to build a word which matches a category on the board or one of his own words with the letters he has.
If he has a matching word for a category on the board he gets points for each letter the word is long multiplied with the number in front of the word.

If he has a word to one of his categories, he has to place his category on one of the places on the board.
He is not free in the selection of the place. The last placed category is marked with the colored stone. Normally the player has to choose a field with a lower number.
There are 2 circumstances where he can choose another:
1. The marked field is field 1
2. The number of letters is higher than the number of the blocked field.
The points are calculated in the same way, number of letters multiplied by the number of the field.
At the end of the players turn the colored stone is always placed on the word category which was used.

The game ends if one player has reached the defined points (e.g. 500). This player wins.

name: Vorsicht Falle
description:
From the side of the box:

The goal of the game is to bring four marbles over a swiveling round board into the target. Each player tries to spin the round board at the right moment to trap the opponents marbles.

Contents:
16 colored marbles
1 spinable game board
1 six-sided dice
1 rulebook

name: High Society: Wie werde ich prominent?
description:
Content:
Gameboard
5 white cones
4 figures of each of the 6 player colors
120 chips in 4 colors (categories of fame)
1 die

The board shows a round turn with 6 different fields:
grey fields: Starting places for the white cones
4 different "fame fields"
"Door of success" fields

At players turn he role the die and moves 1 of the 5 white cones.
If the cone ends on a fame field he gets 1 chip of the adjustend color.
If he ends on a "Door of success" fields he pushes open the door.
At each players turn he is allowed to pay up to 3 chips to enclime the ladder of success. He has to open the "Door of success" to be allowed to do this. From the rules it's not clear if he has to do this 1 time for all 4 ladders (one for each category) or only one time for all.
It's also possible to interpret the rules that you are only allowed to do this when you move on a "Door of success" field.
If you come exactly on the same field as anothers players figure you have to fight with rolling a die. The higher number stays on the field, the lower number has to climb down to the next free field. The defending player wins ties.
On the highest level, the defending player is allowed to role 3 dice where the highest is taken for the compare.

The player who has reached the highest position of 2 ladders wins the game.

name: Partyspaß mit Didi Hallervorden: Fünf verrückte Partyspiele lassen kein Auge trocken
description:
This game consists of 5 little games which can be played as a tournament one after each other, where the player with the most points wins or each game as a single game.

Didi Hallervorder is a famous German comedian, actor in funny films and moderator e.g. from "Hidden Camera". This game is a party game. Didi is known to participate for each joke and this is the reason written in the rules why his name is in the title and his image is in all games.

The games:
1. Pinch the Didi (Zwick' den Didi). A spinning circle is in the middle and a path for a kind of race. The players pinch their little clothes peg at the edge of the spinning circle.
At all positions there is an action e.g. move 3 fields, suspend 2 turns.
These actions are executed, normally moving forward your figure on the path.
After the round 1 or more players reach the finish line this game ends. The points each player gets are written on the path.

2. Didi listen (Didi horch einmal):
5 little balls: 4 empty and 1 with stones in it.
1 4 part puzzle showing Didis face for each player.
The active player takes all the balls in his hands and tries to hear which is the stone filled. Each player who is right gets 1 piece of his 4 piece puzzle. Who has finished first gets 5 points all others 1 point for each piece.

3. Didi eats chinese (Didi ißt chinesisch):
Feet a Didi figure with your chips using chopsticks like in China. Game ends when 1 player has feet all his chips. He gets 1 bonus point. Each player gets 1 point for each of his chips Didi has eaten.

4. Jiggle Didi (Wackel-Didi)
There is a jiggling figure of Didi in the middle of the table. Each player tries to get rid of his chips by placing them on the hat of the Didi figure. If chips fall down, the player gets them. The player who has placed the last chip on Didi wins this game and gets 1 point. Each other player gets 1 point minus for each chip he still has.

5. Didis gymnastic party (Didis Party-Gymnastik)
There is a start and finish sign. These are placed in 4 m distance.
A stack of cards is shuffeled. Each of the cards shows a kind of gymnastic figure. The actual player opens the top card. This shows how to hold the arms and feets and where to place chips on the body for his run. With this positions the actual player tries to transport as many of these chips without that they fall down. Each chip which is still in place at the finish gives 1 point. The rules do not mention how many rounds this game is played.

Playing with more than 4 players you have to build teams.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Schnüffel-Nase (Eine spannende Ganovenjagd)
description:
Contents:
In this game there are 28 rouge chips (each rouge of 7 rouges is 4 times available), 7 team marker, 1 dog and 7 smaller rouge chips for determining the order.

Gameplay:
In this memory game 2 to 4 players have to find 7 different rouge chips in a certain order, which was determinded¬¬¬¬¬ at the start of the game. The first player to find all the rouge chips in the right order is the winner.

At the start of the game one player shuffles 28 (21 for 2 players) rouge chips and places them face down on the table. Then 7 groups are formed. Each group consists of 4 (3 for 2 players) rouge concealed chips.

At the start of the turn the active player takes the dog and places it next to one of the seven teams (not the team it has come from) and flips one of the rouge chips. If it is the next rouge the player has to find, the chip is placed in front of the player. If it is not, the chip is placed face down again. In any case the turn of that player ends.

name: Icos
description:
In Icos, you play a wandering hero; accepting and completing quests offered to you by the people of that fair land.
you will encounter hazards, monsters, and companions that impede or aid your journey. you can obtain a variety of resources, which enable you to take on greater dangers The first hero to gather great renoun will become the Hero of Icos.

Icos is a world still in its humble beginnings. The people know the settled land and the sinister wilderness that bounds it, and little else.
But, the influence of the things that lurk in those woods is seeping out into the idyllic settlement in the form of strange creatures, and dark whispers causing good men to sour into violence; Icos needs a hero.
the folk of Icos are losing hope, and are reaching out. with a myriad of concerns and worries posted on message boards around the kingdom, someone must rise in aid to the good people of Icos before everyone falls under the loathsome shade cast by the menacing woods.

—description from the designer

name: Tempus
description:
Tempus is a retro style card game that's fun for everyone! Inspired by the greats, like UNO, Skip-bo, Phase 10, and Rack-O.

Players control time to play all of their cards before their opponents!

Components: 1 travel case/game board, 1 instruction sheet, 168 cards, consisting of 12 each #1-#12 (clock cards), 18 n (wild) cards, and 6 Reverse time cards.

Reverse time cards: These cards dictate the counting order of the game. The first time they are played, they are played face up to change the direction to counterclockwise (backward) counting direction. The second time they are played face down to indicate clockwise direction. They are played to the side of the time zones, separate from the counting piles.

Objective: Play all of the cards in your countdown deck before your opponent! The game ends when a player has accumulated 365 points, and then the lowest score wins!

Setup:

Deal 12 cards face down to each player, each player flips their top card over and places it on top of their cards to create the countdown pile.
Reveal 4 cards face up in the 4 time zones in the center. If any n (wild) cards are revealed, cover them up with another card until 4 clock cards.
If any reverse time cards are revealed, they are played to the side of the time zones.


Play: The player to the left of the dealer draws cards until they have 5 in their hand. They may use cards from their countdown pile, hand, or discards to count the hours of the clock in the time zone, according to the direction (forwards or backwards) in the directional area.

Counting in Tempus is cyclical, like a clock. Players will count 11-12-1 in forwards direction, and 1-12-11 in backwards direction.

If a player can play all 5 cards from their hand in a single turn, they can draw 5 more cards and continue playing

All n cards must be covered by the next clock card in the sequence before that players turn is over. If it cannot be covered, it is removed from the time zone and placed at the bottom of their countdown deck.

A player MUST count at least one card in the Time Zone from their countdown pile, hand, or discard per turn. They must draw cards into their hands until they can. If a player has more than 5 cards after discarding, they must place the excess cards at the bottom of their countdown pile.

A player ends their turn by discarding 1 card into one of their four discard piles. Cards may be stacked, but only the current top card of each discard pile is playable. Any remaining cards in a players hand carries over to their next turn, where they will draw until they have 5 again.

Play continues to the left until one player has used all of the cards in their countdown pile. All other players add up their cards remaining in their countdown piles and add it to their score. (1-4: 5 pts, 5-8: 10 pts, 9-12: 15 pts, n: 20, RT: 25)

Once a player has reached 365 points, the game is over, and the player with the lowest score wins!

—description from the designer

name: Gina Giraffe
description:
Gina Giraffe is a card game where the players try to match the cards correctly. Each player starts with a card and they take turns drawing cards until someone end your giraffe row and win the game/round.

The game gets more dynamic with each turn because more cards at sight left on the game zone. It means that the players will need more visual speed and attention among others, to do not lose their chance, because the first person who complete Gina wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Puzzle
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Dickens A Christmas Carol Board Game
description: Dickens A Christmas Carol Board Game features questions both on the story itself (10 points for each correct answer) and Dickens’s writing of the story (20 points). You pick which type of question you want to answer.

name: Endgame
description:
Endgame is is a game where multiple spymasters are competing to control the world.Each player is given three spies at the beginning of the game. These spies can be used in a few different ways.

In the operations section of the board exists four cards. On the top right hand corner there is a circle with a number in it. That number is how many spies you need to allocate to purchase that card.

When you purchase a card you have two options with it. One, you can play the card and gain the effect of the card. A card can be played at any time even if its not your turn.

In the top left corner of the card is a star with a number inside of it. These are victory points points you get when the game is over. However if you play them you wont get victory point total

Another use of spies is to capture territory on the world map. If an area is undefended (Meaning there is no spy there) it only requires you to put one spy there. If there was 1 defending spy there you would have too expend 2 spies to capture it, if 2 are defending you would need 3 spies to capture, and so forth.

When controlling an area that area gives you certain perks. For example as long as you control north america you gain one extra worker. However once you lose influence over that area you lose the extra spy.

At the end of the game you will look and see who has influence over the seven continents. You would add up the total form areas (including bonuses for holding countries).

The person with the most victory points wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Marine-Spiel
description:
This turn of the century German game stands out for its magnificent artwork and very unusual board. The box cover shows a pre-dreadnought battleship slicing through the sea, from off its starboard bow, while the board initially unfolds to show a side-on view of the ship with no apparent game features.

However, the board image then unfolds further from the ship's main deckline to reveal a schematic of the ship's compartments, a 46-space roll-and-move track from a bunkroom in the bow to the engine room. The artwork in the gameboard portion is highly detailed, with images of furniture, seamen at work and varied ship's stores, but in a plain red ink against a white background.

There are six playing pieces, highly detailed human figures in different uniforms and dress, printed on cardboard and standing in coloured wooden disks.

Both the cover illustration and the board take considerable artistic liberties with technical details. The ship on the cover looks very much like the 1898-commissioned pre-dreadnought battleship Kaiser Wilhelm III, but has an extra funnel and is missing a side turret. The ship on the board has the correct two funnels, but is missing the barbette gun beside the main forward turret as well as one of the three side turrets, and has no rear turret. The ships fly non-existent and therefore neutral flags of horizontal stripes, but are red-yellow-blue on the cover and red-blue-yellow on the board.

The cover art is signed with the initials SR, while the board art is unsigned, which may explain the differences in detail. The lack of any publisher information is unusual for a German game of such high quality.

—user summary

name: Lunik
description:
An extremelly rare greek board game from the late 1950's. It can be played from 2 to 5 players. Every player move with the sum of the two dices and he must collect all the needed items to launch rockets with their sattelites.
The winner of the game is the player who launches the most rockets.

name: Wer das Glück hat, führt die Braut nach Hause
description:
The deck consists of 16 cards. Each player get 4 Cards and Pays 6 tokens into the cash box. The remaining 4 cards are laid out front up on the table. Each player gets to exchange one card of his hand with one of the remaining cards. Für this he has to pay 3 tokens. Afterwards wins and losses are determined and another turn begins. The game ends, if a player has the bride, one groom and the ring on his hand. All other combinations cause wins or losses or are neutral.

If a player has the ring, the key and one of the two grooms he may offer tho buy the bride from the player who holds her. If the other player accepts the offer, the bride and two other cards are shuffled and the player with the groom and ring draws one card.
If he draws the bride, he wins the game and the contents of the cash box.

—user summary

name: Route 66 Dice Game
description:
The player rolls all five dice and scores any sixes rolled. If no sixes are rolled, their turn ends, they score 0, and the dice pass to the next player.

They can continue their turn and roll again, but if no sixes are rolled, they lose any points for that turn.

The first player to reach 2451 miles (the length of Route 66) wins.

name: Coleopterra
description:
Competitive game for 2-4 players. Each player controls 5 beetles, who must collect the most points by getting food tokens from the board to their lairs. Each beetle has a special movement to move the tokens and also, to fight against the enemy beetles.

In each turn beetle must do any three of these actions: walk, turn, fly, collect food tokens ir attack an enemy beetle.

The "token food" looks like beetle's food. When these are collected in the lair, these become in victory points or support beetles.
Finally, a player could win reaching the points goal or collecting the most points in a pre set time.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Combat Command: Battalion Level Rules for World War II – Basic Game
description:
In Combat Command you take the role of a Battlegroup Commander maneuvering a mixed force that can range from a reinforced infantry battalion task force to a battalion sized panzer kampgruppe. The game recreates World War II tactical battles by using an innovative integrated sequence of play which meshes the actions of each player in order to simulate the swirling battles of the period.

The game allows you to command forces modeled on historical battlegroups in games based on actual battles or in hypothetical match ups between roughly evenly matched forces. All technical data is presented in one table covering a wide range of equipment used in World War II from French Somuas to German Panthers. The easy to use Quick Reference data chart allows players to concentrate on maneuver and not on minutiae yet covers all the important weapon systems and hardware innovations of the war.

—description from the publisher

name: Occupation
description: A roll-and-move game on a Monopoly-style board from 1940s, found in Jersey, that uses subversive jokes to mock wartime life.

name: Tower of Disa
description:
A game of dexterity for 2 to 4 people; usually played by 2 people. Comes with a 52 "logs" (dowels). Each dowel is about 4 1/8" long.

You begin by laying a base of parallel logs and then alternate turns to add a log one at a time. The last person to lay a log on the stack without upsetting the tower is the winner.

name: Kingdoms Wars
description:
Pen and Paper games played with 3 dice, pen and paper. You are the founder of kingdom you can write your kingdoms name to top of paper. you should play at least A4 paper. You are rolling dice for resources each turn 1=Cow 2=People 3=Culture 4=Iron 5=Stone 6=Food you and your opponent keeping paper in front of them without showing to someone. you should write top of the paper side by side soldier, food, farm, people, cow, milk, iron, mine, stone, wall, culture, then roll dice for who will be first, then roll 3 dice.

For example you roll 1,3,6 then you should write under of cow 1 under of culture 3 under of food 6, you are starting with 20 food if you run your food because peoples and soldiers eats 1 food per turn your peoples starts to die, you roll a single dice and that much people die. you are gaining resources same as dice number, but if you roll same number at all dices like 111,333... then you get double of it 333=18 resources.

You are trying to destroy your opponent by soliders, you can create solider with 1 iron and 1 people,you can declare war if you have more than 20 solider , if you decide to attack then you can see your opponent paper if he has wall your 5 solider dies for per wall then walls demolish, then rest of the your soliders and your opponent solider starts to clash and who has most of the soliders win, if you win and playing more than 2 people you can take all of his resources to your kingdom.
You can build or buy something for improve your kingdom in your turn

Wall = 25 stone killing 5 soldiers if they attacking
Soldier = iron+people
Farm = 15 stone+people producing 1 food per turn
Mine =20 stone+people producing 1 iron per turn
You can buy people with 5 food
You can kill cows for 10 food
People can drink milk instead of eating food but you cant produce new peoples with milk
If you have more than 30 culture you can spend 30 culture and roll 3 dice and steal that much solider from your opponent.



My advice if you are not trusting your opponent you can play open kingdom paper in front of you so no-one can cheat.

—description from the designer

name: Rusty Trombone
description:
The hilarious new party game where you and your friends get to come up with new sex positions. What’s a Dusty Suitcase? What’s a Muddy Hobo? It’s only as vulgar as you and your friends make it!

Game play: Dealer draws five cards from the deck and selects two cards to form a new phrase and puts them on the table, discard remaining cards back into the deck.

Players write down what they think the description is, it can be anything you want. Answers tend to be more risque, but don't have to be. Everyone hands their answer to the person sitting next to the dealer, who now has to read all of the answer out loud.

Dealer selects which answer they like best and game play continues in a clockwise directions. Game is over when one player wins 10 rounds or is the last person to pass out.

Game contains 216 cards, which allows over 45,000 combinations of phrases!

-description from designer

name: Foodie Kitchen
description:
Foodie Kitchen is a strategic dish building card game for anyone and everyone that loves food! Become the head foodie of Foodie Kitchen by preparing delicious dishes and collecting kitchen tools. Along the way, you’ll have many action cards, such as Dumpster Dive, Art of Chopsticking, and Steal The Recipe, to stop the other foodies from winning!

Foodie Kitchen is fun, quick, easy-to-learn and has just the right balance of strategy and luck so that no one game is ever the same. Play Foodie Kitchen with family and friends!

Foodie Kitchen is a light and casual game for 2-5 players and plays in 15-30 mins.


HOW TO PLAY:

1. All foodies start the game with 5 Mini Mart cards.
2. Foodies draw two cards at the start of their turn. Foodies can either draw from the Mini Mart deck or the Inspector deck. The Inspector deck is a high risk, high reward deck.
3. Foodies will draw ingredient or action cards from the decks.
3. Foodies have a maximum of 2 moves per turn. Foodies do not have to make 2 moves. (Playing a card from your hand counts as a move OR Moving a card from one dish stack to another counts as a move OR Flipping a wild card from one ingredient to another counts as a move)
4. First Foodie to 11 points wins!


HOW TO WIN:

1. First Foodie to 11 points wins!
2. Foodies can earn points by creating dishes. A dish is worth the numbers of ingredients it takes to create the dish.
3. Foodies can earn points by collecting tools. You get 3 points for a set of 3 of the same tool cards.
4. Foodies can earn points by collecting A-rating cards. You get 4 points for a set of 3 A-rating cards. However, you must maintain the highest number of A-rating cards in the game in order to get the 4 points.
5. Foodies can earn points by collecting James Mustache Award cards. You get 1 point for each card.

name: Veg Patch Match
description: Children learn about different fruits and vegetables as they build matching and memory skills in this jolly game with a cheeky twist. Take turns swapping your small veg patch cards to replicate the central veg patch board, be the first to do so and shout "Veg Patch Match!" But watch our for Mr. Sprout; when another player uses this card they can change the veg patch which everyone is matching to! A fun strategic game for all the family.

name: Independence.....
description:
Canary islands are independent... The next day, Spain strikes. Each turn they head towards your cities and each turn you try to stop them. If you hold on them for 2 days,they"ll retreat and you will win. If they occupy your main city by the 2nd day,they'll win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Launch Bay Escape
description:
It's been 30 years since the last uprising of the Zraxii Empire was beaten down by the brave troops of the Terra Republic. Applying for the mission with the codename "Elite Peacekeeping Shockwave" sounded glorious at first, but turned out being a little bit dull as patrolling a remote part of the galaxy without any upbeat outposts did not motivate the crew greatly. Instead, one of the most stimulating activities became the weekly BBQ on the electric fire in the dust-heavy unused launch bay, within the protective shield of the XP95 fighter craft. Today's menu included some deep space frozen Milky Way cow meat, discovered on an abandoned vessel near the dwarf planet Taplor 4.

"RRAARRRAARR!" — The ship's alarm was blazing.

Only after a few important wasted moments did the squad realize this was not a test as they found themselves between the run wild XP95 fighter, filled with enough explosives to destroy a small moon, and the marching forces of the until now assumed defeated Zraxii Empire trying to board the ship. Luckily the squad's exceptionally extensive combat training and experience came in handy, if only they had kept up training regularly...

Launch Bay Escape is a ridiculous co-operative game featuring planning that's enriched with a small deck-building mechanism. It's suitable for space soldiers from the age of 10 and takes about 30-45 minutes. The difficulty level is easily adjustable per game as you increase the complexity by adding more and more aliens, obstacles, and madness.

The game is played in rounds. At the start of the game a rectangular game board divided in rows of squares is placed. One end features the launching ship and the starting area for the players, the other end features the Launch Bay exit. All players have their own character sheet and corresponding deck, and all players have their own special abilities, number of hit points and shield. Players start with six cards in their hand. At the start of a round, all players plan three cards from the available cards in their hand, face down. Next, the first card of all players is revealed. All cards show a number, movement options, and special abilities. In order of highest to lowest number, every player follows the instructions on their planned card. When all cards are resolved, the ship moves one row towards the Launch Bay exit and all aliens move once towards the ship and attack. This is repeated for both remaining planned cards. At the end of the round, all planned cards and remaining cards in the player's hand are discarded and a new hand of six cards is drawn. Once damage accumulates, some cards will be planned randomly.

Players can gain experience by killing aliens. Experience enables the players to buy extra cards to add to their deck. In addition, players may find items on the game board, usable only once or multiple times.

The players lose if the ship or all the players are destroyed before reaching the escape pods at the end of the Launch Bay.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Meat Boy: Rival Rush
description:
Super Meat Boy Rival Rush is a one versus one competitive card game where Players race to the finish. Players assemble twenty card decks comprised of actions and skills that will get them to the end, along with some nasty tricks to trip up their opponent. Beloved characters from the Super Meat Boy Cinematic Universe make appearances for the first time as trading cards, each with their own unique abilities and powers to help navigate the levels ahead at breakneck speeds. Rival Rush is a nonstop fast paced no holds barred finger blistering every card for themselves showdown where only the swiftest and smartest survive.

Taking heavy influence in the micro-deck builder genre, the game puts the players in the task of creating a deck of cards that matches the symbols that pop up in the "stages" in front of us. The trick? Your rival might guess which card you have chosen for this turn and could block your moves through the stages; and in Rival Rush there will be only ONE winner.

Taking in consideration that the game offers the possibility of a fresh experience every time it's played thanks to it's random generated levels (constructed from the cards themselves), Rival Rush seems like a very fun and competitive way of enjoying Super Meat Boy; hopefully not as frustrating as it's digital counterpart.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That

name: I Know How You Died
description:
This game was made as a form of giving back to our fans and supporters. Yes, it's FREE! You can get the Print N Play file simply by subscribing your email to Medieval Lords. We love to spread fun and joy (perhaps death and destruction too, in this case) It is wild, so expect to laugh lots when you play - more so if your friends are horrible actors! Alternatively, you can get the game professionally printed over at The Game Crafter here: https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/i-know-how-you-died1 (Cost-to-cost price by Game Crafter with zero profit for us) This game is intended for pure utter rubbish type of casual fun, don't go in expecting any serious game play! Play this with the wrong crowd and you'd end up in an awkward evening!

Players are issued 3 random secret cards depicting various deaths, and they must choose one of them to re-enact. Then after everyone has done a quick 5 to 10 seconds re-enactment of their chosen scene, they toss these cards (still face-down) into a common pile in the middle of the table. Shuffle the pile and reveal the top card to everyone. If anyone wants to guess at who had acted out the death scene of that particular card, simply say 'I know!' and call out that player's name. This is on a first-come-first-serve basis. Note that the actual actor of the card cannot guess his/her own card, but must pretend to participate so as not to give the answer away.

If a scene was guessed correctly the first time, the guesser gains 4 Point. If a scene was guessed correctly the second time, the guesser gains 3 Point. The actor also gets 3 Points. All wrong guesses will deduct 1 Point from the guesser.

If no one got the correct answer to a scene after two attempts, the next scene is drawn and the game continues. After 3 scenes, the entire pile is discarded completely and a new round begins. This also means there will be some scenes that do not show up despite having been acted out. This is to increase the difficulty of the game.

The game ends when the last card is drawn, or when someone achieves 20 or more Points. Rules can be found at the Files section of this game page.

Have fun dying...
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Tower: Market Inventory Randomizers
description:
18 round inventory marker tokens that are meant to be placed directly over the existing inventory spaces on the six market stall tiles included with Tower.

Includes instructions for use.

It randomizes what the markets will sell in the game.

name: Rune Walker: A Solitaire Rune Game
description:
Rune Walker is a game of discovery and adventure using a standard set of 24 runes. It draws upon the ancient myths of the Teutonic peoples in order to present a world of heroism and challenge. Each step matters in this world where Jotuns intend to thwart the Rune Walker and her attempt to reclaim the wisdom of the nine worlds. The Rune Walker will face opponents of immense and growing power armed with lore and weapons of great strength. The object of Rune Walker is to succeed in walking all nine worlds and to rebuild the great world tree – Yggdrasil. When all nine worlds have been placed upon Yggdrasil the game is won and the Rune Walker has claimed the wisdom of the Runes and worlds.

- A Game for One Player

—description from the designer

name: Captain Can Spell
description:
The First Word Climbing Game

Captain Can Spell is a word game with innovative game rules. It is easy to learn and fun. Besides this game will test your word skills, it also involves layers of strategy for you to discover. This game will fit all word game lovers, from beginner to expert.

Gameplay overview (2 players):

Each player is dealt 13 cards, the aim is to get rid of all cards, players take turns to play a word. All words are ranked, from lowest to highest, by their first letter in alphabetical order. Player in turn must play a word of the same ranking or higher than the previous player. For example, the previous player played "book", the next player can play "bat" or "cat, dog, eagle...zoo", but this player cannot play "apple" due to "A" is lower in rank than "B". If this player cannot or does not want to play a word in his/her turn, then he/she has to pass and draw two cards from the draw pile. After a pass, the next player can play any new word.

Scoring system:

The player who gets rid of all cards wins the round, the losing player has to take the penalty points which is the number of cards in his/her hand plus the number of cards remains in the draw pile, 1 point each. This will add up to his/her total penalty points. When one of the players reaches the total penalty points of 100, the player with less penalty points wins the game.

3-4 players game:

This game can be played up to 4 players with the slightly modified game rules in which involves some different strategies of playing.

—description from the designer

name: Monkey Moves Game
description:
The monkeys can do it all. Upside-down. Mirroring. On one foot. In the air. They have balance, flexibility, and strength... but so do you.

Monkey Moves is the ultimate game to test your trust, coordination, and ability to have fun. Pair with a fellow monkey and get your body moving to mimic the monkey moves on each card. The game is in your hands as you and your partner strategize to earn more points than your opponents. Calibrate on Level 1, risk it with Level 2, or jump straight into challenging Level 3 moves; higher level moves are harder, but worth more points. And remember, it’s always worth trying the move, or your opponents can try to steal.

Are YOU up to the challenge?

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Sports

name: GAMBLE ZEBRA
description:
User summary
ギャンブルゼブラ (GAMBLE ZEBRA) is a Japanese card game. English rules are on the designer's website.

In the game of GAMBLE ZEBRA, players try to accumulate victory points by betting on black or white.

Each player receives an identical deck of eight bidding cards. Any of these cards can be played in two ways: bid on black with a value of X or bid on white with a value of Y. In any card, X+Y is always 9. For example if the upper half of a card is 8 on black, the lower half is 1 on white. In addition, each player receives two random special bidding cards.

Each round, a victory point card, whose value ranges from -1 to 5, is shown up. Players guess whether the back of the card is black or white, and play two cards from their hands. When the card's color is revealed, the highest bidder on that color takes the victory point card and a random victory point modifier card.

After five rounds, the highest scorer wins the game.

Designer's summary
3つの要素があるカードゲームです。
1つ目、ギャンブル要素：白と黒、どちらに賭けるのか
2つ目、駆け引き要素：カードを2枚出して相手より大きい数字を狙う
3つ目、運要素：駆け引きで勝てても結果が更に変化する

勝利条件：5ラウンド勝負終了後、一番ポイントが多い人が勝ち

name: DUSK: Arena of Shadows
description:
Dusk is a dark fantasy combat game based around large models, tactical movement, and deck construction mechanics.

Players will field a single Phantom avatar then take turns constructing decks from a selection of Phantom specific gifts, universal skills, and universal weapons. Each option has 9 potential picks of which players will choose 4 cards to add to a basic deck. All basic decks are 13 cards and identical for parity and balance.

Once decks are constructed players will use the numbers on cards to engage in arena combat at exact ranges while managing their hand size and card abilities to leverage their specific construction strategy.

Fighting in teams or (1 v 1) the game ends when you have eliminated your opponents and established your dominance in the Arena of Shadows.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Number, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Hippos Love Sushi
description:
You and your hippo friends have just discovered a restaurant in the jungle. The kitchen is fully stocked and none of those pesky humans are around! As culinary connoisseurs, you decide to take a shot at the menu. However, as you know, too many hippo chefs can ruin the sushi. So choose your meals wisely, and you just might end up with the fattest belly.

Hippos Love Sushi is a bluﬃng/memory game for 2-4 players ages 5 and up, where players take turns adding secret ingredients to Meals. Afterward, each player chooses a Meal to eat. Each player scores 1 point for each correct ingredient in his Meal. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Gobs of Jobs
description:
Gobs of Jobs is a game about earning money and what to do with it! Save it? Spend it? Give it? Yes to all three!

Save up for something big and important. Treat yourself and have some fun. Help others and make a difference.

The goal of the game is to earn the most money and use it for Saving, Spending, and Giving. The player with the highest money total on their cards wins.

name: シュレディンガーの宴 (Schrodinger no Utage)
description:
シュレディンガーの宴 ("Schrodinger's Banquet") is a card game about quantum mechanics.

Players compete for scoring by dividing into two teams, white cats and black cats. However, the players do not have a set team at the beginning of the game. Players work toward the final victory, while also building the two piles and earning their score.

A a turn, the player simply puts one out of three cards in front of someone. Wherever the card is played, the probability of the black cat team or the white cat team written on the card will be added. If this probability exceeds 100%, the player's team is confirmed. Then, when the player's team is confirmed, the points from the card that confirmed the team will be added to the team. The game is over when all players have a confirmed team, or the deck runs out. The team with the most points wins. Even though it is very simple, frustration is bound to happen.

name: Lost Stories
description:
Everywhere you go in human society, just beyond the corner of your eyes and under every step you walk are tendrils of the past, of futures that never happened, of broken things, and of things not born. They’re all lost stories. Some of them can nearly push themselves into reality. Writers, artists, musicians, lovers, and the thin spaces of the minds of the mentally different are all places where a Lost Story can become real in one way or another. Don’t you want to get your sheepskin? Don’t you want to finally be a real story? That’s what all the other Lost Stories call it “Getting the Sheepskin”.

—description from the introduction

The 28 page PDF game document includes 21 pages of print-and-play cards. Playing the game also requires several ten-sided dice (standard dice can be substituted using an alternate method). Players take turn in order and player elimination may occur prior to a final win, though winning does not require every player but one be eliminated.

This game was written for, and submitted to, Game Chef 2018.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Legend of the Ancients
description:
In Legend of the Ancients, players will attempt to piece together the greatest legend of a people lost almost entirely to antiquity. By exploring deeper and deeper into the ruins of this lost tribe, they will discover and try to make narrative sense of new elements to the legend, all while hopefully not succumbing to their worst fears. As these things always go, however, there is a catch. Somewhere in the deep, dark underground waits a malevolent force, older than time itself, and with each step they take, our intrepid explorers are unwittingly awakening it. Will our noble adventurers unlock the key to the lost Legend of the Ancients? Or will they be overcome by terror... or something infinitely worse?

—description from the introduction

The cooperative storytelling game is published as an 8-page PDF rules document and a 12-page print-and-play PDF game materials document. A 1-page, print-and-play DOC file also is included as an errata. The game uses two distinct decks of cards and a play surface that is randomized at the start of the game.

Play involves drawing map tiles and placing them, to create the randomized playing surface. Players have a token marking their position on the board. During each turn, the player selects an action from among six possibilities and executes that action. Several of the options entail moving the player token to a new map tile.

Players are free to cooperate to achieve game goals, and play is considered cooperative. Indeed, a few game actions require more than a single player. Individual players may have leave the game prior to the end of play (they are driven "stark, raving mad"), but this is not common. Instead, the game ends when the players collectively complete one of two tracks of play (one of the tracks is the "happy" ending - universal success; the other is the "doom" ending - universal failure).

The game is meant to be played with 3 - 5 players; a minor variant rule can be used to adapt the game for 2 players - in effect, the rule creates a dummy, limited, third "player".

The game was written for, and submitted to, Game Chef 2018.

—user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Wakening Lair: Doppelganger Promo Card
description:
Promo card for Wakening Lair distributed at Gen Con 2018 with game purchase.

Doppelganger is a monster card that has use right an unused hero.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Grand Manoeuvre Rules Updates for 1811-1851
description:
This rules update for 1811-1851 is for players who already have Grand Manoeuvre`s original Napoleonic war games rule set. For those that do not, please see Grand Manoeuvre Nineteenth Century Wargames Rules Variants (1811-1851). Grand Manoeuvre`s Rules Updates for 1811-1851 cover the following wars:

1. The South American Wars 1811-1824.
2. The November Uprising 1830-1.
3. The Egyptian–Ottoman Wars 1831–3 & 1839-41.
4. The Mexican War of 1846-8.
5. The First Italian War of Independence 1848-9.
6. The Hungarian Uprising 1848-9.
7. The 1st Schleswig-Holstein War 1848-51.

The set includes the following: A rules introduction booklet, which explains the game basics and historical terms. The introduction includes rules amendments for each war, units` and generals` ratings. Rules amendments notes for each war listed above. These have notes on; tactical doctrine, unit qualities, leadership and where appropriate the weapons used by each side and their effects on the rules. Orders and messages sheets, Unit/A.D.C. number labels, and order cards are playing aids to make player`s order writing easier.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: World War I Game
description: This is part of the Learningames History Series. In it, you learn about World War I and the battles that were fought. There are three levels of play included in the rules; Basic Game, Identify the Location of the Event, and Identify the Event Based on the Location. The winner of the game is the player with the most cards.

name: Arena Deathmatch (Third Edition)
description:
Avatars of War: Arena DeathMatch is a 28mm miniatures game that depicts the bloody clash between two or more bands of heroes facing off on the floor of the arena, in front of a raucous crowd that is thirsty for action, violence and death. This deadly contest is known as a deathmatch.

The most powerful heroes among the mortal races are known as Avatars of War--heroes chosen by the Gods of War themselves. These Avatars, in addition to being fierce combatants, are able to draw upon the silver of divinity within their souls for the power to expand their already awesome combat abilities.

In Arena DeathMatch, each player controls a band of Avatars of War as they face off on the arena floor in front of a cheering (or jeering) crowd.

The perils of the Arena stand against you: traps, hazards and even savage beasts stand between you and your opponent. The door to the Arena opens, and the shouting crowd is eager to see their favourite heroes fight to the death. Will they be cheering your victory...or your death? There's only one way to find out!

DIFFERENCES IN SECOND EDITION (2011) VERSUS FIRST ONE

The second edition is the result of compiling all the feedback from players and review and refine the first edition rules accordingly, resulting in a smooth and streamlined set of rules that deliever plenty of action and strategy. In Arena Deathmatch 2nd. ed you can customize your fighters and game tactics to new levels, choosing from more than 500 different options for their weapons, armor, feats, abilities and spells. The potential combinations and strategies with the new ruleset are almost limitless.

DIFFERENCES IN THIRD EDITION (2016) VERSUS SECOND ONE

The 100% new thing in 3rd are Combat combos: A combat combo consists of performing a succession of combat actions to carry out extremely powerful attacks. Look for the symbol § to know which actions are comboable.
After successfully executing a comboable action, the Avatar can immediately (without the enemy being able to act) perform another action (comboable or not). The combo will end when a non-comboable action is performed, or when performing an action without success (by mistake or by the opponent's counter).

COMBATE GLADIATORIO FANTÁSTICO

Arena Deathmatch es un juego de combate de miniaturas.
En Arena Deathmatch cada jugador crea y dirige una banda de Avatares de la Guerra y la enfrenta a la banda de otro jugador en la arena, bajo la mirada de la muchedumbre, sedienta de acción, sangre y violencia.

El desenlace de una partida de Arena Deathmatch empieza a escribirse mucho antes de saltar al combate, al reclutar y adiestrar a tus campeones de la arena.
Una vez en la arena, deberás poner a prueba tu capacidad para pensar rápido, usar tácticas astutas y utilizar los puntos fuertes de tus luchadores para atacar los puntos débiles de los luchadores de tu oponente.

Pero tu contrincante no es el único obstáculo hacia la victoria, los peligros de la arena son un reto por sí solos: pozos de muerte y bestias salvajes se ciernen sobre tu banda.

Finalmente, no subestimes la importancia de agradar a tus seguidores ¡Tener a la multitud a tu lado marcará a menudo la diferencia entre la victoria y la derrota!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Schach-Ballspiel
description:
Each player has 11 playing pieces. The pieces may capture each other. Different pieces move and capture differently:

Center-Forward (1x): moves straigt or diagonal, captures any adjacent piece
Outside-Forward (4x): moves 1 space diagonal + any spaces straight, captures any diagonal adjacent piece
Midfielder (3x): moves diagonal, captures any diagonal adjacent piece
Defensive players (2x): moves straight or diagonal, captures any adjacent piece
Goalkeeper (1x): moves to any of the 5 spaces in front of the goal, may not capture and can't be captured

If a playing piece enters a space adjacent to the ball, it may play the ball straight ahead, as many spaces as possible or wanted. If the ball ends it's move adjacent to another playing piece it may be played further according to it's movement ability and so on.

The first player to achieve a goal wins the game.

—user summary

name: Rabbit Gene Rummy
description:
The bunny-themed card game that helps teach the basic principles of Mendelian inheritance. We’ve all heard the idiom: “breeding like rabbits”. Well, here is a card game that brings it to life! No smell, no fuss, no need for cages! Here’s a visual way to learn the jargon and the basic principles of Mendelian inheritance while playing a fast-paced card game.

Create legal matings by matching a buck (dad) and doe (mom) with one baby they could 'legally' produce according Mendel's Laws. Earn points for each known allele that appears in a mating. The more unknown alleles you can fill in for each mating, the more points you can earn.

Brief Overview of Gameplay:

Cards are dealt to each player with some left over to go on the table as the Gene Pool (draw pile).
On each turn you draw a card.
If you can form a legal mating, you lay the trio down.
Then discard one card if you have one.
The game ends when someone runs out of cards or both draw piles are depleted (the Gene Pool and Retirement).
The winner is the person with the most points.


—description from the designer

name: A Game of Knights and Knaves: Fire and Ice Expansion
description:
This is an Expansion for A Game of Knights and Knaves which allows you to recreate both Historical and Fantistorical battles and campaigns set in the medieval period. You can create an army from your favourite fantasy book, television series or movie or, if you, prefer from history. A campaign system lets you and your friends take the command of a great house and battle for the throne of mythical or historical England in the kingdoms. This Expansion includes The Battle for the Throne campaign system and complete orders of battles for a campaigns set in mythical Westerlands, England during the War of the Roses and an alternative history campaign featuring exiled Lancastrians, Spanish Conquistadors, the Aztec Empire, a Native American Confederation and a Viking Colony all battling for control of the New World.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: A Game of Knights and Knaves: The Olde World Expansion
description:
A Game of Knights and Knaves allows you to recreate both Historical and Fantistorical battles and campaigns set in the medieval period. This Expansion lets you create armies from medieval Europe both mythical and historical. A campaign system lets you and your friends take the command of a great house and battle for the throne of fantasy Olde World or historical Europe in the Hundred Years War.

You need a copy of the A Game of Knights and Knaves – the Basic Game to use this Expansion.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Neue Kohle
description:
By skillfully playing the euro notes, it is important to win the largest amount of money.
Depending on your mood, you can choose between three game variants, each requiring different decisions. Combine these three variants with each other, so you have up to seven game variants - up to the championship.
Of the 14 different Euro banknotes, each of which must be operated differently, you only have a maximum of five in your hand to play it profitably.

name: Farmito
description:
Farmito introduces children to the joys of country life. By pairing baby animals with their parents, leading them to their living quarters, feeding them and collecting their produce, they learn how a traditional farm works and how important wild animals are in preserving the balance of nature. (Information from the publisher).

A game for smaller children.

You roll a die:

if it shows "animals" you flip an animal counter and try to match the animal to the corresponding Living area of the farm
if it shows "feed" you pick the first feed marker from a pile and place it to the corresponding living area of the farm (where the animals live that eat this)
if it shows the "farmer" you move the farmer pawn. If there are already 3 animals (mother, Father, kid) in the area and enough Food, the player wins the "produce" counter (e.g. milk from the cows or eggs from the chicken).


When the Five products have been picked up the game ends. The player who has collected the most produce counters wins the game.

—user summary

name: Anime Island
description:
Welcome to the Network's newest hit reality survival game show... Anime Island!
We've taken 16 cliche anime characters and stuck them on an island together. They'll face new challenges each episode. They'll fall in love, become rivals, and entertain you every step of the way. One-by-one they will be voted of by you, the viewers, in a process called, The Tribunal! Call in your votes now to make sure your favorite characters survive... Anime Island!

Players have secret agendas dictating which characters they want to stay and which ones they want to go. For instance an agenda may say if you get both Cookie and Jikurou kicked off the island you get 10 points. Another could say if you make sure Daphne stays on the show the whole game, you'll get 11 points. Each episode (round) the characters face a challenge which will change which characters fall in love, become rivals, or are immune to the tribunal vote.

Use deduction and negotiation, along with special tribunal powers of the fallen characters, player will try to manipulate the game to score the most from their secret agendas.

The Game takes place over several rounds (episodes).
Each episode has the following phases:
1) Today's Challenge
Challenge cards are flipped up and determine which characters become rivals, form partnerships, or have immunity.
2) The Discussion
A 1-minute sand timer is flipped and everyone discuses who to vote off of the island. Characters that gained immunity during the challenge cannot be voted for.
3) The Tribunal Vote
When the timer runs out every player simultaneously points to a character (that does not have immunity).
The character with the most votes is kicked off the island. In a tie> They are each kicked off!
Any character that is partnered with a character that is voted off, also gets kicked off the island. A Character that is a rival with a character that gets kicked off the island gains immunity for the next episode (in addition to whoever gets immunity through the challenge)

After 9 episodes, the game ends, and players calculate their score based on their secret agendas and which characters got kicked off, and which ones remain.
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Role Playing, Voting

name: Masterminds & Minions
description:
Play as a cliché villainous mastermind trying to prove that you are the best mastermind! Choose a secret lair to operate out of, will you choose the abandoned nuclear launch silo, perhaps the orbital space platform, or do you find yourself still operating out of your mom’s basement?

Players will use their mastermind to create minions and send them out to the cities to pull off heists. Unfortunately for your unsuspecting minions, those cities are guarded by super heroes and security forces. Those forces that keep villains like you from doing all the fun things villains do, will make life for your hapless minions...unpleasant.

Complete heists and upgrade your secret lair to prove that you are a better mastermind than the rest.

A variety of masterminds, cities, and lairs to choose from coupled with unique gameplay for each mastermind ensures that Masterminds & Minions will remain fun time and time again.

When the game begins four cities will be selected for the board, each city is protected by a custom super hero. Each player will choose one mastermind and one secret lair. Each mastermind has a custom deck of cards, and additionally will draw three heist and city cards to determine their evil plans and where they will try to accomplish them. Action points can be spent to play mastermind cards, use lair abilities, or take other game actions. This will allow the players to create minion cubes and move them from the mastermind’s lair out to the various cities that have been selected for this game. Once the minions are in the city, each player turn a super hero card will be played trigging the security forces and super hero’s powers. When enough cubes have been accumulated a heist can be completed scoring victory points for the mastermind.

Players will also have other special cards or abilities custom to each mastermind and lair that will allow them to interact with the game and other players in interesting ways.

In addition to completing heists, victory points are accumulated by upgrading your lair to make it cooler than the other mastermind’s lairs. Once enough victory points are scored a winner is declared.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Brige: The Board Game
description:
A political game where a player plays as a party in a town called Brige in Europe, 1915. His goal is to attract as many followers to support his party by moving across the map of Brige. The game begins with the overthrow of Major of Brige, and ends in 1918, the end of WW2, when order is brought back to the town and elections take place. The party with the most voters wins the game.

The game is consisted of a main board map (the town of Brige), Personal Board- these boards give information about the party's current stand. Their content is changed along the game as the party is influenced by the player's decisions, and other effects . In addition, there are "Point of Interest" cards that resemble an encounter with a citizen or an event that is happening that requires the party's decision. Whenever a player lands on a Point of Interest, he takes a card from the pile and must act according to the type of event at hand, and organize his position after reading the consequences. The face of the cards is where the information about the event is given, with the available decisions & options at its bottom. On the back of the card is where the decision's effect is shown.

Along the game, a party may hire citizens that it encounters and turn them into "Agents". Once this is done, the player places a figure on the board. Agents are the connecting bridge between the players, and allows a party to make contact with other parties. Every agent has its own skill and have specific actions that can be done with them. A Gunman for example, may attack other units on the board, including the party leader that will lose the player's game if is assasinated.

An important aspect in the game is money. The game currency is called "Brigs", and is affected by the current information on the player's Personal Board, or throught drawn Point of Interest cards. Without money, an agent can't be paid, some actions can't be made, and the player will most likely have few units on the board, what makes him vulnerable to Gunmans. The player must carefuly plan his campaign in order to make sure he doesn't fall into issues such as this.

—description from the designer

name: 2018 Malibu Games Because Summer
description:
2018 Malibu Games Because Summer is a word game consisting of tiles packaged in a pouch that resembles a pineapple. Players form teams. Tiles are drawn from a central pile and used to make words. Some tiles are "twistable" meaning the tile can be used as two different letters depending on which edge is up. Teams can steal other teams tiles by adding tiles to make a word or rearranging the tiles to make another word. When the draw pile is exhausted the game is over and the team with the most used tiles wins.

—user summary

name: Dirty Habits
description: Collect six category tokens (Partners, Eating, Work, Bathroom, Shopping, and Travelling) by answering correctly, truthfully or to the satisfaction of all the other players a question in the appropriate category. Tokens can be lost by declining to perform or describe a named nasty habit. Questions are of the kind of "How would you disguise that you were eating your earwax?"

name: Elefantræs
description:
A memory racing game.
Get your elephant across the meadow to the circus tent by remembering the tiles.

name: Den hemmelige have
description: A memory game for two players (or two two-player teams). On their turn, a player will draw a card, look at it, and place it on the board so the opponent can see the the front side of the card. The player will then have to recite all the cards that they have drawn. This will become harder and harder, and once a player fails, the opponent will get a point. First player to five point wins.

name: The Holiday Fun Quiz Pack
description:
Do you know the name for a baby turkey? Or which US state was the first to declare Christmas a legal holiday? Can you hum the tune to "Frosty the Snowman"? Put your knowledge to the test with this bumper pack of quizzes and games! With one quiz dedicated to all things festive, another with questions on everything from food and drink to geography, and a game that sees you humming the tunes of well-known festive songs for you teammates to guess, this set is the ultimate in holiday fun!

Set contains:
100 holiday quiz questions
100 general knowledge questions
50 holiday "hum that tune" cards

—description from the back of the box

name: The Monster Among Us
description:
The Monster Among Us is a social deduction/hidden role game played over three nights. You and your friends reside in a quiet village. But lately, things haven’t been so quiet. A series of killings, always at night, has plagued your village. And one thing is clear: these attacks are not the work of mere men. A monster is behind them; but what kind?

A team of 4 to 9 villagers, each with unique skills and occupations, must band together to search the village and its surroundings in pursuit of the hidden monster. But there’s a problem. It is becoming increasingly clear that some of the villagers are not what they seem. No one can be trusted - not even you - because the monster is among us.

—description from the designer

name: Dream Lands
description:
GREECE 5,000 BCE

The Ancients were masters in telling of stories, dreams, visions and prophesies. Their stories were inspired by mysterious symbols, colors and numbers.

Draw symbol tiles from the bag and use them to create the story you want to tell. A tile can be used more than once, and both sides of the tiles can be used within the same story. Its easy to invent a few fables to amuse your friends.

Enchant your audience and win applause disks. May the best dream win.

Carry a bag of tiles and scoring disks with you where ever you go. You are always ready to play.

DREAMLANDS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES

—description from the designer

name: Melos
description:
AEGEAN SEA 4,000 BCE

Dark obsidian, a glass-like stone, was mined on the volcanic Greek island of Melos for thousands of years. Obsidian was extremely valuable and used to make razor sharp weapons and farm tools. The nearly lifeless island attracted explorers searching for the valuable rocks containing obsidian. They landed their boats next to the beaches and moved inland, where they mined the rock. They pushed the rocks to the beaches and then into their boats for transport overseas.

Choose your tiles carefully, so that together they overcome the resistance of the rocks and opponents. Push your opponent’s tiles into the sea to drown them. With more than two players, the scheming starts as you resist or not, or let some opponents pass.

Melos is only available as part of the Ancient World Multi Game System.

—description from the designer

name: Assyrians
description:
MIDDLE EAST circa 700 BCE

Assyria is preparing for battle against the surrounding nations. A lone prophet, Isaiah, has visions of doom. “See, the Lord is going to lay waste to the earth and devastate it; he will scatter its inhabitants.” Will the nations believe that the Assyrians are coming to destroy their towns and cities? They say to the seers, tell us pleasant things and prophesy illusions.

Each round in this numbers game, threat tiles are selected but concealed. Players draw power tiles and may contribute them to the collective power. When a threat is revealed will their power be enough to overcome it? If so, you score the tiles that you kept.

Has everyone contributed enough to overcome the threat or kept their share of the resources? It’s tempting to make excuses and get away with it. Discover each other’s scheming and bluffing side or their open and co-operative nature.

An ice breaker for many players with fast moving discussions.

—description from the designer

name: Ziggurats
description:
UR FERTILE CRESENT circa 2,100 BCE

One block at a time, the Sumerians built wide, flat pyramids, called Ziggurats, in their city of Ur.

Be the first to move your block on top of two of any players’ blocks which are stacked on a foundation block. Stop your opponent’s blocks from moving by stacking on top of them. But watch out! Everyone loses when someone cannot move any of their blocks.

—description from the designer

name: Tekel
description:
BABYLON 538 BCE

Followers of the Most High God have been deported and brought to the Babylonian empire. During the reign of King Belshazzar they were threatened and oppressed. As the strife increased, there was no turning back. Farmers were put under the control of citizens, citizens were put under the protection of nobles, and governors ruled the nobles to unite them. On Tekel, the day of judgement, the Most High God will decide who has been found wanting?
