Players must unite their people by stacking their people tiles in the right order by the time they reach their opponent’s back row. Choose carefully when to unite them, so not to slow their pace or expose them to oppression.

Tekel is only available as part of the Ancient World Multi Game System.

—description from the publisher

name: Agros
description:
Much land in Ancient Greece was mountainous and unsuitable for farming. Farmers competed to plant and harvest grapes, barley, figs, olives, currants and raisins.

Plant four seed tiles at a time on open adjacent squares and try to complete a line of seed tiles across the board to gain a harvest. When there are few open squares, you can remove some of your opponent’s tiles. It looks simple but as the board fills up it gets more tricky. Maybe you want to let someone get a harvest as they will do the same for you. Informal co-operation when more than two play can get you ahead.

Who will be the first to gain six harvests?

AGROS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES

—description from the designer

name: The Game of “Yeah, But…” I Am
description:
Each player or team begins with three pawns of the same color on the Ya But (start) space. In turn, each player/team rolls two six-sided dice, leave start, and advance around the outer track in either direction. A player/team may roll a die and advance again when answering a question about religion correctly. There are two sets of question cards. One set for beginners; another set for advanced players. Each card contains six questions. The asker simply asks the next question on the card. The correct response is on the back of the card. There is no penalty for a wrong answer. However, if while taking one’s turn that player says, “Yeah, but” then the player’s pawn is sent back to the starting space.

Players must follow the instructions on any space on which one’s pawn rests. A player may not advance a second pawn until the first pawn has reached Home of Humility (finish). The third pawn may not be moved until the second pawn has reached the finish space. A pawn does not have to reach the finish space by exact count. Any unused movement points are given to the next pawn. The first player/team to get all three of one's pawns to the finish is the winner.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: The Vault
description:
You've been planning for years and have finally done it, you have made your way into the city vault where the precious Elestar Crystal is kept. However now you must race and battle opponents, slip past security guards, dodge bullets, avoid lasers, find the crystal and escape to safety with your prize, for in this safe, nobody is safe.

This is a print and play game with a 5-piece double-sided modular board, originally created for the 2017 Nine Card Nano-game Print and Play contest. The rules for setting up the game are quite loose allowing for many variations and levels of play. You can even make up your own special rules for the boards you make (for example you must touch all five cards of the board before leaving the vault). You can overlap boards, you can use less than 5 boards, you can use the sample boards in the rules, you can decide how many security guards to play with (if there are less players you could even use the unused player meeples as security guards for extra challenge), you can decide if you want to use the holographic crystal, etc. the point of it is, get creative. Once you have a board set up, you and the other players must race to grab the crystal while dodging around walls, avoiding lasers and security guards, and dueling each other to grab the crystal out of the hands of the opponent. Then you must get back to the vault door and punch in the code to escape into the night with your prize.

In addition to printing the files for this game you will also need:
-4 different colored meeples
-3 black meeples
-2 acrylic crystals
-3 green d6s
-3 red d6s
-1 black d6

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Deepwater
description:
Deepwater is a solo game set in the year 2047 - in which the player assumes the role of a tech billionaire taking over a loss-making, underwater, deep-sea research and farming facility, six months after an industrial accident at the base released a crystalline, genetically engineered mutagen named "Zenobia" into the sea.

During each game, the player will have to recruit marine biologists, deep-sea engineers, offshore operations staff, and security personnel. As the game progresses, the player will also have many opportunities to build onto their facility, and develop superior underwater tech and submersibles - to help achieve their character-specific goals. Will the player be a philanthropist, or a greedy business magnate, for example.

Many dangerous situations will arise throughout the game, which the player will have to make tough decisions to overcome - including underwater earthquakes, superstructure fails, flooding, intrusions by Eco-terrorists, and shark attacks. The multiple choice nature of these hazards will lead to the player having to sacrifice resources, cash, crew, and moral standing - with potentially devastating environmental impact.
Deepwater presents a tense, suspenseful, narrative-focused adventure with each and every game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Economic, Environmental, Farming, Fighting, Nautical, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Worker Placement
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Giant Spider Games

name: Small Sea Empires
description:
Explore the New World, settle unknown lands, establish trade routes, and deal in exotic resources to become the most prosperous colonial empire!

On their turns, players will be able to lay down their trade routes by placing a number of ships on the board. When a player's trade route reaches an island, they will explore that island resources and raise the demand of that resource on the Resource Market. Players can later settle the islands and trade the resources, thus gaining gold for the trade, but also lowering the demand of that resource, making it less valuable for the other players to trade.

Finally, the objective of the game is to have the most gold at the end of the game!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Grid Movement

name: Villanova
description:
Prototype made at PapJam 2018.

A friendly game of balcony gardening.

Players manage balconies during the Villanova Balcony competition, obtaining different colors of flowers from a market and using them to create patterns. Each judge card will have a different requirement that needs to be satisfied in order to obtain prestige. Will the players be able to satisfy most judges?

—description from the designer

name: Super Genius: Alphabet
description:
Players sound out the letters while matching them with illustrations. There is always one -- and only one -- match between any two cards.

Pick a cooperative rule or race to find the match.

name: Super Genius: Addition
description: This addition matching game focuses on building Addition skills, teaching beginners the early fundamentals of math, while building and enhancing skills for more advanced students. There is always a match between any two cards. Find the pair between an equation and its sum, two equations or two sums.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Super Genius: Multiplication 2
description:
Raise your multiplication powers to the next level, while practicing your time tables from 6 to 9. Combined with Multiplication 1, this game covers all the times tables for numbers 1-10.

There is always one -- and only one -- match between any two cards. Pick a cooperative rule or race to find the match.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Super Genius: Reading 2
description: This reading matching game focuses on the Dolch list of the most common sight words from children’s reading books, and helps prepare early readers for more complicated language skills to come. There is always a match between any two cards. Find the pair between a word and its image, two images or two words.

name: Super Genius: Reading 1
description: This reading matching game focuses on the Dolch list of the most common sight words from children’s reading books, and helps prepare early readers for more complicated language skills to come. There is always a match between any two cards. Find the pair between a word and its image, two images or two words.

name: Summer of Rock
description:
In Summer of Rock players take on the role of groupies following a band around the US on their summer tour. The goal is to get the greatest number of rock points as possible. This goal is achieved by seeing concerts. To do so a player must be in the correct city, on the turn the concert is happening with enough money to see the concert (or a ticket). Each player attending the concert gets d6 + the value of the city.
Players move around the board by either rolling a custom d6 or by paying to move a fixed amount. Players earn money by foregoing moving and instead rolling a custom d6. Event cards may be drawn as a result of a dice roll.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Black Spot
description:
Black Spot is a game of luck and deception in 3 wholly different modes

Treasure spot (5-10min)
Test your luck with your fellow shipmates to gain the largest amount of treasure as you take turns drawing from the treasure pile, but beware the Black Spots curse as its waiting to take your treasure away!

Liar's spot (10-30min)
Outwit your fellow shipmates as you strive to gain the most treasure. Draw treasure from the pile and declare your treasure. You aren't under any obligation to tell the truth about your haul, but your shipmates may call your bluff

Spot Roulette (Depends on number of players)
Someones going to get it, hope it isn't you. shipmates draw from the treasure pile until someone draws the black spot. Repeat this process until 1 shipmate remains

name: La que se avecina
description:
Boardgame based on the Spanish TV show "La que se avecina"

It's a secret role party game which simulates a neighbours community reunion. Every round players will solve crisis and events using cards and money.

The money is secret in a bag and every player has a amount of money as objective in the last round to win the game.

—user summary
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Trillionaire Expansion Pack 1: Neato Prime
description:
Get ready for more cute and cuddly cartoony billionaires from the Neato Prime Dimension to join the battle! These characters are illustrated with striking new artwork, add new strategy opportunities to your gameplay, and are of course riddled with that patented goodness only Dandy Randy can provide!

This expansion pack also comes with a new Control Card, increasing your options for unsettling your opponent's strategy and setting yourself up for victory instead.

An entirely new type of card is in this pack: Dimensional Lawyers! These Neato Prime Lawyer cards come with an ability Standard Lawyers could only dream of (if Standard Lawyers had dreams). This ability adds a completely new type of action you may take each turn, yielding more strategy opportunities and adding extra variety to gameplay.

A complete set of Neato Prime Cash Cards is included in this expansion so the look and feel of your deck are as customizable as your strategy!

Other useful facts about this expansion:

All cards are compatible with all other Trillionaire cards.
This pack is structured specifically so that buying once will give a player enough of each card to use it to the fullest. Buying more packs is only necessary for players looking to construct multiple decks simultaneously.
Expansions add gameplay mechanics and variety to gameplay. They do not (and never will) make the game easier to win.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Silhouette gratis Demo-Spiel
description:
Silhouette gratis Demo-Spiel is a free demo version of Silhouette Cards with a deck of 30 cards. It was released in the Stadt Land Spielt! Sonderdrucke 2018 for the gaming event in Germany and Austria on Sep. 8th and Sep. 9th 2018.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Trillionaire Expansion Pack 2: Earth+
description:
Get ready for more cool and sophisticated billionaires from the Earth+ Dimension to join the battle! These characters are illustrated with striking new artwork, add new strategy opportunities to your gameplay, and are of course riddled with that patented goodness only Dandy Randy can provide!

An entirely new type of card is included in this pack: Dimensional Lawyers! These Earth+ Lawyer cards come with an ability Standard Lawyers could only dream of (if Standard Lawyers had dreams). This ability adds a completely new type of action you may take each turn, yielding more strategy opportunities and adding extra variety to gameplay.

This expansion pack also comes with a new Control Card, increasing your options for unsettling your opponent's strategy and setting yourself up for victory instead.

A complete set of Earth+ Cash Cards is included in this expansion so the look and feel of your deck are as customizable as your strategy!

Other useful facts about this expansion:


All cards are compatible with all other Trillionaire cards.
This pack is structured specifically so that buying it once will give you enough of each card to use it to the fullest. Buying more packs is only necessary for players looking to construct multiple decks simultaneously.
Expansions add gameplay mechanics and variety to gameplay. They do not (and never will) make the game easier to win.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Trillionaire Expansion Pack 3: Millennials Succeed!
description:
Get ready for more dutifully successful billionaires from the Millennials Succeed! Dimension to join the battle! These characters are illustrated with striking new artwork, add new strategy opportunities to your gameplay, and are of course riddled with that patented goodness only Dandy Randy can provide!

An entirely new type of card is in this pack: Dimensional Lawyers! These Millennials Succeed! Lawyer cards come with an ability Standard Lawyers could only dream of (if Standard Lawyers had dreams). Expansions add gameplay mechanics and variety to gameplay. They do not (and never will) make the game easier to win.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Trillionaire Expansion Pack 4: Bermuda Wormhole
description:
Get ready for more mysterious and extraterrestrial billionaires from the Bermuda Wormhole Dimension to join the battle! These characters are illustrated with striking new artwork, add new strategy opportunities to your gameplay, and are of course riddled with that patented goodness only Dandy Randy can provide!

An entirely new type of card is in this pack: Dimensional Lawyers! These Bermuda Wormhole Lawyer cards come with an ability Standard Lawyers could only dream of (if Standard Lawyers had dreams). This ability adds a completely new type of action you may take each turn, yielding more strategy opportunities and adding extra variety to gameplay.

This expansion pack also comes with a new Control Card, increasing your options for unsettling your opponent's strategy and setting yourself up for victory instead.

A complete set of Bermuda Wormhole Cash Cards is included in this expansion so the look and feel of your deck are as customizable as your strategy!

Other useful facts about this expansion:


All cards are compatible with all other Trillionaire cards.
This pack is structured specifically so that buying it once will give a player enough of each card to use it to the fullest. Buying more packs is only necessary for players looking to construct multiple decks simultaneously.
Expansions add gameplay mechanics and variety to gameplay. They do not (and never will) make the game easier to win.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order

name: 맛있는 코딩
description:
Yammy Yammy Coding is software educational game. Players collect material tiles to make chef cards, collect chef cards, to make the food card related to the chef cards. The player who makes the food card first win the game.

Yammy Yammy Coding helps the player to understand the construction of condition. Players can improve the computational thinking skill by thinking about the conditions and what materials they need during the play.

—description from the publisher

name: Shoot Cows 3: Chickenpacolypse
description:
You've escaped the cows in Holstein City. You've battled the pigs of Little China. Now test your mettle in a deadly race against HOMICIDAL CHICKENS!

Bird Flu has infected the city's poultry. Now they're stronger and deadlier than ever before!

Luckily for you, new Vehicle cards let your Survivors team up to bring the hurt!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Zombies

name: Shoot Cows: Shoot More Cows
description:
Shoot More Cows is a convention exclusive boost pack for Shoot Cows. The pack includes:
1 New Survivor: John Green
4 New Creature Cards: Super Cow (2 copies), Undead Bessie, and Devonshire Devourer
7 New Item Cards: Canned Goods (3 copies), Branding Iron, Flame Thrower, Hunting Rifle, Crowbar
3 New Event Cards: Cow Tipping (2 copies), Stampede
1 New Location Card: Stadium
The pack also includes a Sole Survivor Mode card detailing a new challenge way to play Shoot Cows.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Zombies

name: Cursus Honorum
description:
Setting & Theme: The cursus honorum was the sequential order of public offices held by aspiring politicians in the Roman Republic and the early Roman Empire. This game simulates those career paths, with senatorial factions represented by each player, during the rise of the Republic. Starting around 241-237 BC when the provinces of Sicilia and Sardinia et Corsica had been conquered through war with the Carthaginians, each turn abstracts a generation of Roman politicians competing for offices and wielding state powers, with factions leveraging their wealth and influence to increase their reputation and legacy. Senators also serve in provincial posts, protecting and developing the expanding Republic while amassing their own fame and fortune. Throughout the game players must cooperate to ensure the public’s satisfaction with the government remains stable and the Republic remains prosperous and secure, all while competing to attain the highest status.

General Course of Play: Each turn begins with die rolls triggering events in the provinces. Then elections are held where factions compete to form the strongest voting coalitions and senators claim offices in Rome and the provinces. Players then alternate taking actions that include using office powers and influencing clients, often with adverse effect on their opponents. Each turn concludes with a sequential reckoning of state and faction accounts, setting the stage for the next generation of struggle and achievement.

Disclaimer: This is a updated prototype that has been play tested, but is still in development.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Kvíz casino
description:
Knowledge and tactics.
Place your bets!

Do you know the answer? Then you almost won the case.
If you're not sure of yourself, guess and make your tactic!
Listen carefully who is bluffing and who is doubling his bets.
The new "Quiz Casino" board game provides a real challenge and fun. Unmatched casino feeling with real poker chips and cards.
But here not all depends on fortune!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Big Time Football
description:
P&P FILES NOW POSTED!

It's third-and-five on your 30 yard-line and your opponent has the ball. He usually throws short in such situations, but he seems to like screen passes and hasn't thrown a long ball all game. He calls his play; now what will YOU do? Play a man-to-man defense, zone, blitz?

Play realistic pro football on your tabletop in about an hour. BT Football is based on current NFL stats in aggregate -- no teams, so it's just you against your opponent, on equal terms.

Nine offensive and six defensive plays are resolved on individual cards via five dice. The only charts are for special teams, interception returns, fumble returns and the like.

The game is intuitive, highly portable, easy to play and the results are realistic. A specially-designed scoresheet is used to record each play and simultaneously keep track of game time.

—description from the designer

name: Monkey, May I?
description:
Don't get caught monkeying around! This game is easy to play!


Flip over an action card
Make a good choice
Collect Monkey Money


This game was developed to help kids learn to make good choices.

Skill checklist:
Self-Awareness
Self-Control
Making Good Choices

—description from the designer
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Wise Ask
description:
Wise Ask - A Trivia Game Where It Pays To Be A Know-It-All.

If you get invited to one more run-of-the-mill trivia game night, your know-it-all mind is going to blow a neuron. Let that brilliant brain of yours really shine when you play Wise Ask.

Rather than answering one measly little question to earn a point like some trivia games, Wise Ask makes you answer five successive multiple-choice questions in your head and then shout a five-letter word made from the letters associated with each correct answer. Shout out the right word, get a smart card. Get it wrong, lose one. Be first to collect five cards that spell S-M-A-R-T and win!

—description from the publisher
categories: Educational, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: The Red Devils At Arnhem
description:
Red Devils At Arnhem is a two player board-wargame recreating Operation Market-Garden. The plan as to capture a series of bridges with paratroopers and with Allied combined air and ground units break through the German lines during WWII and end the war by Christmas in 1944. Unexpected by the Allies was the presence of German SS forces at Arnhem. This spectacular plan is now in your hands and the possible the fate of the war.

—description from the publisher

name: Gem Hustle
description:
Fast and fun dice bluffing game

It's tough out here in the old west but your gang of outlaws recently “discovered” a stash of gemstones. Must be your lucky day. Now all you've got to do is divide it up. Of course you want the bigger half, but the desert is too unforgiving to risk a gun fight. So you play a game of chance. That doesn’t mean you’ll play fair though...

Gem Hustle is dice game for 2 to 5 players. Roll the highest each round to claim gems, but you can only roll each dice once. With only a few high value dice, do you chance it on your own or team up with others but share the spoils?

Rounds are played until players have used all their dice or until there are no more gems left to be won. In a round players will;


Stash - players take it in turns to add gems to the grey bag.
Pick - players choose which dice they are going to roll.
Hustle - players can chose to team up with other players and share the stash.
Roll - players roll their dice. The players with the highest total claim the stash.


—description from the designer

name: Peter Lugenschüppel
description:
The players start with one pawn on space 1. Movement is determined with one die. The first player to reach space 90 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Some events cause the player to start with a secondary pawn to rescue the primary one, which has to stay on it's space till the secondary pawn arrives. If this is achieved the primary pawn moves again and the secondary one waits on this space till it may be needed again. To win the game only the primary pawn needs to reach space 90.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Folytassa őrmester úr!
description:
"Keep On Mr. Sergeant"

Service message:
Dear adults and kids,

This is an exciting game resulting many cheerful moments and much more mind-breaking minutes. First of all you will need some ingenuity and combination skills to be able to win.

The venue of the game is an imagined army base where several comic situations may occur. They are governed by 203 coloured cards decorated with artistic graphics. One of he aims of the game is to acquire the Secret Plan and forward it to the sergeant by the most creative way. Meanwhile we should be careful not to be seized to prison (however the prison works with half board service) or not to blurt any secrets in the pub in delirious state. We should decide tactically during our turn of duty whether we take risk or just take part in the barrack contest of „who knows better the canteen-keeper's woman.

But the surprise of the game is still left: the evolvement of ’ant’, ’chameleon’, and ’hyena’… Those have the best chance to win who can conform to the constantly changing situation rather than choosing a permanent strategy. Any lags can be caught up with clever decisions. This is a real brain training. You can have several hours amusement by learning the duty service regulations.
Wish you many clever decisions, good luck and lots of fun,
the happy Sergeant

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Affinity: Goodies 7/7 Special Plato
description:
Three additional Emotion cards.

Simply shuffle these new cards to their respective decks.
Usual rules apply.

Promo found in Plato magazine 109.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: テバトリ (TEBA TORI)
description:
User summary
テバトリ (TEBA TORI) is a Japanese memo game. Teba means 'wing' and Tori is 'chicken', so Teba Tori is fried chicken wings.

Deep fried chicken wing tip, called TEBASAKI in Japan, is one of Nagoya's spacialties. In the game of TEBA TORI, you score points by completing a set of TEBASAKI, Beer, and Towel (to wipe grease out of your fingers).

During your turn, you flip three tiles. If you have flipped TEBASAKI, Beer, and Towel, you score points depending on the number of TEBASAKI on the tile. If you have flipped Bone, however, you must return a set you have collected to the playfield.

It is recommended to read the tile name each time a tile is flipped so that the game gets heated.

You win the game if you have collected the most TEBASAKI among players.

Publisher's summary
名古屋で人気の手羽先唐揚げをビールとおしぼりとセットにしてたくさん食べた人の勝ち。
裏向きでランダムに並べた24枚の六角形タイルを、手番が来たら3枚めくり「手羽先」（chicken)「ビール」(beer)「おしぼり」(towel)の組み合わせを作れたらもらえます。めくったタイルをみんなで声に出していくと盛り上がるよ。
もしも「ほね」（born)をめくったら、自分が得たセットを1セット場に返さなくてはならず、全体を混ぜてゲーム再開！
publishers: Banjo Yugi Seisakujo BGM (盤上遊戯製作所 BGM)

name: Dinosaurs Get Stress, Too!
description:
This is a therapeutic educational game designed to help children cope with stressful situations.

Players roll dice and consult a Symptoms Chart with a whimsical cartoon illustration of a stressed-out dinosaur. The active player chooses a Control Card or a Relaxation Card in response. If the text on the card increases that player's anxiety he or she must take a Stress Rock chip. A player stuck with a Victim Card gets hit on the head with a foam rock. The player then describes how he or she will deal with this stressful event.

EXAMPLE: The child is stressed "when his Dad hogs the TV."

The object of the game is to get rid of all Stress Rocks in a player's possession.

Designed for kids age six and older to play with a parent, teacher, or therapist.

Includes charts, cards, dice, chips, rules, and a large chunk of foam granite.

—user summary

name: Mass Extinction
description:
User summary
大量絶滅 (Tairyou Zetsumetsu) is a Japanese game of Mass Extinction.

Trilobites have been prosperous for approximately 300 million years from the early Cambrian to the end of Permian, but the time is coming that they are about to die out. They have survived many times of extinction events and following changes of ecosystem by evolving into various forms. Though having survived through Cambrian, Ordovician, Devonian periods, they are eradicated in the End-Permian extinction.

Mass Extinction is a game with a theme of survival and evolution of trilobites. They will be rewarded each time they survive a catastrophic event. Even death of an individual might trigger an evolution for the species.

With the doomed future ahead, which species will enjoy the most prosperous ending?

カンブリア紀初期からペルム紀末までの約3億年にわたって繁栄を続けてきた三葉虫にも絶滅の時が迫ってきました。
今まで、何度も大量絶滅が発生し、その度に生態系は一変しました。
三葉虫も様々な進化を遂げることによって生き延びてきたのです。
カンブリア紀後期、オルドビヌス紀末、デボン紀・・・そして、ペルム紀末の史上最大の大量絶滅の際に、三葉虫も種自体が絶滅してしまうのです。

このゲームは、そんな三葉虫たちの生存競争および進化をテーマとしています。
ときおり訪れる天変地異に耐え抜いた三葉虫たちは大いなる褒美が与えられることでしょう。
また、1個体が死ぬことによって、その種族としては進化の足がかりを掴むかもしれません。
絶滅を目前に控え、束の間の繁栄を極めるのは、どの三葉虫でしょうか。

name: mini-go
description:
mini-go is a checkers variant where both players try to enclose the opponent's tokens in order to remove them from the board.
The player which only has three tokens left looses the game.

This is part of a travel game edition from Spear.

name: bastion
description:
bastion is a checkers variant. The player with the white tokens tries to reach all red places or to enclose the black tokens of the other player. The player with the black tokens tries to remove at least 16 white tokens from the board by jumping over them.
The winner is the player who reaches his goal first.

This game is part of a travel game edition from Spear.

name: wirrwarr
description: wirrwarr is a one person logic game. The player tries to arrange all the tokens in a specific order by moving to adjacent files in a minimum number of turns

name: Urbi et Orbi Game 2000
description: Players are travelling to Rome. On their way, they answer several questions about ancient Rome.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Lach mal wieder
description: Funny question and answer game. Each player has his own cards and reads a question to the next player who answers with the answer on his card.

name: Arschkeks: Wirst du es packen oder verkacken?
description:
Party Game.
85 challenge and special cards, 1 die, 1 Arschkeks (Ass Cookie).
The player who has the "Arschkeks" is the active player. He draws a card and tries to do the challenge. If he is successful he gets the points which are written on the card. After his challenge he selects the next player.
If the player does not succeed he gets a punishment.
Examples for challenges:

Call your the other players "Arschkeks" for 5 minutes.
Hold your chair with your outstretched arm for 30 seconds.


Example for Punishments:

Jump 1 minute on the place and say with each jump idiot
10 knee bends


Special cards: suspend (stay in pushup positon till the next player has done his challenge), take 2 cards (draw 2 and do both), creativ card (make your own challenge for 1-3 players), joker (you may ignore 1 punishment, if you don't want to do a challenge)

name: 勇者アーキテクト (Brave Architect)
description:
User summary
勇者アーキテクト (Brave Architect) (Yuusha Architect) is a Japanese co-operative card game. Technically, the English version of the title is closer to 'Architect of the Brave', as you construct your heroes. This game was followed by two other editions that can be mixed, but not with this base game.

勇者アーキテクト (Brave Architect), like a TRPG, is a co-operative card game to create characters for each player and fight the dragon.

Create your characters by selecting from 7 types of tribes, 8 types of weapons, 2 types of combat styles for each weapon, 10 types of sub weapons, and 18 types of skills. Shuffle the cards of the selected category into decks for each player. The players then use their decks to battle on the map.

The enemy's dragon is also automatically formed for each game and attacks the players' characters with multiple attributes. Survive the enemy attacks, destroy the parts, raise your characters' levels and fight the dragon.

Publisher summary
TRPGのように、プレイヤーごとにキャラクターを作ってドラゴンを討伐する協力型カードゲームです。
キャラクター（種族）７種類、武器８種類と武器ごとに戦闘スタイル２種類、 サブウェポン１０種類、スキル１８種類から好きな組み合わせを選んでキャラメイクします。
選んだカテゴリーのカードを混ぜてプレイヤーごとのデッキとします。
プレイヤーはこのデッキを使ってマップ上で戦闘を繰り広げます。
敵のドラゴンも遊ぶたびに変わる自動キャラメイクで、複数の属性を持ちキャラクターに襲いかかってきます。敵の猛攻を潜り抜け、パーツを破壊し、レベルを上げてドラゴンを討伐しましょう。
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Five in a Row
description:
This game is played with a large spinning circle (dial) that is divided into four colors (red, yellow, blue, green). Each section has holes for 5 colored pegs as the same color as the quarter section. Each player decides which color they want to play and then takes the 5 pegs of their color. Each player, in turn, spins the dial. There is an arrow in the corner of the box. Whichever color the arrow is pointing at when the dial stops, the player of that color gets to put one of their pegs in one of the holes of that color, regardless of which player spun the dial.
Winner is the first person who has succeeded in getting all 5 of their pegs into their colored area.

name: ポプボブ (POP & BOB)
description:
User summary
ポプボブ (Popubobu) (POP & BOB) is a very fast party game themed on the manga/anime Pop Team Epic. (You can play it without knowing the show.) The game takes under a minute to pay.

There are mainly 2 types of cards to play, one with ポプテピピック ("Pop Team Epic") printed on it and the other with ボブネミミッミ ("Bob Epic Team") on it. First,randomly deal one of these cards to each player. During the game, each player can only speak the words on the cards dealt to them.

Next, deal another card to each player. Each player must show this card to other players but not see it themselves (like in the game of Indian Poker). Players must tell the others if other players' cards are ポプテピピック ("Pop Team Epic") or ボブネミミッミ ("Bob Epic Team"), and they will win if they all manage to guess their cards correctly.

However, this is quite a confusing challenge, because each player can only utter the word on the card dealt to them. The rules of this game can be explained in 1 to 2 minutes and it can be played in 30 seconds or so, with up to 9 players.

Publisher's summary
「ポプテピピック」の二次創作パーティーゲームです。（作品を知らなくても遊べます）
主に「ポプテピピック」と書かれたカードと「ボブネミミッミ」と書かれたカードの２種類を使って遊びます。まずランダムにこれらのカードを書くプレイヤーに配ります。このゲーム中そのプレイヤーは配られたカードの単語しか話せません。
次にもう１枚ずつカードを配り、同時にカードを他のプレイヤーに向けて公開します。（インディアンポーカーです）。
プレイヤーは、他のプレイヤーのカードが「ポプテピピック」と「ボブネミミッミ」のどちらかを教えて全員が正解すればプレイヤーの勝利となります。
ただし最初に配られたカードの単語しか話せないので大変なことになります。
ゲーム説明に１～２分、ゲームプレイ時間は30秒、最大で９人まで遊べます。
categories: Card Game, Fan Expansion, Party Game, Real-time

name: Road Closed
description:
Build Roads - Connect Cities - Sabotage Friends

Better be quick and smart - the newly minted transportation commissioner has approached your company to devise a road network to connect all the cities; however the commissioner has also contacted your biggest rivals too. Who is going to win the contract? It’s anyone’s game and you’ll stop at nothing to get the job done – even if it takes sabotage. But your rivals feel the same…

Draw your tiles and place them efficiently to connect all your cities while avoiding sabotage from your opponent's road closures. Be the first to successfully connect all your cities to at least two other cities and you will win the contract (and the game).

—description from the designer

name: Million Mile Flyer
description:
Criss-cross the USA in a race to obtain a million miles!

Fasten your seatbelt and prepare for takeoff, as you are about to embark on a sprint to a million miles! The skies ahead are turbulent and unpredictable. Bad weather, traffic delays and disgruntled passengers will all conspire against you as you and your fellow competitors criss-cross the country in a race to determine who will be crowned the Million Mile Flyer.

Along the way you will have the opportunity to impede your opponents progress, but keep in mind what ever misfortune you visit on others will likely be returned. But that's all part of the fun. The game is unpredictable and your circumstances can literally change in the blink of an eye.

Frequent travelers will find themselves reliving their own air travel nightmares in a humorous setting while kids will love the nonstop, action packed race to the finish line.

—descriptoion from the designer
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Mine Carts
description:
Mine Carts is a game in which the players together explore an abandoned mine, looking for precious ores!

The abandoned mine is represented by a six by six grid on a board. The players start with two player figures each at the edges and take turns placing square tiles with tracks leading into the mine. They follow the tracks and may stumble upon ore deposits when doing so. Mining an ore deposit yields an ore token that may be more or less valuable.

Throughout the game, players will find themselves colliding with other players. Players that collide will loose their player figures and will, when no player figures remain, be eliminated from the game. However, eliminated players haven't automatically lost the game. They may still win, granted that they managed to collect the most precious ores before being eliminated!

Clever players may find ways to mine the ore deposits while also eliminating other players!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Interference!
description:
Interference! is a game in which two players attempt to save the world from utter destruction.

You are the operators of a missile control mainframe and due to a slight human error, the total annihilation of the world is looming! The systems have locked you out and you can only rely on your hacking skills to regain control.

The mainframe's lock is represented by four double-sided cards that are shared between the two players. Both players hold a hand of secret action cards as well as a card showing a secret target sequence.

Using their action cards, the players struggle to change the lock sequence into their target sequence. This will break a layer of the mainframe's security system and help the players regain control.

Will the two players prevail and save the world or should we all seek immediate shelter? The fate of the world is in your hands!

—description from the designer

name: Prima Materia
description:
The elements have become misaligned and are causing all sorts of trouble in the world. Severe drought, hurricane after hurricane and yet another super hero movie that no one asked for are just some of the plagues the world has had to live through. In Prima Materia, the players struggle to align the elements in an effort to make all things good again.

The elements are represented by sixteen double-sided cards showing one of the four classical elements on each side. These cards are arranged in a grid of four by four cards. Each player holds a secret hand of action cards as well as a card with a secret target sequence. The players use their action cards to change the elemental cards and gain points for each sequence they manage to form.

Will the elements realign and introduce stability in the world? Or will we face a future of starvation, war and reggaeton music?

—description from the designer

name: Home Delivery
description:
Why go to the same boring job every day in order to receive a steady and predictable income when you can start working in the gig economy? The gig economy allows you to get all of the drawbacks and none of the benefits while struggling to make ends meet.

In Home Delivery, the players take on work as traveling popsicle sellers. The players take turns placing rectangular city tiles forming the road network of the city. In some parts of the city, there lives popsicle-craving residents with very specific tastes. They will gladly purchase a popsicle but it will have to be of the correct flavor.

Each player can take on tasks from the local ice cream parlors, delivering a set of popsicles to the residents. For every task that a player completes, they are awarded with a small paycheck. The players may save their paychecks to pay for things like rent and food or may use their pay to gain a competitive advantage over their fellow popsicle sellers.

Have you ever dreamt of owning your very own ice cream truck? Well forget about that. You're part of generation rent and this is the gig economy so all you can afford is to rent one and hope that your investment pays off!

So what are you waiting for? Quit your day job and become part of the new economy. It's gonna be huge.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Homebrew: The Potion Brewing Game
description:
In Homebrew: The Potion Brewing Game, the players venture down into the haunted basement of their house. The players are attempting to brew magic potions and need to find the correct ingredients, but someone has left the basement in a terrible mess!

In every room of the basement, one of six different magic ingredients is to be found. The players each hold secret recipe cards and take turns exploring the basement by placing new rooms next to the existing ones.

When a player manages to find the ingredients required to brew their special magic potion, they gain a point. The player having brewed the most potions when the basement is fully explored becomes the potion master and wins the game!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Fantasy, Medieval, Puzzle

name: ひどらのしょうもうせん (Hydra's War of Attrition)
description:
ひどらのしょうもうせん (Hitora no Shousen) Hydra's War of Attrition is a Japanese 2 player abstract game with a horror theme.

Translated from the rules
"There are small hydras which inhabit a dangerous land full of evil spirits. They sluggishly move back and forth, sometimes running across one another. When that happens, they battle to the death."

User description
Each player places a trio of hydra tokens (Majoritei, Arakure, and Fushigi) on marked spaces along the edge of the board. A turn then consists of the following steps: Multiplying the Majoritei, moving a hydra, and possibly removing opposing hydra pieces.

Players start by taking a Majoritei hydra from their supply and placing it next to another one already on the board. They then choose one of their hydra to move. Finally, if they've surrounded an opponent's hydra and at least one of their surrounding hyrda is on a nest of evil spirits, they capture their opponent's piece and return their piece from the nest to their supply.

These steps are repeated until one player can either form a line using six of their hydra, or until all of a player's hydra are captured.

name: DisgRace To The White House
description:
DisgRace To The White House is a fast-paced, strategic, and satirical board game for energized progressives everywhere. In between protesting, marching, and crying into your pillow--why not laugh too? DisgRace To The White House provides catharsis and the roadmap to resistance during these trying, rights-depleted, tiny-hands times. Players brush up on America's horribly archaic Electoral College system as well as DJT's certifiably insane Tweets, as they navigate the election in a race to the White House.

While battling for electoral votes, players impersonate Trump's "unique" form of verbal diarrhea, quote mind-bending Tweets, and pick up "Disaster" Cards, all in the name of winning the oval office through alternative facts. Interactive, team-building and generally outrageous, players shriek, squeal, and laugh--all at the same time. Gameplay constantly shifts until a winner is crowned (poor choice of words). You're never assured of victory until the bitter end (sorry "Haters and Losers!"). A perfect gift--play it around the trashcan fire when the Trumpocalypse finally comes!

—description from the designers

name: The Hunt for Lirog
description:
In this little card game you are trying to capture magical creature named Lirog. This old and powerfull but not too smart being, has something priceless in his posession. As one of the wizards you are trying to lure him into the trap using spells and forest fruits. In the deck there are 12 kind of cards with distiguish powers. Every player is trying to program the game area, so that after activation, Lirog will enter their trap.

There are only 52 cards in the deck. At the start of the game players recive 3 random cards each. In a specified order they can put one card on the game board and take 1 card from the market or take 2 cards from the market. After all players finished their turns, creature will make his moves. Depending on cards that affect him, he will move around the game board. If during move phase Lirog enters one of the traps, the game ends. Owner of that trap becomes the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: TV Triviapalooza
description:
Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that'll have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains!

Put on your smarty pants and have a ball! Play for hours & collect 'em all!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun. Seriously.

—description from the box
categories: Dice, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 80s Triviapalooza
description:
Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that'll have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains!

Put on your smarty pants and have a ball! Play for hours & collect 'em all!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun. Seriously.

—description from the box
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pop Music Triviapalooza
description:
Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that'll have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains! Juicy little tidbits of useless knowledge!

Put on your smarty pants and have a ball! Play for hours and collect 'em all!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun. Seriously.

—description from the box
categories: Dice, Educational, Music, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Christmas Questions Triviapalooza
description:
Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that'll have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains!

Put on your smarty pants and have a ball! Play for hours & collect 'em all! Juicy little tidbits of useless knowledge!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun. Seriously.

—description from the box
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Movies Triviapalooza
description:
Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that's have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains! Juicy little tidbits of useless knowledge.

Put on your smarty pans and have a ball! Play for hours & collect 'em all!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun. Seriously.

—description from the box
categories: Dice, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Calico Critters Surprise Party Game
description:
Help the Critters find all the hidden objects to decorate the house before the guest of honor arrives. The 3-dimensional game board features 4 Calico Critter rooms.

As you travel the game board with your Critter, you'll look for the 5 things which belong in your room. You'll need a good memory and a bit of luck to succeed. If you get your room totally decorated first, before your opponents' AND before the birthday girl arrives--Surprise! You win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Batman Miniature Game: Batman 80th Anniversary
description:
Dark Knight. Caped Crusader. World’s Greatest Detective. Whatever you know him as, wherever you know him from—the blockbuster movies, TV shows, video games, cartoons, or millions of comics—Batman is proof you don’t need superpowers to be a superhero… and the poster boy for what a bad childhood can do to you.

Millionaire Bruce Wayne was just a kid when he watched his parents get gunned down during a mugging in Gotham City. The crime would define his life, as he dedicated himself to becoming the world’s greatest weapon against crime—the Batman.

Forget his Batarangs, Batmobile, or Utility Belt filled with high-tech weapons. Batman is the most feared superhero of all because he’s pushed himself to the absolute pinnacle of human achievement. He’s a brilliant detective who’s mastered fighting techniques the world’s barely heard of. An Olympic-caliber athlete with a plan for every occasion, Batman’s seemingly always five steps ahead of his foes. But in his crusade against injustice, two questions always loom: How far will he go to protect the innocent, and will he sacrifice his humanity along the way?

2019 will be the 80th birthday for the caped crusader since his first appearance in Detective Comics #27 from 1939. So what better way to celebrate than with a new version of Batman. The 80th Anniversary miniature sees the Dark Knight leaping into action, surrounded by a cloud of bats, to instil fear into the hearts of his foes.

Happy birthday, Bruce. Here’s to another Bat-Tastic 80 years!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Cow's Look
description:
Το Βλέμμα Της Αγελάδας ("Cow's Look") is a game for 2 or more players played with a standard set of playing cards and three special dice. Each player rolls the dice and selects his actions aiming to be the first one to get rid of all his cards.

Each round ends as soon as one player discards his last card and then all other players score their hands. When someone reaches 150 points the game is over and the player with the least amount of points wins.

name: Courage
description:
Courage is a 2-4 player battle royal style conquering game. You are a want-to-be hero and have awoken on the island of courage, a place to prove yourself but seems like your not the only one. You and you're friends build the island and use its various unique movement mechanics to approach and attack each others castles, use the moving terrain and items to get there quickly and effectively.
once you take an opponents castle they work for you, meaning this game starts as a competitive game but ends co-operative.
Last castle standing, wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Savage Planet: Savage Seas
description:
Savage Seas is a team-based skirmish game where two teams program their Orders and sail their ships into battle against each other. Each player on a team leads one (or more) specific crew(s) on their ships. The crews are the same on both ships, but each crew has a different job: one controls their ship’s movement, one leads the firing of her cannons, one specializes in close combat and melee, and one gives special Orders. Working together as a team to program your ship’s Orders is key because the last ship standing is the winner!

Savage Seas takes place in the dark fantasy world of Savage Planet, it was last seen in Savage Planet: Fate of Fantos.

—description from the publisher
categories: Fantasy, Miniatures, Nautical, Party Game, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Daring Heroes: The Golden Age
description:
Daring Heroes: The Golden Age is an exciting adventure card game that puts each player in the role of a fantastic superhero of yesteryear.

The players team up to foil the villains’ crimes and must be vigilant against their dastardly Doomsday Devices! Heroes rally together against villains to score events.

The players need to score 50 points worth of events before the villains do to foil the villains’ despicable deeds.

Daring Heroes: The Golden Age comes with one die, nine Hero cards, and three decks: the Action Deck, the Event Deck, and the Villain Deck.

The Action Deck contains Feats, Sidekicks, and Devices that empower the Heroes. The Event Deck contains standard Events worth 1 to 5 points and the dreaded Doomsday Device special Events. The Villain Deck contains Villains and the Devices and Henchmen that will help them take over the city.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Candy Cane Wars
description:
We've signed a contract with Santa Claus to sell children candy. Unfortunately, everyone else did, too. Can you strategically build the city, move your dealers, and place your candy canes to earn street cred and become the most powerful dealer in town?

Candy Cane Wars is a simple but surprisingly deep "give this, take that" style game that requires you to constantly be planning five moves ahead of your opponents.

Players can choose one of three actions on their turn: placing a card, moving their dealer, or placing a candy cane. Each action comes with pros and cons, and could significantly hurt or help your opponents. Where you place your candy canes affects your street cred, and special "action" cards can quickly change the game for any one playing. The game ends after a player has placed three candy canes and everyone finishes their last turn. Whoever has the most street cred win!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Pattern Building, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Philadelphia 1895
description: Philadelphia 1895 is a solitaire game.

name: Malifaux: Ice Dancers
description: Rasputina has made many changes since taking over the Cult of December. The power of the old priesthood was crushed, and many of her followers enjoy a greater degree of freedom. While they still hold to the old practices and sacrifices, some have begun flourishing in other ways. Foremost among these individuals are the Ice Dancers; they use the elemental force of ice and storm granted them by December to create icy paths beneath their feet, gliding along effortlessly.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Blessed Of December
description:
There are many arcane and fell rituals in the Cult of December, some which even His followers fear. None is more terrible than bestowing the title of "Blessed" on a member of the cult. The ritual is performed once a generation, and is the deciding proof of December's choice of the leader of His cult. During this, the chosen sacrifice is stripped of all humanity, transformed into a living expression of December's power ... and His all-encompassing hunger.

At the beginning of her stewardship, Rasputina performed the ritual as December directed, choosing a young woman from the Silent Ones. It did not take long for the Ice Witch to regret going along with the ceremony, as she watch the woman become a prisoner in her own body. The Blessed retained more of her sanity than any in memory, and it became clear this was nothing more than a constant torment. This poor creature became one of the driving reasons for Rasputina's defiance of December, as she is forced to watch the poor wretch become more feral with each passing day.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Colombi
description:
Transparent, colored tiles in the three primary colors red, blue and yellow result in the corresponding mixed colors by overlaying. A board, a bag and a color dice complete the materials.
The child naturally discovers basic concepts of color theory, the larger ones make exciting games out of them and the adults have to be very careful when they want to win their tricky game.
Include rules for 5 different games.

This is mine!: 2-6 children throw with a color dice and have to put the tile on the board. Mixed colors are formed by stacking. Is the color the right color, the player get a point.

Tile away! 2-6 children first draw a tile, then the dice is thrown. If the tile can not be laid, it will be in your own stock. Next time you can use the new tile or a tile from your own stock.

Who takes, wins! 2-6 children put all the tiles in the board. The game starts with 1 red,1 yellow, 1 blue, 2 green, 2 purple and 2 orange fields. Throw the dice and take the tile(s), if it is on the board or put the tile(s) on the board, if it is missed. The game ends, if all tiles are from the board.

Criss-cross! 2-4 players draw tiles out the bag (2 tiles with 2 players, 3 tiles with 3 players etc.). All other tiles are seed on the board. Every turn you plays one tile and remove one tile or vice versa. You win the game, if you have one row with the same mixed color.

Blue against red! 2 players use only 6 red and 6 blue tiles. It starts on the first and last row of the board. You win the game, if you complete the purple row in the middle. You can only draw your own color, but with purple you always take the top part. It does not matter if this part is red or blue.

—user summary

name: Coffin Quiz
description:
Put your knowledge of ghosts, witches, and all things spooky to the test with this hair-raising trivia game. Each card comes with a quiz question and a frightful forfeit - answer the question correctly and you can nominate another player to complete the forfeit. Get the question wrong, and you'll be the one stuck with it! Just the thing to see who has the braaains of the bunch!

—description from the publisher

name: Round & Crowned
description:
Everyone has four princes, they want to conquer the crowns. The crowns are located in the center of the playing field. The playing field is a turntable that constantly changes position. The players roll alternately with two dice and move on the one hand the disc by correspondingly many positions further and on the other hand one of their figures. The disc can only be entered and left at certain points, and the center must be reached exactly. If a prince has reached the middle, he gets the crown and becomes king. He can now go home. Those who have their four kings back in the palace first have won this exciting dice game.

If the princes meet opposing princes in the game, they are beaten and have to start again in the castle, kings are beaten, so they start in the coronation hall.

—user summary

name: Champions of the Internet: Life Life to the Max Expansion Pack
description:
THE MAGIC OF MAX
Max’s cards are full of magical powers. If you
put down a Max Card and the judge chooses it as the winner, you get to make up a rule for another player that they must follow for the remainder of the game!

WHAT’S IN THE BOX?
30 People Cards (all of Max, the random dude)
20 Question Cards

Add to the main deck


—description from the publisher

name: Winnie the Pooh: Umbrella Race
description:
Each player sends an umbrella down the stream.
Who will manage to get his umbrella through the finish line first?

Playing Materials: 1 board, 5 umbrella cards, 5 card holders, 5 colored chips, 3 colored dice, 1 instruction

Winnie the Pooh: Umbrella Race is a racing board game.
The main goal in Winnie the Pooh: Umbrella Race is for a player’s umbrella to finish first.
Before the game starts, each of the 5 different color umbrellas(red, blue, green, yellow and purple) must be placed on a starting position(the order is randomly selected). Each umbrella is represented by a color chip(each color chip matched an umbrella). The chips are all turned face down, so their color are hidden and then shuffled. Each player takes a chip and looks at the hidden color it represents. All players must keep their chips face down in order to keep their umbrella hidden. The game then starts with the younger player’s turn. The player takes the three colored dice and rolls them. Then he or she must move each umbrella according to the colors that came up in the dice. The umbrellas can be moved only forward and they can’t pass over another umbrella or finish on another’s umbrella’s position. After the first player moves the selected umbrellas, then he passes the dice to the second younger player. The next players turn starts. The game ends when all the umbrellas enter one of the last blocks. Then the chips are turned up and their colors are revealed. The player whose chip represent the umbrella which finished first is the winner.

The game has taken great inspiration from Ravensburger Snail's Pace Race.

name: Hi-Ways
description:
The new Connection game. Players sit side by side with the board in front of them. Players choos colors and roll dice to decide who starts. Each Player, alternately, rolls the dice and places a Base-Piece on any one of the Sites defined (bracketed) by the 2 numbers that appear on the dice, either above and below, or on both sides of the Site. If all the player's stock of Base-Pieces is already placed on the Board it is possible to Reposition a Base-Piece to the new Site - according to the throw of the dice. Bases under Bridging-Sections can't be removed. A Player unable to place a Base, because all the Sites of the numbers rolled are captures, loses that turn. A "Double" number on the dice earns the Player another turn. A Player may pass his or her turn if numbers are not suitable.

—user summary

name: Tor
description:
The realistic football game for strategists and tacticians. The purpose of the game is to score as many goals as possible through clever play. The players are placed on the corresponding red squares according to the usual football system (4-2-4 or similar). Each team in their half. Each player receives a dice. First is rolled around the ball. Who dices the higher number, receives the ball and thus the impetus. The ball is placed on the base plate of a figure on the center circle. Then both players roll their own die. First, the ball-leading team always pulls, then the opponent. The rolled eyes determine the number of steps of the footballers. The player can draw one or more figures in all directions over free points on the black lines. The defending player can take the ball from the opponent. All football rules such as offside, penalty area, ball, corner or penalty are explained in the rules.

—user summary

name: Wort Roulette
description:
A letter game with luck (roulette) and creativity, quick thinking and imagination. One of the players turns the roulette wheel and throws in all 6 bullets. The letters, groups of letters and free fields marked by the 6 balls when the wheel is stationary are called by the game master. All players now occupy the corresponding fields on their board with their chips. Freifelder allow the choice and use of any letter. Now we turn the hourglass and each player now tries as quickly as possible to form a common noun before the clock expires. The more letters or groups in a word, the higher the scoring. The winner is the one who has scored the most points after an agreed playing time or after a certain number of laps.

—user summary

name: Raetia
description:
Germania 250 CE

When the Roman province of Raetia was invaded by Alemanni tribes, refugees fled through forests and mountains to the safety of the city of Brigantium?

Fast moving race and dice game.

A die roll determines the movement of your refugees over land tiles. Your supplies should be used carefully to change your luck. Will you have the bribe needed to get past the guards at the city gates?

RAETIA IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES.

—description from the designer

name: Land of the Two Rivers: Iraq War
description:
Land of the Two Rivers is a game of the Iraq War in the post-invasion period starting roughly in Summer 2003. By this point Saddam's government had disintegrated and fateful decisions had already been made regarding official U.S. policy towards powerful factions within Iraq. The players are faced with the situation as it existed at that time, as the Sunni insurgency was building momentum, the Shia were taking advantage of the chaos to flex their long-suppressed muscle, and everyone was realizing there were insufficient U.S. forces to police the entire country. Regional and global entities like Syria, Turkey, Iran and Al Qaeda were attempting to shift events in their favor. The game does not provide the ability to alter what had already been done up to that point, but each player has options on how to conduct operations going forward.

The game is designed for three players, representing:

1. United States, British, Other Coalition, and Iraqi National Forces (INF)
2. Sunnis (Iraqi Sunnis and their sponsors in the larger Sunni world)
3. Shiites (Iraqi Shia and their sponsors in Iran)

The U.S./Coalition objective is to stand up the Iraqi army in sufficient strength and effectiveness to control the majority of the country, with a small number of supporting U.S./Coalition troops.

The Sunni and Shiite objectives are to gain control over enough of the population to give them a decisive advantage in the eventual political and economic solution that must one day be achieved.

Players are free to cooperate and make (or break) any agreements they wish. However, there can only be one winner, so ultimately one player must outmaneuver the other two.

The game has rules for U.S. Morale and Commitment similar to Nick Karp's classic "Vietnam: 1965-1975", training of Iraqi National Forces (INF), Ground Attacks, IED Cells, Ambushes, Air Strikes, Al Qaeda unpredictability, Suicide Attacks, Coalition country withdrawals, Civilian Casualties, and more. There are sub-systems for the hunt for High Value Targets (HVTs), Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMDs), and Infiltration of support from regional players.

-description from designer

name: The European War
description:
This a rare and unusual Japanese game about the European theatre published during WWI.

It is a roll-and-move game of maneuver for 2-6 players, pitting Germany, Austria-Hungary and Italy against France, Britain and Russia.

The former start in the upper left of the board, and the latter in the lower right. Various tracks connect the two, and the objective is to capture the opponent's headquarters. Each of the countries starts with two playing pieces, whose initial placement space is determined by a die roll.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Chūshingura
description:
This Edo-era (early 1800s) game is perhaps the earliest to focus on the famous story of the 47 Ronin or Chūshingura (The Treasury of Loyal Retainers).

It is a Mawari-Sugoroku style of game, with die rolls determing movement around the board. Each panel illustrates an episode in the story of the group of samurai who were declared ronin after their master Asano Takumi-no-kami Naganori, the daimyō of Akō, was forced to commit seppuku by the Shogun in 1702.

They eventually got revenge by killing their former master's treacherous opponent Kira Kōzuke-no-suke Yoshinaka, and then turned themselves in to the authorities knowing that they in turn would be forced into seppuku, which they did as a group.

name: Magnetic Pac-Man
description: Μαγνητικό Πάκμαν (Magnetic Pacman) is a fun 2 player roll and move game themed after a great 80's hit Pacman.

name: Lucky Ducky
description:
Roll the foam Lucky Ducky Dice and add up your ducks... highest total after three rounds wins. Try for special 'duck combos' for added bonus points!

History of rubber ducks included.

name: Malifaux: The Undying – Story Encounter & Adventure Box
description:
A bitter rivalry spills out onto the streets of Malifaux in the Undying! Will you help Minako Rei defeat the dreaded Manos, or will you harness the immortal necromancer's power for your own?

This is a Resurrectionists/Ten Thunder Story Encounter Box Set, containing eight 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high-quality plastic, and Stat Cards.

Set Contains:

Adventures

2x Malifaux Encounters
1x through the Breach Adventure

Models
4 Ten Thunders Models
‣ 1 Minako Rei
‣ 1 Wanyudo
‣ 2 Katashiro
4 Resurrectionist Models
‣ 1 Manos the Risen
‣ 1 Grave Golem
‣ 2 Mourners

Stat Cards

1x Minako Rei
1x Wanyudo
2x Katashiro
1x Manos the Risen
1x Grave Golem
2x Mourner

Please Note: Miniatures supplied unpainted and some assembly will be required.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Charm Warders
description:
Charm Warders are powerful Chi users who have dedicated their lives to warding off evil spirits. By harnessing and focusing their Chi, they are able to create mystical barriers that prevent spirits from passing. The most powerful of their number can even create powerful Chi Blades, which can cut through many of the defences of otherworldly creatures.

Since last year's Battle of London, some Charm Warders have felt the barriers between the worlds weakening. These men and women have travelled to Malifaux in search of some way to repair the damage being done to the world.

As with most spellcasters, the magical talents of the charm warders have increased significantly since they passed through the Breach. Most end up selling their services to the Ten Thunders in exchange for the ability to study the Oni, ghosts, and other strange creatures at their beck and call.

As a group, the charm Warders are starting to realise that Malifaux itself might be the problem. They have started to research a way to strengthen the barrier between worlds in the hopes of saving Earth... even if it means the loss of Malifaux.

Ten Thunder Box Set, containing two 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high-quality plastic.

Set Contains:

Models

2 Charm Warders

Stat Cards

2 Charm Warders

Please Note: Miniatures are supplied unpainted and assembly will be required.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Obsidian Statue
description:
The resurgence of magic on Earth since the opening of the first Breach has led to some odd events. Perhaps one of the strangest was the sudden awakening of the Obsidian Statue that guarded a small, forgotten temple in Tibet. The statue could only move its mouth, but even this was enough to draw pilgrims from far away lands.

Shenlong, upon learning of the statue, arranged for the statue to be brought to Malifaux. It was a massive undertaking, but the eventual journey through the breach completed the awakening and granted the statue full movement.

Now, the Obsidian Statue serves those who gave it life. It owes them a debt that can never be repaid... and the Ten Thunders know this.

Ten Thunder Box Set, containing one 32mm 'heroic' scale miniature made of high-quality plastic.

Set Contains:

Models

1 Obsidian Statue

Stat Cards

1 Obsidian Statue

Please Note: Miniature is supplied unpainted and assembly will be required.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Final Boss: Next Stage
description:
Kill Monsters, destroy your friends and defeat the Final Boss. This expansion adds Stages!

A card management game with take that mechanics and fierce player competition.

The player with most Victory Coins after the Final Boss appears wins the game.

There are more game modes such as cooperative, solo and elimination.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Decade: Time to Achieve
description:
Theme
Caution: This is not just a game, it is a LIFE STORY.

You have a stable job, but also notice that there are lots of hidden opportunities around you, and you cannot wait to show to the world achievements you can make. To be a famous Business Giant? Or to be a wealthy Property Tycoon? How much can you accomplish within a decade? They are all of your choices. Occupation, skills, opportunities and so on of each Player are different but remember, there is one thing always fair to everyone - time. Make the best use of your time, in this limited life, and make all your dreams come true!

Game-play
Every player will receive a set of career card, a player board and 11 time tokens. Players can spend time on the following actions each turn:-
Training: Increase one's skill level so to get a promotion to increase the salary
Opportunity: Pick an Opportunity Card which has various useful effects
Start a Business: Pick a business card and start it to earn more income
Upgrade a Business: Upgrade a business card to make it more profitable
Purchase Property: Pick a property card and decide whether to buy it
Sell Property: Roll a dice and decide whether to sell a property on one's table
Remaining time tokens will be used on sleeping, gathering and travelling to adjust one's Pressure Index.

Goal
By managing one's time and money, Players need to achieve as many Dreams as possible, and at the same time try to form a family while not to get over-pressurized. These all constitute to Players' Life Satisfaction Point and the one with the highest win the game.

—description from the designer

name: Eiserner Kanzler
description:
Eiserner Kanzler is a historical quiz game which was published to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the birthday of Otto von Bismarck.

—user summary

name: By This Axe: Medieval Fantasy Battle Rules
description:
By This Axe: Medieval Fantasy Battle Rules presents a simple, fairly standard wargame ruleset to handle small- to medium-size miniatures battles (optional rules allow play without miniatures). The rules assume two or more armies will be involved, each with two or more units. Infantry units contain 3 to 25 figures; cavalry units contain 2 to 15 figures; figures may be arranged as desired but only up to the first three ranks are involved in combat.

The game assumes 1:5 to 1:20 scale ratios though any type of (consistent) basing is allowed. Action resolution uses a modified six-sided-dice resolution method; 1 is successful, 6 is failure. Unit movement takes place in inches; various terrain effects are noted. The mass combat is fairly abstracted.

An optional "Command and Control" method relies upon card drafting from a standard pack. The standard command method assigns a Leadership level which limits actions.

The game does support individual figures that may represent generals, leaders, and "characters" (generally - mages, priests, etc.); these figures may duel each other. The game does support (but does not require) fantastic elements and magic, and a variety of non-human "monster" units are described in "Appendix A: Fantasy Supplement". Numerous unit types have special abilities that allow units to take special actions or make special movements. Generally, these all work within the basic framework of the game. Opposing forces are constructed using a "point cost" method that allows disparate but balanced armies to be fielded.

Play involves turns, with both players executing some portions of the turn simultaneously, other portions in alternating order. Each player turn is executed in five enumerated phases that take place in order. The phase orders are:


Phase 1 (optional) - draw cards
Phase 2 duels between individual units are resolved
Phase 3 Ranged fire and magical attack is resolved
Phase 4 Movement (each side, in turn)
Phase 5 Mêlée is resolved


Units must test morale after sustaining damage; units may route; leaders may attempt to rally.

The game does not elucidate a winner or formulaic victory situation; presumably this becomes evident through play. After the battle is concluded, a simple process is used to determine Battle Results. This process may determine a "victor" for post-game results. Opposing armies are impacted by the Battle Results, both in survivorship and field location (presumably this allows multiple engagements in a campaign).

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Halma heksagonalna
description:
Halma, but on a hexagonal board.
—user summary

Halma, ale na planszy heksagonalnej
—user summary (Polish)

name: Warcaby heksagonalne
description:
Analogous game to checkers only on the hexagonal board
—user summary

Warcaby tyle że na heksagonalnej planszy.
—user summary (Polish)

name: Schnelle Spur
description:
The game can play by 2 to 4 children. Each player receives a team of three sprinters of the same color (tokens in three different heights), which he places in any order on the three "left" starting points of a corner. The sprinters must clear the starting fields as quickly as possible. The smallest sprinter can move on one move one space, the middle two and the largest three spaces further. About thin blue lines can be drawn, about thick not. The own Sprinter can serve as "accelerator", the field occupied by them is not included in the counting. Enemy sprinters can be thrown out. The first to bring all three sprinters into the three target fields next to their starting fields has won.

—user summary

name: Lethal Skies
description: Lethal Skies is a tactical game of air combat between modern fighter jets. In Lethal Skies each player controls two or more aircraft in fast paced dogfights. This book provides the basic rules framework needed to play Lethal Skies. Rules for individual aircraft, their traits and weapon systems are available separately.

name: Numidia
description:
North Africa 40 CE
