The Numidians were conquered by the Romans during one of their civil wars . The new governor appointed officials to plan roads connecting as many towns and cities as possible. They wanted long straight roads crossing rich farmlands to transport food to the population with a surplus for export.

Spread out your town and city tiles on a 8 x 8 squares board, to make roads which connect together to form one network, through as many open squares as possible.

Numidia allows you to play as co-operative or competitive game. The social atmosphere is diferent but the rules are the same.

NUMIDIA IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM

—description from the publisher

name: Summons
description:
Roman Empire 1 CE

Caesar Augustus issued a decree that a census should be taken in the entire Roman world. This was to aid military conscription and tax collection. Everyone was summoned to their home town to register and be counted. For many this involved a long and difficult trip. Luckily, they were able to gain encouragement and support from others making the journey.

Use both your own and the other players’ people so that your
people can race home by moving as often as possible each turn.
Move your people tiles forward on a 8 x 8 square board depending on the numbers on the tiles in line with the last tile that moved. A skillful player can get a large number of moves on his turn by moving a low number tile first and aligning the successive tiles well.

SUMMONS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM

—description from the publisher

name: Huli
description:
If you are reading this then fate has found you.
My voice in this text is from the year 3045. What you are reading on your screen is a simulation of possible change in what ever time you may find yourself in. This simulation is a meditative practice of change for our Aina(land) and Uhane(spirit). A change that that I dare say has gone to the worst in the time I am from.

We call this simulation Huli.

Huli, was created with several goals in mind, to teach our keiki’s (children) the importance of land stewardship, of reminding our elders that it is never too late to change your narrative, and finally to act as a guide and pathway for alternate timelines.

In Huli, you will take the mantle of one of these Avatars, KONOHIKI: The Steward of the Ahupua’a, KUMU: THE Steward of Knowledge, MAHI’AI: The Steward of Cultivation, and LAWAI’A: The Steward of the Sea.

Your goal is to practice removing all Eha (hurt) from the landscape through time.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Champion of Earth: Robots and Cyborgs Expansion
description:
We'd always planned to extend the enemies that were attacking Earth alongside the aliens.

Robots and Cyborgs are the first to join, putting their steel bodies and mechanical minds to the task of defeating the last defenders of Earth. The Alien invaders have promised the Robots a "chunk of Earth" in return for helping them defeat Humanity... Little do the repressed mechanicals know that they will be getting the Earth's core!

They have agreed and joined the Aliens in their invasion, giving Humanity another enemy to stand against.

Includes one (1) new double-sided character card, seventeen (17) new equipment cards and eighteen (18) robot and cyborgs cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Objection Overruled
description:
Objection Overruled is a quick-fire, take-that courtroom battle game for 2 players.

Easy to learn, fun to play and ultra-portable – Objection Overruled pits you as two corrupt lawyers arguing high-profile court cases before Judge and Jury.

More concerned with winning than the truth; you must bamboozle the Judge with science and facts to “prove” your version of events. And if that doesn’t work, throw in some dodgy evidence, bribes and lies to cheat your way to victory.

Justice is overrated.

Each player shuffles their deck and draws 2 cards. In turns, you must play a card and draw a card - mounting up evidence to discredit your opponent and win the case. If you can't respond according to the card chart you loose the case and move on to the next trial.
First player to win 5 case makes partner and wins the game.

For an extra challenge, you can use the "Lawyers never lie" rules: where you can play evidence cards face down. Get caught lying, or falsely accuse someone of doing it, and you'll loose the round.

—description from the publisher

name: 俺は豪族 (Orewa Gozoku)
description:
In the history card game 俺は豪族 (Orewa Gozoku) (I, Clansman), you play roles of the lords of ancient Japan and lead your clans for 16 generations -- from the 4th to the 7th Century A.D.. You compete each other in collecting political powers. Victory Points are earned when you contribute to strengthen the kingdom in military, economy and other fields. At the end of the 7th Century, the player with the most VPs is the winner and becomes the highest rank aristocrat in the newborn empire.

The game is played in 16 rounds. Each round, players take turns placing their workers on production buildings in a counterclockwise order, and then buying cards from the market in a clockwise order. When you buy a card, the production buildings you own and the one occupied by your worker in total must produce the resources sufficient for the card's cost. Some cards become your own production buildings, and others provide VPs.

—description from the publisher

name: Raja Luwak
description:
One day, the peace in a distant kingdom of Luwak (chivet) is broken by the disappearance of the Raja Luwak (the king of chivet). Each member of the Luwak tribe begins to compete to claim the throne of the Luwak Kingdom.

In Raja Luwak, you dive your way deeper into the kingdom by pressing your luck in dice rolling and gathering materials to outwit other competitors and claim your true worth of the throne of Luwak.

—description from the publisher

name: Grumantra of Dalhalla: Mahapatha
description:
In the esoteric world of Dalhalla, there's a hereditary ancient ritual to achieve greater understanding to the mysterious power of Vishra called Mahapatha, a ritual that can be achieved only by sacrificing oneself to the underworld.

In Grumantra of Dalhalla: Mahapatha, fight your way against the dungeon master or become the dungeon master in this turn/action-based strategy board game. Learn new techniques, master your inner strength, and return with your comrades to Dalhalla to master the rank of Adhipa.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Team-Based Game

name: Pokémon TCG: Hydro Fury Theme Deck
description:
The Hydro Fury Theme Deck is from the Celestial Storm expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the seventh expansion in the Sun & Moon series. However, it also contains cards from earlier expansions in the Sun & Moon series. It predominantly focuses on Water and Fire type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Swampert.

Like other Theme Decks, Hydro Fury includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, a Swampert deckbox and a TCGO deck access code. (User summary.)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Pokémon TCG: Tropical Takedown Theme Deck
description:
The Tropical Takedown Theme Deck is from the Forbidden Light expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the sixth expansion in the Sun & Moon series. However, it also contains cards from earlier expansions in the Sun & Moon series. It predominantly focuses on Alolan Pokémon, with the main Pokémon being Alolan Exeggutor.

Like other Theme Decks, Tropical Takedown includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, an Alolan Exeggutor deckbox and a TCGO deck access code. (User summary.)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Pokémon TCG: Mach Strike Theme Deck
description:
The Mach Strike Theme Deck is from the Ultra Prism expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the fifth expansion in the Sun & Moon series. However, it also contains cards from earlier expansions in the Sun & Moon series. It predominantly focuses on Dragon and Fighting type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Garchomp.

Like other Theme Decks, Mach Strike includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, a Garchomp deckbox, and a TCGO deck access code. (User summary.)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Pokémon TCG: Imperial Command Theme Deck
description:
The Imperial Command Theme Deck is from the Ultra Prism expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the fifth expansion in the Sun & Moon series. However, it also contains cards from earlier expansions in the Sun & Moon series. It predominantly focuses on Water type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Empoleon.

Like other Theme Decks, Imperial Command includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, a Empoleon deckbox, and a TCGO deck access code. (User summary.)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Dragon Quest Dungeon II expansion pack
description:
An expansion for Dragon Quest Dungeon II that introduced a new game mode.

14 new monster figures
2 hero figures
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Maze, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement

name: Pokémon TCG: Destruction Fang Theme Deck
description:
The Destruction Fang Theme Deck is from the Celestial Storm expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the fourth expansion in the Sun & Moon series. However, it also contains cards from earlier expansions in the Sun & Moon series. It predominantly focuses on Darkness type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Hydreigon.

Like other Theme Decks, Destruction Fang includes damage counters, a custom coin featuring Hydreigon, one two-player mat, a Hydreigon deckbox, and a TCGO deck access code. (User summary.)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Pokémon TCG: Clanging Thunder Theme Deck
description:
The Clanging Thunder Theme Deck is from the Celestial Storm expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the fourth expansion in the Sun & Moon series. However, it also contains cards from earlier expansions in the Sun & Moon series. It predominantly focuses on Lightning, Fighting, and Dragon type Pokémon.

Like other Theme Decks, Clanging Thunder includes damage counters, a custom coin featuring Kommo-o, one two-player mat, a Kommo-o deckbox and a TCGO deck access code. (User summary.)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: The Donner Party Board Game
description:
Winter, 1846. Experience the harsh and fateful journey of America’s favorite cannibals, The Donner Party. Pick up and own the game today… IF YOU DARE!

May the best cannibal win:

Brave your way out of the snowy slopes of the Sierra Nevada mountains and stagger to safety in Fort Sacramento. Collect Fingers Of Meat along the treacherous Emigrant Trail whilst avoiding Toil, Trouble and Doom (and learnin’ a little history along the way). The one who gets to the Fort with the most Meat wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Baby Boum
description:
Baby Boum is a board game in French designed to answer to a popular scientific objective. It was created by five doctoral students and produced by the Nancy student association Big Brother. This game was created by Quentin Dumont, Mickaël Lebdar, Géraud Le Falher, Tania Louis and Camille Paoletti, advised and supervised by Stéphane Goria (researcher at the Mediation Research Centre of the University of Lorraine) and Marie-Laure Lenertz (Communication Officer at the Institute of Genetics and Molecular and Cellular Biology of the University of Strasbourg) as part of a training for doctoral students during the "Science & You" days at the University of Lorraine in Metz in 2015. Using black humour, this game highlights the problem of infertility in some parts of Africa (contrary to stereotypes and other preconceived ideas, research shows the health and social urgency associated with this problem). The scientific elements conveyed by the game are based on the research work undertaken by Emmanuelle Simon (researcher at the Centre de recherche sur les médiations of University of Lorraine).
It is a humorous game in which each player plays a character or a pair of characters whose particular winning conditions and other characteristics are represented on a tablet on which the cards drawn during the game are placed. The game also requires 2 dices.

name: Seekrieg (Fourth Edition): Ship Data II – Refits & Modernizations World War 2
description: Additional ship data after its most recent refit prior to the outbreak of the war and any refits or alterations.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Seekrieg (Fourth Edition): CNO Series – Naval Operations Pacific 1 and 2
description:
Ready to play scenarios for naval wargames.

Contains 15 different operations that are historically accurate and give a complete breakdown of the units involved. The operations are varied to include several types of actions as well as an umber of different sizes of operations.

This set includes Pacific 1, CNO #3 and Pacific #2, CNO #5 which were previously published separately.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Lost in Canton
description:
Lost in Canton is a game that has a revolutionary structure as it uses boards as pages in a book, and the game itself looks like a book.

The game is about a fairy tale in Canton, China. Within the tale, the Dragon fish kids are born and put into human society. They will learn all the wonderful knowledge and every handcraft skill of Canton culture, and eventually go to the Temple Gathering to ascend as a real Chinese Dragon.

During the game, players each act as a newly born Dragon Fish kid that has just landed upon Canton's land. The players need to find different masters to learn the knowledge and handcraft skills. On a player's turn, they can ask any other player a question about the location info of the master. The asked player can answer the truth or use their ability to avoid answering or confuse the asking player. The first player that found their master's location wins.

name: So Here's the Scenario
description:
It’s now a family game with a built in raunchy expansion for adults. You get to draw a scenario, while others respond and generate laughs.

4 decks. 3 of them are used together to form a complete sentence creating just 1 of one million possible scenarios.

The 4th deck is used for responses. One player will read the scenario while the other players respond. The reader will then read the responses out loud to choose their favorite response. The goal of the game is to win 5 scenarios or to just have a good time laughing with your friends. Familiar playing style, but has two ways of being entertained. Through the scenario's as well as the responses. Has a well balanced blend of pure ridiculous to the infamous raunchy card styles.

—description from the publisher

name: Familocas
description:
In this game you try to collect families.

The game consists of 40 cards divided into eight families of five. Each player receives six cards. The rest go in a pile.
On your turn you will ask another player for a card from a specific family. You must already hold at least one card from this family. If you get a card, your turn continues and you can ask again (same or other player). If the asked player does not have a card from the family, your turn ends and you draw a card from the pile (until it is empty).

This game is essentially Go Fish, but played with a custom deck.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Memory

name: Balancespillet
description:
A balancing game with a "platter" suspended from a gallows.
On your turn you need to place a piece on the "platter". A die will determine which colour piece to place. The pieces come in three sizes worth 1, 2, or 3 points. If you succeed in placing the piece without pieces falling off, you get the points for the piece. If you fail, you get no points.

Play for a predetermined number of rounds. Most points wins.

name: Daredevil
description:
Press your luck card game where you risk it all for fame.

Select a stunt and roll dice to see if you succeed. Failed stunts give consequences that hamper your future actions. "Death" knocks you out of the game. The surviving player who completes the most points worth of stunts wins.
48 stunt cards
7 character cards
2 standard six-sided dice
1 rulesheet

—description from the publisher

name: Den Store Dyre quiz
description:
Den store dyre quiz is a game, which can be played by anyone interested in wildlife.

Roll the die and answer a question matching the color of the die roll. Answer correctly and you'll collect a colored bottle. But be careful; a white die roll will force you to spin the bottle, and either you or one of your opponents will get a punishment. The first player to collect one bottle of each color wins the game.

name: Keeper of the Coins
description:
In this Canadian abstract game which uses coins of various denominations, players are attempting to move their 4 coins around the board, starting at home and then to the "bank" and finally to the finish space. Players are using dice to move their coins around the board, either using the full total of the dice to move one coin or splitting the dice to move two coins.

There are also rules for capturing other players' coins and protecting oneself from being captured (if you can flip your coins from their 'heads' to their 'tails' side by rolling an odd number).

Players must supply their own coins to play this game. (The game only comes with a felt board to prevent coins from slipping around and two dice.)

—user summary

name: Ancient Battlelines Clash
description:
Ancients Battlelines Clash (ABC) is a set of fast-play battle rules for the ancient and medieval periods. Units are classified by type (infantry, chariots, etc.), role (battleline, skrimisher, etc.), and fortitude (combination of morale, skill, and equipment), and can be further differentiated by special rules giving the missile attacks, special formations, etc.

Play is IGO-UGO, with each player activating all his units during his turn, then the other player activates all his during his. An activated unit can move, charge, melee, etc., and the whole activation is resolved before going on to the next unit. (In other words, there are no separate phases where the whole army first moves, then shoots, etc.)

The suggested basing is similar to the WRG standard, but the rules only really care that all units have the same frontage.

—user summary

name: Shield Wall: A War Game for your Inner Viking
description:
Victory is your only aim here today, O' Jarl of the Northern Kingdoms! Bolster your line, steel yourself, and be prepared to consult the Witch Doctor to gain an edge over your foes this day. Treachery, doom, and total annihilation await your foes as wage war against them for the ultimate prize, gold, gems, and Valhalla!

Will you gain a seat at Odin's Table this day?

Shield Wall is a strategic game of fast-paced card combat that will challenge your ability to defend and attack simultaneously. Simple game mechanics and infinite replayability are inherent in this simplified game of war with a Viking twist.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Photo Safari
description:
A jungle adventure theme memory game. Fighting with the poachers and shooting the ecology and habits of the jungle animals.

Helps children to strengthen their understanding of nature while strengthening their dynamic memory ability through both simple and difficult modes.

In order to do well in this game, correctly remembering the positions of all kinds of existence in the jungle is critical. As well as all the memorization reinforcement, We also hope that kids can learn from the game that poachers are not the good guys and that they are not welcomed both by people and nature.

name: Emak-Emak Matic Racing Game
description:
Who is truly Queen of the street?

In Indonesia, mom is commonly known as the queen of the street when riding an automatic motorcycle. However, what if 5 queens of the street are riding automatic motorcycle? It's gonna be crazy race!

In this game, you will play as mom who has different mission. Choose the right action card to be champion!



HOW TO PLAYIn setup every player get 2 cards in hands. Active player will choose 1 card, place it in the centre of table. Other player also will choose 1 card and give to active player. Do not open all this cards. Active player must shuffle the cards so active player don't know who is give what card.

Open the shuffled cards and active player must running all of action cards. But if 'workshop' card showing, it's first priority to action. Otherwise the sequence of action is up to you.

Active player can lie (Bluff) other player.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Racing, Video Game Theme

name: Spellbook'd
description:
Take on the role of an aspiring Wizard in an Academy of Magic. Each Wizard is building up their skills to win an upcoming contest of their skills, judged by the Council of Archmages. Study the different schools of magic, redeem your knowledge for Magems, and partake in a Spell Battle in your effort to become the victor of the contest!

Spellbook’d is a card drafting and dueling game involving three different game rounds to gather cards, spells, and points to win the game. After the three different rounds of play the Wizard with the most Spell Points is declared the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Varya: Spellmasters
description:
Varya: Spellmasters is a fast-paced "take that" set collection card game, with an element of resource management. It is thematically set within the Varya universe, where mages and spell casters use elements to bend the world around them to their will. Players within this game are competing to be crowned as the Champion Spellmaster

Varya: Spellmasters is designed to be played by 2-5 players from start to finish in 15 minutes. Gameplay is easy to pick up, as players perform one action on their turn before play passes to the next player.

Spells are cast by focusing on the elements (playing an element card on the table in front of the player) and then playing a spell card. Focusing on an element counts as the player's action for that turn. Spells which affect the field of play are drawn throughout the course of the game.

The first player to cast 2 Master Spells will be crowned champion and win the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Canon: The Card Game – Textual Criticism and Apostolic Fathers Deck
description:
Play the card game Canon with this deck on its own, or combine it with a different deck to expand your game play options. Adds textual criticism into the mix, as it raises questions not just about the canonical status of works as a whole, but also different versions of those works and passages found in some manuscripts but not others.

—description from the designer

name: Canon: The Card Game – Old Testament Pseudepigrapha Deck
description:
A deck for Canon The Card Game, with Jewish extracanonical texts chosen by a scholar!

This Canon: The Card Game deck features ancient Jewish works from outside both the Hebrew Bible and Old Testaments. The contents were selected by Professor Jim Davila, who studies, writes about, and teaches about these texts for a living. You will probably learn something while playing the game with this deck, but you will definitely have fun.

You can play the game with this deck alone, or can mix and match with others to play with precisely the texts that interest you.

—description from the designer

name: Across Canada Travel Game
description:
This is roll-and-move game, with the goal of travelling across Canada from coast to coast.

Players start either in Vancouver, B.C. or St. John's, Newfoundland. The first player to get to the opposite city wins the game.

On a players turn they roll the two dice. If possible, they must move their pawn to any city connected to the city their pawn is in. Pawns can only move to adjacent cities. A pawn can only move if the value printed above the route exactly matches the result of the dice rolled. If the values do not match, the player can re-roll both dice once. If again the player cannot move because the results do not match, they must pay a $5 fee to the bank. If players run out of money and cannot afford to pay the $5 fee, they are eliminated from the game.

Movement can happen in any direction, even away from the player's destination. If you land in a city with another player, you must pay that player $1.

—user summary
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder At The Flying Divots Golf Club
description:
The annual Golf Club Dinner is taking place tonight. The President of the Club, Spike Divot, has been found lying in a poof of blood behind the Clubhouse. Who was responsible for making his card?.

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder by Royal Command
description:
The time is the present. The place is the royal residence "Rutting 'Em Palace" in the royal kingdom. As good king wends-His last has failed to produce an heir to the Kings throne all the royal nieces and nephews have been invited to their vast and wealthy kingdom to hear the announcement of who will succeed the King. But... Good King Wends-His-Last is found dead before the announcement could be made. Join us in solving this murder by royal command.

—description from the publisher

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – Lynx Helicopter Expansion
description:
TANKS: The Modern Age is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a Tank Platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory.

The Lynx expansion contains a plastic Lynx helicopter, Lynx helicopter card, 2 hero cards, 5 crew cards, 3 upgrade cards.

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – PAH Helicopter Expansion
description:
TANKS: The Modern Age is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a Tank Platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory.

The PAH Helicopter Expansion contains:
- plastic PAH Helicopter
- PAH Helicopter Card
- 2 Hero Cards
- 4 Crew Cards
- 4 Upgrade Cards

name: A B C... Divertiamo!
description:
Learning the alphabet will be easy and intuitive thanks to the 28 cards with letters and the 28 cards with images and words to associate with the corresponding initial!
A game that stimulates language and the exercise of imagination to have fun discovering the alphabet.
Four game modes:
1 - Memory-like;
2 - Place the image cards faceup on the table, reveal 1 letter card at a time, the first player to cover the matching image card collects it and the winner is the player with the most cards;
3 - Old Maid-like;
4 - Scopa-like.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Conga Mummies
description:
Conga Mummies is a simple grid movement game for one to four players. Each player controls a "mummy" token that moves about the board, square-by-square, as desired. The gridded board is laid out roughly to approximate a humanoid form. Players start in the "head" grid and then move to specific squares in each "hand" and "foot" to collect canopic jars containing organs. All four embalmed organs (stomach, intestines, liver, and lungs) are required for the mummy to reach the afterlife. The first player to recover all four of the needed organs wins the game.

Each grid square has a random chance (25%) of containing a beast; this is determined when the first character moves into the square. Beasts, if encountered, must be defeated to proceed. Individual mummies can take damage and be destroyed (the player loses and drops out of the game).

The primary innovation of the game involves player movement. Players must move in a "conga line" pattern, following exactly in the leader's footsteps, but one to three squares behind (depending on how many players there are). The line leader makes all decisions and performs all combat. If desired, the line leader can yield their position (when low on health, for example) and move to the back of the line. Alternately, each player can cast three "compel" spells during the game. Each "compel" spell forces the leader to move to the back of the line.

The basic strategy is to remain at the back of the line (in safety) through the first three organ collections then to move (and remain) in the lead position for the final organ collection (thus, winning).

The game supports single-player play, though this becomes simply an exercise of trying to move and survive to the end, rather than managing the "conga line" strategy.

The game is provided as a four-page, print-and-play PDF document containing the rules and the game board. It was distributed for free from various online sites.

—user summary

name: Murder Mystery Charades
description:
If you can not do the mime you can't solve the crime

Read the clue then mime the murder to help solve the mystery! classic charades gets a wicked twist in this fast and furious update where you don't just have to guess whodunit but how and why!

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in the Wild West
description:
Ten years ago Sheriff P shooter was made sheriff of Dodgy city and helped to clean up the town. To celebrate the 10th anniversary of his appointment a party is being thrown at Lil's last chance saloon where there will be plenty of whiskey, women, gambling and music - yoo hah! But before the party is in full swing, shots ring out and the Sheriff is found dead outside the saloon.

Host your own party to find out who was responsible for such a blast!

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in the Thirties
description:
Who shot Sam Shady? Rooseville, 1931. Sam Shady, private eye to the stars, is celebrating his birthday in style. He’s invited all his current clients, as well as his closest rival, to dinner at his classy house. As his guests are getting to know each other before the first course arrives, Sam steps outside for a quiet smoke and shortly afterwards, he is found lying dead in the middle of his lawn. Find out who made Sam’s birthday go with a bang!

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder at Soft Rock Cafe
description:
Raymond revue owner of the famous chain of restaurants/nightclubs is enjoying himself at a friends birthday party. He is on medication to enable him to keep (it) up with his young girlfriend
but he suddenly keels over and dies.

Host your own party to find out who wanted to cut his line.

—description from the publisher

name: Project Swarm
description:
How I expect the synopsis to sound when it's actually done:

Traverse caverns full of monsters, forests full of traps and towers full of rats.

This roguelike dungeon crawling adventure for 1 to 5 players features customizable characters, an innovative swarm mechanic, and endless fun.

Do you like old school Gauntlet? Experience? LOOT?
Players take on one of the 6 elemental playstyles. The Martial Knight, The Holy Priest, the Nature Druid, the Clockwork Gunslinger, the Shadow Necromancer, or the Arcane Mage are playable characters in the base game. And don't let that stop you from playing the way you want to play! Earn access to other classes through XP gain and continue to defeat wave after wave of enemy.

The game is a tactical exploration adventure where the players play cards to attack monsters. Each card played goes into a cooldown row to be used later, or the player can burn their highly coveted bits to cool them down faster. Through exploration, the players will reveal monster spawner tiles in search of the exit tile. Once the players decide to exit the dungeon they must face the second level, full of harder monsters and better loot. After exiting that level, the dungeon's boss must be defeated if the players wish to keep the loot they've gained thus far. If the players die at any time, they lose their gear and can try again.

The base game comes with (at least) two dungeons that are different each time you play. Completing a dungeon will allow you to purchase more gear for another run.

Honestly, we're still playtesting the hell out of this game, so everything here is subject to wild changes. Including the theme. I'm not 100% sold on fantasy.

name: Turtle Wars
description:
Turtle Wars is an original card game where Turtles and their ocean friends battle it out for freedom, honour, and gold.

The aim of the game is to gather Turtle Gold and defend it from the other players. You can gather gold peacefully or you can go to war to take it from your rivals by force.

The game uses a turn-based pick-up & play model, with a separate battle mode for warfare.

The deck is made up of 140 cards of which more than 100 are individual and unique designs (the rest are the gold)

—description from the publisher

name: Elephant Combat Arena
description:
Elephant is the name of a Gladiator Arena in the Middle-East. 15 Gladiators will compete for the trophy, but beware, the arena keeps it´s former champions to stop you.
Gameplay is a mix of Deck/Character building with Dice/Combat. The side-Missions is the other cool factor. A game from 2-4 players with the objective to attain 10 points, first player that gets 10 pts wins.

name: Fates
description:
Fates is strategic, puzzle, card game for 1 to 4 players.

The Moirai Sisters, also known as The Fates, are the personification of destiny. The three sisters are daughters of Zeus and responsible for controlling the life-thread of all mankind. Together, the sisters ensure that the fate of every individual takes its course without obstruction.

Clotho has the Spindle. She is responsible for spinning the life-thread. Clotho is bound with creating life.

Lachesis has the Measure. She is responsible for allotting the life-thread. These allotments represent the life span of an individual.

Atropos has the Shears. She is responsible for cutting the life-thread. This is when the life of every person comes to an end.

There are nine Moirai Cards, three of each Sister. The Moirai Cards are shuffled and dealt in a 3x3 'Moirai Grid'.

Shuffle the 18 Puzzle Cards and deal them face-up in three piles.

Each players' goal is to manipulate the Moirai Grid in order to match one or more of the topmost Puzzle Cards. Matching the Puzzle Card to the Moirai Grid allows you to claim the matched Puzzle Cards. The first player to claim an agreed number of Puzzle Cards wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Mythology, Puzzle

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in the Orient
description:
Renata Scoop an English journalist investigating a smuggling ring involved with Thai antiques, was attending a riverside party at the Siam orchid hotel in Bangkok when she received a call on her mobile phone during the display of traditional Thai dancing. She left the party briefly only to be found dead a few moments later in the exotic gardens

Host your own party to find out who was responsible for disconnecting her line.

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in the Pits
description:
The post race party is being held by the sponsors of the Formula 1 racing team Team Rex at the Sin Bin Ring in the city of Muchodosho in the Sultanate of Djuluvmee. However before the party begins the owner Rex Motors is found dead. Who was responsible for stopping him in his tracks? Host your own party to see who waved the chequered flag.

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Death of a Chef
description:
Head chef Russell Uppermeal has invited friends and colleagues to help him being awarded the "Most Ridiculously Expensive Meal" for his battered oysters in unicorn sauce. Host your own party to find out who carved him up!

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder by Degrees
description:
Professor Morrie R Tee, the famous Criminologist and Master if St Rumpet's College, Oxbridge, is guest of honour at the graduation of the 1000th student to successfully complete the Bachelor ot Arts Degree in Detection (B.A.D). However, all does not go according to plan and the Professor is found dead in his rooms whilst having afternoon tea. Did someone tamper with his teapot or was it written in the leaves?

Host your own party to discover who was responsible for this dastardly deed.

—description from the publisher

name: Murder à la Carte: A Cat on the Catwalk
description:
Fran was a designer in the swinging sixties, Models, photographers and the own of a purple rolls royce all features in her glamorous life, but not always as friends. For Fran manipulated people and one night one person could stand it no longer...

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder at the Match
description:
Toni Totti famous Italian center forward is to be formally signed by Malechester United Football club following the home league game against Malechester Rovers. He didn't arrive at the post match party but was found dead floating in the team bath in the changing rooms.

Host your own party to find out who was responsible for giving him his red card.

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Death by design
description:
Matt Finish, the interior designer star of the TV show Changing Homes and Gardens, was to be the guest of honour at a party to celebrate the final days filming of the weekend makeover of Mr and Mrs Tipp's house by the C.H.A.G. team. He didn't make it to the party but was found dead in the walled vegetable garden. Host your own party to see who had designs on his murder!

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder on the Piste
description:
Who Killed Richard Pickle? The time is the present and wealthy entrepreneur Richard Pickle has invited friends to a brunch party at his chalet in the Swiss ski resort of Kloisters. Before the party Richard went for his early morning ski and tragically sometime later was found dead lying in the virgin snow.

Host your own party and find out who is the murderer on the piste!

—description from the publisher

name: Lost
description:
The largest copper mine in Ancient Hindustan was a maze of dark tunnels deep below the earth. Miners could easily get lost, and when water and rocks blocked the tunnels, they struggled to return to daylight.

Move your miner from tile to tile until it reaches the opposite corner. Movement depends on the number and direction of the rays on the tile it occupies. Each turn, players shift a row of tiles to block other players or open up a route for themselves.

LOST IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES

—description from the publisher

name: Floodwaters
description:
Ararat circa 25,000 BCE

The Lord saw how great man’s wickedness on the earth had become and every inclination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil all of the time. The Lord was grieved that he had made man on the earth and his heart was filled with pain. So the Lord said, “I will wipe mankind, whom I have created, from the face of the earth. I am going to bring floodwaters on the earth and to destroy all life under the heavens.”

Players move their people disks according to one of the adjacent tiles. As tiles are removed one by one, player's people drown and they are out of the game. The winner is the last player who has people that have not drowned.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement

name: Rays
description:
South Africa from 20,000 BCE

For centuries, African tribesmen gazed into the heavens searching for the falling star which would return the ghosts of the dead to the earth.

Be the first to connect two opposite sides of the board by using the rays of the tiles to join the path up. Clear a path for yourself and remove your opponent's tiles.

RAYS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM

—description from the publisher

name: Fists & Fury
description:
Fists & Fury is a tactical combat game where the players create their individual fighters through a simple process, and pit them against each other in one-on-one, or even group combat, utilizing a hex-grid and tokens. Included are rules for:


Building a unique Fighter
Creating a unique style
Advice on setting up duels and tournaments
Adding and using weapons


Designed to be a "beer & pretzels" game with minimal preparation, Fists & Fury is flexible enough to handle most any style of play you can imagine within the genre.
—description from the publisher

Fists & Fury is a simple hex-and-counter miniatures wargame that focuses on small combats. Each counter represents a single combatant. Each combatant has unique skills derived from an available pool of combat "styles" that are reminiscent of pop-culture martial arts. Combatants are further specialized by buying abilities using a points pool.

Players take alternating turns. Within a turn, movement and combat are rather free-form; attacks are resolved using two ten-sided dice, with modifiers, and results are applied immediately. Players may set their own victory conditions, but the default condition is complete destruction of the opposing force. The game is unusual in allowing much variety in the individual units, with significant player decisions made during unit construction (this also is a somewhat time-consuming pre-play process).

The game is published as a print-and-play instruction manual.

—User summary

name: Ka-Zing
description:
A card game where players link together a series of wand movement cards with a magic word to cast spells. There are three different game modes, each with a different objective to be achieved by the spell being cast. These three standard game types either encourage precise wand movements; promote expertise at casting longer more skilful spells; or pit players against each other in a classic wizarding duel!

Ka-Zing can be enjoyed by players of all ages, and has a built in difficulty mechanic where simultaneous play is possible between the easiest “learn to play” difficulty level (ideal for new or younger players) and the standard difficulty level (for more experienced players). Ka-Zing also comes with an advanced level of difficulty, unlocking more complex wand movements for players who like a challenge.

Ka-Zing can be played in Solo mode, as a group of 2-5 players, and even as a co-operative competitive mode, where players can form teams to compete against the other teams.

—description from the publisher

name: Colonize!
description:
Explore, exploit, expand, colonize!

Earth is in peril, if we want to survive we have to leave or it will be the end of the human race. In Colonize! you are the captain of the biggest space ark of your nation. With that giant spaceship you will explore the unknown space, exploit the resources you find, terraform planets and lastly bring your population there! Each of these efforts of colonization will grant you Victory points. But beware, your ship’s reactor produce dangerous radioactive wastes! These wastes take a tremendous space in your cargo's ship. Will you recycle them on Earth or will you simply dump them in deep space? The game end after 8 turns, so you will have to make a lot of choices if you hope a to find a new home for your survivors stranded on a over polluted earth.

Quick Gameplay overview:
Every player start by placing their ship on Earth’s tile.
At the beginning of a turn each player take a Waste token and put it at the start of their energy track on their Spaceship board. In a clockwise order, each player spend 2 energy points to make actions, moving their Waste token as a marker along the energy track. Actions may include :


Hauling population or resources into your spaceship
Moving through space tiles
Exploring the unknown space
Using space artifacts
Installing a Station on a planet
Exploiting the resources of a planet
Terraforming a planet and building a Colony


When the waste token reach the end of the track, it is moved into the ship’s cargo space. Every player put a new Waste token on their energy track and a new turn begin ! The game ends when there is no more waste token available.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Making Faces
description: Player picks a card and draws the subject of that card on a plastic mask in front of their own face. Other players guess the subject. A correct guess allows the drawing player and the guessing player to both advance on the board.

name: Trains in Space
description:
You have trains, they are in space.
Welcome to the Galaxy of Trains in Space! This is a tabletop card game for 2-4 players. It can be played with the standard rules specified in the Operations Guide, or with modified rules for alternate play.

In the distant future, where humans have reached far beyond our own solar system, the colonies are expected to supply Earth with the resources that it has long-since depleted. But lately the colonies have stopped sending back supplies, so the Czar of Space has readied his military to wipe out all of the colonies unless they can prove they are worth keeping. A plea went out and he's agreed to spare just ONE space colony if it can prove that it produces more valuable resources than the others. The colonies' leaders quickly sent out their Mighty Space Trains to appease the Czar, but in their panic, they all left EMPTY!

This is where you come in; as Engineers for each colony's respective Space Trains, you must grab random junk along the way and load it onto your Train before reaching Earth. That's right, it's your job to fake the value of your colony for its survival! Don't let the other Engineers get the better of you, load your train and blast their cargo with weapons you'll find. Defend your colony, and prove that you have what it takes to be the ultimate Engineer on the Trains in Space!

Featuring elements of Roleplay, Press your Luck, Set Collection, Take That and Pool building gameplay as you become the Engineers for your Space Trains in order to acquire the most valuable load out of space-junk to save your Colony.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Set Collection, Take That

name: Jagger Arena: Delilah
description:
Welcome back, jagger. You'll find a few changes since you last battled on the Grid. We've added some surprises to make things more interesting. Even though you have some new programs at your disposal, don't get too cocky, there's always a better jagger out there.

Three new program sets!
The Delilah, Ezra, and Natasha program sets add more options for building your own program sets. Some programs introduce new command abilities, while others are new versions of previous command abilities.

Two new command abilities!
Halt will shut down a program and prevent it from attacking or using a command ability. Barrier will prevent a program from taking damage.

New logic bombs!
These new logic bombs don't reveal cards in the Grid. Instead, they have abilities that will help or hinder all players.

Random seeds!
Random seeds will change the state of the Grid. Each game will be different, as the random seed chosen for that game will alter the rules.

Jagger Arena: Delilah is an expansion that requires the Jagger Arena core set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Fruits Go Racing
description:
Fruit Go Racing is a racing game where players drive special fruit-shaped cars. During the game the players will have to optimize the drawing and the use of the cards (the fuel of the cars) paying attention to the position on the race track and try to upgrade their "Fruitcar", collecting the gems released by the other cars!

—description from the publisher

name: Miss Tree and the Stolen Broomstick
description:
Who stole the prize broomstick "Joystick 2001?"

Miss Tree is very proud of her prize broomstick which she calls "Joystick" but someone has stolen it from the cabinet at Toad Stool Hall. Eight pupils are suspected of the crime but only one is guilty.

Host your own party to find out who is the guilty suspect.

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder at the Feelgood Fitness Centre
description:
Who murdered Wally Noveau-Richards?

The time is the present, and it's Happy Hour at the grand re-opening of The Feelgood Fitness Centre. Wally goes to take a swim in the newly revamped pool but never returns to the party. He is found dead in the pool but who sent him to his watery grave?

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder at Sandy Bay Surf Club
description:
The time is the present and the millionaire owner of the sandy bay surf club, Mr Rupert Baywatch has been found stabbed to death in the sand dunes during a swinging nighttime barbecue down on the beach. Why should anyone want him dead?

Host your own party and find out why Rupert's all washed up!

—description from the publisher

name: ダイスガールズ (Dice Girls)
description:
User summary
ダイスガールズ (Dice Girls) is a stage battle card game with a theme of a battle among pop singer groups. All the characters are from Japanese video games named "The Idolmaster" and "The Idolmaster Cinderella Girls".

Each player has six idol (pop singer) cards at the beginning of the game. Players take turns playing an idol card and rolling a number of dice printed on the card, determining her power. Then she activates her ability written on the card. Dice results are changed frequently by their abilities.

The game ends when all players have played five cards. They total the power of all their idols, and the player with the greatest power wins the game.

Depending on game mode, initial cards are determined by simple deal or rochester draft. Additionally, a three-game match can be played if each player has a copy of this game. Players make three groups of six idols and play three games. The player with highest total score of three games wins the match.

The game has been published since 2012, and new stand-alone expansions have been added, from Track 2 through to Track 5. You can mix these sets as you like, or play them separately. The rules remain the same, the card sets vary. The decks are for two players, but more can play when combining decks.

Publisher's summary
ビデオゲーム「アイドルマスター」、「シンデレラガールズ」をモチーフとした二次創作のカードゲームです。プレイ人数は２～３人推奨ですが、カードを増やせば６人まで対応できます。
手札のアイドルカードを交互に出してはダイスを振り、5人（枚）出した時点でのチームの合計力を競うゲームです。
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: 16-K AM Presents The Heritage of Council Bluffs
description: Monopoly Style game based on the City of Council Bluffs, Iowa United States.

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in the Air
description:
Who killed Mr Valentine D Plaza?

The time is the present and Mr D Plaza together with several of his friends and associates are on board Concorde returning to New York. The aircraft is cruising smoothly at Mach II, twice the speed of sound, when Valentine is taken ill and dies. It looks like foul play but who should want him dead?

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder on the Med
description:
Who killed Charles Taxwell?

Charles Taxwell the well known international business tycoon is cruising the med on his luxury yacht "Jellyfish II". The family are busy preparing for a special party at their beach side villa when they dock in Los Amigos. Everyone is looking forward to an exciting day but behind the scenes all is not well. The party was just beginning but it was just ending for Charlies Taxwell who was found dead.

Host your own party and find out why he ended up like a fish out of water!

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder on the Dancefloor
description:
Who did the dance of death?

It's the eve of the final of Dance Factor and the competition is tighter than the male dancers leotards. Crane Breville Cowl decides to host a pre-final bash to relieve everyone's tension and invites the finalists and his colleagues to come along, but all he gets for his troubles is a stiletto heel in the head.

Host your own party to find out who stepped on Cranes parade.

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party: The Triple Crown Affair
description:
Who Poisoned Lucky Eddie Merino?

The time is the present. The place is Newmarket. Lucky Eddie Merino, Head trainer for the O'Callaghna Stables and trainer for "Royal Lady" Derby and Gold Cup Winner, was found dead in the tack room of the O'Callagham Stables. He died of heart failure caused by the drug Eqimyotel. Why was Lucky Eddie poisoned?
We are gathered here in the midst of a family feud filled with lies and deception to solve the mystery of the Triple Crown Affair.

—description from the publisher

name: The Casino Killings
description:
Los Angeles, 1934. In the city of Angeld, even the angels have dirty faces. To survive on these mean streets, a guy has to be tough, and a dame has to be tougher. Lou Harger thought he was a tough guy, thought he could handle himself. He was wrong, dead wrong, and now he's just dead....Murdered...and the the $20,000 that he won on the roulette table is missing.

Legendary private eye Philip Marlowe has been investigating, and he's summoned together the principal suspects in his enquiries. One, or more, of the guests at dinner is a killer. It's your task to find out who the guilty party is before it's too late.

—description from the publisher

name: Samburu
description:
Samburu is a strategic game in which two players manage villages of nilotic peoples and the roles the individuals fulfil in the tribes.

Regularly, the villages enter into competitions to measure their strength and success perpetuating traditions. By conducting initiations and ceremonial rituals, among other happenstances, players can make sure the guardians they select to represent their tribe are recognised as worthy of respect.

In game terms, players manipulate stacks of discs of various colours over a number of rounds concluded by scoring both for population of their settlements (height of the stacks), as well as the rank of their guardians (the top disc in each stack).

Each round consists of players drafting action cards that rotate in and out of a shared pool, temporarily making some of them unavailable to both players. At the end of 4 rounds, the player who accumulated the most points wins the game.

name: Murder at the Cafe Resistance
description:
Who blew herr up?

It's the end of the Second World War and Herr Bevore is throwing a party at the Café Resistance. Everyone is invited, even his victors, but before the party begins he is bumped off in his bedroom by an explosive Roquewurst sausage.

Host your own party to find out who flambéed Herr Bevore!

—description from the publisher

name: Konter
description:
An exciting football match for two players.

During the game the players take turns, setting their pieces on any space of the football field. To score, a player has to connect the goal of the opponent in a continuous line with the edge of his side. If both players block the path so that no goal can be reached, it is a draw.

The first player to score five times wins the game.

—user summary

Nutze deine Chance ...

Wer führt seine Mannschaft
zu Tor, Sieg und Titel ?

Ein spannendes Fußballspiel
für schnelle Taktiker

—description from the publisher

name: Stoneware Tribe
description: In this game, each player as a member of tribe. Player should learn skill, get sources and complete tribe's requirements. Then won the symbol of honor - shell. Who has the most shell will be the only winner at the end of the game.

name: For whom the money tolls?
description:
For Whom the money tolls? is a game that a human player who received a request for relief from the civil war between three tribes of Elf, Dwarf and Werwolf intervenes and earns money by supporting the dominant power.

You can earn further on the basis of the money you earned, or acquire local people by buying local people, or get the title without paying any attention to money. you can take various strategies with each round.

And the final goal of the game is to make a local win in the round and finally become a mastermind that dominates the civil war.
categories: Card Game, Civil War, Economic, Fantasy, Medieval, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: じゅげむとショゴス (Jugem to Shoggoth)
description:
User summary
じゅげむとショゴス (Jugem to Shoggoth) (Jugem and Shoggoth) is a swift co-operative game, whereby the players use only two kinds of cards on which either "Jugem" or "Shoggoth" is written. The game takes only seconds to play.

First, deal 1 card to each player. From this point onwards, the players can only utter only the word on the card dealt to them, either "Jugem" or "Shoggoth".

Next, deal another card to each player. The players together hold the card in front of their forehead, concealed to themselves and revealed to other players, like Indian poker. Players then try to tell other players the cards they have infront of their foreheads (their identities), which is concealed to themselves.

Publisher's summary
「じゅげむとショゴス」は、「じゅげむ」と「ショゴス」のどちらかが描かれた２種類のカードのみを使うゲームです。
まずプレイヤー全員にカードを１枚ずつ配ります。
これ以降、プレイヤーは配られたカードに描かれた「じゅげむ」と「ショゴス」のどちらかの単語しか口にできません。
次にもう一度プレイヤー全員にカードを１枚ずつ配ります。
そのカードを一斉にインディアンポーカーの要領で頭の前で公開します。
プレイヤーはそれぞれ自分自身のカードだけが見えない状況の中、お互いになんとか意思疎通して互いの正体を教えあう協力ゲームです。
categories: Card Game, Fan Expansion, Party Game, Real-time

name: Kickflip
description:
Kickflip is an easy-to-learn and quick-to-play skateboarding card and dice game for 2-5 players. Players will play Trick Cards while rolling dice to determine the success of the Trick. There will be Flip, Grab, and Grind Tricks and playing them in certain patterns will earn bonuses such as rerolls and extra points. Each player will have a total of 3 different turns with each turn scoring its own points. At the end of the game, the player with the single highest scoring turn is the winner!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: The Conquest of the Moon
description:
A beautiful, educational and adventurous greek board game from the mid 70's. It was released from "Stam toys" toy company. It can be played from 2-4 players.
Each player takes at the beginning an astronaut and four rockets (same color as the astronaut). In every turn he roll the dice and moves on the board. There are some cards, which when you draw them (reaching the exact spot)you must follow the order. You can also put the rocket of your color in some spots on the board. When another player reaches those spots, he loses one round.
The winner is the first player who reaches the last spot.

—user summary

name: Name the Server
description:
The game you play with a group of people at a restaurant where you don't know the server.

Don't allow your server to give you their name.

Game Play: Round 1: Everyone at the table gets 1 guess. Round 2: The server may give you 1 clue and everyone takes 1 more guess. Round 3: The server may give 1 clue, everyone takes 1 more guess; if everyone is wrong, the game ends with no winner.

Correct Guess Points: -20 points per round after the first round, 100 points for the server's name, 75* points if it's their middle name, 60* points if it's an immediate family member name, 50* points if it's their best friend's name (*the server must offer this information without prompting from anyone at the table).

—description from the publisher

This game is free to download and/or print. DPH Games uses this as a promotional game. It is free to use and share. Please do not take credit for its design.

name: Mom's Bluff
description:
Mom's Bluff is a great game for anyone who enjoys talking smack. Be it, players who are locked in a War or someone who just bluffed, smack talk is in order.

Mom’s Bluff is similar to both WAR & Poker. The game is meant for 3-6 players. There are two standard decks of cards used in Mom’s Bluff. The objective of the game is to win as many cards as possible by knocking other players out. Have the biggest pile of cards when there are only 2 players remaining to win.

Mom's Bluff is a family game that can be transformed into a drinking game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Wann kommt der Osterhase?
description:
The players start at space 1. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the player. The first player to reach space 75 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: CubHitos
description:
CubHitos is a game based on the construction of milestones in the history of humanity where you represent a secret society that will move your threads to achieve or sabotage these projects according to your convenience, is a program of programming secret actions in euro style where to contribute your resources to the projects you will win victory points.

—user summary

juego basado en la construcción de hitos de la historia de la humanidad en donde representas una sociedad secreta que moverá sus hilos para lograr o sabotear estos proyectos según su conveniencia, es un juego de programación de acciones en secreto de estilo euro en donde por aportar tus recursos a los proyectos ganaras puntos de victoria.

—user summary (Spanish)

name: Ironsides: First Newbury, Second Newbury, Preston and Worcester
description:
Ironsides is an area movement and impulse game depicting four battles of the English Civil Wars; First Newbury, Second Newbury, Preston, and Worcester. In addition, there is a bonus scenario for Third Newbury, where the Parliamentarian armies declined to fight another battle.

One player controls the Royalist armies of King Charles I, King Charles II, and the Duke of Hamilton. The other player controls the Parliamentarian armies of the Earl of Essex, Earl of Manchester, Sir William Waller, and Oliver Cromwell.

Philip Jelley uses the same grand tactical area/movement design as Lilliburlero (ATO 40), with counters representing the generals and regiments of horse, foot, dragoons and artillery that fought in the battles. Each turn represents one or two hours of time, with weather and nightfall affecting command, control and activation. Scenarios are included with historical and free deployment, and optional units. Players may deploy on the edge of the maps and manoeuvre to a battlefield of their own choosing. Ironsides contains 470 ½ inch counters, one full size and two half sized maps, and a six-page rulebook.

FIRST NEWBURY, 20 September 1643: The Earl of Essex had marched his army deep into the midlands to relieve the Parliamentarian stronghold of Gloucester only to find the road back to London blocked by the Royalist Army at Newbury. In the bloodiest battle of the war so far 28,000 men fought each other to a standstill in the hedgerows as the London Trained Bands fought off charges by Prince Rupert’s Cavaliers. Horrified at the slaughter King Charles I withdrew to Oxford, and Essex returned to London in triumph.

SECOND NEWBURY, 27 October 1644: After their victory at Lostwithiel King Charles I and Prince Maurice entrenched their armies around Newbury, only to be surrounded by the Parliamentarian armies of Essex, Manchester, and Waller. Outnumbered three to one the war might have ended in an afternoon, but after desperate battle the Royalists survived long enough to escape during the night.

THIRD NEWBURY, 9 November 1644: Reinforced by the remnants of the Northern Royalists under Prince Rupert, King Charles I returned to Newbury to relieve Donnington Castle and recover the artillery left there after the last battle. Manchester refused to fight, Cromwell accused him of incompetence, Manchester accused Cromwell of insubordination, and the resulting furore led to the creation of the New Model Army. This is the battle that might have been.

PRESTON, 17 August 1648: The captive King Charles I made a deal with the Duke of Hamilton to restore him to the throne with a Scottish Army. Hamilton invaded England with the help of Sir Marmaduke Langdale’s Northern Royalists just as uprisings across England and Wales stretched the New Model Army to the limit. Cromwell force-marched his “Ironsides” 300 miles from Wales to join John Lambert’s Northern Army so they could attack the Royalists despite being outnumbered two to one. They defeated Langdale on Preston Moor, and caught Hamilton’s divided and disorganised army crossing the River Ribble. After his victory Cromwell marched on London, purged Parliament, and executed the King.

WORCESTER, 3 September 1651; Charles II succeeded his father as King of the Scots, but Cromwell invaded Scotland and destroyed the Scottish Army at Dunbar on 3 September 1650. Raising a new army, the young king slipped past Cromwell into England, and tried to rally English Royalists to his cause. Cromwell followed him with the New Model Army, gathering County Trained Bands as he marched south. Intent on a battle of annihilation that would end the civil wars for once and for all he surrounded the Royalists at Worcester on the River Severn. Seeing the Parliamentarian army divided by the river, Charles II attacked one half, but was defeated as Cromwell used a bridge of boats to reinforce his threatened flank. The Scottish army was destroyed and Charles escaped into exile.

—description from the designer
categories: Civil War, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Highest Bidder: Porn Stars
description:
Become a porn movie director looking for the best talent for your next project. Place secret bids on 14 unique characters (7 male, 7 female) worth points based on their industry experience.

Each round you are dealt 9 cards and are faced with three new porn stars at the center of the table. All players sort the cards in their hands and simultaneously at the count of three you place between 1 and 7 cards face down in a pile in front of you to bid on the first star. Cards are then revealed one at a time around the table, starting with the top card in your pile, and some hilarious and unexpected situations will arise as cards begin to interact with one another.

Highest Bidder: Porn Stars utilizes programmed actions. Once placed, you cannot rearrange the order of the cards in your bid pile. Some cards are Cash Cards which add to your current bid, others are text-based Effect Cards including "Draw a random card", "The next card revealed by an opponent is invalid", "The current Porn Star is worth double points", and more.

The game continues for 5 rounds with the final round having only two Porn Stars that are automatically worth double points. Will you go all-in on the most valuable stars or will you spread out your bids for an larger orgy of lower-scoring talent?

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Action Queue, Auction/Bidding, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sino-Japanese Naval Battle
description:
Sino-Japanese Naval Battle, a desktop wargame, is based on the storyline of the combats between Qing and Japan in the War of Jiawu, and it stimulates some of the most crucial naval battles. The game resembles a real naval battle that includes many uncertain factors, and only appropriate tactics will result in the success. In this battle concerning the two east Asian nations' future and fate, can you lead your own naval forces to revive or rewrite the history?

—description from the publisher

name: Crocodile: Mini
description:
You can take this compact set wherever you want - to long trip, cafe or meeting with friends. This is mini edition of popular party game - Crocodile. Lesser size of cards and lesser size of box. Now Crocodile in your pocket.


Takes about 30 seconds to understand rules.
Fun, noisy and sociable.
For any company.
You'd better not forget to put a video of this on tube!


—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Party Game, Travel, Word Game

name: Die Hansa und Klaus Störtebeker
description:
One player represents Störtebeker and gets the black pirate ship. Up to five players represents the Hansa and get a "Hansa-Kogge" each.
A token is placed at each harbor. All remaining tokens are places at Hamburg, where the Hansa players start. Each gets a starting capital of 6 tokens minus the result of his first die roll. The Hansa ships move on the black routes. Movement is determined by a die. In each harbor the first player collects the token. The Hansa players collect as many tokens as possible. The first player to get back to Hamburg after all tokens in the harbors are collected, collects all remaining tokens from the guild cashbox. On some spaces events hinder the players.

The Störtebeker player starts at one of the red spaces. He ist the last to move. If the pirate ship gets on the same space as one of the Hansa ships, it sinks the ship and gets all it's tokens. The same applies the other way around. Störtebecker may even steal the tokens in the harbors, expect from the guild cashbox in Hamburg.

The game ends, when all remaining Hansa ships are back in Hamburg. The player with the most tokens wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kingdoms
description:
Kingdoms is a 3-5 player card game based on the classic card game "Sevens". It is played with a unique deck of cards numbered 1-13 and each card has an ability written on it.

The objective of a round is to get rid of cards in your hand by playing them onto separate piles in descending order from 7 to 1, and ascending order from 8 to 13. The objective of the game is to be the wealthiest Kingdom at the end.

There are four "suits": Kingdom of Dragons (orange), Kingdom of Pixies (purple), Kingdom of Seafarers (blue) and Kingdom of Animals (green). In general, it is good to have cards of mid values as these must be played before the higher and lower cards can be played.

Players start the game with 20 coins each. At the start of each round they must pay 1 coin in tax to their Kingdom. When a player plays the "Tax Collector" (number 11) they get to collect all taxes currently on that Kingdom.

A round ends when someone plays their last card. All other players must pay coins based on the cards still in their hands — very low and very high cards cost more.

If at any point someone is unable to play a card they must take "the Plague". Whoever has the Plague when a round ends must pay an additional penalty of 3 coins.

There's a second deck of cards called "Prosperity Cards". Whenever you play the number 12 of any Kingdom you get to draw a Prosperity Card. These cards have special perks such as forcing another player to play a specific card, or moving the Plague to another player. They are kept face up in front of you and can be activated at any time during the game.

The game ends when someone runs out of coins, at which point the player with the most coins is the winner.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Australian Bicentennial Edition
description: Australian Bicentennial Edition, released to commemorate bicentenary (1988)

name: Show & Tile: Promo Packs
description:
This promo pack includes additional cards to expand list of things the players can build along side the base game.

Include as many of these packs as you like, shuffling them into the word deck! When these are in play, each player draws an extra card. During guessing, ensure the back of the card you've chosen is visible.

name: Ga-na-nam
description:
Vedic math inspires this minimalist, miniature card game.

Conceived in a dream by a Sanskrit teacher with a degree in math, this game explores the hidden life of numbers.

You have at least five numbers in your hand. Can you divide into your opponent's number while preserving your primes?

Strategy, skill, memory, risk, and luck are all features of the quick game play.

The challenge might seem easy, but it actually drives substantive cooperation and competition that is fun for kids and adults.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Educational, Memory

name: Extreme Rail Travel
description:
There are most dangerous and extreme railways in the World. You are one of companies that operated to build a railway across one of the most extreme environments on Earth.

Your train move across dangerous cliff, freezing cold iceberg and vulnerable slope. The more dangerous railways you build, you attract more audacious passengers. You not only earn money from them but also have responsibility for their safety.

This is a train building game for 2-4 players. You run your "roundle engine" to build the extreme railway. During your turn, you will move your conductor around the roundel to collect essential resources and invite those audacious passengers to get on your train. Apart from that, you build the railways from bidding on those railroad blueprints.

Although you can catch more passengers who want to try those exciting journeys, the railroad costs your more and more money and more and more harder to build if you don't manage your roundle engine well.

When there are no railroad-blueprint cards in general supply, the game ends. Players then score for their connected rails and their locomotive. Who has the highest victory points wins the game. If there is a tie, the player who has most coins remaining wins the game.

Who will be the earnest company and bring the most extreme rail travel to your adventurous passengers?
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Das Surf Spiel
description:
Game published by the German Surf Magazin.
Each player has two surfers who must both get home to win the game. It is a simple roll and move game, obeying good or bad spots your surfers land in.

name: Taste of Italia
description:
Only a few minutes left before the closing of the supermarket. Will you have enough time to gather all the necessary ingredients to your Italian menu? Organise yourselves et cooperate because you can't do it on your own... A cooperative game for the whole family!

After all the tiles have been displayed, the first player turns a card showing 4 ingredients. He has, with the verbal help of the other players, to find the way of a single colour leading to the first ingredient of the list before he runs out of time. The next player can then try and find the second ingredient, and so on until the menu is complete.

name: Tarok Tarok: Dealers Duel Deluxe
description:
An old twist on a modern design, a new table top experience based on the tarot decks of old. Pick your suit and build your kingdom, deploying heroes to fight and defend of attacks while your build your base and expand your empire. The suit features typical battle style cards, featuring themes from the old solitaire and tarot suits, as well as 22 major arcana wild cards that can turn the tide in your favor!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: Captain Gully's Buried Treasure Pirate Card Game
description:
Captain Gully's Buried Treasure Pirate Card Game turns your table into a tropical island ready for everyone to begin their search for buried treasure. Yo-ho-ho pirates, you will enjoy digging for treasure that includes gold coins, diamonds, sapphires and rubies. Along the adventure, players must avoid rough seas and pirate thieves stealing your cards. Ages 4 and up. Players 2 - 4 and plays in approx. 10 - 15 minutes. Get ready to laugh and have fun, it's time to raise the anchor and set sail for buried treasure! This game is sure to make kids laugh when adults salute their pint-size captain or when forget what to do first. This game allows parents and grandparents to help children age 3 and age 4 to learn the game by making mistakes and not following the rules - and kids love to catch them!

There are multiple ways to play the game so that as kids age, you can add variety and difficulty to the game.

The goal is to collect the most treasure card sets (depending on the option played) and the rest of the cards to be in the discard pile.

Option 1 Use only the 40 treasure cards for a matching game.
Option 2 Collect the most treasure card pairs.
Option 3 Collect the most groups of 3 treasure cards.
Option 4 Collect one of each treasure to make a set. (Most sets wins).

—description from the publisher

name: Soirée Pizza
description: Party game containing 240 cards with questions related to films and series, divided into 4 categories (question, mime, true/false, identify the film). Each correct answer is worth 1 point, first player to 20 points wins. No rules are enclosed, so players can make up teams, assign a game master to ask the questions to all players, or adapt the amount of points necessary to win to shorten or extend the game's length.

name: Murder on a Train
description:
In the coldest month of 1933, somewhere near the Austrian border, passengers aboard the Simpleton-Orient Express experience a murder that will change their lives forever! But who killed mysterious stranger John Doe? Go full steam ahead with up to 7 female and 7 male passengers!

—description from the publisher

name: Ravioli Roadhogs
description:
Ride around Raphael's ranch in a rapid race to reap rich rewards!

This game was designed live at the Penny Arcade Expo (PAX) Australia 2018, during the "Let's Make a Board Game - Live!" panel. 'Ravioli Roadhogs: The Pasta and the Furr-ious' was created on audience suggestions and then condensed into a tabletop board game to be added to the PAX Aus Tabletop Library (and in print-and-play through BGG).

Players are Italian hedgehogs planning their best routes to reach each rewarding cuisine. Plan your route, roll your dice, place your pasta al dente, but aim well or hit the rocky road.

The first player to collect all three dishes and return to the Start line wins!

-description from designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Bloody Christmas: A holiday themed drinking game for anytime of the year.
description:
Bloody Christmas is a drinking boardgame that tasks a group of players to make their way to the bar and then back home. The first player to do so wins. To do so they take turns rolling a six sided die and simply move that number of spaces on the gameboard.

There are three types of spaces you may land on.
