Ready, set, go! We point toward the person you estimated as minority.
We will open the card of the person with the most votes.
Result:


He is a majority : minority win
He is a minority : person with most votes lose
publishers: 北のゲーム部(North Game Club)

description: The game consists mostly of 25 double-sided fish cards which show one of 5 fish cards on each side (can be the same on both sides, can be different). These cards are spread out on the table. One player starts and places a boat token on a fish card, then flips up another fish card. If that card shows the same fish, they place another fish on the new card, etc. If the card shows a different fish, it's the next player's turn to pick a fish card. The player who places the ninth boat removes all the marked cards and gets coins from a market board. In the second round, the goal is to flip up the seventh fish; in the third round, the fifth; and in the fourth round, the third. Bonus points are awarded for correctly predicting the fish on the final remaining card. Whoever has most coins at the end of the game is the winner.
publishers: Adventure Planning Service (冒険企画局 / Bouken)

name: Picture Pathway
description:
Picture Pathway is a game of visual perception where players attempt to collect the most cards by forming Pathways. A Pathway is a chain of three or more cards where similar adjacent cards can be linked together by the number of nodes of the shape, the color of the shape, and the shade of the background. There are two ways to play picture Pathway: The Longest Pathway and Find Your Pathway.

In The Longest Pathway, players compete simultaneously to see who can most quickly find the longest Pathway in a set of twenty-five cards.

In Find Your Pathway, players take turns trying to complete Pathways between specific cards. Players receive an origin, inhibitor, and destination card to determine each player's individual goals. Each turn a player can flip a picture card, place a color token, replace their inhibitor card, or remove a picture card to work towards forming their Pathway.

-description from designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Elder Shadows
description:
Times are dark and sinister agents move in the shadows. Can you stop the Elder Ones from awakening?

In this 2-player asymmetrical card game, one player investigates several locations for indications of Cultist activity. Facing maddening dangers and grotesque specters, the Investigators duty is two-fold - find out what horrors lurk in the shadows and stop them. Be clever and investigate rumors to gather insight before the cult can awaken an Elder One.

The Cultist sets perilous traps, summons fearful specters and casts reality warping spells to prevent the Investigator from discovering the secrets of the Elder Shadows.

Each player is given a set amount of action during their turn to use as best they see fit. Will you draw cards or Investigate? Will you summon a Specter or set a trap? In a devious twist to standard card games, Elder Shadows implements a unique Sanity system making all cards more, or less, powerful based on the current Sanity level.

Can you expose the Cult before they can open the gateway to unimaginable horror?

name: Parade Down Tulip Lane
description:
The object of the game is to obtain the Dutch ideals of Health, Wealth, Peace, and Plenty. Starting at The Holland Sentinel, players will move around the board in a clockwise direction, according to the throw of the dice, until one player has accumulated:

5 Health cards
5 Peace cards
5 Plenty cards
$1,500 in Dutch Traveler's Cheques and/or investments.

—user summary

name: Catastrophic: Birds & Bees
description:
The first expansion for Catastrophic adds 40 new cards to the game around the theme of reproduction.

This includes animal traits such as Viviparous and Oviparous, which allow your species to reproduce with live young and eggs, new plant traits for wind pollination and the use of scents and deceit to help your plants reproduce.

The expansion introduces powerful new interaction cards, and new events that your species communities will have to handle, including oil spills and meteorites!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Polemos
description:
A battle-royale, tile placement, strategical board game with grid movement and resources management mechanics.

The game starts with putting villagers on the border and each stepping to the middle tile of the side. Villagers start moving by opening new tiles. They explore new lands and mine or find resources, kill enemies, buy new soldier... But they must be afraid of The Storm. The Storm is behind them, and the safe zone is becoming smaller over time. They must fight for that zone and survive. They can mine resources, help friends, shoot from catapult, be lost in a forest an much more.

A bit detailed:

Getting Started
To start a game you need to connect borders and place tiles inside borders. Then choose a color, take 2 soldiers, open the central tile of one of the sides of hexagon and place your soldiers on it. That tile is considered as free space. It cannot harm you or be used in any ways. Place the counter on one of the corners of hexagon, which will be counting point. After finishing the preparation choose the first player by rolling the dice, the queue will be determined clockwise. The goal is to survive and be the last man standing.

Turn
Each of villagers can do one action in each turn. The actions are: moving to neighbor tile, buying another villager, killing enemy villagers. Villager can move only to neighbor tiles (the tile which has common side). He must open the unopened tile after moving on it, if the tile is not closed by the storm. He can also carry the resources with him to the new tile (maximal quantity of each resource is mentioned on villager’s section), but resources only of one type.

Villagers
A villager dies after a hit from another. To hit an enemy, villager needs to stand on the neighbor tile of the enemy and move to another neighbor tile of an enemy, which is not an abyss, another enemy. You can only kill one enemy on a tile, if the enemy villager’s number is greater than one, you can choose which on must die. Villager dies immediately, when he stands on enemy tile. Player can use only the resources, which are located in it’s villager’s tile. Player must pay one bread , if his villager’s count is more than or equal to 3, otherwise he must sacrifice one of his villagers for each unpaid turn. On one tile can be placed less than 4 villagers. You can buy new villagers by gold. Bought villager is placed on tile, where is the other villager with gold. After death of the villager all his resources stay on the same tile, and everyone can take it. If that tile is not available, the resources go to bank. If player does anything with villager, he cannot cancel it.

—description from the publisher

name: World of Wonders
description:
In World of Wonders, you are a district Governor in a large but not grand civilization. The King will bestow his favor to the Governor that develops the most resplendent district.
You will do this by building city structures, discovering Natural Wonders and constructing Great Wonders, and thereby gain glory for your district and win.
This game plays 2-7 players with a dynamic change in strategy depending on how many players are at the table.
The game is unique in that the cards are used as workers to construct buildings, as well as the military to attack other players with.

name: Blacking out the Moon
description:
Players each have a board with the moon shown. On the moon are numbered spaces.

Players throw a dice and the number rolled can then cover the matching number on the moon with a blackened counter.

The winner is the first player to black out the moon with the counters.

Artwork suggest manufactured in the late 1940s to 1950s.

—user summary

name: The War of the Orcses: Mass Battle Rules for the Orc Civil Wars
description:
These rules describe an often overlooked period of warfare known as the Wars of the Orcses, a civil war between competing factions in the northern regions of Orcland. The war was fought between two rival branches of the House of Plantagut: the House of Lank-Pasta, associated with the emblem of the red rose growing out of the skull of a dead Angry-Vin Goblin – and the House of Yorc whose symbol was the white rose (growing out of the arse of a dead Stu-Wart Goblin). The wars lasted for over thirty years with many epic battles fought including the Battles of Stained Albans, Pewksebery and many many more. The struggle swung back and forth with first one faction in the ascendancy and then the other. The heavy loss of Orc life was both widespread and tragic – and neighbouring powers looked on with interest as Orcland seemed to tear itself apart. Eventually the war ended at the decisive Battle of Bogsworth Field and the crowning of the warlord Hen-Wee as king Hen-Wee VII. The kings position was further strengthened when Hen-Wee married Elibarf of Yorc, the daughter of Edturd IV, the most prominent Yorcist claimant to the throne of Orcland.

The Wars of the Orcses rules allow players to fight large scale battles between rival Orc armies with lots of supporting allied and mercenary units of Goblins, Hobgoblins, Trolls and Ogres. The rules included a detailed background to the conflict, the key players and a list of the major battles fought. Also included is a scenario describing the Battle of Pewksbery. If you fancy a bit of Orc on Orc action you probably need help – but either way these are the rules for you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Civil War, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
publishers: AB One Games, Dice the Apocalypse

name: Rise of Kings
description:
5 POPULATIONS. 4 NATIONS, 2 GAME MODES, 1 KING This board game is set in the Medieval Northern Europe and is a fusion of several board games and video games that have made the history of entertainment. It consists of over 900 pieces including soldiers, officers, relics, constructions and dices as well as an IOS and ANDROID APP.

The object of the game is to become the King of the Empire subduing other population in a economical war. Choose your population and, turn after turn, evolve to unlock features that will allow you to attack your enemies more effectively and move through land and sea faster. Conquer territories, capitals and relics on the gameboard, earn points in the APP and evolve to subdue the other population.

—description from the designer
categories: Age of Reason, Civilization, Economic, Farming, Medieval, Mythology, Religious, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Hands up ramasjang
description:
Oh no ? The villains have escaped. Help Christians to catch them. Roll the colored dice, and catch the fast and cunning villains. The more you catch, the better. Excitement for the whole family.

... a game about the Danish childrens show "Ramasjang mysteriet" for the youngest players.

Players take turn rolling the two dice. The color on the dice show which villain figures the player gets. If there's no more figures of a villain, you can instead steal that villain from an opponent - but only if he does not have two of that kind.
The player ending with the most pairs of villains win.

—user summary

name: Quadrille
description:
Quadrille is a four-player hidden identity game. One player is the girl in the forest, the other players are witches trying to kill the girl. One if the witches can be a traitor. If the girl finds the sword in the forest, she becomes the Hero who can kill the witches. It's up to the witches to see to that this does not happen.

The game consists of 12 cards and 25 markers.

-User summary
mechanics: Area Movement, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Pac-Man Maze Craze
description:
It's a race to collect the fruit as you roll the die and move around the "screen" just like the video game. But look out for the ghosts, Blinky, Pinky, Inky and Clyde! They'll try to get in your way and keep you from moving around the board and collecting your fruit.
—description from the publisher

Pac-Man Maze Craze was a Wendy's Kids' Meal giveaway based on the classic video game. Players roll a special die to move around a board representing the Pac-Man screen and collect a designated number of fruit tokens. Landing on a ghost token ends a player's turn and blocks a path. Rolling a ghost on the die causes loss of a fruit token. First player to return to the start with the right number of tokens wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Spooky Game
description:
The Spooky Game is a simple spin-and-move game contained in The Spooky Box of Books boxed set. Players spin to move their tokens on a track decorated with various scary creatures. Some space move the players forward or back, offer short cuts or cause loss of a turn. To win, a player must land on the finish space exactly.

—user summary

name: Race Car Rally
description:
In Race Car Rally, players roll a die to move their markers around a race track. Spaces with oil spills move players back two spaces. An oil can moves a player two spaces forward. The first player to complete a lap and reach the finish wins.

This game is included in the book Cars and Trucks Sticker Jigsaw Book.

—user summary

name: Murder at Tara
description:
Murder at Tara, An ACOS Gay Game. A Role-Playing Murder Mystery game for eight Adults.

MURDER AT TARA
Someone murdered Villain Legree, that scoundrel scalawag who was determined to steal Tara from poor Miss Harlot O'Hara by raising her taxes sky high. Villain used to be the cruel overseer at Tara, but now he's just dead.
It's up to you and your guests to discover who murdered Villain Legree - and why.

THE SUSPECTS
Harlot O'Hara --- beautiful owner of Tara Plantation. Since Villain saw her without her dress, it was curtains for her. People thought she was sweet on Lark Gaybelle, but perhaps everything was not as it seemed at Tara
Lark Gaybelle --- handsome stranger, hired to build a levee across Tara's lowland to help prevent the pasture from flooding. A dapper man, never without this spats and gold-handled walking cane, he made more than one's heart throb at Tara.
Butterfly the Queen ---- Miss Harlot's personal srvant. Flighty as his name, he was always there to lay out Miss Harlot's clothes -- and sometimes her beaux.
Leslie Coward --- the owner of the elegant neighboring plantation, Thirteen Oaks, and Oblivion's husband. Bespectacled and nervous as a mouse on a hot tin cat, he was afraid of his own shadow - especially one dark shadow from his past.
Oblivion Dehavilland, sweet wife of Leslie Coward. Oblivion, poor dear, was a bit forgetful since the onset of mental pause.
Rough and Ready the Tarlton Twins, fro the neighboring plantation, Fetish Hall. They were wild and kinky guys, and their lives were somehow entwined with poor dead Villain Legree. They both had meaningful relationships with various animals, vegetables, minerals, and sometimes even humans.
Mammy Dearest, Tara's faithful servant. She stalked the halls of Tara with her padded shoulders, serving Pepsi and True Grits in Southern style. She knew most of Tara's dark secrets, and she had a few dark secrets of her own.

—description from the publisher

name: Murder in Key West
description:
An ACOS Gay Game. A role-playing murder mystery. Includes audio cassette tape.

"Someone murdered Donny Doornail, beloved Owner of the Lambda Lodge in Key West."

Invite your friends! Assign each a role. Play the game that lets you solve The Murder!

—description from the publisher

name: Moderner Wettkampf
description:
This is a race between a runner, an automobile and an aeroplane.
The players start at space 1 and have to reach space 40 to win the game. Movement is determined by a die. There are 3 tracks on the game board. The runners use the pink and blue spaces, the automobiles the white dots and the aeroplanes the light and dark brown spaces. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: USA On The Road
description:
USA On The Road is a spin-and-move game originally included in Chik-fil-a kids meals. Players spin to move along a track that traverses the United States. Some spaces cause players to move forward, back or lose a turn. Other spaces ask players to do some sort of activity (e.g. pretend to water-ski or tell a story), sometimes earning an extra move or spin. The first player to reach the Statue of Liberty wins.

On the back of the game board is one section of a five-part game called "Our Big World."

—user summary

name: The Path to Glory
description:
The Path to Glory is a roll-and-move game originally published in England Activity Book, filled with various games and puzzles about the England soccer (football) team.

Players roll a die to move along a track representing a soccer game. Some spaces represent positive or negative events in the game, and move players forward or backward or even allow a roll for an instant win. The first player to reach the goal at the end of the track wins the game.

—user summary

name: Mort-A-Mania
description:
Welcome to Mort-A-Mania, the knock-down, drag-out, fight-night clash! Take on the role of necrosurgeon as you build your fighter out of the animated remains of last week’s toughest contenders. Purchase tumultuous tonics, scintillating spellbooks, and battle-ready body parts at auction using your own life; who needed those last 10 years anyway? Set your monstrosities against one another in a free-for-all winner-take-all combat to the undeath!

Mort-A-Mania is a quick-play beat’em up card game that’s approachable to all levels with an emphasis on player interaction. Spellbooks, tonics, and body parts keep the combat engaging and visceral. Perfect for a quick match or an all-night tournament, Mort-A-Mania promises to provide perpetual play and politics in practically precise proportions.
It’s Magnificent! It’s Mayhem! It’s…

Mort-A-Mania!

Mort-A-Mania is played in rounds, each round beginning with an auction. Cards are dealt onto the table for all players to see, then each player secretly bids on each card. When all players are ready, bids are revealed and the highest bidder on each card wins it and pays the bid out of their life pool.

After the Auction comes the Combat, where players take turns using their newly purchased limbs, spells and tonics to deal damage to their opponents. After everyone has taken their actions and the dust settles, damage is tallied up, dead players are eliminated, and the game moves to the next round.

When only one player left alive, they are declared that winner!

name: Dread Streets: The Cinematic Swashbuckling Game
description:
As far as the eye can see, it stretches on and on, the endless cityscape known only as the Dread Streets. In the afternoon, true to form, the Commoners bar their doors and windows. For the Heroes of Dread Streets are about to awake from their drunken sleep, to beat each other up in yet another senseless brawl!

Dread Streets lets you direct a swashbuckling movie, complete with ridiculous stunts, pirates, musketeers, freaks, drinking, brawling and lots of taunting.

After having toured conventions in Denmark since 2013 we’re finally bringing you the complete Dread Streets game as a printer-friendly PDF, complete with printable miniatures, cards and tokens.

FIRST YOU ROLL – THEN YOU PLAN! Your turn won’t be ruined by bad luck. You roll the dice before you decide what to do, then you plan accordingly. Experience humble success instead of epic fiasco!
MULTIPLAYER. Three's not a crowd with Dread Streets. It plays equally well with 2, 3 or 4 players.
COMPATIBLE. Dread Streets is designed with 25-28mm miniatures in mind, but our Zone system lets you use any size of miniature and/or battle map.
NO MEASURING. The play area is defined by the placement of buildings and terrain, not by strictly measured distances.
COMPLETE … SORT OF. The game comes with printable miniatures, cards and tokens. You only need to supply a battle map, terrain, snacks and booze!

—description from the publisher:
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: No Yolk
description:
First you get the chickens... then you get the eggs... then you get the coins! Jump start your chicken farm and sell loads of eggs in this card game for 2-6 players. Make your chickens extra happy with upgrades like Disco Speakers and Autofeeders. Happy chickens lay more eggs, and the first player to 15 coins wins!

Turn Sequence:

Replace any Fertilized Egg card in your henhouse with a Chicken card.
Calculate all upgrades, then collect an Egg card for each of your Chicken cards.
Draw 1 Action card.
Take any 3 Actions. You may use the same Action multiple times.
At the end of your turn, if you have more Eggs than you have space for in Egg Cartons, you must discard extra Egg cards.


Actions:

Draw an Action card.
Use an Action card.
Buy a Chicken card.
Buy an Upgrade card.
Draw an Egg card.
Sell Eggs


The first player to collect 15 coins wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Road Trip
description:
Road Trip is a spin and move game with a modular board. It was originally a giveaway at McDonald's restaurants.

The game consists of 20 punch out paper tiles printed with road patterns. Players arrange the tiles to create a town, then spin the paper spinner to move their paper cars around the board, trying to make it from start to finish. The spinner determines the direction of movement rather than the distance. All moves are one square. Spins may also move players to one of two traffic circles or allow movement of another player's piece.

—user summary
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Murder Happens: The Lilly Mystery
description:
Murder Mystery party game that you host at home for 8-12 players who dress up as their characters. One of them is the murderer and the others must figure out who it is by studying the clues, police report, map, crime scene photos, and cross examining the other players.

It’s early century, but the rapid development of steam technology makes it feel like we are living in the far future. Steam power has ushered in a technological age with machines and devices that are amazing. Steam power is modern power, yet the age old drives of greed, lust, envy, and hate still guide us, and still, murder happens.

The guests in this steampunk world arrive at the Lilly Hotel to gather in this quaint place in the middle of town, yet surrounded by woods. Actually, that sounds a little creepy. It’s a comfortable establishment with good food, but the Lilly’s claim to fame are the seances held there. So ghosts are expected, as are the lost loved ones. Perhaps what is surprising are all the tawdry foibles of the living; greed, secrets, lust, and the soon to be dearly departed.

So sit down at the table and as soon as the honored guest arrives by steam driven airship you can be assured of an interesting evening… and that someone ain’t gonna make it.

—description from the publisher

name: La Sfida agli 8000
description:
"La Sfida agli 8000" is an educational game about safety, equipment, etiquette and more about the world of mountain hiking. The game is co-designed by Marco Confortola, a professional Italian climber who already conquered ten "eight-thousanders".

Players compete in two or more teams. Teams win by climbing and conquering all of the fourteen eight-thousanders and to do so, they need the correct equipment. Equipment is won by correctly answering questions about the word of hiking, trivia style.

name: Patisserie Trickcake
description:
A trick taking game where you become a cake shop and sell cakes to your customers. From beginners to experienced people can play.

Play Summary

Each turn, the Leader plays a card. He takes the "Customer" card with the corresponding cake and places it next to the just played cake card.
Then, the player to the left plays and then in clockwise order plays a card.

Play a card with the same colour; if he can’t follow color, he places any color card in his correponding "Storage Area"
"0" card of other other cake can be used as a wild card (i.e. can be used to follow the lead suit)
If he plays a card with value 0-3, he can pull the cards from his "Storage Area" of that cake type and add all these to get a new total value
Compare the sum of the just played card with previous played card(s)
If the sum is same or smaller, he puts all cards into his own "Storage Area" of that cake type
If the sum is larger, the previous card(s) is/are put into the owner’s "Storage Area" of that cake type. He gets the "Customer" card and place it beside his just played cake card(s).
He chooses a card from the replenish row to refill his hand
The Leader gets the final remaining card from the replenish row.



The player with card(s) still on the table is the winner. If he is the leader, he takes the cake card as his score and returns the "Customer" card to the supply. If a fellow player wins, he takes the cake card as his score. He also gets the "Customer" card and the "Start Player" card. He now scores 3x points for that cake.
At the end of the game, each collected cake card scores 1 pt (3 pts 3 pts 3 pts with the corresponding "Customer" card). Who has the highest points wins.

name: UGO: Magic Garden
description:
UGO: Magic Garden is based on the highly praised UGO! In UGO: Magic Garden you are a wizard taking part in a yearly contest for becoming the best wizard. You're trying to plant exotic plants in your garden. There are easy, fertile patches of garden, but also patches that need the help of garden gnomes. You can also cheat by hiring goblins. But beware! At the end of the game, you'll be checked to see if you haven't cheated.

—description from the publisher

name: Void Zone
description:
Void Zone is a highly tactical pure strategy game set in the future where you pit your 2 robots against up to 3 other players in a constantly and dynamically shrinking arena. You win the game by out-manouvering your opponents and pushing them out of the playing area.

The game features a novel and highly thematic mechanic when the first player loses all their robots, the rate of arena shrink dramatically increases bringing a tense, engrossing, organic and rapid resolution to the game. The game is therefore designed to have a dramatic climax and if you are the first to go out, you will always want to see how it plays out.

Your robots have a Charge Chamber, which when filled can be used to perform upgraded actions to help give you the edge over your opponents.

Each turn you will perform actions with one robot, then perform actions with your other robot on your next turn.

On your turn, you will perform up to 3 different actions or the same action twice:
- Run. Move your robot round the arena. Each space on the board can only be travelled over twice so how you move is criticial to your success or demise.
- Jolt. Knock opponent robots (or even your own) one space to gain a tactical and positional advantage!
- Place Force Shields. Inpenetrable shields that you can place adjacent to your robot to use for area control or to help push opponents out
- Drain / Recharge Arena. Use this to take some power from the arena and power up your charge chamber, putting you at more risk or replenish the arena to give you some breathing space
- Jump. As the game progresses you will need this to help get you out of a corner or to cause spectacular KO's
- Upgrade Charge Chamber Capacity. You want to get more powerful actions? Of course you do!

If you find yourself in a tight spot and see no way out then don't worry! You can use your Prime token to give you some breathing space or to open a path to victory.

There are multiple variable player powers which provides great replayability and for more variants, there are rules for House Robots who add to the mayhem!

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Map Deformation, Map Reduction, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Hao Hao
description:
A new guest has arrived at the "Jardin des Mondes". It's Hao Hao, a wonderful giant panda! Help him find new friends and discover his new environment. But watch out for the snow leopard, he can jump at any moment. Be sharp and move Hao Hao thoughtfully. He will always be thankful.

Progress of the game:

On their turn, each player plays the following steps in order :


The player reveals 1 tile that is in sight of Hao Hao's figurine;
According to the animal that has just been flipped, the player has to reveal 1 or 2 more tiles, if they match, they can collect them;
The player moves Hao Hao;
All the tiles still face up are turned face down.


The game ends when Hao Hao cannot be moved to a tile face down. Players count their points (roughly equal to the number of tiles they've collected) and the player with most points wins.

name: Murder Happens: This Prom's Killer
description:
Murder mystery party game for 8-12 players that you host at home. Each player dresses up as a character, one is the murderer and the rest must figure out who that is. To solve the mystery there are clues, police report, crime scene photos, and a map. You go over these materials then question all the players about what their characters did and saw to finally solve who done it. The game lasts a times 2.5 hours.

Remember the excitement and glamour of your Senior Prom? Well now you can relive it, 1980s style. McKinley High School is having their Senior Prom, and like your typical prom there will be punch, snacks, a student rock band, and the coronation of the prom king and queen.
This could be any American population, with the in-crowd, jocks, geeks, dopers, losers, and even the well liked, super cool drug dealer. Don’t you remember how fun it all was?
On this particular prom night though there is more going on than your standard spiked punch and necking in a dark corner. Real murder and mayhem is brewing. By the end of the night you will be shocked and astonished and will have lost a considerable amount of respect for your fellow students and the school faculty (who would have thought!).
So throw on a boutonniere, squeeze into that tiny gown, fluff your hair up big and get ready to boogey on down with some punch, canapes, cookies, and some drop dead entertainment.

—description from the publisher

name: CAB! The Vocabulary Card Game
description:
CAB! is an educational card game based on the parts of speech. It involves turn-taking, incidental learning, peer teaching, spelling and grouping.
The game has the potential to improve vocabulary and literacy skills while engaging students in a fun experience.

OBJECTIVE
Be the first person to get rid of all your cards
 
SETUP
Each person draws a card. The player who’s card has the greatest number of letters is the dealer.
The dealer shuffles the deck and gives each player 7 cards.

Then places the remainder of the deck face down to create a ‘pick up’ pile.
The dealer takes the top card off the ‘pick up’ pile and puts it face up, to begin the ‘put down’ pile.

START PLAYING
The person to the left of the dealer begins the game.

When it’s your turn you must put down a card matching the top card on the ‘put down’ pile, either being the same type of word (adjective, noun, verb or conjunction) or having a matching punctuation sign
(! , ? ‘ : “” . ).
You can also put down any ‘action card’ (see action card).
 
EXAMPLE: If the top card on the “put down’ pile is the word ‘happy’ with a : on it, the next person must put down either another adjective card, a card with a : on it or a action card (see Action Cards).
 
If you don’t have a card that matches the card on top of the ‘put down’ pile you must pick up a card from the top of the ‘pick up’ pile. This is the end of your turn.

ACTION CARDS
The following action cards can be placed on the ‘put down’ pile at any point during your turn, no matter what the top card on the pile is. When an action card is played the word type is automatically changed to the same as the word on the card being played.

Pick Up 2 – When this card is played the next player must pick up two cards and cannot put down any cards. If they have a ‘pick up’ card as well they can then play that card, making the next person pick up four etc.
Miss A Go – When this card is played the next person misses their turn.
Go Back – When this card is played the direction of play is reversed.
Spell It – When this card is played the player putting the card down picks up a card from the ’pick up’ pile and asks the player, who's turn it is next, to spell the word. If the word is spelt correctly, the card is placed on the ‘put down’ pile and the speller takes his turn. If the word is spelt incorrectly, the card is given to the speller and they miss their turn. The next player in the sequence then starts their turn.

WINNING
The first person to get rid of all their cards is the winner!

-description from designer

name: Planetex
description:
Planetex is a game for 2 to 4 players from 60 to 90 minutes long. The players embody space carriers. Playing their action cards, they will have to travel the solar system collecting resources and delivering them to the planets that require them fulfilling missions and improving their ship.
—description from the publisher

Planetex es un juego para 2 a 4 jugadores de 60 a 90 minutos de duración. Los jugadores encarnan a transportistas espaciales. Jugando sus cartas de acción deberán recorrer el sistema solar recogiendo recursos y entregándolos en los planetas que los requieran cumpliendo misiones y mejorando su nave.
—description from the publisher (Spanish)
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Master of Disaster
description:
A natural disaster (or three!) has ravaged your town. People need food, water, and supplies, and time is running out. You need money now and lots of it. Can you navigate the twists and turns of utter destruction to save the lives of everyone in town before nature strikes again?
Master of Disaster is an educational board game that teaches about natural disasters and what to do if one hits in a fun and interactive way. Each team, or agency, has to protect the US from disasters, purchasing insurance-like protection based on risk and cost estimates. They earn money answering questions on the disasters. Each agency hopes to have to most money left at the end.
For each one sold, 100% of the profits go to hurricane relief.

name: Lustiges Braut und Bräutigams oder Verheutathungs Spiel
description:
Each player pays an equal amount of coins into the center space (wedding ceremony). The players roll 2 dice. If they roll two equal numbers they win the corresponding amount of coins from the center space. If a player rolls two different numbers, he has to pay the corresponding amount of coins into the center space.

On rolling two sixes, the player gets half the coins from the center space and the game starts anew.

—user summary

name: Invaders from Galaxy X
description:
Waves of aliens are attacking the planet. After the last spaceship of the invaders arrive you have limited time to destroy all your enemies or they will manage to send a message to their home planet to send more reinforcements. You must build your defense so it will hold until the last spaceship is destroyed.
The difficulty level of the game is set by the invaders wave layout. Changing the layout can change the whole game flow and make it more challenging.

The game is played using hex map and the units are counter that use the classic A-D-M indication.

Game Flow
The turn is constructed from the following phases
Activate aliens: Activate the current turn invading aliens by turning this turn aliens and placing them on board.

Reinforcement: The player receives reinforcements points that can be used to buy units and buy factories that will be placed on the board.

Activate: The player receives energy points that will be used to move the units that are already on board, energies units and launch defend satellites.

Move aliens: Move the aliens based on their attributes toward the cities.

Combat: If there are adjacent aliens forces to the defending forces then combat occurs between them.
Combat is done using D6 and a hit is determined if the result is lower or equal then the power of the unit attacking.

After the tenth turn end of game is checked:
The player wins if he eliminates all the invading aliens
The player loses if there are still invading aliens after the 15th turn.

The game participated in the BGG 2018 war game print and play contest and won the following awards:
2nd Place: Best Solitaire Game
3rd Place: Best Game in this year's theme: SCI-FI & FANTASY
3rd Place: Best Short/Quick/Small Game

—description from the designer

name: バハムート ゲート 拡張: Attack from Hades (Bahamut Gate Expansion: Attack from Hades)
description:
This is the first expansion for Bahamut Gate (バハムート ゲート). It adds a new method of play that gives special extra attack cards to the Boss and summons cards to the players. It also includes four new bosses. The new method of play can be used with the Bosses from the base game.

Different combinations of extra attack cards can be added to the game to adjust the difficulty.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Powder and Plunder
description:
Powder and Plunder is a pirate-themed deck-building, tabletop game. Each player controls a ship, trying to be the greatest pirate captain on the high seas.

Players use their deck of cards to control their ship throughout the game.

There are five types of cards including; order, loot, damage, raid and liar defence.

The game includes ship pieces of the players. This is a 2-to-5 player game, with the goal generating both wealth and renown achieved via card play.

name: Ngā Moana: Oceans
description:
NGĀ MOANA | OCEANS is the first game in a series that follows the Peoples of the Pacific as they stride from the stone to the stellar age, in a rich Universe of OCEANS, ISLANDS, PEOPLES, WORLDS, STARS, and GODS.

OCEANS starts this epic story on a small Island home. Players play intrepid Characters from the Island who are preparing to venture into the middle of the vast Pacific Ocean, at the calling of their Ariki (Chief), following the tale of a navigator that returned from sea with stories of the Great Fish of Maui.

Players will play as a small whānau (family), within the story. They will work to build Waka Hourua (seafaring boats) and their whānau Mana, while following the Seasons and the Atua (Gods) that drive them. Players move three Meeples representing three generations of the whānau around an Island, collecting resources and building their technology.

The game uses an asynchronous game ending mechanic, meaning Players can finish earlier than others, but risk missing out on building bigger, and better Waka Hourua. Additionally, when playing as a game series, Players order of completion in OCEANS translates directly to the starting order of ISLANDS, providing a connected narrative between the games.

—description from the publisher

name: Exocracy
description:
Strategy game, resource management and pits where your goal is to become a member of the Federation Z, a fanatical, extremist and strangely altruistic civilization dedicated to the conservation and exploration of the galaxy and the planets that form it. In this episode we must colonize the planet Azul 33A, which during the last stellar cycle suffered some kind of global disaster that has diminished the flora and fauna that inhabited it. You will have to restore the balance to the ecosystem, you will have to reforest forests and plains, repopulate the animal species and help the possible natives who have survived the hecatomb. If you think you are ready to restore your balance to the planet Blue 33A you can start your training as commander of the Z Federation.

The game is in full development, there have been several tests with great results and right now the rules are in the update phase, I hope to finish them in the coming weeks and update the profile of the game.

I encourage anyone to contact me with any questions about Exocracy or its development.

I am currently looking for an illustrator and a graphic designer to design the final image of the game, write me if you are interested.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, City Building, Civilization, Dice, Exploration, Humor, Industry / Manufacturing, Miniatures, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Travel
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Goo Nebula Panic
description:
Escape from certain death in a nebula made of horrific goo monsters! In this game you become crewmembers lost in the Goo Nebula, attempting to repair a small ship before time runs out. Little handmade goo monsters of various colours and levels of deadliness seep on board: you must hunt through the junk on board to find the repair parts for your engine, then race to the bridge and warp to safety! Randomised ship layouts and a random deck of playing cards representing the stuff on board mean that each game is different, but always fun and challenging!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: MAG-Miners
description:
Part of a three in one games system, MAG-Miners is a magnetic spaceship, flicking game for 1-2 players.

In solo mode, you will be in charge of a fledgling, asteroid mining company. You will try to blow up asteroids, collect the valuable metal ore inside and transport it back to Earth, all on a very limited fuel (flick) budget.

As you start to turn a profit, you will be able to afford more fuel for each mining trip. With enough wealth you will eventually unlock new ships to help you take out giant, ore encrusted asteroids in search of the fabled rare metals that will make you all filthy rich!

At any point during your solo campaign (or as a stand alone, heads up match), another player can take control of a band of raiders (with their own custom ships) and try to steal the miners ore and potentially capture their ships.

I am hoping this game could evolve with expansions full of new ships for the miners and raiders alike, along with even bigger asteroids to truly take mining operations to be next level.

—description from the designer

name: MAG-Wars
description:
Part of a three in one game system, MAG-Wars is a magnetic spaceship, battling game for 2 players (or 4 with an extra copy and a large tabletop).

In MAG-Wars, players choose either miners or raiders and build a small skirmish unit of ships with which to battle each other (based on the encounter’s points value and theme).

Before the battle can begin, the environment must be set.

Of the three games in this overall, magnet based system, both MAG-Wars and MAG-Miners will use a procedurally generated system to make sure each arrangement of asteroids and space debris is completely unique.

Once the environment has been set, players will each draw three hidden objective cards and battle will commence:

1.Players line up their ships on opposing table edges.

2.To decide who goes first, both players choose one of their ships and simultaneously flick them across the table.
The player who flicks closest to their opponents side of the table without going off is the winner and goes first.
Note: There will be practice mini games available in MAG-Skills (the third game in this system) which will help players perfect their flicking power and accuracy.
3. The first player flicks all of their ships once.
4. The second player then flicks all of their ships once.
5. Play continues like this with each player only being able to flick their mobile ships (right way up).

Beyond flicking to move, spaceships in MAG-Wars can do a number of different things. Here is a list of some of the potential actions that can be declared during a battle:

A. Attack - You can flick a ship at an enemy and if it makes contact, that enemy ship loses power and is immobilised (placed with its tail end down on the table).
B. Assist - If you have an immobilised ship on the table, you may declare assist, rotate that ship to the angle required and then flick a ship at it to try and knock it back down (power it up). If successful, that ship may be flicked this turn as normal (chaining multiple assist flicks can potentially power your entire team back up in one turn).
C. Repair - Some ships need only make contact with a powered down ship to be able to power it back up and get it flicking again.
D. Dock - Certain ships have the ability to dock with other ships. If this is declared and the flick successfully makes contact with an appropriate target (varies per ship), then the two become docked together.
A docked ship can be:
- Towed to its enemy’s portal and captured (removing it from the game),
- Boarded and looted,
- Did I mention these ships TRANSFORM!!!
Well actually they can be combined together in various different combinations. Should a player declare ‘dock’ and then make contact to the appropriate ship, the two ship models can be temporarily combined to form a ‘Hyper Ship’ with a very powerful and unique ability.

To win the game you must either:
Knock/have all your opponent’s ships immobilised,
Fulfill all three of your hidden objective cards,
Have the highest total ore value when all ore has been collected.

—description from the publisher

name: Waleczne Piksele: Osadnik / Imperialny Osadnik
description: Two additional cards Settler and Imperial Settler.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Toutilix Access
description:
Toutilix Access is a version of the game Toutilix, with adaptation for visual impaired and blind people.

In the game you will find 100 card with letters (2 alphabets and extra cards). You will find 12 Rules from 10 famous designers.

The card have 3D impression that make Letters and Braille point readable from blind person

—user summary

name: Crypto Go
description:
Crypto Go is an educational card game designed to teach up to date symmetric cryptography. Crypto Go decks consist of 108 cards, representing 6 types of modern cryptographic tools, each one represented by a color. Each player is also given 2 cheat sheet cards showing the security level of each cryptographic tool and how to combine the tools to provide confidentiality, integrity and authentication.

Crypto Go is a drafting card game. The goal of each player is to collect as many Crypto Kits as possible with cards of the maximum security level. A Crypto Kit is a set of cards that combines enough cryptographic tools to provide confidentiality, integrity and authentication properties.

Mechanics of the game are similar to those of Shushi Go game.

—description from the designer

name: Craftalong
description:
Craftalong. The Panduro game of creativity.

Game containing a large number of small DIY crafting items such as cotton balls, small wooden stics, beads, small glitter pompoms, etc, and glue. The players take turns to roll dice to determine which type of crafting item to sample - one at a time. When all players have sampled 10 items each, they start crafting a figure each using all their 10 respective items. The winner is the player who first finish building her/his figure from the 10 items allocated. Players should strive to make as nice and creative figures as possible.

Panduro sells tubes with refill materials for the game. However, the base game contains materials for many plays.

—user summary

name: Téki-Téhou
description:
Where does the panda live? What does the cassowary eat? Is the kiwi a mammal?

The cards present different animals in their bottom part and pieces of information about them in the upper part (their habitat, classification, diet et size).

Each player in turn must play a card with at least one common characteristic with the card played by the previous player. If one can't play, they must draw up to three cards! Luckily, there are som joker cards that one can play on any card.

The first player with no more cards wins.
Is that all? Of course not! You can as well annoy a bit the other players with some other cards, preventing them for example to place a mammal as a last card or making them draw cards.

One last thing, on a few cards, you'll find a music note. It means the one playing it must make the noise of the animal represented on the card, which isn't always that easy.

—description from the publisher

name: Card Reader
description:
18 card game (standard deck) simultaneous action game developed for Ludum Dare 43, a 48 hour game jam themed on "Sacrifices Must Be Made".

You win by making a stack of 3 cards on 1 pile or 1 of your cards on top of each pile.

Sacrifice low cards to the pit to destroy an opponent's higher card on the pile. When both players play to the pit the higher card gets returned to the owner's hand and the lower card is discarded.
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Hovsa!
description:
Roll and move game for four players. Each player have five slim pawns in their color. On turn each player rolls a d6 die and move one of their pawn along a spiral of 48 colored spaces. The goal is to reach the center space. The catch is that the board consists of two layers: An upper visible layer with holes, one for each space, for the slim pawns to rest in, and a lower layer with seven holes allowing a pawn to drop out of the game. Before playing, the lower layer is randomly rotated and flipped relative to the visible top layer. The players are only allowed to have two pawns at the board at the same time. A disappeared pawn is out of the game. If a player loses all their pawns the player is eliminated. Thus, players tries to remember the positions of the bottomless pits to avoid losing all pawns.

—user summary

name: Murder Happens: Done In Out Of Prescott Junction
description:
Murder mystery party game for 8-12 players that you host at home. Each player dresses up as a character, one is the murderer and the rest must figure out who that is. To solve the mystery there are clues, police report, crime scene photos, and a map. You go over these materials then question all the players about what their characters did and saw to finally solve who done it. The game lasts a timed 2.5 hours.

In a bare board town in the Arizona territory a steam engine idles while water from the Prescott Junction tower pours into her tanks. Puffs of steam periodically hiss from her sides. The weary passengers are not happy that the train will be delayed overnight. When they continue on their journey tomorrow though they might wish that they had stayed after all.
In a train headed out west from Chicago are all the western dreams. Starting a new life, striking it rich, and escaping the law. There are your typical conflicts as well, water, money, land, women, fighting, killing, and just general out west rowdiness. It’s a long slow trip and the passengers are restless, so a galloping train robbery might seem like a nice break from the monotony. Boredom leads to other activities too, you probably know what I mean.
This big as the western sky story has just about everything you’d expect in a western, plus some mysterious cursed tunnels, cattle, and murder happens. Which, in the general picture of things, probably isn’t all that surprising.

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Happens: The Beatnik Who Wasn't Beat, but was Shot
description:
Murder mystery party game for 8-12 players that you host at home. Each player dresses up as a character, one is the murderer and the rest must figure out who that is. To solve the mystery there are clues, police report, crime scene photos, and a map. You go over these materials then question all the players about what their characters did and saw to finally solve who done it. The game lasts a timed 2.5 hours.

In the medium sized town of Richmond, north of San Francisco, is a flourishing beatnik community. It’s not a big time city but they have gained some notoriety for their poets and artists. Richmond has the typical big city intrigues of politics and the art business. It also has drugs, wild music, orgies, political scandals, anarchists, wild philosophers and even some bikers that are all part of the scene.
Throw into the mix characters with criminal backgrounds, frustrated writers, fake artists and fake beatniks and you have a recipe for the oldest crime known to man.
Get out your bongos, berets, some Jazz, red wine, spaghetti, and garlic bread. Brush up on your beatnik lingo and you will set the mood for this titillating tale of coooool cat intrigue.

—description from the publisher

name: Öresund Svensk: Dansk Ordlek
description:
Swedish/Danish card game where you learn about words in the other language.

Made for the opening of the Öresundsbron between Sweden and Denmark in 2000.

Plays like Happy Families, but in two different languages.

—user summary

name: Of Dreams & Shadows: Potion of Courage Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for Of Dreams & Shadows.

"Potion of Courage " is a new resource card that you add to the resource deck at the beginning of the game.

It is am "Item," with a cost of 2, and the following ability: "Discard this card to regain two."

This promo was released in Game Trade Magazine #224 (October 2018).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing

name: Eine Frau. Ein Spiel.
description:
As a follow-up to Ein Mann. Ein Spiel., Marcel-André Casasola Merkle designed the game Eine Frau. Ein Spiel. based on the book, "Eine Frau. Ein Buch.".

One played reads a question from a deck of question cards, with multiple choice answers, and the quickest player to grab the champagne bottle token will give an answer. The player that is answering can wager an amount of diamonds based upon their confidence, and other players can grab the bottle and provide other answers.

The publisher's website includes the following sample questions:

Which faux pas are you not allowed to commit as a woman during a visit to the Academy Awards? Under what circumstances is a marriage null and void? And why may a convertible in Bavaria not be pushed?

name: Moogic
description:
Moogic is a strategy card game capturing the thrill of competitive cattle farming. Building and running an economically viable farm will require the skillful management of resources as well as the strategic deployment and timely slaughter of cattle for income. Along the way you will also raise revenue by milking your cows, breeding cattle and sending your herd to graze on both your own and your opponent's farm, all while attempting to defend your own patch of grass from your similarly inclined neighbor.

Players have a hand of cards from which they play farmland, cattle, action, enrichment, and building cards. Farmland cards are free to play and produce grass which can be spent to play other cards. Any unspent grass can be grazed on by your opponent's cattle to earn money. Money can also be earned by milking cows or slaughtering cattle. Action and enrichment cards directly affect the player or other cards in play. The winner is the first player to earn 100 coins.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Economic, Farming, Print & Play

name: Winnie de Poeh Junior Jacht
description:
Kids game, in which you try to roll sets of the same pictures by rolling 5 dice (for 3, 4 or 5 tokens), or roll 5 different pictures (for 7 tokens).
The first to fill up his card with 25 tokens wins the game.

—user summary

name: Se Rappeler
description:
Se Rappeler, also known as "Fun to Remember" is a box containing the components to play a series of children's memory games:


The Pairs Memory Game - the traditional "Memory" game where players turn over two cards at a time trying to make matched pairs.



The Countryside Game - On a board depicting an outdoor scene, a player arranges several pieces in the empty spaces and shows it to the other player. The first player then secretly changes one or two pieces and shows it again to the other player, who must identify the changes. Players take turns until one has identified ten changes correctly.



Kim's Game - Players take turns being the dealer. They place 20 silhouette pictures on the table, give other players a few seconds to look and then secretly remove one or more. Players then must mark on their board which pieces have been removed, keeping the markers for correct guesses. After each player has been dealer twice, the player with the most markers wins.



What Followed Next? - Players start with a set of eight pictures face-down. The first player chooses a picture, looks at it, says aloud what it is and then places it face-down, starting a row. The second player chooses a second tile, looks and then must say the name of the first and second tiles in order. The third player must name the first two tiles in order and then his or her newly-drawn tile. This continues until a player thinks another has made a mistake and calls for a check. The tiles are checked and whichever player is wrong is eliminated. Play includes until only one player remains.



In the Pocket Game - Each player has a board depicting 20 objects. Silhouette tiles of these objects form a supply. In turn, each player chooses a silhouette and hides it. The player to the left then asks a yes/no question about the item (e.g. "is it round?"). If the answer is no, the next player asks a question. If the answer is yes, the asker may guess the identity of the item. If correct, the player receives the tile and places it in the correct space on his or her board. If incorrect, the next player may take a turn. The player who wins the tile becomes the next to choose a tile and answer questions. The first player to get five tiles wins.


—user summary

name: Discover the Salem Area
description:
Discover the Salem Area is a Monopoly clone where the properties represent businesses and organizations in the town of Salem, Ohio.

—user summary
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Wrath of Kings: Rising Conflicts
description:
As the struggle to take the Throne of the Ancient King escalates, so too do the efforts of each of the Houses of Arikania. Wrath of Kings: Rising Conflicts brings a number of great things to your Wrath of Kings gaming. This 140-page, full-color rulebook features:

A polished Wrath of Kings ruleset – Combining the original rules with the FAQ, and tidying up some of the language for clarity.

An advancing storyline – The world of Arikania is rich and full of deep secrets that can only be revealed through the narrative.

30+ new units for the game – Each House receives six or more new Leaders, Infantry units, and Specialists.

World-building art – There are a lot of great art pieces that really give a feel for each House and the lands they inhabit.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Cell-O
description:
A strategy game for 2-4 people. Cell-O allows players to change their pieces over the course of the game, creating countless combinations of movement possibilities!

In Cell-O, each player starts with a single cell creature which can move, eat, multiply and evolve into slowly-growing shapes that dictate their future movement. Competing against other creatures for food and space, players must try and expand their population enough to escape the primordial pool of their species' birth into the greater world beyond.

During a turn, each player gets one action to move, eat, or spawn a new creature from an existing one. Eating gives a creature a new shape that then dictates how it moves in future. It takes tactics and foresight to mutate and expand your population in order to escape while preventing your opponent's from doing the same.

When a player gets enough of their creatures across the board and out of the pool, they win!

-description from designer

name: Storm of Spears
description:
Storm of Spears is a set of grand-tactical miniatures wargames rules for Greek hoplite battles of the late fifth and early fourth centuries BC. They also cover contemporary Rome, Etruria, and Carthage.

Despite the grand-tactical scope, the rules allow players to control quite a bit of tactical detail like file spacing and line depth, these being deemed critical to the tactics of the period.

Scenarios are provided for seven historical battles (all Greek), and orders of battle are provided for dozens of further battles and campaigns. The rules allow for troops based on 30, 40, or 60mm frontages.

—user summary

name: Blanc-Manger Coco: Le Petit Ballon
description: Promotional pack of 55 cards (including rules) included as a gift in the December delivery of the "Le Petit Ballon" wine subscription box.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Eia jõulud Tondikakul
description:
Based on the movie with same name.

In this co-op game local businesman want to cut off all the forest. Players must find evidence that there are living great grey owl in this forest. The species belong to red list so it is only hope to save the beautiful forest.

Players roll the dice, move their characters and collect the evidence-cards. Also the businessman move in the forest and try to remove the evidences. If any player collects the 5 different evidence cards in front of him/her before the deck is exhausted all player win. Otherwise they lose.

—user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Itancan
description:
Itancan is the Sioux word for Chief. The goal of this game is to be the first player to gain 28 feathers, thereby becoming Itancan (chief.)

Equipment:
1 board
6 playing pieces
1 die
28 peace cards
21 musket cards
60 feathers
12 value 10 feather tokens

The board is set up like a spoke, with the center spot being the Sacred Circle and is the starting place for all players. The four spokes signify the four directions.

Players roll a die and move that number of spaces on the board in any direction on a spoke. However, movement on the outer circle is only in clockwise direction unless when instructed by a card or other space directions.

The various spaces are:
Gaining and Losing Feathers
Peace Pipe Card - draw a Peace card and follow directions
Musket Card - draw a Musket card and follow directions
Eagle - gain one feather
War Council Place - If any player lands on a space occupied by another player both players go forward to the nearest War Council Place space. Once a player has twenty feathers or more he must give a feather to any player who manages to get them to the war council place as long as the other player has less feathers.

If you land on an unoccupied War Council Place space, the player who is closest on the board in any direction must join the player on that space.

Once a player gains 28 or more feathers, the remaining players have one turn to try and drop that player down to below 28 feathers. After all players have one more turn the player with the most feathers (28 or more) wins.

—user summary

name: Jewish Picture BINGO
description: This simple game is a version of BINGO in which, rather than numbers, players spin a spinner and match pictures. The goal is to "be the first player to get 5 Bingo markers in a row in any direction. (Horizontal, vertical, or diagonal)."
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Religious

name: Think Twice!
description:
Sixty pictures are on the tables. The clue you are given matches none of the pictures ....

Only one picture has a word sounding like the clue word you are looking for...and that's the answer!

So think quickly and find the matching picture before anyone else!

name: Calypso Cricket
description:
A fascinating and exciting game awaits you in the world of Calypso Cricket! Score runs, bowl out opponents, and go for gold in this classic game designed by Compton Welch!

Designed for between 2-22 players, each team plays cards from the deck when they are up to bat (played over two innings with one side batting out or one inning on a limited overs basis.) The objective of the game is to score the required runs, or when the team bowling last has captured all of the wickets of the team batting last below their score.

name: Salamamba und Fisolix' Zeitstrudel
description:
A small expansion for Salamamba. The players have some new goals and depending on the result of the game, they can open different parts of the expansion.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: The Ultimate Skirmish Game
description:
These rules will enable you to play skirmish or adventure games, using 40mm or 28mm miniatures, from any era of history from the Prehistoric right through to the Napoleonic wars. Games can be played with as few as 2 figures and up to about 30 figures a side. Rules for stealth, fist fighting, martial arts. multiple combats, cavalry, spears and a whole host of other weapon types are included. Most games can be played in a couple of hours and so are suitable for club nights. Although these rules were primarily designed for our 40mm Samurai range, they could be used with our 28mm Prehistoric Settlement. These rules will also help you find a use for all those part finished armies that we all have. As you only need a small number of figures, taking up a new period need not be a vast and time consuming occupation.

The game has a Character development section, enabling the Player to chart the progress of their Characters. So who knows maybe your peasant can make it and become a Warrior or even a Hero!

—description from the publisher

name: Sagoleken
description:
A fairy-tale based tricktaking game. The game consists of a number of playing cards and bonus cards. The tricks are played with the playing cards, the winner drawing a bonus card, keeping it hidden unless it's a princess which is kept face up.
The bonus cards consist of princes, lands, princesses and dragons. A combination of prince, land and princess forms a kingdom, worth points. A dragon can steal a face-up, non-kingdomed princess, and can be stolen back with a prince plus a certain combination of playing cards.

Once all three princesses are in Kingdoms, the game ends, and the player with most points wins.

—user summary

name: Fußball-Skat
description:
The game map pictures a soccer field. The players have to move a ball on a grid into the opposite goal. The movement of the ball is determined by a deck of 60 cards. Each player has a hand of 8 cards to choose from. After a card is played, it is discarded and another is drawn.

The first half of the game ends, when the deck is played through once and the second half ends when the deck is played through a second time.

This game was published in the 1950s.

—user summary

name: Pegasus Garden
description:
Pegasus Garden is a dexterity or "kinetic" game of card flipping and set creation. The theme is a garden party for mythological unicorns and winged horses. From 2-4 players may play the game and it takes about 10 minutes per player to complete. The goal is to get as many of your faction's beasts to the party safely. Players take turns flipping or dropping their cards onto the play field, attempting to create sets of their faction that will score points. Players may build their own score or attempt to foil their opponents by changing/removing their opponent's sets. Along the way, party goers may help each other get to the party, or perhaps get distracted by pretty butterflies and miss the party altogether.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Humor, Mythology
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Our Sputnik
description:
This Russian board game was released in 1961 by the Moscow publishing house "Detsky Mir" ("Child World" in Russian) with a circulation of 50,000 copies. The outer box shows a satellite resembling the Russian Sputnik 3 in orbit around Earth.

The game board consists of the Earth centrally located. A pin protrudes out of the Earth. On the pin sits a flat cardboard disk that has various sized holes punched through it. The disk represents outer space around Earth and is spun to play the game, producing a 3 dimensional playing board.

The game includes a springboard (rocket base) and 2 balls (satellites).

As the rotating disk spins players "launch satellites" one by one. They receive small chips if their "satellite" comes to rest in the punched out holes.

Players receive 3 chips, if their satellite comes to rest in the smallest holes. 2 chips if they can land in a middle sized hole and 1 chip if a player lands their satellite in the largest holes. The winner is the player with the largest number of chips after a nominated time or first to a set number (i.e. 10).

—user summary

name: Harem Wars: Negligee Add-on Deck
description: Add on deck of unique cards for Harem Wars. Contained 50 cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Harem Wars: Battle Girls Add-on Pack
description: Add on deck of unique cards for Harem Wars. Contained 45 cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Harem Wars: Galaxy Girls Add-on Deck
description: Add on deck of unique cards for Harem Wars. Contains 50 cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: すごくすごいヨガ (Hyper Super Yoga)
description:
Publisher's summary
すごくすごいヨガ (Hyper Super Yoga) is a Japanese tile game of speed and relaxation.

Let's yoga!!

The players get limb cards quickly from the pile on the table and puts them on their Yoga man to make Hyper Super Yoga poses.

Each round, there are special goal cards drawn. Players decide who made the best Hyper Super Yoga poses to match the goals this round.

By being as fast as possible, and getting the best combinations of goal cards as you can, you can earn Yoga crystals and win.

みんなでヨガをしましょう。
プレイヤーは場に置かれた手足カードをリアルタイムで素早く取り、自分のヨガおじさんに重ねて「すごくすごいヨガ」をキメます。
目標となる「すごくすごいヨガ」は、ラウンドごとに引いた複数の目標カードの組み合わせによって決定されます。
プレイヤーはできるだけ多く目標カードの内容を達成し、できるだけ早く中央に置かれたおしまいカードを取って≪ヨガクリスタル≫をたくさん集めましょう。
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Real-time

name: Harem Wars: Love Stories Expansion Set
description: Add on deck of unique cards for 'Harem Wars. Large expansion contains over 100 cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Harem Wars: Echo Tokyo Add-on Pack
description: Add on deck of unique cards for Harem Wars. Expansion contains 10 cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Harem Wars: Beach Bounce – Add-on Deck
description: Add on deck of unique cards for Harem Wars. Expansion contains of 100 cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Harem Wars: Alexa's Wild Night Add-on Set
description: Add on deck of unique cards for Harem Wars. Expansion contains of over 50 cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Sakko
description: Traditional symmetrical two-player game known from Sami areas of Norway since at least the nineteenth century, but may be significantly older. It might ulimately share roots with backgammon and/or pachisi. Each player has an even number of pawns (12 and 14 are known), the board has three rows each with one space more than the number of pawns (13 or 15). A larger king piece starts out neutral, but when captured becomes part of the capturing player’s army. It can be captured back and forth, but will never return to being neutral. It uses two or three four-sided dice (cubes with two opposing sides elongated into pyramids so the die can’t rest on them), marked I, II, III and X.

name: Last Stand: Fantasy & Semi-Historical Miniatures Wargame Rules
description:
Miniatures wargame rules for any semihistorical or fictional setting where close combat remains important (so including many forms of soft science fiction alongside typical fantasy).

Unrelated to any particular setting or range of miniatures, Last Stand divide all troops into a number of generic troop types amalgamating equipment, tactics, morale, etc. An army will contain about 25-60 stands of troops depending on types. Stands can be of different sizes but it is recommended that both sides stick to the same.

Sequence of play is an unusual continuous model rather than the more traditional fixed and repetitious order of conducting events.

The rules are aimed primarily at one-on-one play but solo, pairs, or teams play is possible.

name: Quarrelsome Creatures
description:
How To Play
Shuffle the deck and deal each player a hand of 11 cards. Set the remaining cards aside.

Each trick (or turn) of the game consists of every player placing 1 card into the middle of the playing surface, in clockwise order.

The player to the dealer's left begins the game.

For each trick, the first card played must be one of the game's 8 suits– cat, zombie, werewolf, witch, vampire, ghost, monster or mummy. Subsequent cards played in a trick must follow suit, unless a player does not have a card of said suit, or holds a special (!) card (which may be played instead). The player with the highest value card played, of the dominant suit, takes the trick. Players score 1 point for every card of any type taken, as well as bonus/penalty points listed on special cards.

The trick taker begins the next turn. Special cards cannot be used to start a trick. If the player starting a trick has only special cards to play, all remaining tricks of the hand are void, along with that player being assessed a -15 point penalty.

The first player to 100 points, wins!

name: DEKU
description:
DEKU is a party game that comes with two stand-up artist model figures, a die, words and phrases on cards, and multiple blocks. You use the box to create a double-sided stage of sorts, with teams facing one another and a wall on the stage between the teams.

In a round, someone rolls the die, then one player on each team starts trying to recreate the word or phrase using the artist model figure and any number of blocks. Once one person is finished, they count from 10 to 0, then the other player must stop. They then rotate the stage to show their creation to their other teammates, who try to guess what the person was trying to represent.
publishers: ハレルヤロックボーイ (Hallelujah Rockboy)

name: Flight to the Moon
description:
Post war Soviet space game from 1955 where players land on the moon and return to earth with rockets and a limited fuel supply. The game consists of a board, cardboard rockets and fuel tanks and a dice.

Players roll a dice and move cardboard rockets along a path. During the journey players maybe penalised for landing where a cosmic phenomena occurs or at a space station. Detours are in place but maybe avoided by sacrificing a fuel tank.

Players have a select numbered of spots to descend down to the moon otherwise they continue to orbit the moon until they land on the correct spot. A fuel tank is needed to land and take off. Players can land on the dark side of the moon but will miss a turn.

The return journey to earth has some detours to navigate around and upon earth re-entry (Number 74) if a player has no more fuel tanks then they must wait for another player to pass and tow them to earth.

The winner is the player to return to earth first after landing on the moon.

—user summary

name: 王様ゲーム (Game of Kings)
description:
User summary
王様ゲーム (Game of Kings) is a Japanese card game.

You are descendants of the oldest noble family who founded the current kingdom. Sometimes as a common priest, sometimes wielding authority as a king, it is your destiny to live in the kingdom cycling through prosperity and decline.

Will you gain the most wealth in the raging waves of fate, and leave the best legacy?

name: 関ヶ原 (Sekigahara)
description:
User summary
関ヶ原 (Sekigahara) is a drafting & bluffing game between the East and West Army.

Deciding which cards to pick from the hand is important; whether to pick a card with the same army, simply choosing a big number, or choosing an enemy card. There are many choices and strategies.
At this time, remember who picks cards that you did not choose. Your memory will have a great impact on the bluff battle held after the draft.

Sekigahara is a dense game packed with many mechanics, but it still a quick game, lasting only 4 bids.

name: わんわんわんだふる (Pooch Pooch Promenade)
description:
わんわんわんだふる (which is pronounced "Wanwan wanda furu" and which translates to Pooch Pooch Promenade) is a Japanese game in which players manipulate a "pooch pyramid".

On your turn, you play one of your two hand cards to move dogs up or down the pyramid, then you replenish your hand. At the end of the game, players score for the dogs they have in their hand and points are scored based on the position of the dogs in the pyramid.

name: チクタク・デブリーズ (Chikutaku Debries)
description:
Publisher's summary
チクタク・デブリーズ (Chikutaku Debries) is a Japanese game.

Collect the dust of the universe. The construction of a space mansion has begun. Hurry, pioneers of the universe! Rooms are first come, first served.

The universe is full.

チクタク・デブリーズ (Chikutaku Debries) is a game of competing to become the pioneer of the universe and to be the first to live in the space mansion built in zero gravity.

The desires of the settlers are intermingled, and the rooms become more and more complicated. Move through the space mansion well and push other characters to outer space.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement
publishers: FREAKY DESIGN (フリーキーデザイン)

name: Ortho 4x4
description:
This is the 4x4 version of the game Match 3+. It consists of 24 cards. There are four colours and four shapes. The colours are Blue, Red, Yellow, and green, and the shapes are Square, Circle, Triangle, and Diamond. Sixteen cards have coloured shapes, four cards have colours without shapes, and four cards have shapes without colour.
Each of the two players gets 12 cards. In turns, the players play a card with either the same shape or the same colour as the one played last on the pile.
When the players have no valid card to play, they pass.
When both players pass, the one who passed first can start afresh, playing any card s/he chooses.
Only a card with the same shape can be played on a card with a colourless shape.
Only a card with the same colour can be played on a card with a shapeless colour.
The winner is the player who first empties his/her hand.

—user summary

name: Tęczowy zamek jednorożców
description:
Tęczowy zamek jednorożców

Leśne zwierzęta usłyszały niesamowite historie o magicznych stworzeniach – jednorożcach. Nic więc dziwnego, że każdy w lesie zamarzył o pięknej, tęczowej grzywie, magicznym rogu, czarowaniu i pomaganiu innym.
