Stara legenda głosiła, że śmiałek, który przejdzie przez las i dojdzie do tęczowego zamku – stanie się jednorożcem. Na pełną przygód wyprawę zdecydowały się wybrać: lisica Kornelia, niedźwiedzica Zofia, sowa Matylda, jeż Stefan, zając Ignacy, jeleń Zenon. Na czubek głowy każde z nich ubrało imitację rogu oraz grzywy jednorożca i ruszyły w drogę…

Spin and move game for kids with a castle and unicorn theme. The first part is roaming the board and collecting items needed to get into the unicorn castle. While in the castle, the players need to collect the jewels and get to the finishing line.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Lifeguard
description:
Lifeguard is a cooperative game for 2-4 players; these players are a team of lifeguards at a crowded and chaotic outdoor pool, trying to prevent hazards and save any victims before it's too late.

The players create the shape and depth of their own pool; each zone in the pool fills and empties throughout the game with different risks, hazards, and victims in the form of facedown cards. The guards work furiously to flip over these cards and then work together to deal with whatever emergencies they uncover. Any waste of time results in more facedown cards in their pool, which means any unseen victims' conditions are growing more and more serious, making them harder to save.

In addition to the pool itself, the players can customize the difficulty of the game by adding more hazards or victims into the deck, as well as choose special characters and special abilities for themselves.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Italien-Reise
description:
The players have to travel through Italy from space 1 to space 80. The movement of the pawns is determined by a die. In some cities, events hinder or benefit the players. The last player who arrives on space 80 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ROKURIGO
description:
ROKURIGO is a two-player abstract strategy game that contains elements of Reversi.

The playing area is a 6x6 grid, although players will be placing their pieces only in the central twenty spaces. Each player has three types of double-sided pieces that mirror the numbers you find on opposite sides of a standard six-sided die: 1/6, 2/5, and 3/4, with five of each piece. Some numbers are printed on the game board.

Players take turns placing a piece on the game board. You can freely place one of your pieces in the four central spaces or on the second-closest row of the game board. If you want to place a piece elsewhere, though, you must "sandwich" a piece Reversi-style in order to flip it. You need to track the sum of numbers visible because if you bring the total to 33, then you capture one of the opponent's pieces. If you bring the total to 37 or more, then you lose the game instantly, so think carefully before you flip something!

name: Quantum Wordcraft
description:
Quantum Wordcraft is a crossword style game for all ages. Each player draws 7 cards and then rolls two dice for bonus categories or an extra card. Cards are worth 1-4 points depending on rarity.

It has similarities to Scrabble, but without the need for a bulky game board. No need for a board makes it very portable. You can also play words over other words.

—description from the publisher

name: Starcide
description:
A fast-paced, action, skirmish wargame in 32mm scale, set in a dystopian science-fantasy universe. Starcide reaches between the realms of sci-fi and fantasy with a dazzling variety of factions to select from including:

Legion of the Black Sun (blood-thirsted vampires and Soul-rending necromancers), Empire of Man (Unified Noble Houses of mankind) , Na'vo (cold-blooded reptiles), Prometheans (a human-like Psionic race), and the Locust (deadly insectoids with biotechnological space travel).

—description from the publisher

name: Zombies: The Cure
description:
Is tonight a night where you want insane family fun, or do you feel ruthless, and want to show your competitive side?

Zombies The Cure is a board game where you and your family will have just pure crazy family fun.

Zombies The Cure board game turns into a crazy fun card game. Take the game deck of cards combined with all the expansion packs then becomes a very competitive stand-alone card game for you and your friends to play.

So... go ahead and have some pure crazy family fun tonight.

A Government experiment has gone badly wrong, turning human and creature into the not-so-dead Zombies, monsters, freaks, and some ugly but cute little critters! Zombies are leading to the collapse of civilization, the not-so-dead, or not-so-living is taking over the living, unless it is dealt with quickly all hope will be lost. A cure exists, all you must do is pick it up and carry it to the lab, but be careful trust no one, not even your friends they will kill you, to be the one who takes the cure to the lab.

Zombies The Cure board game requires a mixture of luck and strategy, making it a fun, unpredictable game for the whole family. This kid-friendly, super-competitive, killer-fun game is Just Pure Crazy Family Fun.

The material can also be used to play 9RUN the card game, which can be played one single round or can be played with multiple rounds to see who has the highest stockpile points at the end. Just Pure Crazy Family Fun.

The object is to get your colored pawn to the lab with the cure.

Players can build up an army of cards that allow them to infect you, or sending you to the graveyard where you are forced you to escape or die.

A player may also steal your cure, even killing you and sending you back to start forcing you to begin all over again!

In this game of twist and turns, you'll need lots of skill and a little luck to maneuver your way of picking up the cure and making your way to the lab.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Oxford Street
description:
This game is based in London in 1890, and the player is setting up a department store. The store consists of a number of departments, which each need to be filled with stock. Customers come to the store with a list of items that need to be bought. If all items are sold by a single player's department store, then that player wins that customer. If the customer still has items remaining to be bought, then they move onto the next player's department.

This is mainly a card-based game, where customers, items to be bought, and departments are represented by cards, and stock is represented by small wooden cubes. On a player's turn, they can choose a customer from 3 available customers, who each have a number of items that they want to buy, the number of which are decided by the roll of a dice. Only the number of items to buy is visible to the player, not the actual items themselves, so it's only when the customer is chosen that the items are revealed and the player knows what can be sold. Players receive money for items sold, which can then be used to buy new stock or new departments at the end of their turn.

The game relies on players choosing the right departments to set up, depending on what other players have already chosen, and deciding which departments should get restocked and at what time, especially when money is limited. A player wins by being the player with the highest number of customers that had all items sold during one turn. There are bonus points available for having the majority of customers in each family of customer.

Game contains 70 cards, 50 wooden cubes, 1 dice, 45 £1/£2/£5/£10 notes and a rule book.

-description from designer

name: Horse Con
description:
A game of convention goals, but mostly horseplay.

All of the fun (and sometimes frustration) of attending a convention in one convenient game!

Collect swag, signatures, art or attend panels and other events to accumulate the most "fun" or "points" and have the best convention ever!

As with most conventions, however, sometimes things don't go quite as planned as your time quickly slips away.

Play against your friends and inconvenience them from obtaining their goals while attempting to achieve your own!

—description from the publisher

name: NU2
description:
Turn by turn in NU2, you choose tiles to build a path between your pawns: one path forward and one path back. Choose wisely, or you might be help another player to win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Box of Cookies
description:
Be the first to find the opposite cookie to win the round! Cinnamon or chocolate? Round or square? Solid or hollow? Plain or textured? Wavy or straight?

Who will spot the right goodie first to win Box of Cookies?

name: ダイスガールズ Track２ (Dice Girls Track 2)
description:
ダイスガールズ　Track２ (Dice Girls Track 2)

ダイスガールズ (Dice Girls) is a doujin game themed on pop singer groups from Japanese video games named "The Idolmaster" and "The Idolmaster Cinderella Girls".

This stand-alone expansion set of Dice Girls contains 18 additional Idol cards. The game can be played with any number of players so long as each player is dealt 6 cards, but game plays with up to 6 players is recommended.

日本のビデオゲーム「アイドルマスター」、「シンデレラガールズ」をモチーフにした同人ゲームです。
前作「ダイスガールズ」の独立型エキスパンションセットです。
18人のアイドルが追加されます。
１プレイヤーに６枚のカードがあれば、何人でも遊べますが
最大でも６人程度をお勧めします。
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Red, Green, Blue, Wink!
description: A game to confuse the brain. Not so much "say what you see" as follow the rules. Shout out colours from the cards or carry our the moves - but don't get it the wrong way round.

name: Crisis: The Economist International Money Game
description:
Crisis is a board game that was included with a 1990's issue of The Economist magazine.

The game focuses on the international bullion and currency markets.

Each player is dealt a mixed hand of currencies and gold, and attempts - through bluffing and card play - to establish monopolies in one or more holdings.

The game is a mixture of roll and move combined with card play, management and counting.

The game provides rules and board, but the players must provide cards and a die.

There is no designer credited.

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Warhammer (Fifth Edition): Champions of Chaos
description:
Warhammer: Champions of Chaos is an expansion to the 5th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (specifically to the Warhammer: Realm of Chaos supplement).

This 48-page softcover book provides rules for twelve Chaos special characters.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: ダイスガールズ Track 3 (Dice Girls Track 3)
description:
User summary
ダイスガールズ Track 3 (Dice Girls Track 3) is a doujin game themed on pop singer groups from Japanese video games named "The Idolmaster" and "The Idolmaster Cinderella Girls".

This stand-alone expansion set of Dice Girls contains 18 additional Idol cards. The game can be played with any number of players so long as each player is dealt 6 cards, but game plays with up to 6 players is recommended.

Publisher's summary
日本のビデオゲーム「アイドルマスター」、「シンデレラガールズ」をモチーフにした同人ゲームです。
前作「ダイスガールズ」の独立型エキスパンションセットです。
18人のアイドルが追加されます。
１プレイヤーに６枚のカードがあれば、何人でも遊べますが
最大でも６人程度をお勧めします。
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: ダイスガールズ Track 4 (Dice Girls Track  4)
description:
User summary
ダイスガールズ Track 4 (Dice Girls Track ４) is a doujin game themed on pop singer groups from Japanese video games named "The Idolmaster" and "The Idolmaster Cinderella Girls".

This stand-alone expansion set of Dice Girls contains 18 additional Idol cards. The game can be played with any number of players so long as each player is dealt 6 cards, but game plays with up to 6 players is recommended.

Publisher's summary
日本のビデオゲーム「アイドルマスター」、「シンデレラガールズ」をモチーフにした同人ゲームです。
前作「ダイスガールズ」の独立型エキスパンションセットです。
18人のアイドルが追加されます。
１プレイヤーに６枚のカードがあれば、何人でも遊べますが
最大でも６人程度をお勧めします。
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Mech Showdown
description:
18-card battle of mechs where the intial draft of equipment and weapons leaves two different mechs to use their tactical prowess to bring the other down.

Print-and-play card game based on the Battletech RPG. Tested, and created, by fans with attention to detail and balancing.

—description from the designer

name: Zoo Animals
description:
Zoo Animals is a memory game for 1-4 players, ages 2-6.

Each card in the deck features a name and picture of a different animal; there is one pair of cards for each animal. Players place the cards face down, and take turns turning over two cards, trying to make a match. Players who make a match collect the pair of cards and try again. The game ends when all cards have been matched, and the winner is the player with the most cards.

The game also features a solvable puzzle on the back of the game cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Alternatywy 4: Spisek
description:
Spisek ("Conspiracy") is an add-on (expansion) for Alternatywy 4.

Contains:

new deck of cards for the Host
new deck of cards for the tenants
new characters and their cards
new cards of Abilities
new deck of event cards
new activities on the board
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: ダイスガールズ Track 5 (Dice Girls Track 5)
description:
User summary
ダイスガールズ Track 5 (Dice Girls Track 5) is a doujin game themed on pop singer groups from Japanese video games named "The Idolmaster" and "The Idolmaster Cinderella Girls".

This stand-alone expansion set of Dice Girls contains 18 additional Idol cards. The game can be played with any number of players so long as each player is dealt 6 cards, but game plays with up to 6 players is recommended.

Publisher's summary
日本のビデオゲーム「アイドルマスター」、「シンデレラガールズ」をモチーフにした同人ゲームです。
前作「ダイスガールズ」の独立型エキスパンションセットです。
18人のアイドルが追加されます。
１プレイヤーに６枚のカードがあれば、何人でも遊べますが
最大でも６人程度をお勧めします。
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Vancouver Buses
description:
Vancouver Buses is a roll and move game in which players take on the roles of bus drivers travelling around Vancouver. The first player to complete a circuit beginning and ending at the Kootenay Loop exchange wins.

The game was developed by the Vancouver Environment Education Project at the University of British Columbia to familiarise six to ten year old children with the Vancouver transit system.

—user summary

name: Reel Masters
description:
Reel Masters is a 1-8 player tabletop fishing game. Move your boat, choose your lure and cast your line in hopes of hooking the monsters! Once you hook a fish, roll your dice against the fish to determine who is stronger. Pull hard enough and you can land the fish and earn a chance at cash for powerful upgrades.

Reel Masters has 5 species of game fish commonly found in lakes throughout the United States. This unique game truly captures elements of the real life experience.

Compete in multiple game modes with teams, solo or co-op. If your boat has the most total weight at the end of the game you win! The board changes every time you play and with multiple ways to play, Reel Masters is sure to bring fun to the table.

Good Luck and Tight Lines!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Simulation

name: Persist: The Game
description:
Persist is a card game that helps women laugh at the ridiculous role assigned to them in the game of life. The double standards. Being told to smile by strangers. Mansplainers and manspreaders. Unsolicited questions about family planning. Not to mention all the ways women are doomed to fail at living up to culture’s standard of womanly virtue and grace. We know we sweat, we don’t glow.

Persist calls bullsh**. By asking women, their friends and allies to put all the cards out on the table—by being real, Persist invites women to laugh, learn from each other, connect meaningfully… and get up to fight another day.

How to Play Persist: Be the most persistent by earning three cards of the same life value (career, health, leisure, or relationships) to achieve a milestone. Collect three milestones to win.

Cards fall under six categories of gameplay: truth, would you rather, trivia, sharing, roadblocks, act it out, and the occasional wild card. Each category requires a different kind of action for the player to perform individually, with others, or even the whole group. Once played your cards may not be safe! Other players may steal your cards if they are going after the same values. This is where things get fun!

—description from the designer

name: Goblin Derby
description:
Goblin Derby is a racing game for 2-4 players. The first player to finish 3 laps around the dangerous and haphazard track is the winner.

Before the race starts players must first scavenge parts from the junkyard to build their, often wacky, vehicle. Then, after assembling their monstrosity, players roll dice to move their cart along the track.

Watch out for the other players, they will try anything to win from ramming you to throwing rocks to shooting rocket propelled goblins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sjónarspil
description:
Sjónarspil is an Icelandic family and party game. Players get cards with adjectives and must choose the cards that best fit their opponents. Who in the group is the nerd and who is the helpful one? There is no correct answer, as players get more points the more players choose the same adjective. Great game for your group of friends, as the rules are simple, playing time is short and everyone acts at the same time - no wait for others.

—user summary

name: The Popular Entertainment Box
description:
Vintage family game suitable for people of all ages, playing individually or in teams.

A parlour party game, where players give answers or replies to puzzle type topics - as yet cannot give a date for it (suspect it may have been published around the 1950's, maybe even earlier?).
Contains:

1 x Question / Puzzle ring-bound booklet - 48 pages of different categories/topics

1 x Solution / Answer ring-bound booklet - 48 pages

name: Of Soldiers & Strongholds
description:
A 2 player chess derivative type game where players roll dice and set up Fortifications to gain control of and dominate the battlefield. Players will be able to obtain Supplies to aid their endeavors as they both vie for the top.

Each player controls one of four Armies which each consist of 7 different pieces (each Army differs in type) that can be used for tactical thinking, critical math skills for younger children, and a simple-but-fun and straightforward gameplay.

Suitable for ages as low as 8+, and the game comes with:

14 polyhedral dice
10 colored six-sided dice
2 white six-sided dice
9 Supply sticks
sheet of felt
rule book
piece of merchandise
game map


Players take turns moving their Armies across the board and attacking each other and each other's Fortifications as they vie for last man standing status. Player polyhedral dice start on their highest numbers and are reduced through battle until they are wiped from the board. Fortifications include: Outposts, Bases, and Forts, each with differing ranges and providing different advantages/disadvantages. Supplies include: Lapis Slabs, Hemp Stacks, Blood Vials, Gold Ingots, and Lavender Sprigs.

Can be played on the provided game map, or on any chess/draught board. Complex enough for adults to lose themselves playing for hours while still simple enough to appeal to children. Makes a perfect gift for the board gamer friend/significant other in your life!

—description from the publisher

name: 17 Steps
description: 17-Steps is an awareness-raising game. It’s to raise an awareness of the SDGs, there are 17 of them. You can’t talk about achieving the global goals if you don’t first create awareness about it. People need to know what it is. The game originated from the fact that we have 17 SDGs, and the game is supposed to lead you to a paradise. But before you get to that paradise, you have to take 17 steps based on your knowledge of the SDGs.

name: Atnor
description: Atnor (means ‘five’ in Eggon Language) is a game of five. Players are imersed in a tactical environment to have a set of five. Perfect for lovers of logic and strategy.

name: Luku Luku Abstract
description:
LUKU-LUKU is an education game with three editions – Noun, Abstract and Map. It’s a fast game and based on the name, it is about how fast your eyes can move. This game tends to make people aware of their surroundings. Lukuluku Map is more of a geographical game while Abstract teaches stars, numbers
and regular shapes in a fun way depending on what the player wants to learn.

name: The Battle of Adrica
description:
The Berzuline conference did not go as planned. Tempers are high, fresh wounds come to mind. The treasure lay awaiting exploitation.

It was clear a battle would occur.

name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): Dark Elves
description:
Warhammer: Dark Elves is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dark Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Tanks & Yanks: World War I 1917-1918 – Deluxe Edition
description:
It is now 2017, one hundred years since the United States entered the First World War on the side of the Allies in one of the most unnecessary and wasteful wars ever fought.

The research required almost got in the way of the game system, with diagrams and illustrations. Consequently after system, with diagrams and illustrations. Consequently after many rewrites it was decided to create one book as a game system and another as a simple note book. Both over lap each other. It did seem necessary to describe the tactical techniques in some great detail. Fortunately there is plenty of information on how these weapons were used on the battlefield. This availability of information made it possible to transform information into a realistic game system. However incomplete as it may be, the rules still effectively cover only a small part of the late ground war.

The game system includes supportive diagrams, illustrations, tactical notes and Quick Reference Sheets (Q.R.S.). The Turn Sequence and Turn Phases, once understood, make play easy and fast. The system has two Turn Sequences one of which is optional and the other mandatory. Six basic Turn Phases move the game along to a conclusion. Manufacturers will be glad by the fact that the game is best played using lots of figures and models. Let us be glad that there are sources for figures and models.

Basic units are 12 figures for a platoon with four platoons making a company and three to four companies making a battalion. Figures can be mounted individually or on multiple stands. Morale is based on unit size and applicable modifiers. Movement is with a D-10 die roll for both infantry and tanks. Transport and field artillery movement is determined by the roll of a D-6. There are two Turn Phases in which players can shoot. Hand-to-hand combat is easily performed. Players are always encouraged to adjust the rules to suit their perceptions.

To me, Yanks and Tanks captures the flavor of the late war. I hope your games will be hard fought, yet fun, and the game system competes well with other similar systems.

—description from designer

name: KOKAGNE 357
description:
KOKAGNE 357 is an abstract Domino style tile-laying game for 3 - 6 players.

The goal of the game is to be the first to get rid of all his Kominos.

Players begin the game with 5 Kominos. On his turn, each player places 1 Komino on the table and draws a new one at the end of his turn. Each Komino that is placed on the table (with the exception of the first one) must be orthogonally in contact with at least 3 symbols of previously played Kominos and at least 2 symbols must match. If a player completes an orthogonal or diagonal row with 3, 5, or 7 symbols of the same color/shape, he is allowed to give 1, 2 or 3 Kominos to his opponents.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Teflarok: Game of the Gods – Abilities Expansion
description:
In the game Teflarok: Game of the Gods, it does not make a difference which Norse god you choose to play as. But now, in this expansion, each of the nine gods have their own special abilities! This expansion adds new strategy and dynamics to the game. The expansion includes new rules, 9 ability cards for each of the gods, and a token for use with one of the gods.

Available as a a free print-and-play download or get it home-printed from the publisher when purchasing the base game, Teflarok: Game of the Gods.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Print & Play

name: Schicksalspfade: Kartenset
description:
The Schicksalspfade: Kartenset (Paths of Destiny Mapset) contains two double-sided game maps for the miniature game Schicksalspfade. The terrains are printed on high quality cardboard. They can be unfolded and put together in any way to reenact scenarios and campaigns from the Schickssalspfade base game.

In addition, the set also contains standees of characters from the base game, also printed on high-quality cardboard, as well as the reference sheet, the turn indicator and all the markers needed to replay the base game scenarios and campaigns. In addition, plastic feet are included in order to set up characters from a Schicksalspfade scenario against each other on the terrain maps.

—description from the publisher

name: S.O.S.petto
description:
A game that combines pictionary, trivial pursuit and snakes&ladders

Players take turns drawing a card; the team gain points if one player can guess the drawing made by his teammate or by answering to the question offered by the card.
Winner is the team that reaches first 48 points.

—user summary

name: Run For Office Card Game
description:
Politics can be dirty and politics can be frustrating but now politics can be fun with this fast-paced exciting card game. Players work to win the nomination of their party in the first phase of play then join together in teams to compete in the national election. Votes are gained by using political influence in this trick-taking game. Do you have what it takes to run for office and lead your country to greatness or, at least, have a lot of fun trying?

Run For Office is played in two phases of seven rounds each. The first phase is the Primary where each player works to win the nomination of their own party. The second phase is the Election where players work together in two competing teams to elect a president (winner).

In the Primary, each player gets a party, negotiates a platform by trading cards, and then gains Influence Cards. The Influence Cards are used to win Vote Cards by taking tricks. The Top two players who collect the most votes in their party are the winners of the Primary. The remaining players form teams with the two winners and a final Election takes place. Again, players gain Influence Cards to take Vote Cards through tricks but must do so in teams. The party members with the most votes at the end of the Election are the winners.

-description from designer

name: Endless Pass: A Viking Saga – Einar Boar Warrior Promo Card
description:
Promo player board from the 2018 Dice Tower Kickstarter campaign.

Einar has the special ability "Shield Tactics: ignores health damage from greek fire cards".
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Illuminati: Fake News Sites Promo Card
description:
This is a give away card distributed at conventions or by buying from Warehouse 23 (SJ Games' online store).

This card adds the Fake News Sites group to the game. This media group gives the owner advantages to all attempts to neutralize other groups, along with providing them with some transferable power.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Storm over Yasuda Auditorium, University of Tokyo
description:
Storm over Yasuda Auditorium, University of Tokyo is a two-player game of "Yasuda Auditorium Incident", a conflict between Tokyo Metropolitan Police's riot squad and All Campus Joint Struggle League, January 18-19, 1969 during University of Tokyo Protests.

FYI
https://features.japantimes.co.jp/student-riots/

The game system is based on Avalon Hill's Storm over Arnhem.
Riot Police player aims to remove university students from Yasuda Auditorium (and the surrounding buildings). University Students player aims to block it.

A sequel: University of Tokyo Too Far

name: Littlestorm Activity: Body & Letters
description:
A really nice and fun alphabet game. Let children learn the alphabet while they play a suerfun game.

Littlestorm Activity is a creative and learning-rich children's game which is filled with entertaining action.

The game can either be played as a team game or individually.

name: Singolo
description: Singolo is a chess variant where the player moves like the horse. All 64 fields of the board needs to be touched exactely once.

name: Gain Less
description:
The more you win, the more you lose!

The object of the game is to demonstrate the pitfalls of gambling. This is an educational game for young people (ages 6-19). It teaches them that although gambling sometimes brings in big money for them, most of the time it ends up with heavy loses, resulting in accumulated debts and addictive behavior.
—description from the rulebook

Gain Less is a roll-and-move game, with a number of "betting" spaces for players to spend money at. There is always a chance of winning more money back than you have spent, but the game is designed so that you lose money more often than win, similar to the odds found at casinos and other gambling houses. Gain Less is an educational game, used to demonstrate to young teenagers and adults that when you gamble, ultimately you lose more money than you win.
—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Suspekt
description: The players try to move their pieces to the center of the game board. But be careful: The other players should not find out which piece is yours! Therefore, bluffing is an essential part of the game.

name: Euro-Mille
description:
The easiest way to the Euro!
A family board game that can be played from 2-6 persons. Although Euro-Mille is directly linked to the Euro conversion, it can still be played as a nostalgic game to remember the good old times with different currencies in all countries across Europe.

name: Süßer Tod
description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Sweet Death

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

Fatal Truffles!
Armande de Coca is dead - next to him the best sweets from all over the world...

name: Schnurrende Zeugen
description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Purring whitnesses

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

The only whitnesses for the murder of Millicent Manners are her cats.

name: Mord im Atelier
description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Murder in the atelier

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

Albert Thomas, a well-known artist and art faker is dead. Who killed him?

name: Tödliche Diät
description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Fatal Diet

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

Claudia Culpepper is killed in an exclusive spa while she wanted to go for a midnight meal...

name: Tödlicher Kaufrausch
description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Fatal spending spree

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

A mysterious crime in a shopping mall where 2 men wear the same shirts and one of them is dead now...

name: Psychobunnies
description:
Psychobunnies – What’s that then?

It’s an incredibly addictive tabletop card game that challenges your memory & strategy skills whilst still having an element of luck that can come around to bite you on the backside when you least expect it. Oh, and it’s got psychotic bunnies. Don’t forget the bunnies.

To win the game, you need to ensure you have the lowest score possible each round. The last bunny standing is the winner. That might sound easy, but with only 10 seconds to view half or your drawn cards and the other half of your hand a complete mystery, it soon becomes more of a challenge!

Play can become incredibly strategic (e.g. do you 'play safe' and try to attain low scoring cards, or do you collect high scoring cards that others are more likely to discard, running the risk of being stuck with them when play ends?).

Then there's the element of luck. You have no idea what half of your deck contains. Sometimes at the end of a round, they're as much as a surprise to you as to the rest of the players. This can be a good or a bad thing! Add to that several 'Trick or Treat' cards designed to test your skills (and your sanity), and Psychobunnies is an absolute riot to play.

No bunnies were harmed in the making of this game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Party Game

name: Detective Mickey
description: This is an exciting memory game with Mickey and his friends for 2-6 young players.

name: Cinderella's Ball
description: An exciting dice game for 2-4 young players.

name: Party Pictures
description:
The judge draws a Party Pictures Card from the deck and shows everyone. Players select the best matching Caption Card from their hands and place it face down. The judge reads the Caption Cards aloud and selects the funniest caption. The player with the funniest match wins the card! The first player to earn five Party Pictures wins.

Contents:
75 Picture Cards (150 photos)
300 Caption Cards
Instructions

name: World Wide Wob: Das Spiel um die Zukunft einer Stadt
description:
The players may play different roles to further develop Wolfsburg, a German town.
They are experts in different domains, such as city development, real estate speculation, city council, VW group. The winner is the player who developed Wolfsburg the best.

name: Pizza Ninja
description:
Pizza Ninja is the fastest and most honorable way to order pizzas. We guarantee 30 minutes delivery time or our delivery ninja will commit seppuku to regain honor. Order now (Not serving pirates)!

Pizza Ninja is a solitaire game, were you will deliver pizzas to hungry workers in a business building. But beware the pirates that want those pizzas too.

During each of your turns, you can take four actions to move the Ninja around the board and deliver one of your pizzas on random spots on the board. Or you can fight nearby pirates with your Ninja skills. But after you have done your actions, all the pirates will move closer to you and the pizzas and even more pirates will enter the office. If they reach you and hit you, you will loose some of your precious time.

You win, if you can deliver all your pizzas to spots on the board before the time runs out.

name: Knightzz
description:
Knightzz is a thrilling game derived from Chess Knight.

The game portraits knights quest for ancient relics. Knight's Movement in the board is same as that in chess game (L shaped moves) and no movement is allowed to previously occupied cells. One knight can conquer another knight in his path. The knight who collects 5 relics first will win the game.

name: Four Corner Kingdoms
description:
Four Corner Kingdoms involves building a tableau of your kingdom using unique placement mechanisms to create combinations of icon types, suite types, etc. which score at the end of the game. Additional aspects of the cards can interfere with your opponents.

Players play two cards from their hands, one at a time. They place the cards in their playing area (tableau) which also represents a map of the topography of their land. There are rules about what terrain does when it is placed (e.g. draw an additional card, gain immunity to attack for the round, etc.). The rules of how the cards are placed also depends on the terrain type.

Your decision of how you make your kingdom depends on trying to score certain elements while also using less valuable (point-wise) utility cards (cards that give you more cards, etc.).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: CoAUTHORation
description:
A co-op storytelling card game where the players work together to guide the main character of a fantasy story to a suitable ending before any player runs out of cards.

Cards come in three suits: Characters, Places and Things. One of each card type is used to create the main character, the hero/ine of the story. A main character will also have a Trait and a Theme that help direct the narrative.

The players take turns as the Author to add cards from their hand to the table. Everyone who is waiting for a turn is an Editor. Editors offer suggestions (in the form of cards from their own hands), and reward the Author for creative plays with "Awesome cards" - as in "That was awesome!" - which are bonus cards added to the Author's stock.

Any card may introduce the namesake element into the story (eg. a volcano, Zombie, or mask), OR be used as an action to describe another character doing something (eg. incinerating, chasing, or tricking). The cards provide a growing pool of words to be used, reused and reinterpreted as the story goes on. The rules of narration may be as strict or generous as the players wish. Spontaneous role-playing and voice-acting are often observed in casual play.

The game ends when the main character's conflict is resolved, or any player runs out of cards. Players can resolve "cliff-hanger" endings in a number of ways: they may reveal the remaining cards, ad-lib a fitting resolution, or by player elimination.

CoAUTHORation can also be used for brainstorming or as a tool to overcome writer's block.

—description from the designer

name: Alaska Inn
description:
The rumor that the Yeti comes around at the Alaska is spreading out. A lot of Hunters hear it and gather for hunting the Yeti at the INN in front of the Snow Mountain.

Right here is the Alaska INN! Players become the hunter and hunt the Yeti for honor. Of course, some of them have no interest in hunting the Yeti and others seek to make benefit through the other ways! Sell the items to hunters, or research about the trace of the Yeti.
Anyway, this is most interesting case of various cases in West Land recently.

Players stay the Alaska INN during the winter season and expect to see the Yeti. Players place their hunters every rounds for performing the action they want. The capable Actions of players are following: Paying the cost to employ a hunter, Manufacturing the items using their own materials, Selling the own items, Scoring the points by providing the trace and by funding to INN, Going out for hunting (to catch the Yeti or material or the trace and others).

At every round, Environment Card must be open. The Environment Card gives issue to players regarding the trace, change of weather and etc. This game will end when the winter season is over or the Yeti is caught. At this time, a player scoring the highest point will be a winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Silent Crash
description:
Silent Crash is a social deduction bidding game of cornering the market on shifting resources.

​It is a 3-11 player game running to roughly 30 minutes play time per round. It requires nothing apart from the 2 page low ink PDF file available for download and printing at the bottom of the page. 

It is a simple bidding, bluffing and social deduction game designed to represent competing to corner the market on various stock market shares. Knowing if you've successfully controlled the market and betting accordingly is the root to financial success and crushing your competition. 

Originally designed based on a hidden loyalty bidding mechanic for a multi-player wargame, Silent Crash became too complicated to be part of another game, but not fully developed enough for a full release. As such we have made it available as a free Print and Play.

Players bid on whether they have the resource which occurs the lowest unique number of times. They gain points by successfully doing so and can swap resources based on other player's bids.  

—description from the publisher

name: Carrera de Mente: Para Genios
description: A box with 6 new books, with expert questions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: Ediciones de Mente, Ruibal Hermanos S.A.

name: Snap Action Football
description:
You secretly pick a running play. Your opponent sets a pass defense. Now go to the special Snap-Action dice for the outcome. Runs, passes, punts, field goals...this pocket-sized game has all the elements of real football...except the crunch of the pads.

—description from the back of the box

name: Trivial Pursuit: Sports Enhancement Card Set
description: An expansion set (cards only) consisting entirely of sports-related cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Gates of Leningrad: A Panzer Grenadier Game
description:
In the summer of 1941, German panzer spearheads pushed towards Leningrad, Cradle of the Revolution. Adolf Hitler declared the city's capture to be the leading objective of Operation Barbarossa, the June 1941 sneak attack on the Soviet Union. Desperate to stop them and preserve the city of Peter the Great, the Red Army repeatedly made valiant efforts to stop them, and just as often, the Germans rolled over and around them. By August the city had been isolated from the rest of the Soviet Union, but its defenders refused to yield. For 900 days they held against savage Nazi bombardments, writing an epic chapter in the story of the Great Patriotic War.

Gates of Leningrad is a complete Panzer Grenadier game based on based on the German drive to capture Leningrad, and the Soviet defense of the approaches. There are 30 scenarios based on these battles, organized into ten “battle games” that allow you to play the scenarios in sequence toward your army’s operational goals.

—description from the publisher

name: Galactic Bounty Hunt
description:
Galactic Bounty Hunt (GBH) is a gateway board game where each player controls one of six different Bounty Hunters that are taking part in the Great Hunt – the ultimate bounty hunting competition, which will determine who’ll earn the position of Leader of the Galactic Bounty Hunter’s Guild. Competitors will have to travel across the Galaxy, capturing dangerous creatures (and earning credits in the process) in different systems before being able to return to the Guild’s HQ and claiming the title of Leader. Equip your character with the best gear available and be on the lookout, for monsters might not be your deadliest foes – other Bounty Hunters might not want to let you earn the so-coveted prize of the Great Hunt! Good hunting!

Features:


GBH introduces players to many different gameplay mechanics and systems, in an easy to learn way – the perfect introduction to the world of modern board games. Mechanics include dice rolls, card drawing, luck mitigation systems (ammo, equipments,etc), PvP (player-vs-player) combat and more.
No player elimination and no Kingmaker effect: even when the game seems lost, players can still turn the tide in their favor.
Beautiful cel-shaded, comic-style art.
Six different Bounty Hunters to play as, each from a different species and System.
Twelve different kinds of monsters to capture, two of each element.
Dozens of different pieces of equipment, from weapon mods to consumable items, will give you an edge, as long as you choose carefully – and can afford them.
Warp through the Galaxy at light speed using the portals on each System – but take heed, for you can’t be sure where each portal might take you.
Fortune cards will keep the game unpredictable: they can help or hinder any of the players, independently of who triggered the event. Mix things up a little to turn the tide – for or against you.
Keep the best monsters you capture as pets to engage in fights with other players.
Falling behind on your trophy collecting? Not to worry! Board another Hunter’s ship, engage in combat and try to steal one of their trophies.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Reunification: A Letter-Writing Game about Reconciliation
description:
Your country has been deeply embedded in a tumultuous civil war for many years. Homes have been destroyed, lives torn apart, and families separated—including yours. Your family was divided at the beginning of the war, destroying any possible contact over the subsequent years. Finally, the opposing sides within your country have begun talks, and reconciliation is happening. Over the coming months, you are encouraged by the government to write letters to your family. In a year, the walls will be torn down, and citizens will begin the arduous process of coming together, finally giving you the opportunity to reunite with your long-lost family.

But do you even know them anymore?

Reunification is a game for 3-5 players where each player takes on the role of one member of a family that has been split apart due to a civil war. Throughout the game, you will ask questions of the other family members in order to get to know them and build up familiarity, empathy, and compassion with each other. It is a game of questioning and writing—in hopes of gaining insight and perspective, understanding and trust.

Through their answers to questions, players are creating and telling a story about the world they have created and the family they belong to.

name: Turn-Domino
description: Who can clap their hands under one leg, move like an "aviator", wave their arms and legs in a circle, or do the "dog"? In Turn-Domino, you lay out the tiles so that the colors match, then do what's shown on the tiles.

name: Selfie Speed
description:
Selfie Speed is a fast-paced game in which players compete to be the first to match their frames to the selfie cards.
The player who makes the most selfies wins!

Choose a set of transparent slides with the same frame color.


Pull 5 selfie cards out of the pile and place them in a row in the center of the table.

All players simultaneously place their slides on as many matching selfie cards as possible.
The player who makes the most selfies wins!


—description from the designer
publishers: Advance Games Co., FoxMind, FoxMind Israel

name: 'Eres To You Fuzzy Wuzzy: Colonial Wargames Rules
description:
Wargame rules designed to fight battles during the Sudanese colonial campaigns to relieve Gordon at Khartoum and then to re-conquer the Sudan.
These rules are intended to be used with 15mm-scale figures mounted on two-figure stands. They are very basic, and follow a simple sequence of actions (orders, movement, fire, melee, retreat).

name: Hordes of Dervishes
description: Wargame rules written so that small colonial battles in colonial Sudan could be fought as ‘one offs’ or as part of a campaign. Intended for 15mm-miniatures. Heavily based on the same system of De Bellis Antiquitatis, with a simple game sequence of movement, fire, melee.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Master Farmer
description:
A strategy game whose object is to collect the greatest number of vegetables in your fields. Players take turns drawing cubes from the bag
and creating a 5x5 grid by putting them next to each other. Each player chooses a vegetable to collect and tries to collect as many vegetables as possible within one or more fields.
The player with the most vegetables in their fields wins. What strategy will you choose? Add a maximum number of vegetables to your fields or try and block your opponents from collecting theirs?

Take out the 25 cubes from the tray and place them in the bag. Each player chooses a vegetable to collect, picks a cube and attaches it to the grid.
The strategy is always whether to add maximum vegetables or to try and block opponents.
The player with the greatest number of vegetables in their field wins. In the sample the player with the carrot field is the winner!


—description from the publisher

name: Belfedar
description:
This game is a fully cooperative game,
people are running along a spiral path and are trying to open 8 wooden doors in order to get out of a dungeon.
Its contents consists of 250 distinct challenges.
Each step to open a door requires to cooperate and develops team competence and spirit in the following fields.


better knowledge of himself and the others
self-esteem and group confidence
creative expression, developing creativity and imagination
feelings: expressing feelings and emotions (not judgements)
listening: observing and listening others in order to better understand his way of life
cooperation: experimenting with cooperation in order to better understand its advantages compared to competition and concurrence


The game requires some extra material not included in the box
pencil and paper sheets
according to the challenges : players may need, objects from the room, scissors, scotch tape, clothes, blindfold, scarf, rope, watch with seconds, bag,...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Catastrophic: Sink or Swim
description:
The second expansion for Catastrophic adds 40 new cards to the game around an aquatic theme.

You can now enhance your species with fins, scales, blubber to create aquatic animals for the first time, and your land-animals can also be enhanced with traits that improve water retention for dry climates. However you will also need to face new dangerous events including rising sea levels and nuclear winter!

The expansion introduces new interaction cards that help your new species form shoals, or even drift on ocean currents.

The expansion can be used with the base Catastrophic game or in combination with the first expansion, Birds & Bees.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Biatlon Plus
description: A popular biathlon, but with minimal coincidence and the maximum of strategic elements to win. This extension will bring you closer to the real race biathlon you love to watch. A lot of driving effects come into play, such as shooting fatigue, hook driving, and many more.

name: Werewolf In The Dark
description:
In an ancient forest there was a tiny village. The villagers had cut a clearing into the dark chaos of the forest and cultivated a space for the patterns of life to grow. Everyone knew everyone else’s name (and business) and the only dramas in the village were small ones. In short, it was peaceful.

But all that changed when, one night, a wolf’s howl split the darkness.

OVERVIEW

Werewolf in the Dark is a game of hidden roles, deception, strategy, and, above all else, survival. When the lights go out some are afraid—they hide and hope. Others know that it is up to them to protect their fellow villagers and drive back the monsters menacing them. Still others begin to the feel the dark stirrings of a terrible hunger and rise to hunt.

Werewolf in the Dark is played in two alternating rounds: night and day. Players join one of two teams: the village team or the monster team. Each night the lights go out and players get up and venture out to hide or hunt. The players on the monster team are trying to kill the other players by covertly tapping them on the shoulder until all the villagers are dead. The villagers are trying to survive the night round and gather information about the identities of the monsters among them. When the first dead body is found, the lights come on and the day round begins. All players then gather together to discuss what happened in the night round and vote someone out of the game. The game continues until there are only monsters or villagers left.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Fantasy, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Evil, Incorporated
description:
In this combined deck and bag builder from Brotherwise Games, Evil, Incorporated lets players take the role of super-villains competing to see who can become the most infamous. Players build a deck of plans and resources, recruit special minions, and build an evil lair staffed by those minions. Infamy is acquired over the course of the game, and the player with the most infamy wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Spies/Secret Agents

name: GRES: Desfile
description:
GRES:DESFILE (Carnival Parade), is a card game inspired by Brazilian carnival parades.

Your aim in the game is to combine the cards so that you accumulate the most points, creating the best samba school parade.

The game is divided into two phases. First, you collect the cards and combine them the best you can. This phase ends when the first player calls for the calculation of the results. In the second phase ("Apuração"), players will reveal the cards (show their parades) and the points will be counted. The player with the most points wins.

Be careful! You lose valuable points if it rains during your parade or your "Barracão" (art studio) burns down. But you can also be lucky and get some money from unconventional sources or have a little help from biased judges. So, prepare your strategy and make a carnival parade to remember!!!

—description from the publisher

name: Abar Depth
description:
Abar Depth will take you to a deadly dangerous reef, that most don't come back alive from. Filled with sunken ships and endless caverns it tempts lots of adventurers and artifact seekers. Many end up in a nearby tavern instead though, and play a game of magical dice. Dice, that can tell stories about adventures that were, and these that could have been. And there’s a lot of gold and treasures at stake.

Abar Depth is centered around said game of dice. 2 to 5 players can sit by a table together.

Each person rolls 2 dungeon dice, picks 3 character dice and attempts to defeat others in a game filled with treason, monsters and artifact hunting. Dice belong to different hero classes and offer actions like healing, attacking players or summoning a giant demon.

name: M as in Monkey
description:
Sigma the monkey really likes the alphabet and he is trying to learn the letters. Help him find the first letter in words, or the picture of an object that starts with a certain letter.

Bingo meets memory in this game where you help Sigma the monkey to find the letter matching your picture, or the other way around.

First player to fill all their double cards wins

name: Treats & Tricks
description:
Treats & Tricks! is a fun fast-paced game where awesome pets clash in an ever-changing "Chain of Command".

Treats And Tricks is a fun, easy and quickly played card game with adorable illustrations of dogs, cats, birds and rabbits/rodents. This game includes 52 playing cards so it is small and portable to take with you just about anywhere. You can play it two different ways - by playing tricks or by playing treats. This game plays different every time so you'll always be up for a new challenge.

There is strategy on how to manage your three cards you have in your hand. You'll have to play wisely to not waste your best card or give up low cards with high point values.

You are trying to gain the most points to win the game.
—description from the designer

name: All Aboard: Around the World Train Game
description:
This appears to be a simple roll-and-move game, with the theme of world railway travel, and based on an oval board game.

From the description on the back of the box:

First class, non-stop family fun from London to Rio via Delhi and Sydney!

Travel in style, stopping off at exotic locations to take in the sights. Watch out for obstacles that will slow down your journey, like leaves on the line, and hope to be sped up by express routes.

Set Up
Each passenger boards their train by placing a train token at the start of the train track.

How to Play
Passengers take turns in a clockwise order; youngest passenger starts. On your turn, roll the dice and move forward that many spaces. If you land on a space with text on it, read out the text and follow the instruction. If you throw a '6' you do not get another turn.

Winning
The first passenger to reach the end of the line and complete their journey wins. Keep playing until all trains have pulled in.

Contents:
1 x game board
1 x die
8 x train tokens [blue, brown, green, pink, purple, orange, red, yellow]

name: Random Narrative Game
description:
Random Narrative Game is an interactive, choose your own adventure style, group storytelling game. Players work together to create a cohesive story based on the setting, pathways, and choices presented to them. The twist is all choices are determined by luck and the roll of a dice.

—description from the designer

name: Idi-umms
description:
Let's not beat around the bush. Sometimes you need to let off some steam, right? This may be a far cry from your typical card game, but give us the benefit of the doubt, huh?
Now, I don't wanna let the cat out of the bag, but you really should jump on this bandwagon and take our game for a spin!
You may think we're not playing with a full deck, but there is a method to our madness. So get off the fence before you miss the boat and join us for a game of Idi-umms...

Idi-umms is a fast-paced, fill-in-the-blank card game where players compete to see who can earn the most points by recreating idioms using the word cards in their hand.

—description from the designer

name: Beg, Borrow & Steal: The Light Edition
description:
Do you like collecting things?
Do you ever beg your friends to give you things?
Do you regularly borrow things and never return them?
Have you considered stealing things you want?


If any or all these things are true, then THIS is the game for you!
In Beg, Borrow & Steal players collect sets of 3 identical cards by taking cards from other players or stealing them from the draw pile. The player with the most completed collections when the Steal pile runs out wins! Some people work hard to achieve success, but in this game, you have to Beg, Borrow, and Steal to succeed!


Both The Light Edition and the Dark Edition can be played separately or together as an expanded version of the game. Each game is perfect for 3-4 players in normal play mode. When combined the game can accommodate up to 8 players in normal play mode or 3-6 players in challenging mode.


—description from the designer

name: Deckfighters: Mixed Martial Arts Card Game Expansion – Purple Edition
description:
New cards, new categories, new abilities. Adds 12 cards to the standard DECKFIGHTERS deck. Each expansion pack increases the numbers of players by 2.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Starfarm Ceres
description:
It is the distant future, the year 2000. Mankind has colonised all of the rocky planets of the inner solar system. However Ceres, deep in the heart of the Asteroid Belt, remains a distant and desolate outpost even after the industrial process used to create fertile soils and an oxygen-rich atmosphere.

You are one of a few hardy (some would say fool-hardy) galactic pioneers who have sunk everything they own into a patch of Cerean land and a handful of 'bots to tend and defend it. For the rapidly growing crops of Ceres fetch premium prices back on flooded, overpopulated Earth. Meanwhile the warlike colonies of Mars, intent on their independence from Earth, continue to blockade and harass Cerean shuttles. Will you make your fortune and retire to the balmy resorts of Venus? Or will the challenges of Starfarm Ceres overwhelm and ruin you?

Starfarm Ceres is a worker placement solitaire game divided across three game boards. On the first, you deploy your 'bots to sow crops and harvest them once they mature using a unique time delay mechanism. On the second you must shoot down Martian saucers that multiply and descend to raze your crops. Finally you must send shuttles back to Earth, through the Martian blockade, to the third board where you sell your produce and buy upgrades. The language-independent game boards are double-sided with slightly different scenarios on each, giving eight different game setup possibilities.

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Farming, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Race to the Moon
description:
A spin and move game to see who can reach the moon first. Produced in 1959 possible as a supplement or to promote Dell Comics.
Players follow their individual paths from the Launch platform on earth to the moon, moving by the count of a spinner. A player may encounter setbacks and advances as they proceed along their path. A number of space stations along the way give a player an extra turn. The winner is the first to reach the moon.

name: Home Run Dice
description:
A new abstract strategy game, where a unique dice roll and a unique gameboard offers a unique challenge for up to four players. Escape with your dice to the nest on the other side and knock out your opponent’s dice on the way. It is not possible to make diagonal moves and the dice are moved by the number on the top but it must be rotated a quarter of a turn as well. So, the next move will be able to move a different amount of steps. IF IT IS POSSIBLE YOU CAN EAT OPPONENTS UNITS WITH A HORSE JUMP . L . POSSIBLE TO EAT AS MANY AS YOU CAN IF MORE THAN ONE HORSE JUMP IS POSSIBLE

—description from the designer

name: Flug zum Mond
description:
German game published as a special supplement in the Housewife's Journal in 1940.

A simple roll and move game where players start from earth centered in the middle of the board and race along 112 squares to reach the moon. The playing pieces are cut out hot air balloons. Along the way players can advance or be penalized on certain numbered spots.

Translated as 'Flight to the Moon' this German game has beautiful color illustrations, and written down the bottom is special supplement to 'The Leaf of the Housewife' (gr.1886) 54th year (1940).

—user summary

name: 蟻地獄 (ARIZIGOKU)
description:
User summary
蟻地獄 (ARIZIGOKU) is a Japanese abstract game for two players. (In English it would be Antlion Pit and the Romaji could be read as ARIJIGOKU). The game was produced with help from DIY 卓屋 (DIY Takuya), the manufacturing section of a board game circle named "Play Space Takuya" based in Sapporo, Japan. DIY Takuya helps by making game boards, components and organizers using laser-cut wood.

In the 2-player game of ARIZIGOKU, you try to save members of your faction from the Antlion pit.

At the beginning of the game, you are assigned one of four factions. Member tokens are scattered in a concave pit-shaped game board. Each member belongs to two factions, inscribed in each side of the token.

You have three actions each turn. By spending an action, you move your rescuer pawn to save a member, or move a soldier pawn to force a member fall one tier. If a member falls to the bottom, that member is lost.

You win the game when you save a certain number of members of your faction. You lose the game when three victims of your faction fall into the bottom of the pit. (Other conditions may apply.)

This game has two modes: basic game and standard game. In the standard game, there are Antlion turns in which the Antlions may capture members actively.

Publisher's summary
自分の救出駒が蟻地獄の巣穴に落ちる前に、戦士駒と協力しながら自分の印がある陣営チップを５つ巣穴から救い出すか、相手の陣営チップを蟻地獄に３つ食べさせると勝利となります。砂を掻き分け、陣営を見つけながら、この地獄から仲間を救い出せ！
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection

name: Culdcept: The Card Game
description:
A 1997 Japanese promo game to promote the Sega Saturn Culdcept game, only 500 in existence!
Created by Hobby Japan, Omiya Soft and Sega.
Based on the Sega Saturn game cards and rules.

Like the 1997 Sega Saturn video game, Culdcept the card game is a mix of Monopoly and Magic The Gathering.
Player summon monsters, cast spells and try to occupy as much land as possible.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Territory Building, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting
publishers: Hobby Japan, Omiya Soft, Co. Ltd., SEGA Games Co., Ltd.

name: Tante Anna!
description:
The first player to roll a 6 is aunt Anna's escort and places his pawn in the center of the game board. The other players place their pawns on any space (luck symbol) on the ring of their color. Then the escort player places aunt Anna on a heart in a column where no pawn is standing and rolls the die. He may move aunt Anna in any direction according to the result of the roll. If aunt Anna lands on a column with one ore more pawns, the player of each pawn has to pay a token, which is placed inside the hollow aunt Anna figure and the escort rolls again. If aunt Anna lands on a column with no pawns, the next player gets his turn. He rolls the die and moves his pawn clockwise. If he lands in the same column as aunt Anna, he gets chosen to be her new escort, if not, the next player has his turn. If a new escort has been chosen, the abandoned escort gets all tokens inside aunt Anna and her new escort gets to move her to collect tokens for him.

The game ends if one player looses all his tokens. The player with the most tokens wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: FlamingOs Card Game
description:
Get tropical with FlamingOs! Pair, swoop, block, and steal to win!

FlamingOs is a fun card game for 2–5 players. Players take turns drawing cards and pairing mingos to earn shrimp. 10 shrimp points earn a player 1 'O' card. (Shrimp cards are worth 1 point, Jumbo Shrimp cards are worth 5 points.) The first player to get 3 'O' cards wins. But watch out! There are Sharks, Pelicans, a Crab, Seagulls, and special Shrimp that can help or hurt a player’s advancement to win.
FlamingOs takes less than 5 minutes to learn and plays about 20–40 minutes.

name: Trivial Anime
description: This game is a Trivial game about anime where the players have to show how much knowledge they have about this topic. The players have to complete their anime character in order to win.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sensei Clash
description:
Sensei Clash is a 2 player game where you'll need to master the figthing styles of the snake, owl and tiger to trick your opponent and win.
You'll be placing cards upside down every turn and then revealing them simultaniously to see the amazing or terrible outcome your movements have had.
The first one that strikes its opponent down to 0 health will win the game.

—description from the designer

name: Eine lehrreiche Kometenfahrt
description:
Eine lehrreiche Kometenfahrt ("An instructive comet ride")was a promotional game to advertise the German company Torol and its gas lights products.
This roll and move game has players travelling through the solar system, starting at the sun and finishing at Neptune. Pluto is mentioned as a newly discovered planet (discovered 1930) but is out of order from the other celestial bodies. The game is instructive giving information about the planets.
Players begin by paying 2 Marks to the cashier and may add to the pool by landing on certain worlds. Some planets may give an extra throw of the dice. While asteroids or Halleys comet can send you forward or backwards. The winner is the first to land by exact count (number 120) on Neptune and collects the cashiers total.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Exciting Outta-Space Game
description:
The object of the game is for each player to complete as many orbits around the earth as possible without stopping on the space that sends the capsule back to earth.
Each player has a coloured space capsule and with the use of a spinner can send their capsule into orbit. During play the player may lose of gain a turn, advance their orbit or maybe returned to earth. If returned to earth the player still retains the number of orbits that was completed. The player can then return to orbit on the correct spin.
The game is played for a predetermined time, or go back into orbit a predetermined number of times. The player with the most orbits is the winner.

—user summary

name: Ten Frame Towers
description:
Stack your Ten Frame Tower with as many number bonds to 10 as you can to win. Challenge your friends to see who can stack the highest tower.

How To Play:

Roll the dice and take your tiles
Stack number bonds to 10
Person with the highest tower wins!


—description from the publisher

name: Rocket Satellite Action Game
description:
A three-dimensional game of skill to pilot a rocket ship to explore outer space. Published in the mid to late 1950s. The colorful board has planets and other cosmic objects viewed from inside a spaceship. Plastic spacecraft are guided along a space path using a magnetic control device. Points are scored either by flying successful legs of the journey, being penalized for going off course or hitting a Space Port or racing the course under a set time. The player with the most points or fastest time is the winner.

—user summary

name: Normandía: El desembarco
description:
Spanish wargame about the Allied invasion of Europe during the WWII.

Components:
-Map of 60 x 45 cm
-310 counters
-Booklet rules in spanish
1 die

name: Star Ride
description:
Star Ride is a board game where players travel though the zodiac and major star constellations. Players move a circular path around the board and have 4 star playing pieces which can jump to a zodiac constellation and onto the major stars in that constellation. The winner is the player who reaches the North Star first.

—user summary

name: Trade
description:
Ever want to navigate the seas? Travel the world? Run your own company? In TRADE, the board game, you can do it all: make decisions, be your own boss, and sail to victory! In this exciting new game of strategy and negotiations, you transport back to the 18th century in order to be in command of your own trading company. This international business is all about the gold, but watch out for your gold hungry opponents! With the roll of the dice, the selection of a port where you're destined to carry the purchased goods on your ship, and the luck of the winds - you can win it all! Beware of the adventures, fun, and laughs that are likely to occur along the journey.

From the box:

TRADE - The new exciting game of strategy, negotiations, and fun.

Can you navigate the high seas? Run your own company? Build the ultimate trading empire? In TRADE, the board game, you can do it all! Brave the rough Atlantic Ocean, make decisions, and sail to victory!

In this exciting game of strategy and negotiations, you return to the 18th century to amass riches in international trade. With the roll of the dice, you select a port where you purchase goods for your ship to carry. Next you transport these goods across the sea, for sale. Get ready for many adventures along the way!

Gameplay overview from rule sheet:

The basic premise of TRADE is simple: you enter a port with one of your ships, buy one of the goods that the port exports, transport that good across the sea, and then sell that good in a port that imports it.


You get 2 ships.
There are 6 goods available for trade: Sugar, Tea, Lumber, Rum, Molasses, and Wheat.
A ship can carry at most 5 loads of goods.
There are 6 ports (Boston, Charleston, Kingston, London, Lisbon, Africa).
You can purchase a dock at any port which cuts your purchase price for goods in half at that port.
Each turn roll 4 dice and divy those results up between your 2 ships.
There are 6 trans-Atlantic routes.
Each route goes through a central Hurricane space you want to avoid ending your turn on.
Along each route are "A" spaces. If you land on those you draw Adventure cards that can be a Task or a Demand. Tasks are missions you can complete for rewards. Demands represent the economic climate and change values of goods. Players vote to keep current Demands or adopt the new Demands.
You can sabotage opponent ships if you are in the same space by paying gold to destroy their goods.
If a player lands on the Hurricane, all ships not in a port are drawn towards the hurricane.
You can bribe other players in exchange for non-binding verbal agreements (votes, etc.)
Play continues until the last Adventure card is drawn. Highest score wins.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Economic, Educational, Math, Nautical, Negotiation, Number, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: Operation Apollo
description:
Operation Apollo is a race to the moon and back published late 1960s. The game has a 3 dimensional metal earth and moon embedded into the board and 2 roulette wheels. The spaceship playing pieces separate into 3 stages (rocket, command and lunar module). The lunar module is magnetic to stick to the moon.

By the spin of the roulette wheel players leave earth and travel in an orbital path to the moon, needing to land on certain spots to enter a moon orbit and landing. The playing pieces separate on landing, with the Command module remaining in lunar orbit. The lunar module lands on the moon and remains. Players then travel back to earth needing to re-enter at a critical point. If their spaceship overshoots your lost in space and out the game. The first to have their command module back to earth is the winner.

—user summary

name: Valuable Vases
description:
Valuable Vases is a fun lightweight social deduction party game. Plays compete to collect all types of vases by “stealing” them from other players. But get caught stealing the wrong vase and you may end up with more loss than gain.

Story: While coming back from selling what you stole, in the market you were tired. Walking home in the dark night, the moonlight shows you your path. From the street you see a shiny white ceramic vase sitting on a window sill. Your steal for today was over but the thief in you provokes, saying “ An extra sell will help tomorrow”. As everyone is asleep you tip toe and slide the vase in your bag. A few steps ahead you see another Blue vase and carefully slip that as well.

You escape the house well, but just as you step out you bump into another black hooded thief. With a sly smile he asks “What have you got in your bag?”

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Unicorn Hoopla
description: The box contains two unicorn headbands and six decorated rings. The headbands have a unicorn horn on them so when you are wearing one you become a unicorn. Each player wears a headband and takes three rings. The layers then take it in turns to throw their rings at the other players unicorn horn. Whichever player gets the most rings over the other player’s horn is the winner.

name: Furloughed Friends: A Government Shutdown Game
description:
The shutdown continues. Federal government agencies are closed over disagreements for funding to build a wall along the southern border of the United States. Tension is mounting in DC and Americans across the country are and struggling from inability to access certain services. See if you can make a deal or build the wall before our elected officials!

Players are divided into Team Democrat and Team Republican. Democrats win by passing appropriation bills to reopen the closed agencies before Republicans secure funding for the wall. Republicans win by securing funding for the wall before Democrats reopen closed agencies. Players reopen agencies/build the wall by advancing spaces along the board which has a map of DC with federal buildings and the southern border of the United States. Individual players can also negotiate to reach a deal.

Either party can win if it receives a 70 percent or higher approval rating based how they play their cards to win the hearts and minds of the American public.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement, Voting

name: Adventure Post: Adrift
description:
Adventure Post is a series of solo-mini-adventures delivered to your door on a postcard each week. Every week is a small portion of an overall larger campaign which will take many, many weeks to come to conclusion. The postcard will include a QR code or website address that will direct you to the weekly adventure document. The document will explain the setup, instructions, and key areas on the adventure map.

Adrift uses simplistic dice rolls for combat and interacting with the world. You play a the crew of the USF Montoya as they battle to keep their ship operational and sleeping passengers safe from harm.

The Story:
The USF “Montoya” has a skeleton crew in operation, while the colony of “Unnamed” remain in cryo-stasis, Shortly after a burn
manoeuvre the “Montoya” had a major impact, the cause is likely to be a derelict or rogue asteroid.
Alarms have sounded and the command crew have woken all available crew to restore vital functions. The ships log recorded by the Computer “TREVOR” recorded the above. TREVOR has suggested to you the Captain:
1: Engineering to survey hull for breaches.
2: Restore the main power.
3: Navigation to restore Subspace.
4: geometrics to find location.
5: Analyse Cryo-stasis systems and stabilise.
6: Security, a small squad of Federation Marines to secure the ship and repel borders if required.
7: Engineering to re-engage Hyperlight drive.

Adrift is only the first adventure in a larger overall campaign. There are more adventures of different themes and new rules on the horizon.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Janko
description:
