Each player sets his numbered tokens on the corresponding spaces with the white dots. The players roll the die once a turn and sets the token with the rolled number on the space with the black dots. If a player rolls a number, where the token is already on the space with the black dots, he has to pay a coin into the cash box. If a player rolls a 6 he may roll again. If he rolls another 6, he wins all coins from the cash box.

The first player to to get all 6 tokens to the spaces with the black dots, wins half the coins from the cash box. The last player to achieve this gets the remaining coins from the cash box.

—user summary

name: El tanque the bite game
description:
Fight against other sharks for being the winner of the best food, the tank is small and the sharks are very focused on their decisions.

In this competitive dexterity and skill game, each player is a shark that seeks to obtain the greatest and best investment in food, for this account with your jaws and your agility.
The dice dictate what type of food to take before others.
The shark with the most points in its chips will be the winner at the end of the game.

name: Turtle
description: Turtle is a dice game where the object is to be the last player remaining on the turtle race track. The race track is one hundred feet long. As soon as a player crosses the finish line that player is out of the game.

name: Step Right Up
description:
A carnival-themed roll and move that promises players will "learn carny language", among other thrilling benefits.

—user summary

name: Demon Arm
description:
Demon Arm is a solitaire gamebook originally written for the November 2012 24-Hour Design Contest about a quest for freedom and revenge. Huko is a soldier-turned-ronin who is cursed by the sorcerer Kulaki. A demon partially possesses Huko.

In the game, you play as Huko, fighting for control over your demon arm as you sneak into Kulaki's fortress to force him to exorcise your demon--or, barring that, to exact your revenge.

As you progress through the game, you will be forced to use your demon arm to help you fight, climb, and break into the fortress. Each time you do, the demon can get stronger. If it gets too strong, you could lose your free will and become consumed by the demon.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Push Your Luck

name: A Journey of Conviction
description:
Betrayed by your lord and friend, you have been sentenced to death for the assassination of your lord’s fiancée. Determined to clear your name and avenge the lady’s death, you vow to escape your cell, flee to safety, reveal and slay the true assassin, and duel your lord in order to regain your honor. This is your journey.

Required Components


The postcard (with maps and rules)
The bookmark (with actions and stats)
A pencil with eraser
Any paperback book with 300+ pages


The Gameplay

The game is simple. Each turn, riffle through the pages of the book without looking at the page numbers and quickly insert the bookmark. The number in the "hundreds" place will determine your action for the turn. If you land on page 1-99, then the hundreds place is "0".

If your action is to move, you may only move across dotted lines, never through solid lines. You may move onto spaces containing enemies, but you may not move OUT of spaces with enemies unless those enemies have been defeated. The exception to this is retreating--if you are instructed to retreat and are adjacent to or on the same space as an enemy, you may move 1 space in any direction.

If your action is to attack, the number in the "ones" place will determine which type of attack you use.

Once your action is resolve, the number in the "tens" place may force you to add additional enemies to the map. You choose where to place the enemy. You cannot place enemies in occupied spaces unless all spaces are occupied.

If you must ever choose between one page number and another, choose the page with the most text.

Finally, check the positions of all enemies on the map. If any of them are in range, they attack you.

You win the game if you complete all levels and defeat the Lord.

You lose the game if your Life ever becomes zero.

—description from the publisher

name: Superhero Meeples
description:
Assemble your superhero team to defeat encounters and earn the most honor! Rescue bystanders, capture henchmen, and form a plan to defeat the evil meeples terrorizing the city. A drafting card game that is easy to learn, quick to play, and fun for the whole family.

How To Play:
Players will draft cards to assemble their team of superheroes. Without revealing their cards to the other players, each player looks at the 9 cards they were dealt, selects one, and places it face down in front of them until all players have selected their card. Players then take all of the remaining cards (now 8) and passes them to the player on their left (who also is passing their cards to their left).

Then, starting with the player with the "First Player Card" and continuing clockwise around the table, each player takes a turn choosing either to:

Play the card drafted


or

Discard the card drafted and attempt to win an encounter


If they Play the Card Drafted, they turn their card face-up and resolve any effects on the card (Example: the cards says “Gain a bystander.” They would pick up one of the purple bystander tokens and place it in front of them.)

If they Discard the card drafted and attempt to win an encounter, the player places the drafted card face-up in a discard pile in the middle of the table. They then attempt to win an Encounter, seeing if they are able to meet the requirements of one of the face-up Encounters. If they are able to do so, they place the defeated Encounter face-up in their play area. If the encounter had any special text on it, resolve those now. (Examples of special text: “Discard two superheroes” or “Gain a planning token”)

After ALL players have revealed their drafted card and resolved any special card abilities, replenish any Encounters that were defeated from the face up available Encounters. Then the players pick up the stack of cards that were passed to them from their right. Repeat the process of choosing a card until all cards have been drafted.

After the last cards are drafted, players count up the Honor (Victory points) they earned. Add all Honor earned from defeated Encounters, rescued Bystanders (each purple bystander token is one honor), and any additional Honor from any Ally cards drafted (Allies do not have an icon in the top left corner and also refer to “At end of round…”). The player with the most Honor is the winner!

TYPES OF CARDS AND TOKENS
Superheroes - There are four types of Superhero cards: Strong (green fist), Telepathic (blue eye), Fast (yellow bolt), and Flying (pink wing).

Allies – Allies give additional Honor at the end of the round if certain conditions were met. Allies do NOT count as Superheroes and may not be used to help defeat encounters. Allies do not have an icon in the top corner (also, the art on all the ally cards is a person that is grey).

Encounters – The requirement to defeat the encounter is listed on the bottom half of each encounter. Some encounters give bonuses or require costs. The number in the top right corner is the amount of Honor earned from defeating that Encounter. Some encounters have icons with a “?”, indicating any type superhero may be used in that requirement.

Henchman Tokens – Henchman tokens are represented by the white meeple tokens. They represent a henchman being captured who can share valuable information to you, making it easier to defeat encounters in the future. Each Henchman token counts as a “?” icon when defeating encounters. You do NOT return Henchman tokens to the supply when they are used, they remain with you for the rest of the round and may be used on multiple encounters. Multiple henchman can be used on an encounter, up to as many “?” icons that are on that encounter.

Planning Tokens - Planning Tokens are represented by the star tokens. They represent valuable foresight and information you have gained to more easily defeat encounters. When a planning token is used to help defeat an encounter, it is returned to the planning token supply card. Planning tokens count as a “wild” superhero while defeating encounters. They may be spent to replace any icon on an encounter. Any number of Planning tokens may be spent at one time.

Bystander Tokens – Bystanders are represented by the purple meeple tokens. Each one of these tokens counts as one Honor at the end of the round.

—description from the designer

name: Expande Negocios
description:
Expande Negocios is aimed at students, employees, professionals, entrepreneurs, business owners and investors. Expande Negocios consists of 3 levels by which players perform in a simulated way step by step to grow as great employees, to be owners of their own businesses and become investors, to achieve the much longed for financial freedom. Expande Negocios is a board game that teaches you to create business skills, such as negotiation, sales, detect opportunities, strategies, decision making etc. The person or people who can obtain a "Mega Investment" win(s) the game.
—description from the publisher

Players begin at the inner part of the game board, at the employee level. They roll dice to move their way around a route of fields with descriptions. At this level, they receive a small regular salary and have to gather enough money to start their own business.
At the second (business owner) level, they will use their money from the first level to run their own businesses. This requires negotiation with other players. The goal is to systematize or automate their businesses so they can be promoted to the third and final level.
At the investor level, players buy businesses and try to get rich enough for a mega investment. The first player(s) to manage that, wins the game.
—user summary
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Das Siegel-Spiel
description:
The players start at space 1. Movement is determined by a die or a spinning top (cut-out from the right side of the game map). On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach the Siegel-Werke on space 60 wins the game.

This game was published between 1948 and 1952, while the Grenzlandring was an active racing track.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lost in R'lyeh: Strange Laws Beyond Our Ken Promo Card
description:
If you buy Lost in R'lyeh at your friendly local game store and send in a selfie of you at check-out, Atlas Games will mail you a free promo card featuring Ken Hite and Robin Laws — of award-winning podcast Ken and Robin Talk About Stuff — called "Strange Laws Beyond Our Ken."

This adds a new Event card for the game, the text of which reads "Each player still in the game chooses an Escape card from the player to their right and adds it to their hand. If that player doesn't have any, none are added."

name: Thirteen Factories
description:
The Thirteen Factories, also known as the Canton Factories, was a neighborhood along the Pearl River in southwestern Guangzhou (Canton) in the Qing Empire from c. 1684 to 1856 around modern day Xiguan, in Guanzhou's Liwan District.

In this game, each player is a merchant trying to become the richest merchant by the end of game. Ways to score points include approaching foreign merchants, buying goods from farmers, and visiting the official residence. The winner is the player with the most VP at the end of the game.

她代表了伏尔泰笔下“举世最优美、最古老、最广大、人口最多而治理最好的国家”。这是万国所至之处，八方辐辏，帆樯林立，商贾云集，银钱堆满公行。这里是《十三行》，天朝上国的巅峰华彩。

name: The Cleveland Experience
description:
The object of this game is for the PLAYERS, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a RESIDENCE SQUARE to the shopping locations shown on their SHOPPING LISTS. The first PLAYER to return to his RESIDENCE with TRAVEL CARDS for all locations on his SHOPPING LIST wins the game!
—description from the rulebook

The gameboard, which comes in six puzzle-like pieces, depicts a highly simplified map of Cleveland, Ohio, with featured local landmarks. The instructions pamphlet has contact information for Cleveland attractions printed in the margins. In addition to the game components, real-world coupons are also included for Cleveland businesses that were around when the game was made in 1980.
—user summary

name: Lend Kuule
description:
This cold war space board game was produced in Estonia when under control of the USSR.
This simple roll and move game has players race from earth to the moon. The path has players leaving earth and entering the moon in orbital trajectories. Landing on some numbered spaces will advance players while other spots sends a player backwards. To land on the moon a player enters a tight circular orbit needing the correct number to land.
The winner is the player to first land on the moon.

—user summary

name: Pooh's Hunny Pots
description:
In this children's game from the Winnie the Pooh universe, up to 4 players try to fill their honey pots with honey. To do this each player rolls the die in turn and moves the Winnie playing piece across the field. Depending on the symbol, even to which one lands, certain "tasks" must be fulfilled. The goal is to collect 5 honey tokens of one color and fill it into its honey pot. The hunny tokens (in 4 different colors) lie hidden in the middle of the playing field. If you are allowed to turn an hunny token (one of the "tasks") and if it has the right color, you may keep it. Otherwise you have to put it back on the playing field. The other players should remember the location of the hunny token (if it has the appropriate color for them) to collect it later (if allowed).

—user summary

name: Senpai Notice Me!
description:
Can you keep a secret?
There’s someone who’s very special to me.

In this game, one card represents a very special role: Senpai. Everybody is trying to get Senpai’s attention, but it’s not that easy! First, they have to build up their charms and work up the confidence to make a confession. Trade cards and build the cutest character you can, and be the first to admit your feelings to Senpai… if you know who has the card!

Senpai Notice Me! is a sweet, lighthearted game of homoromantic silliness, matching colours and deducing hidden information. (It’s also very pink!)

—description from the publisher

name: Plundering Pirates
description:
On your turn in the card game Plundering Pirates, you draw cards, then play cards to steal from other players, fight other players, or cause havoc with other players in an effort to obtain more cards that you can trade-in for coins. Once you've acquired enough coins, you can pay to reveal the "B.O.O.T.Y." — a plundering pirate's ultimate treasure!

Whoever pays for all of their "B.O.O.T.Y" cards first wins!
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Churchill Solitaire
description:
A two deck solitaire with a twist, the "Devil's Six" cards that must be played indirectly.

Former US Secretary of Defense, Donald Rumsfeld learn the game from diplomat Andre de Staercke, who learned from Sir Winston Churchill. Donald Rumsfeld published the game as an mobile app on Jan 20, 2016, but the game is playable with two standard 52-cards French deck.

name: Pentamo
description: Pin sticks in the wooden board and be the first to align five sticks to win. Sticks come in four different heights. Taller sticks can replace shorter ones. Think ahead and constantly keep an eye on what’s changing on the board. Very few sticks stay pinned there forever. Play smart to force other players to bail you out.

name: Talisman: Das Kartenspiel – Clash of Heroes
description:
Six adventurers, one goal — to go down in history as the greatest hero of all time. You can achieve fame through adventure, treasure, or direct confrontation, but the trick is to not lose it again. Magic talismans can make the way to fame easier, but these powerful artifacts are quickly lost again, then heroes who were on everyone's lips are soon forgotten...

Each turn in Talisman: Das Kartenspiel – Clash of Heroes, players can perform two actions to move across the modular board, open treasure chests, buy power cards, or attack teammates. Fighting in particular can increase your reputation in no time because for every life point the opponent loses, the attacker receives a fame point. Should a hero lose the last of their life, however, their attacker loses half of their previous glory points as well, which should ensure that the successful adventurer makes an attractive target. Whoever collects twelve glory points first wins.

Talisman: Das Kartenspiel – Clash of Heroes is a new, card-driven game for experience players in the Talisman universe.

name: Matthew Flinders around Australia
description:
Roll and move game of 105 circular spaces, with bonuses and penalties along the way. The game spaces form the edge of the board, around a map of Australia showing Flinders' voyages of 1801-02 and 1802-03.
"An easy to play, educational game for young children based on the historical facts of Matthew Flinders' circumnavigation of Australia in his ship H.M.S. Investigator"

name: The colour of Australia game
description: Roll-and-move game around a square track around the board edges, then around an outline map of Australia in the middle of the board. Certain squares allow a player to pick a card of a particular colour. Other squares are 'wild' and the player can collect any unclaimed card. Once all cards are claimed, players score points based on the size of their sets of cards of each colour. Cards feature Australian animals and places with a brief explanatory text.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Nut Punch!
description:
Nut Punch! is a fast-paced card game aimed at drunken and juvenile delinquents at heart. With its easy to learn gameplay, even the most inebriated person can join in on the fun!

A mix between trick taking and the card game War, Nut Punch! is geared towards quick rounds so no one is out of the game longer than it takes to make a fresh round of drinks.

Developed by a former Marine with fellow Marines in mind, Nut Punch! is the perfect game to accommodate bored Marines/Corpsmen/Sailors/Soldiers/Airmen/Coasties/etc. out on deployment; whether it’s on the Ship, or in the field!

—description from the designer

name: Splatatat!
description:
Splatatat! is a card game that combines shedding, matching and knock-out style game play(Think UNO crossed with Survivor)

Each player chooses a colour to play as and each turn they have the option to splat another player, save themselves or use a slammy or ‘S’ card.

Win by being the last player left in the game or be the first player to have either no cards left or only cards of their colour left

Splatatat! is fast paced, ruthless, unpredictable and fun, which creates an addictive game with a high replay value, with players desperate to seek redemption.

Due to the unpredictable nature of the game, age or skill doesn’t have a bearing on the result (although some strategies can used, it doesn't guarantee a victory) which makes it a great to game to play with the whole family from old to young.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Origemu
description:
An ultralight durable folding puzzle that fits in your wallet. Play it on your own or with family and friends.

The accompanying app provides endless folding challenges. Test your wits or race your friends to match the colours!

—description from the publisher

name: KALKÜL
description:
KALKÜL (Calculus) features a 5x5 wooden playing area, and each player has their own set of tokens numbered 1-4, which are placed in separate bags. Each area in the game board can hold up to four tokens, and players take turns drawing one of their tokens from their bag and placing it in one of the available locations.

The game ends once all the spaces are filled. If a player's tokens in a space have a larger sum than the opponent's, then that player has won that space. Win a majority of spaces on the game board to win the game.

KALKÜL includes two play variants:


Leave all of the player tokens visible on the table, with players placing whichever token of theirs that they want on the game board.
Place all of the tokens in the same bag. Whether you draw your token or your opponent's, place that on the game board.

name: Mobility is a Serious Game
description:
History and goal

In the spring of 2016, 6 committed citizens met to do "something" on the subject of Mobility: Professor Cathy Macharis of the VUI, Karin De Schepper of Insland Navigation & CleanAirBXL, Steven Vanden brande of Durabrik, Guibert Boone of Fockedey, Miguel Vertriest of Duurzame Mobiliteit (sustainable mobility) and Koen De Maesschalck of Colruyt Group.

Under the supervision of Sandra Schruijer, professor Organisation science at the University of Utrecht, they concluded that the game could maybe help us relieve our mobility tangle. Inspired by the work of Laurent Bontoux of JRC (European Commission) they made a mobility game intended to connect people, show empathy for each other's role and let new ideas surface. After an elaborate testing round, the game was launched on 21 June 2017 at the Mobility Congress

In this game players will take turns playing action cards to build arguments for their goals. Other players can vote on what arguments they like.
You get points by having other people vote for your arguments.

—user summary

name: Battle Axe 3.0
description:
Battle Axe is a simple to play tabletop system for skirmish level battles. Using cards instead of dice, you will find the game to be less luck based and much more tactical in nature.

Taking the best that CCG and Table Top gaming have to offer, and combining them, you end up with a system that offers endless option and expansion. The rules and cards provide here will be enough to get you started, and new characters and rule expansions are on the way so you can continue to increase both the size and composition of your War Bands.

This base set offers you the following...


Full color, detailed rule with plenty of examples and diagram to highlight important concepts.
Full Color Combat Charts
60 card Fate deck, in full color
The Elven and Goblin Starting War Bands, which included the faction deck for both races, and three character decks for both, which covers the Elven Warrior, the Elven Archer and the Elven Blade Dancer. On the Goblin side we have the Goblin Thug, the Goblin Warrior and the Goblin Archer. These will give you a good start on the game and additional characters and factions can be purchased as they are released


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Humor Me
description:
Humor Me is a platform that allows players to combine elements of satire, wit and wordplay to make their friends laugh to ridiculous statements they create. There are two types of word decks and a challenge deck. Combine words to create setups for another player or play a challenge that will force you to perform ridiculous tasks or get you into an one vs one duel with another player! The game has a lot of diversity and will challenge your sense of humor in a whole new way.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Mortal Gods: Skirmish Games In Ancient Greece – Athenian Lochos
description:
‘Adronikos, the Spartan Lochos closes with us through the mountain pass’
Pelanus was the most trusted of the Athenian scouts and was also one of the quickest.
‘How many are they?’ Questioned Adronikos as he looked up from the warmth of the camp's fire at his old friend.
‘I’d say 20-30.. but they are spread out. It was hard to get an exact count’.
‘Perfect’.
‘We will hit them from the high ground. We will drive them from Athens before they have the chance to form up’ Adronikos mused.
‘We could meet them head on?’ Pelanus suggested.
‘No. The men are tired. A head-on fight against the Spartans will risk too many of our lochos. Every Athenian life is precious. I will not rush into this’.
Pelanus looked confused and stopped to think upon the command. ‘I understand’ he said slowly, ‘But come the time I will follow you to Hades myself Andronikos’.
‘I know you will’ Andronikos replied as he slapped his comrade on the shoulder, 'but today is not that day’.

This box set contains everything you need for adding Athenians to your games of Mortal Gods. Besides city specific rules and cards you also receive the mighty hero Adronikos, the Defender of Athens and his lochos.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Hatten Sie's gewusst?: Fortsetzungs Serien
description: This Extension adds new questions in 9 categories.

name: Mortal Gods: Skirmish Games In Ancient Greece – Spartan Lochos
description:
"Astis, you have been stood on my shoulder for more than three breaths if you’re going to try and kill me get on with it."

"My Captain, Meonas no I would never."

Meonas turned and sneered at the man. "Then spit it out you whining simpleton." His hand hovered over the pommel of his sword.

Astis stepped back, although used to the venom from his commander he still found himself scared whenever in his presence. He'd seen Meonas, the Harvester, kill men for getting too close or being too slow with a reply, or ignoring orders. In fact, Meonas would probably kill a man for breathing at the wrong moment.

However, his controlled menace and violence made him a formidable foe indeed.

This box set contains everything you need for adding Spartans to your games of Mortal Gods. Besides city specific rules and cards you also receive the dreaded hero Meonas the Harvester, of Sparta and his lochos.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Quickie Ørehængere
description: Small Danish quiz game. 60 questions about pop music. Answer correctly and get a point.

name: Quickie Parløb
description: Small Danish quiz game. 60 questions about partnerships. Answer correctly and get a point.

name: Super Freaky
description:
A card game for 2-6 players where the only goal is to survive. The last player alive win the match. At each turn the player must draw a card and hope for a new super power to add to his hand, otherwise it will probably be a villain to deal with. If the player is without super powers he will have no hope of defeating a villain and will die. The villains are always shuffled in the deck so the less cards remain in the deck the more likely a villain will come out.

—description from the designer

name: Beyond The Wall
description:
The plagued living and the restless dead clash as the wall crumbles in this unique board game from Twilight Creations.

Victory is obtained by eliminating the opposing army but it's not a simple matter of superior numbers or strength of arms. The battlefield is divided by The Wall, an ancient un-scaleable barrier of rubble and bone. As play progresses, spans of the wall fracture and collapse opening the way for troops but also triggering boobytraps.

The End is nigh! Will humanity endure and prevail or will the hordes of relentless shambling dead plow the defenders into the dirt?

The Wall is an exciting, unique element to this game. Players will have the opportunity to physically remove portions of the wall during play, causing parts of the opponent's play field to become vulnerable, but also potentially hurting your troops. Reveal enough of your opponent's forces to crush them on your way to victory!

Beyond The Wall offers a unique experience in tabletop gaming. The game can be tailored to fit your play style and mood. Beyond the Wall can be played at the basic level with no options or, for those seeking more complexity, additional elements can be added to enhance your experience. Elements include mines, wall traps, army construction, special ability cards and attack rolls.

—description from the publisher

name: Exostate: A Base-Building Card Game
description:
Exostate is a base-building card game where you take turns either building, attacking, or defending against attacks and with the final goal being to destroy your enemies core.

Gameplay is strategic and makes you think about where you want to place your structures and how you want to approach attacking your enemy.

—description from the designer

name: Bømlo Spelet
description:
Monopoly style game where the 'streets' are local firms in the municipal of Bømlo on the west coast of Norway.

The goal of the game is to be the only player left that has not gone bankrupt, or if played with a time cap, the player with most money after a given time of gameplay.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Planet-Spelet
description:
This interesting Swedish space game is a spin and move game that has players travel though the solar system to distant planets where they collect radioactive elements or platinum.
Players start with a spacecraft from Earth and head out into outer space. Mars, Jupiter and the other planets revolve in a 24 spaced orbit around the sun. Movement of planets and rockets are directed by a large disc in the center of the board that is spun by the players. The players rockets move to different orbits and planets by landing on a Cosmic Radiation cardboard strip that also rotates around he board (covering only one space across all orbits).
Many hazards and difficulties are against the spaceships. Meteor showers, radioactive dust clouds, operating errors, space police, and much more.
The object of the game is to bring home these riches to earth. The player, who first manages to return their spacecraft back to Earth with a full load of radioactive material or platinum is the winner.

—user summmary

name: Das Labyrinth des Pharao: Die Mumien-Erweiterung
description:
The mummies are placed per player in a pyramid corner of the respective right neighbor. Once the third pyramid tiles are laid, the researchers must be placed irrevocably at the entrance of your choice.

Whenever a chip with a scarab has to be placed during the course of the game, the dice is then rolled and the mummies are moved accordingly within the respective neighboring pyramid.

When a mummy hits an already placed treasure, the mummy steals it and returns the loot back to the stolen player's supply.

The latter will have no choice but to place such a treasure again later, but that could possibly also be of advantage, as experienced pyramid researchers will already imagine

- - -

Die Mumien werden je Spieler in einer Pyramidenecke des jeweils rechten Nachbarn platziert. Sobald die dritten Pyramidenplattchen gelegt, die Forscher also am Eingang Ihrer Wahl unwiderruflich platziert werden müssen.

Immer, wenn im weiteren Spielverlauf dann ein Plättchen mit Skarabäus gelegt werden muß, wird hernach der Würfel geworfen und die Mumien entsprechend innerhalb der jeweiligen Nachbar-Pyramide bewegt.

Stößt eine Mumie dabei auf einen bereits platzierten Schatz, stielt die Mumie diesen, und gibt das Raubgut wieder in den Vorrat des bestohlenen Spielers zurück.

Letzterem bleibt zwar nichts anderes, als solch einen Schatz später erneut zu platzieren, aber das könnte ggf. ja auch mal von Vorteil sein, wie erfahrenere Pyramidenforscher/innen sich bereits ausmalen werden =])..
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Panoply: Classical Ancients Miniatures Rules
description:
Miniatures wargames rules for the Classical and Hellenistic periods, ca 500 - 50 BC. One figure represents a hundred men, one inch on the table represents about 30 yards on the battlefield, and one turn represents about 15 minutes of real time. The rules use written orders and may be characterized as "Old School".

GROUND SCALE: One inch equals approximately thirty yards.
FIGURE SCALE: One casting represents one hundred soldiers.
TIME SCALE: One period of tabletop movement with all its associated or resulting actions, represents 15 minutes of actual time.

The rulebook includes army lists for Greeks, Romans, Carthaginians, Persians, and Macedonians.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Where's Waldo? Memory Game
description:
Kazaam! Can you remember where I am? Waldo's wacky hotel has pairs of "guests"! Remember who is in what window...and find the match! Don't forget! Match the most and you win!

When a player makes a match for either Waldo or Wenda guest cards, he or she gets a FREE TURN token proving a match for Waldo or Wenda. The FREE TURN can be taken at any time during the game after any player has completed his or her normal turn. A player's FREE TURN is in addition to his or her normal turn.

name: RUSH 81 Color
description:
The excitement of RUSH 81 begins with the anticipation of competing against friends and family. There are 81 puzzle pieces, each with a unique position every time you play. The challenge is to finish your hand first while others at the table RUSH to finish tiers. You might think you're right when you make your move - but you will RUSH to take it back when the game reveals that you're wrong.

Concentration, strategy, speed, and sometimes luck contribute to the most sensational board game every devolved - RUSH 81. You will RUSH to finish one game and you will RUSH to start another. A new RUSH begins every time you play. Grab your seat now and prepare for RUSH 81!

—description from the publisher

name: Die Olchis: Rattenduell
description:
In this speed game from the Olchi Universe, players must first place their rat on one of the three colored (yellow, blue, orange) garbage cans. Which garbage can needs to be filled is diced with a color cube. It is rolled in turn. The player to be thrown plays the role of an Olchi, who tries to put the lid on the diced bin in front of the rats. If the Olchi player is faster, he gets an Olchipunkt. If a rat player is faster, this gets an Olchipunkt. If a rat player places his rat on a wrong garbage bin, he must give an Olchipunkt. The player with the most Olchipoints has won.

—user summary

name: Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters: Dark Angels – The First Team Pack
description:
Set in the dark sci-fantasy world of Warhammer 40,000, Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters allows players to build teams of iconic characters and warriors to battle it out for supremacy using custom dice and cards. Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters uses the game system designed by Mike Elliott and Eric M. Lang for Dice Masters and is completely compatible with other games in the line. Four factions are available when the series first launches, and players can either build teams using a single faction or mix and match to create their own Dice Masters team.

The Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters: Dark Angels – The First Team Pack features iconic Dark Angels like Fallen Angel, Cypher and recognizable army-building pieces like the Deathwing Knight.

name: Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters: Blood Angels – Black Rage Team Pack
description:
Set in the dark sci-fantasy world of Warhammer 40,000, Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters allows players to build teams of iconic characters and warriors to battle it out for supremacy using custom dice and cards. Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters uses the game system designed by Mike Elliott and Eric M. Lang for Dice Masters and is completely compatible with other games in the line. Four factions are available when the series first launches, and players can either build teams using a single faction or mix and match to create their own Dice Masters team.

The Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters: Blood Angels – Black Rage Team Pack features iconic Blood Angels like Commander Dante and can’t-be-missed units like the Death Company and Sanguinary Priests.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Launch the Dragonslayer!
description:
In this medium-weight dexterity campaign microgame, launch an adventuring hero (who only superficially resembles a paperclip) from a stack of dice to hit specific targets representing feats of accuracy, athleticism, and daring. Inspired by retro adventure video games, Launch the Dragonslayer! will challenge your hero to brave ever-changing wilds, ration limited resources, leverage unique class abilities, and withstand the temptation of cool cheat codes, all in a noble quest to find and slay a monstrous dragon!

Gameplay progresses through a cycle of turns, which involve rolling for randomized time- and region-dependent encounters, deciding to either travel or recover resources, and moving Time forward one unit. If an encounter occurs, then a system of hit values and encounter effects determines the encounter's ebb and flow. Play is meant to be divided into several sessions, with the general progress of each turn saved between plays. The game ends when your hero resolves the Dragon encounter to slay their sworn foe.

At the beginning of the game, players can choose one of six classes for their hero, each of which has a unique ability that encourages a different style of play. Four stats act as resources that are expended to withstand damage, increase the power of a launch's effect, make it easier to hit a target, or level up to increase your hero's maximum stat amount.

As the hero draws closer to their goal, they will face different effects in each region they visit, challenging you to optimize your hero's path and assess the rewards of various risks. But all the careful planning in the world will only take you so far. In the end, what will make or break your hero's future is how well you can Launch the Dragonslayer!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Fantasy, Humor, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: My Friends Tigger & Pooh: 5 in einer Reihe
description: In this children's game from the Winnie the Pooh universe, players must pull wooden tiles trying to collect a figure in five different sizes. The first player who has a series of figures in all 5 sizes wins the game.

name: Space Race Game
description:
A simple spin and move race to the moon where players choose a spaceship cardboard marker and in turns spin the spinner to move. Players follow special directions along the raceway that may help or hinder their travels. first to the moon is the winner.

A Warren Built game from the late 1950s to 1960s that came in a number of sized versions. The smaller version has the playing board separating and one section of the board is turned around and interlocked into the other section to extend the game board length.

—user summary

name: Sunrise Sardines
description:
There are 3 cards in the middle of the table that make up the ocean and that have 3 separate actions you can take. Each player has a boat that they move to the selected action they want to do on their turn. If both players take the same action whomever arrived at that spot second gets a weaker action they can take. Also, you may not take the same action twice in a row.

Actions you can take:

Trade - You may trade with the available cards that are in the market or draw one card from the deck. The amount of cards you may trade are equal to the number on the card, (which moves up and down during the game like a mini stock market) If you are the second boat to arrive on this spot you can trade one less card.

Fish - You may draw cards equal to the number on your fisherman card that you have leveled up to. If you are the second boat to arrive you draw one less card from the deck.

Sell - If you move your boat to this space the seagull switches to the player it is currently not with. (Seagull forces you to pay one extra when selling)
On this space you may sell to the fancy man. On his card is a row of numbers that slowly grows each time he's sold to and is also the amount you must sell to him. There is a small 5 card deck next to him with the top card revealed that shows what sardine can the fancy man is wanting to be sold. When a fancy man sale is made you raise the trade market number up one, your fisherman up one, and the fancy man up one on their respective trackers. After selling to the fancy man you flip over the sardine can to show it has been sold to you and you gain points based on how many you acquire by the end of the game.

During the game you are collecting sets of cans or a variety pack which is all 5 brands of cans. These cans can be sold, and count as points. Once the fancy man has been sold 5 cans the game ends and the player who did not trigger the end game gets one last turn.

Player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Sangha-Do
description:
In this game you play together, not against each other. Everyone wins together or everyone loses!

The basic idea of the game is that every person strives for happiness and satisfaction in their own way. On this path, you have to overcome fundamental difficulties in life, depicted in the cards and rules of the game. Some cards show things that people suffer from. Other cards show ways to help resolve these ailments. But our lifetime is limited. At some point, the last hour will come! Do we go with a heart full or with sorrow that could not be resolved?

Unfortunately, help is not always readily available, not everything is visible. Unforeseen events change the situation in a flash, and without mutual support, we are lost...

The game is won when all players are freed of their Suffering cards before they have to discard the last Vitality card.

—description from the publisher (translated)


In diesem Spiel spielt man gemeinsam, nicht gegeneinander. Es gewinnen alle zusammen oder alle verlieren.

Der Grundgedanke des Spiels ist dabei, dass jeder Mensch auf seine Weise im Leben nach Glück und Zufriedenheit strebt. Zu überwinden sind auf diesem Weg grundlegende Schwierigkeiten des Lebens, abgebildet in den Karten und Regeln des Spiels. Einige Karten zeigen Dinge, an denen Menschen leiden. Andere Karten zeigen Möglichkeiten der Hilfe, um diese Leiden aufzulösen. Doch unsere Lebenszeit ist begrenzt. Irgendwann schlägt die letzte Stunde! Gehen wir mit einem erfüllten Herzen oder voller Leid, das sich nicht auflösen ließ?

Hilfe ist leider nicht immer passend zur Hand, nicht alles ist sichtbar, unvorhergesehene Ereignisse verändern die Lage blitzartig und ohne gegenseitige Unterstützung sind wir verloren...

Das Spiel ist gewonnen, wenn alle Spieler/innen von ihren Karten des Leidens befreit wurden, bevor sie die letzte Karte Lebenskraft abgeben müssen.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Indrago!
description:
Indrago means "Inside the Dragon".

In order to win this 2-players-strategy, the player must place his/her Knight (chip) in the middle of the enemy Dragon.
Each player has 1 Dragon and 6 Knights of gold or silver color. Their strength depends on the color they stand (the game board is a tricolor "Island", surrounded by "water"). The Dragons can carry own Knights on their backs and capture enemy Knights.

—description from the designer

name: Dominus
description:
Dominus is a tile-laying game where players compete to build the most prestigious medieval monastery. The game features very simple rules, lots of interaction between players (in the form of a shared resource market) and clever tile-laying where players try to match the sides of the tile they are building with the sides of previously built tiles (dominoes style) in order to maximize their score and get access to extra resources. DOMINVS is a fast-paced tile-laying game where a clever placement of your workers on the market will not only grant you access to more resources but may occasionally help you win coins when other players harvest, thus saving you from spending one of your turns harvesting. The market manipulation provides a lot of interaction between players, but not the destructive type of interaction because, even when somebody messes with your plans, new possibilities open in the market for you.

On their turn, the player places one resource tile together with one of their workers into the market (formed by a 3x3 grid of resource tiles). The tile is either placed on the leftmost space of a row or in the topmost space of a column, thus pushing out one other resource tile from the market that the player then collects. If there is a worker on the expelled tile, it's owner recovers it and gains a Prestige Point. Then the player activates the row or the column of the market where the tile and the worker were placed (each resource tile specifies if activates a column or a row).
When activating a row or a column, the player performs one of two possible actions: harvest or build:

The end game is triggered when a player reaches 50 Prestige points. Then, a final round is played and the player with most Prestige Points wins the game.

During playtest, 4 player games would take no longer than 30 minutes, making DOMINVS a fast playing game, with an interesting engine building mechanism integrated, with simple rules but with lots of interesting decisions each turn.

DOMINVS was also designed from the beginning with an integrated and fully functional solo variant.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: TINfluence
description:
Humanity has set out for the stars and settled on different planets. It is now your time to spread influence on the new colonies and undermine your opponent.

TINfluence is a two player game where you will exert influence on planets by playing action to move or add influence tokens.

Each turn, each player will draft actions that are then played out. These actions can add or move influence tokens or can challenge the other player for influence over a planet. The player that has the most influence on a planet gains Victory Points.

The player with the most victory point at the end of the game wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Amulet
description:
The old king has no heirs to the throne, and has decreed that he will pass his crown to the one who has acquired the greatest amount of mystical power (represented in pentacles) between:


the Knight/Dame who kills the last dragons, and
the Knight/Dame who kills the greatest number of dragons.



Pentacles are awarded in specific amounts to players according to their choices, when they simultaneously choose, without knowing the other player's choice, to form or not to form alliances upon encountering each other along the game path.
Pentacle color combinations of 15 pentacles, selected from 9 different colors, are offered to obtain 1 of 3 Amulets of different capabilities to kill the dragons, according to the pentacle combinations offered.
In the meantime, the players must prevent the dragons from destroying any of the towns in the 9 shires, as a 13th attack on any town renders it destroyed, which forfeits the game to the dragons.

Each time the dice are thrown by any player to advance on the game path in the course of regular play, the dice score numbers also indicate which of the 9 numbered shires has its towns attacked by the dragons, and any undefended towns in those shires receive a damage disc, which must not accumulate to 13 for any town.

So, from the outset, an intense race begins to meet a rapid unrelenting onslaught of attacks by the dragons, which attack somewhere on every throw of the dice. A town (18 towns total) can receive a defender when landed on in the course of regular play, which prevents any further damage to that town. A player is knighted when he/she becomes defender of both of the 2 towns in a shire. Once Knighted the play becomes eligible to fight the dragons with an Amulet upon obtaining one.

The object for the players is to kill the 6 dragons in a contest against each other according to the above mentioned criteria with the use of the 3 Amulet types (a player can only possess 1 Amulet at a time), but are quickly drawn into a perilous concerted drive to preclude the dragons from thwarting their opportunity with a 13th attack on an undefended town.

In a dragon fight each of the 3 Amulet types ensures the defeat of any one of 4 of the 6 dragons, so each of the 3 Amulet types ensures the defeat of a different set of 4 of the 6 dragons. Therefore, an Amulet gives the player a 2 to 1 advantage over the dragon, which could kill the player if it is not one of the 4 listed on the Amulet. Players can prevent being killed if they have an escape card.

Amulet features a fascinating paradox where players are compelled to cooperate and form alliances to set up an end game where they can seek to defeat each other. Failure to do so, could brings the game swiftly to and end with victory going to the dragons.

—description from the designer

name: Hägar: Land in Sicht!
description:
Land in sight! Hägar the Horrible & wavering ships in search of the treasure islands. The way is the goal and the way is not so easy. Roll and navigate your way through the oceans and find the hidden treasures first of all!

A entertaining quick game with coasters. Fun for everyone!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Game play: At the beginning of the player’s turn, the player navigates over the map (board) and tries to get a good navigation point to find good treasures.

The active player initially rolls both dice and then optionally has another roll with one or both dice. After that, counts the result. He now hit exactly 1 field of the board through the specified navigation lines (intersection).

If a player hits an island field directly or indirectly (across a neighbored sea field), all treasure tokens lying on this island can be revealed immediately. The player now has the chance to win the treasures of this island. With a direct hit the player has up to 3 rolls, with an indirect hit (across neighbored sea field) only 1 roll with the dice.

For the winning of treasure tokens of islands being hit (directly or indirectly) the following applies:

Number tokens: If a dice shows the number of a certain number token, the treasure is discovered and can be picked up by the player.

Sven Glückspilz or Hägar tokens: A double (2x same number, no matter which one) wins one of these outlying tokens.

Lucky-7 (sum): A dice combination with the sum = 7 (1/6 or 2/5 or 3/4) can also be used as a wild card. The player can choose any outlying token of the island.

The game ends immediately, once all number tokens (total of 6 pieces) are discovered. The player with the fewest victory points in total loses the game. In case of a tie, several lose.

Each won number token counts victory points based on its numerical value. In addition there are (for one player) double victory points for a treasure token on the x2 field.

For the Hägar token, the number of all won number tokens count as additional victory points for the player (in addition to the normal number values).

For each Sven Glückspilz token the player rolls both dice exactly once. The difference between the two results (higher minus smaller number) shows the victory points achieved for this. The player gets nothing with a rolled double.





Land in Sicht! Hägar der Schreckliche & schwankende
Schiffe, auf der Suche nach den Schatzinseln .. Der Weg ist das Ziel und der ist
nicht so einfach. Würfel und navigiere Dich durch die Meere und finde die
verborgenden Schätze vor den anderen!

Ein kurzweiliges schnelles Spiel mit Bierdeckeln. Spaß für jedermann!

—description from the publisher (German)

Spielablauf: Am Anfang des Spielerzuges navigiert der Spieler über die ausliegende Karte (Spielplan) und versucht einen guten Navigationspunkt zu erspielen, um von dort gute Schätze zu finden.
Der aktive Spieler würfelt anfänglich beide Würfel und hat danach optional einen weiteren Wurf mit einem oder beiden Würfeln. Danach zählt das erwürfelte Ergebnis. Er hat jetzt durch die festgelegten Navigationsreihen genau 1 Spielfeld des Planes direkt getroffen (Schnittpunkt).
Falls ein Spieler ein Inselfeld direkt oder indirekt (über ein angrenzendes Seefeld) trifft, können alle auf dieser Insel liegenden Schatzmarker sofort aufgedeckt werden. Der Spieler hat jetzt die Chance die Schätze dieser Insel zu erspielen. Der Spieler hat hier bei einem direkten Inseltreffer bis bis zu 3 Würfe, bei einem indirekten Treffer (über angrenzendes Seefeld) immer nur 1 Wurf mit den Würfeln.

Für das Erspielen von Schatzmarkern getroffener Inseln (direkt oder indirekt) gilt:
Zahlenmarker: Erzielt ein Würfel dabei die Zahl eines ausliegenden Zahlenmarkers, ist der Schatz geborgen und kann vom Spieler aufgenommen werden.
Sven Glückspilz- oder Hägar-Marker: Ein Pasch (2x gleiche Zahl, egal welche) erspielt einen dieser ausliegenden Marker.
Lucky-7 (Summe): Eine Würfelkombination mit der Summe = 7 (1/6 oder 2/5 oder 3/4) kann als Joker genutzt werden. Der Spieler kann sich einen beliebigen ausliegenden Marker der Insel aussuchen.

Das Spiel endet sofort, sobald alle Zahlenmarker (gesamt 6 Stück) geborgen sind. Der Spieler mit den wenigsten Siegpunkten insgesamt verliert das Spiel. Bei Gleichstand verlieren auch mehrere.
Jeder erspielte Zahlenmarker zählt anhand seines Zahlenwertes Siegpunkte. Dazu gibt es (für einen Spieler) ggf. doppelte Siegpunkte für einen Schatzmarker auf dem x2-Feld.
Der Hägar-Marker bringt die Anzahl aller erspielter Zahlenmarker als zusätzliche Siegpunkte für den Spieler (neben den eigentlichen Zahlenwerten).
Für jeden Sven Glückspilz-Marker würfelt der entsprechende Spieler beide Würfel genau 1x. Die Differenz der beiden Ergebnisse (höhere minus kleinere Zahl) zeigt die hierfür erzielten Siegpunkte. Bei einem Pasch gibt es also nichts.

name: Yes! We Have No Bananas
description:
You are a hard-working immigrant produce storeowner and want to make your customers happy. Earn the most money by fulfilling customer orders while overcoming the double negatives that sometimes come with communicating through a language barrier. And above all, make it clear that you have NO bananas!

Yes! We Have No Bananas is a print-and-play card game for 2-4 players designed by Mac McAnally. It's based on the 1923 song written by Frank Silver and Irving Cohn, now in the Public Domain.

—description from the designer

name: Kombina in the Knesset
description:
You are a candidate for the Prime Minister of Israel, trying to form or join a winning government by manipulating, bluffing, or inciting your way to power. Will you play according to principle and form a consistent government, or pull a "kombina" to stay in power?

In Knesset Kombina, players compete as Prime Minister candidates from different political blocs trying to form a winning government. Playing cards represent Ministers of the Knesset (MKs) who can provide the government they join with a certain number of votes and/or actions.

Players can try to form a government independently or by forming a coalition with another player. Gameplay ends when a government is formed.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Negotiation, Party Game, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Alter Ego
description:
In teams of two, players must move their pawn from one corner to the opposite corner of the game board, while forming words beginning with the letters on which their pawn stops. Each word formed deserves points. The game ends when a team's pawn reaches its finish square. The team with the most points wins.

—user summary

name: Royal 9 Dice Poker Game
description:
Royal 9 Dice Poker Game is a roll and score dice party game for 1-6 players where the object of the game is to not only score specific target dice combinations for points but to also outrank your opponents scored target hands to earn even more points. The game uses a 6 dice, 5 suit Poker style layout and a special "Royal" die that adds additional scoring possibilities and mechanics. The scoring scales proportionately when adding more players to remain balanced and has a special rules set for playing solo games. This game's primary objective is to reduce the luck factor commonly found in most dice scoring party games and add more strategy and decision making mechanics found in games like Poker or Rummy while still maintaining the thrill of chance and the social fun of dice party games.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Met K3 de wereld rond
description:
The girls of K3* travel around the world.
Do you travel with them?
With this game you travel with them through five continents and over de seven seas.

There are two modules: 'De ansichtkaartenjacht' (Hunt for postcards) or 'De lange reis' (The long journey).

In 'De ansichtkaartenjacht' (easymode) you travel along a path and collect the most postcards before you are home again.
The person with the most postcards wins. Or in case of a tie, the first who arrived home wins.

In 'De lange reis' you get traveltickets (objects). Travel as fast as possible to all your destinations to collect the postcards and travel home again.
You can use shortcuts, but there is danger on the roads.

Met K3 de wereld rond is a creative, educational and above all enjoyable boardgame.

—description from the publisher (translated)


K3 is a girlband from Belgium (originaly) for young children.

name: Bushido: Mako Takashi
description:
Mako Takashi was a renowned swordsman and respected general before many of the current generation of the Takashis were even born, he was one of the eight great Blademasters of the Empire and was appointed a General of the Imperial Armies, leading the Golden Sentinels before his age caused him to retire. Often referred to as “Uncle Mako” it may not be clear exactly who’s uncle he is as even Hida refers to him as his Uncle.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Nuan
description:
Nuan is on the first rung of the ladder to becoming a Minimoto Blacksmith. His family take great honour from Nuan’s position and he is fully committed to progressing through the ranks. The first step is to master one’s fear for the molten metals they so revere. The impure metals and slag are literally hurled at opponents or cleverly manipulated to create cover for the advancing Minimoto by launching clouds of smoke and sparks into the air.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Tetsu
description:
The relationship between the Minimoto and the bears, that also call the mountains surrounding Jyoto home, runs deep. Whilst being from one of the smallest breeds of bear on the island Tetsu more than makes up for his diminutive size, charging with a ferocity and force that can overwhelm all but the most steadfast of opponents. Surviving the charge of Tetsu is the first plan, what to do next is even trickier.

Blister contains one model, one 40mm base and one full colour profile card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Yokozuna Akashi
description:
Akashi retired as a legend from the fighting pits having garnered renown even outside the empire. His return to the Jwar Isles has had many question the motives behind his return. He has stirred feelings in the Buto that many would prefer buried and it seems that he has become increasingly political as he has aged. Although old Yokozuna is still a threat and as in in his heyday he still does not acknowledge the idea of being beaten.

Blister contains one model, one 40mm base, one theme card and one full colour profile card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Hilltribe Tracker
description:
The Hilltribe Trackers go out into the wilderness to hunt, their prey is the snow yeti that also occupy the mountainous region the Tengu call home. They perform rituals before embarking and brave the elements without clothes on their upper torsos. The yeti are fearsome opponents and thus the trackers specialize in ranged attacks. Hoping to bring down the monsters with a well-placed javelin long before the brutes can bring their overwhelming strength to bear.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: 3 Seeds: Reap Where You Sow – Wild / Drought Promo Cards
description:
A Pair of promo cards that were included in the game Soul of the Empire.

Drought: Event - Discard any crop in play. Return affected seeds to their owners and draw a new crop.

Wild: Crop - Champion Cherries 2,3,2 - Use as part of any incomplete crop set.

name: Unauthorized: Promo Cards
description:
A Pair of promo cards that were included in the game Soul of the Empire.

Extra! Extra! - Wild (Green/Red) Experience card.

Journalist / Anchor - Role Card - Choose a player. Look at their hand. You must then announce a headline (4 words or less) to the group.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Commissioned: Promo Cards
description:
A Pair of promo cards that were included in the game Soul of the Empire.

Isolation - Trial (Martyr) - Remove a Church Member for each Apostle/Missionary from the location(s) where the Apostles/Missionaries are. Skip the Pray/Share actions.

Solitude - Trial (Disciple) - Only the Elder Prays. No talking this Live Phase.
categories: Ancient, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Religious
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Stern der Weisen
description:
The players start at the center of the star on the space of their color, stagger clockwise around the star. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach his starting space with an exact roll wins the game. The players move straight along the blue lines. Changing lines is only allowed, if the movement is starting on a crossroad or junction. If a player is not able to move his pawn according to the roll of the die, he has to pay a fee into the cashbox. On the roll of a 6, the player may roll and move again. The winner gets two thirds of the cash box, the next two thirds of the rest an so on. The second last player gets the whole rest.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: STOOPID! The Card Game: Brain Dead
description:
The Brain Dead Expansion includes 29 brand new cards to swap out and customize with your deck.

This expansion includes:

The New Un-Alive neighbors that feast on your common sense.
The Spooks and freaks with scare you STOOPID!.
The new places cards add even more depth to the game.
All new mechanics and much much more.

—description from the publisher

name: SD Gundam: LaCroix Heroes
description:
In the "SD" World, humans and Mobile Suits lived peacefully side by side. Peace would not last long as Devil Gundam arrived and cast a shadow upon the land. King Levir of the LeCroix dynasty gave the task of defeating the enemy to his Gundam Knights. The Gundam Knights departed immediately to the mountainous frontier of the LaCroix Kingdom to turn back Devil Gundam and his forces.

In this strategic board game based on the highly successful SD Gundam series, players will each assume the role of a Gundam Knight protecting the LaCroix Kingdom. Players will roll dice to move on the grid based board and use weapon and attack cards to overpower and defeat the enemies, and Devil Gundam, to save the LaCroix Kingdom!

SD Gundam: LaCroix Heroes has two game modes:

Game Mode One: The Three Legendary Sacred Shrines. In this game mode, players will be battling the forces of Devil Gundam who have seized control of the Legendary Sacred Shrines. In order to defeat Satan Gundam, you must journey to the Shrines, defeat the enemies within, collect the Sacred Treasure from each shrine (Shield of Power, Armor of Power, and the Sword of Fire) in order to be powerful enough to defeat Devil Gundam.

Game Mode Two: Castle of Devil Gundam. The Knight Gundams, having reached the fortress of the enemy, with the Three Sacred Treasures in hand, must penetrate and search the Castle to find the Sacred Stone Tablet with the spell that will imbue the Sacred Treasures with their legendary power, allowing the players to try and defeat Devil Gundam. But will victory prove so easy?

—description from the publisher
categories: Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Renaissance, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: STOOPID! The Card Game: The Ghost Deck
description:
The new Ghost Deck

An Expansion for STOOPID! The Card Game.

In STOOPID!, When you are knocked out of the game with 3 or more players. Normally you take all your skirmish cards (Red) and use them as your (Ghostdeck). You would then use this new deck to haunt the remaining players.(Using rules from in the core set rules booklet)

But now! there is the Ghost deck.

Death in only the beginning.
Haunt the land lords still alive.
20 brand new cards to haunt and toy with your fellow land lands.

—description from the publisher

name: Inhibited
description:
The purpose of the game is to have fun with friends, ideally in a party setting. The game is a card version of the spin-the-bottle game that has been played at teen-ager parties for decades. It worked like this: a mix of girls and boys sat in circle on the floor. In turn, somebody spun an empty bottle in the middle of the circle. When the bottle stopped, the "spinner" kissed or slapped the cheek of the boy or girl the bottle pointed to. It never failed to get some young hormones flowing and some cheeks reddening (and not just because they had been slapped). It was an innocent enough game for innocent times.

Inhibited attempts to recreate that feeling with cards and extends the slapping/kissing to several actions. It also specifies a series of body parts, but without ever crossing the limit of decency and good taste.

A player sets up an activity between two players (e.g., Peter is to bring his nose in contact with with Paul's ear) and all players in turn can play cards to change the activity and/or the players involved; when there are no more changes, the activity that resulted from all the changes must be carried out. For example, Jane might have to rub her cheek against Peter's neck.

All players involved in an action receive points. If a player refuses to perform an action, s/he is penalised with negative points. The game ends when all 108 cards have been played or when the turn goes around the table without anybody setting up a new action. The winner is the player who has accumulated the highest number of points.

Players can play as individuals or in teams.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Motor City: A Kanban Game
description:
Welcome to Motor City, a board game where you can become an industrialist like Henry Ford in the golden age of the automobile industry. Competing for your manufacturing plant to become the most profitable.

Explore how the techniques adopted by Ford and Toyota revolutionized the way we think of production. Can you mange your production plant as effectively as they did?

The player accepts orders from customers, chooses which products to make and allocates resources and manages the plant to deliver cars to customers in the most effective way possible.

Each player manages a separate board representing a factory, the board is laid out as a Kanban board and the production is tracked as it moves across the board.

At the start of a shift a player may choose to review and accept an order, once accepted an order must be delivered and if the player fails to complete an order they will be penalized. Each shift all players may choose to source materials for their production, this is done by selecting vehicle cards from the available selection.

At the start of each hour within a shift one player rolls dice to determine the available production points for all players, all players get the same amount of production points.

Each player is allocated a quantity of Manufacturing, Assembly and Quality production points, based on dice roll, which they can allocate over the course of the hour. Unused production points are discarded. The player also has the option to trade production points of one type for another but at a 4:1 ratio to indicate the impact of repurposing machines.

The vehicle cards are pulled through the system and production points are allocated as they progress through the system.

The game ends after the last hour on Friday, or the 5th round. Ultimately the winner will be the one that manages the production most effectively to meet their customers’ needs. The player with who has earn the most money by filling orders is the winner.

name: Gangs of Rome: Children of Epona
description:
Adored by the crowd and feared by their enemies, the Children of Epona are both famous chariot racers and dauntless fighters. Now, these living legends can lead you to glory with this new Rome’s Most Wanted box set.

With three finely sculpted white metal miniatures, cards and a selection of unique denarii, it contains everything you need to field the Children of Epona in Gangs of Rome.

This Children of Epona box set contains the following:

Three gang fighters
Three gang fighter cards
Three jigsaw bases
The Children of Epona coin plate containing four denarii
Four corresponding coin cards
Three Gangs of Rome D6 roman numeral die
The Wheel of Nike terrain piece
A printed scenario and special rules

All miniatures are white metal and are supplied with the required MDF base for Gangs of Rome. May require assembly.
categories: Ancient, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Quickie: Godt gået!
description: Small Danish quiz game. 60 questions about achievements. Answer correctly and get a point.

name: The Brotherhood of the Black List
description:
Welcome to the school of assassins created by the Brotherhood of the Black List. The complex is financed by the High Society, rich people who don’t feel safe anymore. They need the support of an entity, one willing to take the necessary risks even to break the law. That said, we should clarify they agreed to only proceed against criminals, so the school will accept orders just for assassins, thieves and terrorists who escaped justice.

Students will have to take these orders, with the name of criminals written on them. Once they got the name, the next step is to register it on the Black List. The ones marked on the list, will be doomed. There are professors to help them in their path. Meanwhile, in the shadows, there’s a new clan rising, the Elite, with which trainees may interact as well.

Each student has their own motivation, so watch out and keep your role secret. Everyone has their specific objectives to win the game. And if your identity is revealed or you cannot fulfill them, your victory objectives will change.

In this hidden role game for 2-6 players, you must complete your objectives before you get killed, and be faster than the others.

You'll need to contact with the elite and several professors,to get help; to get black parchments to complete the orders; to destroy your enemies, in other words, to kill your friends' characters so you have the only one alive; to steal your student files; to go through the elite path and do the blood covenant...

But most important of all, you must recover information. Info is the new coin. But be careful who you trust, no one is what they seem to be in this school...

—description from the designer

name: Rhetoric: The Public Speaking Game
description:
Public speaking. The mere thought of it can set hearts pounding! And yet, being able to communicate one’s ideas in public is an important and sought-after skill. Rhetoric–The Public Speaking Game will help you become a better speaker and have fun in the process!

Rhetoric will challenge, engage and entertain you with a series of public speaking tasks. You and your fellow players will step onto the stage and take turns delivering a series of short speeches, as determined by the squares on which you land.

For the past few years, people around the world have played the board game version Rhetoric in companies, organizations and homes.

Now, it’s your turn to speak!

—description from the publisher

name: Real Life Travel Bingo
description:
Finally, games for REAL families! Each window on the board depicts all-too-familiar travel and holiday experiences, like “we are lost,” “pee emergency,” and “argue where to eat.”

Slide the plastic shutters to mark the space. The first player to get five in a row wins - BINGO! Parents have told us that our game has made long car rides easier, by helping kids laugh at these difficult moments.

name: Rustik Baseball: Travel
description:
Wooden Baseball travel game. Roll the dice, move your pegs, score innings. The player who scores the most in each inning wins the inning, the player that wins the most innings wins the game. If a player wins 5 innings the game is over.

—user summary

name: Tokyo Ultimate Chintai
description:
"Chintai" is a Japanese word and means "rent", specifically for property rent, for like rooms, houses, stores or parking spaces. Tokyo must be one of the most unique city regarding the rent circumstances, because of the smallness, functionalities and highly developed rail networks. You can feel a part of such Tokyo Chintai mood while playing this game.
You become a property agent, and create and rent some Chintais to demanding clients.

In more detail, the players is asked to do as many quotas for renting Chintais as possible. The quotas called "Norma", are being imposed by "Bukken" cards. Bukken means property. The weight of Norma depends on the number of NP points (Norma points) written on each card. Players create a room combining property cards to "rooms". We propose clients and can handle it as a discard if they can contract.
From the property cards and rooms not selected, the norma becomes gradually "Karma", it will accumulate at hand as a deduction point. At the end of the game, the NP of the Karma storage place is counted and the player with the fewest wins.

—user summary
publishers: 東京なかよしデザイン (Tokyo Nakayoshi Design)

name: The Werewolves of LegCo Chamber
description:
A promotional item for the Chinese New Year Fair produced by the Democratic Party of Hong Kong, in "The Werewolves of LegCo Chamber", players either assume the role of Hong Kong Legislative Council members who have to discover the werewolves hidden in their ranks before they are disqualified from serving in the legislature(elimination), or assume the role of the werewolves themselves.

The game is played in the same way as other games in the werewolf/mafia family of games are played. Variations to this are that different LegCo members may also have special abilities which can help or hinder in deducing the werewolves. Moreover, each day, the chairman of the chamber reveals a situation card, based on current affairs in Hong Kong, such as a typhoon, which affects different players' abilities to vote.

The artwork features caricatures of contemporary figures in the Hong Kong government and legislature.

大家好！一連數日嘅年宵市場今日正式開始啦！
我哋民主黨今年主打嘅產品就係呢一款「議事廳狼人」。

我哋將各個角色重新包裝，狼人將由「狼鷹」、「琼子」等出演，可謂入形入格，奸到出汗。
眾議員同各路人物化身村民及特殊角色，有最鐘意睇法國水晶球嘅「薯片」、爆人大獲最開心嘅「占啤」、逗號是本體嘅「鄺神」…等等。
除此之外，我哋亦將香港發生的大小事放到各種事件裡面去，「借尿遁」、「八號風球水浸」、「限制發言」，相信大家玩嘅時候都會會心微心。
正邪對決，壁壘分明。大家要打破猜忌，相互合作，才能對抗狼人。
mechanics: Deduction, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Nyarlatho-Tech
description:
The city was always dangerous but now invaders from dread dimensions have arrived to make it truly nightmarish. Only you can defeat them!

Taking on the role of cyberpunk themed heroes and heroines, the players will try to survive in a place they thought they knew well but which has now been corrupted by Lovecraftian outside forces.

Players go through a location deck where each card represents a different location within the city. For each location an encounter – such as a creature or other hazard – is drawn from another deck. Players have a number of options on how they can try and defeat the encounter depending on their characters skills and armament, equipment and magical artifacts (even the foul Techronomicon!) they have gained and the characteristics of the location and encounter card.

If defeated the encounter gives extra resources for the characters. Otherwise, they lose life or psych tokens; If one character loses all of either, then they die or go hopelessly insane and the game is over.

Players have to be careful on how they manage the resources they gain – take on too few and they won’t be strong enough, but having too much technology or dark knowledge risks losing psych, eventually destroying your very humanity and blasting your mind apart.

Eventually the players will face off with one of a number of different ‘big bosses’ lurking in the labs of the Nyarlatho-Tech Foundation – overcome this final encounter and the city is saved!

Nyarlatho-Tech is a science fiction and horror themed card game, played solo or cooperatively with up to four players. It is simple to set up and easy to play but offers a complex and exciting challenge with multiple styles of play. The city and its inhabitants are randomly generated each time so each game is different.

There’s Dark Gods in those dark alleys so keep your wits – and weapons and weird science - about you!

-description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Das Bibel-Spiel
description:
The bible game
A quiz and memory game for the whole family about the bible and all the stories in there

name: Bernard: Fettnapf-Poker
description: "Bernard: Total irre" is a quick card game in a nice silver box with the famous character Bernard. If you are good at bluffing, you'll win this game!

name: Harry und die Hendersons. Harry dreht alles um!
description:
This game is based on the film "Harry and the Hendersons" from 1987.
Harry the Bigfoot who lives with the American familie Henderson makes chaos in the livingroom.
This means that all glases and furnitures (only the shelves are part of the game) are at unknown places in the room.
